articles.content: A small plane with 10 people aboard crashed into shops in the center of the tourist city of Gramado in southern Brazil on Sunday, killing all of them. At least 15 people were taken to the city's hospital, most of them suffering from smoke inhalation caused by the fire triggered by the crash, authorities said.
articles.title: Small plane crashes into shops in Brazil city, 10 killed
articles.subtitle: Plane first struck the chimney of a building

articles.content: Singer AP Dhillon's actress-girlfriend Banita Sandhu skipped his Mumbai concert on December 7 but attended Diljit Dosanjh's show in Mumbai on December 19. A video of the actress dancing at Diljit's show has also surfaced online. This comes amid a feud between the two singers, with Dhillon accusing Diljit of blocking him on Instagram.
articles.title: Dhillon's girlfriend Banita skips his show, attends Diljit's show
articles.subtitle: Banita confirmed relationship with him in 2023

articles.content: A woman has been detained allegedly for cutting off her lover's private parts after an argument over his marriage being fixed to another woman in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar. The accused and the man got together eight years ago, however, his family opposed their relationship and fixed his marriage to another, police said. The man is undergoing treatment at a hospital.
articles.title: Woman cuts off lover's private parts over his marriage being fixed to another in UP
articles.subtitle: The injured man is in serious condition: Police

articles.content: Four masked robbers armed with guns looted ₹1.5 lakh from a 'Jan Seva Kendra' in UP's Saharanpur on Saturday. CCTV footage of the incident surfaced online in which the four robbers can be seen threatening the staff while waving their guns. The robbers escaped on two motorcycles but one of the staff members followed them in his car.
articles.title: Robbers enter 'Jan Seva Kendra' in UP, loot ₹1.5 lakh on gunpoint
articles.subtitle: 'We have identified the robbers'

articles.content: RBI's ex-Governor Raghuram Rajan said India's GDP growth rate should be over 6% for the country to achieve the 'Viksit Bharat' goal by 2047. "If it's business as usual, it's not going to happen," he stated. "Our working population...is growing...Our growth should...go up by a percentage point or two...The fact that we're not growing faster now is...worrisome," he added.
articles.title: It won't be Viksit Bharat by 2047 if it's business as usual: Rajan
articles.subtitle: 'We are in a sweet spot'

articles.content: India cricketer Cheteshwar Pujara said that Australia pacer Mitchell Starc has improved his bowling a lot and has now become a "different bowler". He advised Indian batters to bat well in the first five overs. "Make him bowl the second and third spells because he gets tired," Pujara said. "He's looking more dangerous than (Pat) Cummins, (Josh) Hazlewood," he added.
articles.title: Make Starc bowl 2nd & 3rd spells as he gets tired: Pujara to India batters
articles.subtitle: Starc has taken 14 wickets in ongoing series

articles.content: A US judge has found Israel's NSO Group liable for attacking around 1,400 WhatsApp users through its Pegasus spyware. Meta-owned WhatsApp sued NSO in 2019, accusing it of accessing its servers and installing Pegasus on devices belonging to groups like activists and journalists. The case will now proceed to a trial only on the issue of damages, the judge said.
articles.title: NSO liable for hacking 1,400 WhatsApp users via Pegasus: US judge
articles.subtitle: 'Spyware firms can't hide behind immunity'

articles.content: Chhattisgarh High Court observed that engaging in sexual intercourse with dead body doesn't amount to any offence punishable under rape laws or POCSO Act. "There's no doubt that the offence committed by the accused...is one of the most horrendous crimes...but the fact of the matter is...for convicting an offence under [rape laws] the victim should be alive," the court said.
articles.title: Sexual intercourse with dead body not rape: Chhattisgarh High Court
articles.subtitle: The court said this while acquitting a man

articles.content: A cow smuggler, identified as Sufiyan was arrested on Sunday after being shot at by police in UP's Jaunpur as he tried to escape. He was caught when police were conducting a checking drive after receiving inputs regarding the movement of cattle smugglers. On being surrounded by police officials, Sufiyan started firing prompting an attack by police in self-defence.
articles.title: Cow smuggler shot by UP police while trying to escape, arrested
articles.subtitle: He was shot in the leg

articles.content: Kanpur Mayor Pramila Pandey has announced a campaign to restore over 120 ancient and abandoned temples in multiple areas of the city and vowed to remove encroachments and resume worship in these temples. A video showed her wearing a helmet and accompanied by dozens of security personnel as she inspected the abandoned temples.
articles.title: Kanpur Mayor Pramila arrives with heavy security to open abandoned temples
articles.subtitle: If needed, bulldozers will be used: Pandey

articles.content: Weeks after seizing power in a sweeping offensive, Syria's new leader Ahmed al-Sharaa in a meeting on Sunday said he would not "negatively" interfere in neighbouring Lebanon. He added that Damascus "respects Lebanon's sovereignty". Notably, the Syrian army entered Lebanon in 1976, only leaving in 2005 after enormous pressure following the assassination of former prime minister Rafic Hariri.
articles.title: Won't negatively interfere in Lebanon, says Syria's new government
articles.subtitle: 'Syria will stay at equal distance from all'

articles.content: Billionaire Jeff Bezos denied reports of him marrying his fiancée Lauren Sanchez in a $600-million (approximately ₹5,000 crore) wedding on December 28. "Now lies can get all the way around...world before...truth can get its pants on. So be careful...and don't be gullible," he said. Sanchez also shared Bezos' X post on her Instagram story, with the caption, "Not true".
articles.title: Jeff Bezos denies ₹5,000-cr wedding with Lauren Sanchez reports, says 'Don’t be gullible'
articles.subtitle: 'Whole thing was completely false'

articles.content: BJP's Amit Malviya reacted to the stone pelting incident at actor Allu Arjun's residence in Hyderabad. "This is state-sponsored terrorism. Congress is targeting him because he refused to campaign for them," Malviya said. "He was earlier arrested in haste for a crime he didn’t commit," Malviya added. This comes after a woman died in a stampede at Pushpa 2's premiere.
articles.title: State-sponsored terrorism: BJP on Allu Arjun's Hyd house attack
articles.subtitle: 'He didn't leave theatre even after woman died'

articles.content: Ten US billionaires made around $796 billion in a market rally driven by tech stocks this year, Daily Beast reported. Elon Musk made the most at $252 billion, followed by Walmart's Walton family ($148 billion) and Mark Zuckerberg ($82 billion). Oracle's Larry Ellison ($73 billion), NVIDIA's Jensen Huang ($72 billion) and Jeff Bezos ($63 billion) are also on the list.
articles.title: 10 US billionaires made $796 billion in 2024 in tech rally: Report
articles.subtitle: Warren Buffett earned $29 billion

articles.content: Film producer Allu Aravind, father of Allu Arjun, spoke to the press after their Hyderabad residence was attacked and damaged by individuals claiming to be from Osmania University on Sunday. He said, "Now is not the right time for us to react to anything." "The police are ready to take away anyone else who comes here to create...ruckus," he added.
articles.title: Not the right time for us to react: Allu Arjun's father on attack on house
articles.subtitle: 'No one should encourage incidents like these'

articles.content: Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford's girlfriend Grace Rosa Jackson has reportedly broken up with the footballer. She realised that Rashford wasn't serious about her and unfollowed him on Instagram, a source was quoted as saying. "She realised there was no future so she has decided to cut ties," the source said.
articles.title: Marcus Rashford's girlfriend Grace breaks up with him: Report
articles.subtitle: Rashford was also axed from the squad

articles.content: Businessman Mohandas Pai criticised the GST Council for announcing different tax rates for salted and caramel popcorn. "This is silly and complex. [This] will lead to tax terrorism," Pai said. "Citizens are becoming victims of bad policy which will make them hostages to rent-seeking officials and create disputes," he stated, tagging PM Narendra Modi and Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.
articles.title: Will lead to tax terrorism: Pai on different tax rates on popcorn
articles.subtitle: 'GST needs to be simplified'

articles.content: An alleged fraudster opened an online account using actress Sunny Leone's name and has received ₹10,000 so far under the Chhattisgarh government's Mahatari Vandana Yojana, the Indian Express reported. Under the scheme, ₹1,000/month is distributed to married women. As per the report, the account's file shows Leone as the beneficiary and has been "verified" by an Anganwadi and a supervisor.
articles.title: Fraudster makes account in Sunny Leone's name, gets ₹10,000 under Chhattisgarh govt scheme
articles.subtitle: 'We are looking into the matter'

articles.content: The Department of Consumer Affairs will launch new apps on December 24 to protect consumers from the dark patterns of e-commerce firms. The 'Jago Grahak Jago App' will alert consumers if any URL may be unsafe. The 'Jagriti App' will allow users to report URLs where they suspect the presence of dark patterns. The government will also launch 'Jagriti Dashboard'.
articles.title: Govt to launch new apps to curb dark patterns of e-commerce firms
articles.subtitle: To know more about the dark patterns

articles.content: The UK should officially designate China a national security threat, Britain's shadow Foreign Secretary Priti Patel has said, as she accused the government of "desperation" in its early dealings with Beijing. "It's clearly complicated legislation, but China should always be up there," she said of the plans for a register of foreign lobbyists and hostile state agents.
articles.title: UK should designate China a national security threat: Priti Patel
articles.subtitle: UK should also restrict TikTok: Patel

articles.content: Renowned Kuwaiti singer Mubarak Al Rashed performed the Indian patriotic song 'Saare Jahaan Se Accha' during PM Narendra Modi’s community event. The event was held at the Sheikh Saad Al Abdullah Indoor Sports Complex as part of PM Modi’s historic two-day visit to Kuwait, marking the first visit by an Indian PM to the Gulf country in 43 years.
articles.title: Kuwaiti singer performs 'Saare Jahaan' amid PM Modi's Kuwait visit
articles.subtitle: To know more

articles.content: A theft occurred at the Indian Overseas Bank branch in Lucknow's Chinhat, police officials said. Thieves gained entry to the bank by breaking through two walls from an empty plot adjacent to the premises, according to the police. Officials added that a total of 42 lockers were cut open, and jewellery along with other valuables were stolen.
articles.title: Jewellery stolen from 42 lockers of bank as thieves break 2 walls in Lucknow
articles.subtitle: CCTV footage showed electric cutters used

articles.content: A woman has said that she had a "nightmarish experience with Ola" on her way to Gurugram. "I noticed two men ahead of the cab, gesturing for the driver to pull over to the left...The situation escalated when I saw two more men on bikes," she added. "I...ran for my life...I tried...the SOS button...it did not work," she further said.
articles.title: Ran for my life after Ola cab stopped by 4 men in Gurugram, SOS button didn't work: Woman
articles.subtitle: 'Driver said his EMI is pending'

articles.content: A picture showing a policeman riding triple seat on a scooter with helmetless riders in Mumbai was shared online. "Mumbai Police must adhere to the rules like everyone else," a social media user said. Reacting to the picture, Mumbai Traffic Police said, "Challan created...[under] Sec 128(1)/194(C) MVA, Sec 129/194(D) MVA. Drive a motor cycle with triple seat...Riding without helmet."
articles.title: Policeman seen riding triple seat with helmetless biker, Mumbai Police react to pic
articles.subtitle: To see how social media users reacted

articles.content: Political analyst Tehseen Poonawalla reacted to an X user's post envisioning "Greater Bangladesh". "It took us 13 days to create your nation, will take us 13 minutes to send it to oblivion," Tehseen said. "We treat you as a friend but if you cross the line, I promise, you will wish, you never messed with us," he added.
articles.title: We'd obliviate B'desh in 13 mins: Tehseen on X user’s 'Greater B’desh' post
articles.subtitle: 'Will turn this dream into your worst nightmare'

articles.content: Hyderabad Police have shared CCTV footage of the stampede incident at Sandhya Theatre during 'Pushpa 2' premiere in which a woman died and her son was hospitalised, saying, "Judge for yourself." The visuals reportedly show actor Allu Arjun being escorted out of the theatre by police officials. Telangana DGP said that a film's promotion "isn't as important" as citizens' safety.
articles.title: Hyd Police share CCTV visuals showing Allu Arjun being escorted out of theatre
articles.subtitle: We've nothing personal against Allu: T'gana DGP

articles.content: A fake lucky draw is offering free gifts in the name of India Post in exchange for personal information. It is asking people to click on a button and fill out a questionnaire. The fact-checking unit of the government, PIB Fact Check took to X and clarified that "it is a scam and is not related to India Post".
articles.title: Fake lucky draw offers free gifts in the name of India Post
articles.subtitle: 'Refrain from clicking on such suspicious links'

articles.content: Rapper Badshah, in his latest Instagram Story, shared a cryptic post amid the feud between AP Dhillon and Diljit Dosanjh. He wrote, "Please don't make...mistakes that we made...Like they say, 'If you wanna go fast, go alone, but if you wanna go far, go together.' United we stand." Notably, Badshah had a feud with Yo Yo Honey Singh.
articles.title: Don't make mistakes we made: Badshah amid Diljit-AP Dhillon's feud
articles.subtitle: Dhillon claimed Diljit blocked him on Instagram

articles.content: RR skipper Sanju Samson shared his thoughts on the franchise's decision to buy 13-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi for ₹1.1 crore in IPL mega auction. Citing examples of Yashasvi Jaiswal and Dhruv Jurel, Samson said RR have a history of finding talents and making them champions. "We want to win...IPL, but...also want to make sure...we're giving champions to Indian cricket," said Samson.
articles.title: RR find out talents, make them champions: Samson on Suryavanshi
articles.subtitle: 'All RR decision makers saw him bat'

articles.content: Ravichandran Ashwin, who retired from international cricket recently, is the first cricketer in history to feature in more than 100 Test matches and retire without playing a Test against Pakistan. India and Pakistan have not played a single Test match against each other since December 2007. A total of 78 players, including 14 Indians, have played at least 100 Tests.
articles.title: Ashwin 1st ever cricketer to play 100+ Tests and retire without playing a Test vs Pak
articles.subtitle: Ashwin took 537 wickets in 106 Test matches

articles.content: Kuwait PM Ahmed Al-Abdullah Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah personally came to the airport to bid farewell to PM Narendra Modi as he departed for India after his visit to the country. The government called it "a heartfelt gesture" and shared pictures of the two leaders. PM Modi was also honoured with 'The Order of Mubarak Al Kabeer'.
articles.title: Kuwait PM personally comes to airport to bid farewell to PM Modi; govt shares pics
articles.subtitle: PM Modi was on a 2-day visit to Kuwait

articles.content: Ex-Chief Economic Adviser Arvind Subramanian criticised the different GST rates announced for popcorn by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday. "This is a national tragedy, violating the spirit of the Good & Simple Tax the GST was meant to be," he said. "Instead of at least moving in the direction of simplicity we are veering [towards] greater complexity," he added.
articles.title: National tragedy: Ex-CEA Arvind Subramanian on popcorn taxation
articles.subtitle: 'It's just irrationality'

articles.content: Billionaire Elon Musk reacted to Germany's refusal to extradite Taleb A, the suspect in the Christmas market attack due to human rights concerns, to Saudi Arabia, terming it "suicidal empathy". Five people were killed while over 200 others were injured in the attack on Friday. Taleb, reportedly fled Saudi Arabia in 2006 after being accused of serious crimes, including rape.
articles.title: Suicidal empathy: Musk on Germany not extraditing market attacker
articles.subtitle: Taleb had rammed a car into the crowd in market

articles.content: A 'Santa Claus Rally' refers to a period around Christmas known for a rise in stock prices. Since 1969, the last five trading days of the year combined with the first two of the new year have yielded an average S&P 500 gain of 1.3%, according to Stock Trader's Almanac. Holiday spending is considered among the reasons behind the rally.
articles.title: What is 'Santa Claus Rally'?
articles.subtitle: 'Rally could be narrower this year'

articles.content: 30-year-old South African cricketer Corbin Bosch made his international debut against Pakistan on December 22, in the third ODI of the three-match series. In 31 List A matches, Bosch has yet to score a century or take five wickets, but South Africa's injury-depleted pace reserves have forced them to rapidly go through their back-up options.
articles.title: Why did SA debut Bosch vs PAK despite limited domestic success
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Pep Guardiola’s Manchester City suffered yet another defeat in the Premier League in December, going down against Aston Villa 2-1 on their trip to Villa Park. Following their recent loss, the 53-year-old talked about how some of his players have 'incredible pride and desire', and they will have to find a way to make a comeback step by step.
articles.title: Guardiola reflects on loss as Man City fall 2-1 to Aston Villa
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who is on a two-day visit to Kuwait, held talks with PM Sheikh Ahmad Al-Abdullah Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah. The leaders signed and exchanged bilateral agreements and Memorandums of Understanding (MoU) after the talks including an MoU on Defence Cooperation, a cultural exchange programme and a framework agreement on Kuwait joining the International Solar Alliance.
articles.title: India, Kuwait sign deals on defence, solar energy cooperation
articles.subtitle: PM Modi invited Kuwait's PM to visit India

articles.content: Less than a month before US President-elect Donald Trump takes oath, Russian President Vladimir Putin said Russia "never abandoned" the desire to normalise ties with US and other Western countries. Putin added that the normalisation of ties should not come at the cost of Russian interests. Earlier, Putin said that Russia is ready to compromise with Trump on Ukraine war.
articles.title: Russia never abandoned desire to normalise ties with US: Putin
articles.subtitle: Trump will take oath as US President on Jan 20

articles.content: Hyderabad Police released footage of stampede to dispute Allu Arjun's claim that he left Hyderabad's Sandhya theatre as soon as he came to know "about the problem outside". The police alleged that he ignored their requests to leave with the timestamped footage showing that the actor remained in the theatre until nearly midnight before being escorted out by police officials.
articles.title: Police disputes Allu Arjun's claim, releases stampede footage
articles.subtitle: One woman died in the incident

articles.content: Colleen Hoover, the author of 'It Ends With US', has praised actor Blake Lively in an Instagram post after the latter sued actor Justin Baldoni for sexual harassment. "[Blake], you've been nothing but honest, kind, supportive and patient since the day we met...Never change. Never wilt," she said. Hoover also shared a link to an article on Blake's accusations.
articles.title: 'It Ends With Us' author Colleen Hoover praises Blake Lively after she sues Justin Baldoni
articles.subtitle: Lively, Baldoni starred in It Ends With Us film

articles.content: India bowled West Indies out for 103 to record a massive victory by 211 runs in the first ODI of the series between the two sides in Vadodara. It was India's largest-ever win in a women's ODI and West Indies' biggest-ever defeat, and it also gave India a 1-0 lead in the three match series.
articles.title: India thrashes West Indies by 211 runs in first women's ODI win
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Businessman Mark Cuban said he called a broker after he first made $2 million by selling his company. "I want you to invest...like a 60-year-old. I don't want you to invest like I'm young, because I want to live off this for a long time," Cuban recalled telling the broker. "I wanted to live like a student," he added.
articles.title: Invested like 60-yr-old: Mark Cuban on mindset after making $2 mn
articles.subtitle: 'I just started dancing'

articles.content: India opener Smriti Mandhana on Sunday broke the world record for scoring most international runs in a calendar year in women's cricket. Mandhana took her tally of runs in 2024 to 1,602 after scoring  91(102) in the first ODI in Vadodara. She overtook South Africa's Laura Wolvaardt, who held the previous record with 1,593 runs in 2024.
articles.title: Smriti breaks world record for scoring most int'l runs in a year in women's cricket
articles.subtitle: Mandhana has scored 3,903 runs in ODI cricket

articles.content: India captain Rohit Sharma, in a video, was seen wielding a baseball bat during the training session ahead of the fourth Test in Melbourne. Reacting to the video, an X user wrote, "He's looking in good touch. Now he's ready to pull everything Aussies throw at him." The 37-year-old has scored 19 runs in three innings in the ongoing series.
articles.title: Rohit Sharma uses baseball bat in training drill ahead of 4th Test
articles.subtitle: The fourth Test will be played from Dec 26

articles.content: PM Narendra Modi interacted with Indian workers at Gulf Spic Workers Camp in Kuwait. One of the workers asked PM Modi, "Sir, do you ever take medical leave?" "I'll tell you how I get [medical leave]. It is like how I came here. The smell of workers' sweat is my medicine," PM Modi said.
articles.title: Indian worker in Kuwait asks PM Modi 'Do you take medical leave?', he responds
articles.subtitle: PM Modi is on a 2-day visit to Kuwait

articles.content: Lauren Sánchez is a former news anchor, who earned an Emmy nomination at Fox Sports Net and later hosted shows like 'So You Think You Can Dance'. She has one child with former NFL player Tony Gonzalez and two kids with ex-husband Patrick Whitesell. Lauren got engaged to Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos in May 2023.
articles.title: Who is Lauren Sánchez, Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos' fiancée?
articles.subtitle: Lauren founded an aerial film company in 2016

articles.content: A man climbed onto a speeding taxi's roof in Mumbai as its driver tried to escape after a hit-and-run incident. A video of the incident has surfaced online, showing the man clinging onto the taxi's roof as it sped away on a flyover. He can be heard shouting at the driver to stop the car and pull over.
articles.title: Man seen on speeding taxi's roof to stop driver escaping after hit-and-run in Mumbai
articles.subtitle: The taxi's windshield was also damaged

articles.content: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed, Crown Prince of Dubai, has pledged to provide prosthetic limbs for a seven-year-old Palestinian boy named Mohammad Saeed Shaaban. The boy reportedly lost both legs and his right hand in an Israeli airstrike on northern Gaza. A clip had surfaced online showing Shaaban moving around a Palestinian camp using a roller skate to navigate.
articles.title: Dubai Prince to give prosthetic limbs to 7-yr-old Palestinian boy
articles.subtitle: Over 45,000 people have died in Gaza

articles.content: After being questioned by a reporter about the English name for his upcoming Kannada film 'Max', actor Kichcha Sudeep responded, saying, "Why are the names of all news channels in English when the viewers and the interviewees like myself are Kannadigas?" Noting that Karnataka has English-medium schools for Kannadiga children, he added, "So what exactly is the problem?"
articles.title: Reporter questions Kichcha Sudeep on English name for Kannada film 'Max', he responds
articles.subtitle: 'Max' is scheduled to be released on Dec 25

articles.content: An Australian media reporter criticised Virat Kohli for "berating" a female Australian journalist at the Melbourne airport. Nine Sports reporter Tony Jones called him a "bully" and said the female reporter was "doing what we do on a daily basis essentially". Reportedly, the argument happened over reporters directing the camera at his family.
articles.title: Aus media criticises Kohli for berating journo, calls him 'bully'
articles.subtitle: 'Really? Big tough man, Virat'

articles.content: A Test is considered drawn, and not tied if the batting team has wickets remaining when the time expires, even if the scores are level. A Test can be termed tied only if the chasing side gets all-out with the scores level. The Bulawayo Test between England and Zimbabwe was declared drawn with the scores level, on December 22, 1996.
articles.title: How can a Test match end as drawn, not tied when scores are level?
articles.subtitle: 2 Tests have ended as drawn with scores level

articles.content: In response to a Delhi High Court ruling, the Consortium of NLUs has postponed the release of the CLAT 2025 first admission list, which was originally scheduled for December 26. The merit list was revised as a result of mistakes in two UG exam questions. The Consortium urged candidates to stay informed through official channels and promised transparency and fairness.
articles.title: CLAT 2025 admission list delayed after court flagged errors
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: An AC sleeper coach bus carrying around 40 passengers caught fire while travelling on a highway near Madhya Pradesh's Barwani on Sunday. The driver, however, managed to stop the vehicle and evacuate all the passengers. A police officer said that the blaze was brought under control in about 30 minutes and the bus was reduced to ashes.
articles.title: Sleeper coach bus catches fire in MP, driver manages to evacuate all passengers
articles.subtitle: Visuals of the bus on fire have surfaced

articles.content: Two US Navy pilots were shot down over the Red Sea on Sunday in an "apparent case of friendly fire," the US military said. The pilots were able to eject safely from their F/A-18 Super Hornet fighter jet, with one suffering minor injuries. The US forces were conducting airstrikes against Houthi targets in Yemen at the time of the incident.
articles.title: US shoots down its own navy pilots over Red Sea in 'friendly fire'
articles.subtitle: US Central Command has initiated probe

articles.content: A 44-year-old Rupen Rao has been arrested after a parcel delivered to a house exploded in Gujarat's Ahmedabad injuring two people. Rao allegedly learned to make bombs on internet to target his in-laws who he claimed had caused separation from his wife. Rao wanted to kill his wife's family and a friend to make her feel lonely, an official said.
articles.title: Parcel blast accused learnt to make bombs to target in-laws in Guj
articles.subtitle: Police recovered two more live bombs from him

articles.content: Aditya Birla Group Chairman KM Birla, in a podcast with Nikhil Kamath, said, "₹1 crore is just not enough to start any business in today's context." "I would rather just keep it in the bank," he stated. On being asked whether ₹10 crore would be enough, he said, "Not so much that you can do...In India...scale is important."
articles.title: ₹1 crore is not enough to start any business today: KM Birla
articles.subtitle: 'Put together a great team'

articles.content: A girlfriend took extreme revenge on her boyfriend in Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh. After an 8-year relationship, the boy decided to marry someone else. Upon discovering this, the girl confronted him and attacked with a sharp weapon, cutting off his private part, and then attempted suicide by slashing her wrist. The police have arrested the girl, and both are receiving medical treatment.
articles.title: UP: Woman chops off boyfriend's private parts in Muzaffarnagar
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Two boys studying in Class 10 and 12 died in Ghaziabad after a fire ignited due to mosquito repellent sticks in their house. According to officials, the victims lit mosquito repellent sticks in their room at 1 am and slept. Their father woke up to massive smoke and fire coming out of his children's room and later found them dead.
articles.title: Mosquito repellent sticks burn house in Ghaziabad, 2 brothers dead
articles.subtitle: Boys lit repellent sticks between two bricks

articles.content: A video has surfaced online showing the moment a four-storey building collapsed in Punjab's Mohali killing two and trapping several others. As per the preliminary investigation, excavation work in the adjacent plot likely weakened the foundation of the collapsed building. The police have booked two building owners and are further investigating the incident.
articles.title: Clip shows moment 4-storey building collapsed in Mohali killing 2
articles.subtitle: Incident took place in Sohana village in Mohali

articles.content: Telangana DGP Jitender and ACP Ramesh criticised Allu Arjun for not caring about the safety of people at the premiere of 'Pushpa 2: The Rule' in Hyderabad. ACP Ramesh reiterated that the actor was informed about the stampede and a woman's death, but he insisted on completing the film. "When DGP...gave him 10 minutes to leave...only then...he budged," Ramesh said.
articles.title: Told Allu to leave after stampede, he wanted to complete film: T'gana police
articles.subtitle: 'Film's promotion not as important as safety'

articles.content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who was conferred with Kuwait's highest honour–the 'Order of Mubarak Al Kabeer', has been awarded 20 international honours in total. He has received Order of Abdulaziz Al Saud (Saudi Arabia), State Order of Ghazi Amir Amanullah Khan (Afghanistan), Grand Collar of the State of Palestine Award and Order of Zayed Award (UAE), among other honours.
articles.title: Which foreign honours has PM Modi been conferred with?
articles.subtitle: To view the full list

articles.content: Five policemen were injured after a police vehicle in ex-Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje's convoy overturned on Sunday. The driver lost control of the vehicle while trying to avoid hitting a motorcycle. Raje stopped her vehicle and ensured the policemen were rushed to the hospital. She was in Bali village to offer condolences to Minister Otaram Devasi on his mother’s death.
articles.title: Ex-Raj CM Raje's convoy meets with accident, 5 policemen injured
articles.subtitle: The incident took place in Pali district

articles.content: Bihar opener Vaibhav Suryavanshi created history by becoming the youngest male Indian cricketer to play List A cricket. Vaibhav, aged 13 years and 269 days, featured in Bihar's Vijay Hazare Trophy 2024-25 match against Madhya Pradesh on Saturday.  He overtook the record held by Ali Akbar, who was aged 14 years and 51 days when he made List A debut.
articles.title: Vaibhav Suryavanshi creates history, becomes youngest Indian to play one-day cricket
articles.subtitle: He was bought by RR in IPL 2025 mega auction

articles.content: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli has got a new look ahead of the Boxing Day Test against Australia in Melbourne. Australian celebrity hairstylist Jordan Tabakman shared a video in which he could be seen giving Kohli the new look. "'The king's new crown," Tabakman wrote. Reacting to the video, a fan commented, "2018 BGT vibe."
articles.title: Virat Kohli gets new look ahead of Boxing Day Test
articles.subtitle: Kohli has scored 126 runs in BGT 2024-25 so far

articles.content: A suspected member of Tehreek-e-Mujahideen terrorist outfit, planning an attempt to exfiltrate into Bangladesh, was arrested from West Bengal's South 24 Parganas district on Sunday. The suspect, identified as Javed Munshi, has admitted to travelling to Bangladesh, Nepal, and Pakistan multiple times, allegedly under the direction of his handlers, using counterfeit Pakistani passports.
articles.title: Suspected terrorist trying to enter B'desh arrested in West Bengal
articles.subtitle: He has served many jail terms on terror charges

articles.content: England have announced their squads for white-ball tour of India and Champions Trophy 2025. Jos Buttler will be captaining both ODI and T20I squads. Ex-England captain Joe Root has been included, marking his return to the ODI side for the first time since the ODI World Cup 2023. Ben Stokes has not been included in the squads due to injury.
articles.title: England announce squads for white-ball tour of India and Champions Trophy 2025
articles.subtitle: India-England T20I series to begin on Jan 22

articles.content: Harmanpreet Kaur emulated Rohit Sharma with a one-handed stunner in the first ODI against West Indies Women to dismiss Aaliyah Alleyne. It was a clean hit from Alleyne, with the ball racing past Harmanpreet’s reach before the Indian skipper lept up like LeBron James to pull off a blinder with her right hand.
articles.title: Harmanpreet Kaur emulates Rohit Sharma with a one-hand stunner
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Marcellus Investment Founder Saurabh Mukherjea expects the Nifty 50 to correct by another 10% for it to be sensibly valued. Stating that the markets are currently seeing a cyclical downturn, he added, "We saw three great years after COVID-19 when the economy did really well." He added that currently "pockets of froth" exist in the small and mid-cap space.
articles.title: Nifty 50 to correct another 10%: Marcellus Investment's Saurabh
articles.subtitle: Nifty fell about 5% this week

articles.content: Indian IPOs raised a record $1.6 trillion (₹1.6 lakh crore) this year, surpassing the previous year's figure of ₹49,436 crore, PTI reported. Hyundai Motor India's IPO, which raised ₹27,870 crore, was the largest in the country's history. IPOs by Swiggy, NTPC Green Energy, Bajaj Housing Finance and Ola Electric were also among the largest issues this year.
articles.title: Indian IPOs raised record $1.6 trillion in 2024
articles.subtitle: 'IPOs can raise ₹2.5 lakh crore in 2025'

articles.content: A Dutch minister’s comments about the Netherlands' pandemic preparedness obligations to the NATO bloc were misquoted in an article online as saying that COVID-19 was the bloc's military operation. Dutch Health Minister Fleur Agema made no connection between the Dutch government’s response to COVID-19 and the preparedness obligations to NATO, Reuters Fact Check reported.
articles.title: Fact check: Dutch minister didn't call COVID-19 a 'NATO operation'
articles.subtitle: To know more

articles.content: Several members of Osmania University on Sunday stormed into actor Allu Arjun's Jubilee Hills residence in Hyderabad and damaged the property after stampede at Pushpa 2's premiere left a woman dead and her 8-year-old child hospitalised. Visuals showed men climbing his house's wall and throwing stones. Police reportedly arrested eight people after the incident.
articles.title: Allu Arjun’s house attacked, men seen climbing wall and throwing stones
articles.subtitle: To watch the video of the incident

articles.content: Poet-writer Surender Sharma said Kapil Sharma cannot do comedy on his own and needs the support of 3-4 people to sustain his act. "Kapil needs a few people to make them laugh...I don't," he said in a chat with Lallantop. Surender shared that he was called to Kapil Sharma's show but he refused to go because of differences over remuneration.
articles.title: Kapil can't do comedy alone, needs 3-4 people: Surender Sharma
articles.subtitle: 'The producers had contacted me but I didn’t go'

articles.content: With his third duck in as many innings, Pakistan’s Abdullah Shafique has become the first opener in history to register three ducks in a three-match bilateral ODI series. India's Suryakumar Yadav, in fact, is the only other batter to have scored three ducks in a three-match ODI series. Shafique has now registered 7 ducks in international cricket in 2024.
articles.title: Abdullah Shafique creates unwanted history with hat-trick of ducks
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Amid the ongoing row over death of a woman during the 'Pushpa 2' premiere, Allu Arjun urged his fans to express their feelings responsibly, and not resort to any abusive language/behaviour "both online and offline". He also warned those posing as his fans using fake IDs and indulging in abusive posts, saying strong action would be taken against such people.
articles.title: Action will be taken against fake fans sharing abusive posts: Allu
articles.subtitle: Allu Arjun was arrested in the stampede case

articles.content: Inflation is the decrease in purchasing power of money. At an inflation rate of 6%, a property or luxury car worth ₹50 lakh will be priced at ₹56.18 lakh in two years and around ₹66.91 lakh in 5 years. The same item will be worth around ₹89.54 lakh in 10 years at 6% inflation, close to double the original price.
articles.title: What will be the cost of ₹50 lakh home or car in 2, 5 & 10 years at 6% inflation?
articles.subtitle: Inflation has a compounding effect

articles.content: A video has surfaced online, showing cows surrounding and stopping a car after the vehicle hit a calf and dragged it for 200 metres in Chhattisgarh's Raipur. After the vehicle stopped, locals rushed to rescue the calf. The visuals from the undated incident have gone viral on social media.
articles.title: Video shows cows running after car and stopping it as it drags calf in Raipur
articles.subtitle: To watch the video of the incident

articles.content: Sri Lanka's Finance Ministry said on Saturday that the island nation had officially ended its debt default with Fitch Ratings upgrading its long term credit default rating to 'CCC+' from 'CCC-'. An official from the ministry also called Sri Lanka's economic crisis "man made". Sri Lanka had plunged into an economic crisis when it declared sovereign default in April 2022.
articles.title: Our debt default has ended, economic crisis 'man made': Sri Lanka
articles.subtitle: 'Could've halted crisis if we heeded to warning'

articles.content: Policemen stormed a cinema hall during 'Pushpa 2' screening in Maharashtra's Nagpur and arrested gangster Vishal Meshram, who was wanted in murder and drug smuggling cases. The accused was on the run for 10 months and was eventually tracked down after police learnt about his interest in the recently-released film. The gangster had 27 cases against him.
articles.title: Policemen storm theatre in Nagpur to catch murderer watching 'Pushpa 2'
articles.subtitle: Meshram has been lodged in Nagpur Central Jail

articles.content: Maharashtra government has decided to relax the maximum age criterion by one year for candidates appearing for Maharashtra Public Service Commission (MPSC) examinations. This one-time measure is applicable for exams advertised post-January 1, 2024 but no stage of recruitment has been done so far. This comes as the recruitment process got delayed due to revised Maratha reservation criterion.
articles.title: Maha govt relaxes maximum-age criterion by 1 yr for MPSC aspirants
articles.subtitle: No age-waiver for exams announced after Dec 20

articles.content: 20-year-old Zaida James broke a unique record, becoming the youngest bowler to take a five-wicket haul against India in Women’s One-Day Internationals (WODIs) in the first ODI. The left-arm spinner finished with figures of 5/45 and bettered the legendary Ellyse Perry’s record (21y 132d) as India were reduced to 314/9 at the end of their 50 overs.
articles.title: West Indies’ Zaida James breaks Ellyse Perry’s record
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Former Pakistan pacer Mohammad Amir believes Virat Kohli is the greatest batter of this generation, and comparing him to Babar Azam, Steven Smith, or Joe Root makes him laugh. "We cannot compare Virat Kohli to anyone because he has won so many matches for India, which seems impossible for any one player," he said on Cricket Predicta Show.
articles.title: Comparing Kohli to Babar, Smith or Root makes me laugh: Amir
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: 48 hours after being dropped from Australia's Test side, Nathan McSweeney hit an unbeaten 78 to propel Brisbane Heat to the top of the BBL 2024/25 table. McSweeney slammed 10 fours and two sixes as the Heat chased down 175 against Adelaide Strikers. “It's always nice to bounce back," said McSweeney, who was named Player of the Match.
articles.title: McSweeney slams match-winning 78* in BBL two days after Test axing
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: India vice-captain Smriti Mandhana was dismissed for 91 in the first women's ODI against West Indies in Vadodara, drawing her level with Ellyse Perry for the most scores of 90s in the format. Both Mandhana and Perry have six to their tally. After being asked to bat first, India scored 314-9, their fifth-highest in the format.
articles.title: Smriti Mandhana hits 91, ties Ellyse Perry's 90s record
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Director Kiran Rao revealed she decided to do the film 'Laapataa Ladies' after her ex-husband and actor Aamir Khan told her one line of the story. "That one line was just so compelling that I was like, I want to do this, really badly," she said. "I was really lucky that he offered it to me, to make," Kiran added.
articles.title: Did 'Laapataa Ladies' after Aamir told me one line of story: Kiran
articles.subtitle: The film recently lost the Oscars 2025 race

articles.content: Around 100 Russian drones attacked Ukraine, with the Ukrainian military saying that they downed 52 of them. The military further said that they lost track of 44 drones, and another had left the territory of Ukraine to Belarus. Some regions, private businesses and apartment buildings have been damaged by the Russian attack, Ukraine said.
articles.title: 100 Russian drones attack Ukraine
articles.subtitle: There are tentatively no casualties: Ukraine

articles.content: Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan said the country will do "whatever it takes" to ensure its security if new Syrian government cannot address the Kurdish militia issue. Turkey regards the YPG, the militant group spearheading US-allied Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF), as an extension of the Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) militants who have fought an insurgency against Turkey for 40 years.
articles.title: Will do 'whatever it takes' if Syria can't curb Kurd issue: Turkey
articles.subtitle: Turkey not in favour of any foreign bases: Fidan

articles.content: As India gears up for the fourth Test against Australia at the MCG, the spotlight is firmly on Virat Kohli. Across six Boxing Day Tests, Kohli has scored 540 runs at an average of 45.00, including a century and three half-centuries. Notably, he is just 134 runs away from surpassing Sachin Tendulkar as India's highest Test run-scorer at MCG.
articles.title: How has Virat Kohli performed so far in Boxing Tests?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Three people who were onboard a plane that made an emergency landing in Russia's Kamchatka region have been found alive after three days. The plane had swiftly lost speed after build-up of ice and was forced to land on snow. One of the survivors said, "Inside the aircraft we kept warm, lit fuel...We switched on emergency beacon...and believed in miracle."
articles.title: Trio aboard missing plane found alive in Russia after 3 days
articles.subtitle: 'Survivors dug a hole in the snow to keep warm'

articles.content: Ex-Australia cricketer Simon Katich said media controversies surrounding Virat Kohli and Ravindra Jadeja are "mind games" from India. "There’s been a few things unfolding in the last week or so, that haven’t gone down well at that camp," he added. While Kohli was involved in a verbal fight with a reporter, Jadeja answered only in Hindi during a press conference.
articles.title: Mind games from India: Katich on Kohli, Jadeja media controversies
articles.subtitle: Border-Gavaskar Trophy is currently tied at 1-1

articles.content: The combined market capitalisation of India's top 10 most-valued companies declined by ₹4.95 lakh crore in the week ended December 20. Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) and Reliance Industries took the biggest hit, with their m-cap declining by ₹1.1 lakh crore and ₹91,140 crore, respectively. Sensex dipped by nearly 4,100 points in the week.
articles.title: India's 10 most-valued firms lose ₹4.95 lakh cr in m-cap in 1 week
articles.subtitle: Nifty dipped about 5% in the week

articles.content: Pakistani actor Khaqan Shahnawaz is facing criticism for jokingly saying he can play actress Kareena Kapoor's son's role. "Kareena ji bahut badi hain. Unke saath beta ban sakta hoon (Kareena is very old. I can play her son's role)," Khaqan said. "Kareena won't even know who he is," an Instagram user said. "If age shaming had a face," commented another.
articles.title: 'Can play Kareena Kapoor's son' jokes Pak actor Khaqan, criticised
articles.subtitle: 'Oh the arrogance is baffling'

articles.content: The tickets for singer Arijit Singh's concert have been priced higher than singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh's concert, costing as high as ₹95,000. The highest-costing tickets for Arijit's show were originally priced at ₹85,000 but were sold out within just four minutes. The ₹95,000 tickets include access to an open bar and a well-stocked snacks buffet. Arijit's show's tickets start from ₹13,500.
articles.title: Arijit Singh's concert tickets priced more than Diljit at ₹95,000
articles.subtitle: The ₹95,000 tickets accommodate only 2 people

articles.content: Television actress Shafaq Naaz, known for 'Mahabharat', recently underwent a knee surgery. "Life threw me a curveball recently, as you all know I injured my knee and I'd to undergo ACL surgery. It's been a tough journey," she wrote. In one of the pictures, she's seen on the hospital bed with her left leg covered with bandages and knee brace.
articles.title: TV actress Shafaq Naaz undergoes knee surgery, shares pic
articles.subtitle: I’m on the road to recovery: Shafaq

articles.content: Delhi Lieutenant-Governor VK Saxena flagged the dire living conditions in Rangpuri Pahari and Kapashera after his visit on Sunday. He said locals complained about poor drainage, water scarcity and lack of hygiene. "I urge ex-CM, current CM...to visit these areas and witness these hellish conditions firsthand. Immediate steps should be taken to improve this deplorable situation," he wrote on X.
articles.title: Hellish conditions: Delhi L-G to Kejriwal after ground visit
articles.subtitle: 'The areas lacked basic civic amenities'

articles.content: A video showing a man being beaten up by a group of men on a college campus in Bihar's Muzaffarpur has surfaced online, following which police filed a case. The video showed the accused forcing the victim to lick their spit. Police said an FIR has been filed against three identified individuals and five others for the attack.
articles.title: Man beaten, forced to lick spit in Bihar; police file case after video shared online
articles.subtitle: Incident took place on December 16

articles.content: NYPD's highest-ranking uniformed officer, Jeffrey Maddrey, resigned following allegations of sexual misconduct. He has been accused of demanding sex from a subordinate in exchange for extra pay opportunities. Maddrey's resignation, accepted on Friday, was effective immediately. Meanwhile, NYPD stated it takes all sexual misconduct allegations seriously and will thoroughly investigate the matter.
articles.title: Top NYPD officer resigns amid sexual misconduct allegations
articles.subtitle: 'This should have been done a long time ago'

articles.content: Ex-Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday criticised the PM Narendra Modi-led Centre for excluding Delhi's tableau from the Republic Day parade in recent years. "What kind of politics is this? Why do they hate the people of Delhi so much?" Kejriwal asked. The tableau proposed by Delhi didn't meet the selection cut for the 2025 parade, officials reportedly said earlier.
articles.title: Why does Centre hate Delhi?: Kejriwal on R-Day tableau exclusion
articles.subtitle: 'BJP has no vision for the people of Delhi'

articles.content: A court in China ruled that a man who was given 3,00,000 yuan (approximately ₹34.8 lakh) by his former girlfriend as an apology for having an affair with his nephew, is not required to return the money, South China Morning Post reported. The man had reportedly accepted her apology but later discovered that she was still involved with his nephew.
articles.title: Court lets man keep ₹34.8 lakh given by ex-lover to apologise for affair in China
articles.subtitle: Ex-lover had demanded the money back

articles.content: Delhi Police identified 175 illegal Bangladeshi immigrants during a verification drive on Sunday. The 12-hour operation, which began at 6 pm on Saturday, targeted areas in outer Delhi. This drive follows a crackdown ordered by the LG Secretariat on December 11 to identify and address illegal Bangladeshi immigrants residing in the city.
articles.title: 175 people identified as illegal Bangladeshi immigrants in Delhi
articles.subtitle: Schools too to spot kids of illegal B'deshis

articles.content: Zeenat, a three-year-old tigress translocated from Maharashtra to Odisha's Similipal Tiger Reserve in November, travelled through Jharkhand and entered West Bengal's Purulia on Sunday, a forest official said. She has been covering 20-25 km every night, the official added. "Every morning...we track her location and identify [some] villages that need to be alerted," the official further stated.
articles.title: Tigress Zeenat, walking 25 km per night, entered Purulia: Official
articles.subtitle: 'The tiger doesn’t move much during midday'

articles.content: Singer Abhijeet Bhattacharya said on a podcast that Mahatma Gandhi was the "father of the nation for Pakistan, not India". "India always existed, Pakistan was carved out of India later....Gandhi was called India's father of the nation by mistake," Abhijeet added. "Gandhi was Pakistan's father, grandfather, grandmother...Gandhi should be given those titles in both the nations," he further said.
articles.title: Gandhi was 'Father of Nation' for Pakistan not India: Abhijeet
articles.subtitle: 'RD Burman was bigger than Gandhi'

articles.content: England's squad for the Champions Trophy marked the return of Joe Root, but there was no place for Ben Stokes. The ECB confirmed that Stokes was left out due to injury. "Stokes was not considered for selection as he continues to be assessed following a left hamstring injury sustained during the third Test match against New Zealand," the ECB said.
articles.title: Why was Ben Stokes left out of England's Champions Trophy squad?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Congress MLC Venkat Balmoori claimed actor Allu Arjun burst firecrackers at his home day after learning about the Sandhya Theatre stampede incident. "You need to show some empathy and support the victim's family," he added. Venkat's remarks came after Arjun held a press conference to address things said by Telangana CM Revanth Reddy. The stampede took place on December 4.
articles.title: Arjun burst firecrackers day after stampede incident: Congress MLC
articles.subtitle: One woman died in the incident

articles.content: The main event of the latest DAZN Boxing PPV belonged to Ukrainian Oleksandr Usyk as he successfully defended the WBO, WBA, and WBC Heavyweight Championships after defeating Englishman Tyson Fury. Shortly after, England’s Daniel Dubois entered the ring, and got into the face of Oleksandr Usyk for a rematch, following his previous loss versus him from last year.
articles.title: Daniel Dubois demands rematch vs heavyweight champ Oleksandr Usyk
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and Samajwadi Party's Rajya Sabha MP Jaya Bachchan after two BJP MPs got injured during a scuffle in Parliament. Poonawalla said, "Rahul Gandhi has stooped down to violence, injured two BJP MPs." He added, "Jaya Bachchan is never with female victims but supports criminals like...Rahul Gandhi."
articles.title: Jaya Bachchan supports criminals like Rahul Gandhi: Poonawalla
articles.subtitle: To know more

articles.content: The CPI(M) has opposed Centre's proposed amendments to the Conduct of Election Rules, calling for their immediate withdrawal. The party criticised the move to restrict political parties' access to electronic and digital election records. "The government's argument...is specious...This approach completely excludes political parties' involvement in procedures to be followed," CPI(M) stated.
articles.title: Withdraw proposed amendments to Conduct of Election Rules: CPI(M)
articles.subtitle: To know what else the party stated

articles.content: The annual Steam Year in Review is in, allowing players to reflect on what games they played and how much time they spent. However, players have started noticing an interesting detail: only 15% of the total playtime by all gamers on Steam was spent on new games released in 2024. This comes as Steam registered over 39 million players this year.
articles.title: Only 15% of Steam playtime in 2024 spent on new releases
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Arif, driver of truck whose container fell and killed a software firm's CEO and his five family members in Bengaluru, blamed a blue car. "Driver [of the blue car] suddenly...braked. I [couldn't] control my vehicle," Arif said. He added he turned left as he saw another car coming towards him after he turned right to avoid hitting the blue car.
articles.title: I was trying to avoid hitting car: Driver of truck whose container fell on tech CEO's car
articles.subtitle: 'Container that fell was loaded with steel'

articles.content: The accident that resulted in the death of Chandram Yegapagol and his family members in Bengaluru was caught on a petrol pump's CCTV camera. Yegapagol, who was the CEO of a software firm, was crushed to death, along with his wife, two children and two other relatives, after a container truck fell on their car. The truck's driver was injured.
articles.title: Video shows moment truck fell on tech CEO's car, killing him & his family in B'luru
articles.subtitle: Car in front of me applied brakes: Driver

articles.content: BJP's Tarun Chugh criticised Congress leader Digvijaya Singh's 'genie' remark on PM Modi, calling it "anti-national". "When PM is spreading India's glory...by visiting foreign lands...Congress is issuing statements that defame the country," Chugh said. His remarks came after Singh accused the PM of spreading hate saying, "It's easy to release genie of hatred, but...challenging to rein it back in."
articles.title: Anti-national: BJP's Chugh over Digvijaya's 'genie' remark on PM
articles.subtitle: 'Singh's statement is highly condemnable'

articles.content: Sri Sri Ravi Shankar's 'World Meditates with Gurudev' event organised on the first-ever World Meditation Day on Saturday in US' New York has broken six world records, Art of Living said. The event earned Guinness World Records' most viewers of a guided meditation live stream on YouTube, two places in Asia Book of Records and three in World Records Union.
articles.title: Sri Sri Ravi Shankar's event on 1st-ever World Meditation Day breaks 6 world records
articles.subtitle: Participants from over 180 nations joined event

articles.content: SEBI has barred PNB MetLife equity dealer Sachin Bakul Dagli and eight other entities from the securities market in a front-running case. The regulator also seized illegal gains worth ₹21.16 crore made by the entities. A SEBI investigation found that the entities executed trades using confidential, non-public information shared via chat platforms.
articles.title: SEBI bars nine entities, seizes ₹21 crore in front-running case
articles.subtitle: Front-running by entities ran for 3 years

articles.content: Singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh wore a ₹9.4 lakh limited-edition Balenciaga racer jacket for his concert in Mumbai. The jacket boasts an oversized fit and structured leather panels in a mix of textures. According to Balenciaga's official website, the jacket costs nearly ₹9.4 lakh. It's exclusive also because the luxury brand has reportedly produced only three pieces of the jacket till now.
articles.title: Diljit Dosanjh wears ₹9.4 lakh Balenciaga racer jacket, only 3 pieces made till now
articles.subtitle: The jacket comes with a lightly scuffed finish

articles.content: A 20-year-old Rakesh saved 30 burn victims who ran into his family’s temporary shelter on farmland for help after an LPG truck exploded following a collision in Jaipur. A hospital was just 1.5 km from their farmland but an eight-foot wall blocked access. Rakesh created a makeshift passage using a ladder and helped them cross the wall one by one.
articles.title: How did a 20-yr-old save 30 victims of Jaipur LPG tanker blast?
articles.subtitle: 'Their skin was charred, could barely speak'

articles.content: PM Narendra Modi was on Sunday awarded Kuwait's highest honour 'The Order of Mubarak Al Kabeer'. It is a knighthood order of Kuwait and  is awarded to heads of state and foreign sovereigns and members of foreign royal families as a sign of friendship. This is the 20th international honour given to PM Modi by a country.
articles.title: PM Modi gets Kuwait's highest honour ‘Order of Mubarak Al Kabeer’
articles.subtitle: Clinton, George Bush earlier got this honour

articles.content: Lauren Sanchez is an established media professional recognized for her work as an Emmy-winning journalist. She is Vice Chair of the Bezos Earth Fund and owns Black Ops Aviation, an aerial film company. Reports indicate that Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez's relationship became public in 2019. Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez will reportedly marry in Aspen next week.
articles.title: Who is Lauren Sanchez, soon-to-be wife of Jeff Bezos?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Actor Salman Khan revealed singer Honey Singh went to the studio and finished the rap for the song 'Lets Dance Chotu Motu' from the film 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan' in 30 minutes. "Then I requested Honey to come and be in the song with us," the 58-year-old added. Salman further stated that it's a "cool song" for kids.
articles.title: Honey went to studio, finished rap for 'Kisi..' in 30 mins: Salman
articles.subtitle: 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan' released in 2023

articles.content: Speaking after Sunday's practice session in Melbourne, Akash Deep provided a big update on Rohit Sharma's injury. "Injuries happen when you play cricket. This is not a matter of concern," Akash Deep told reporters. Notably, Rohit injured his knee during a session with the throwdown specialist when the ball sneaked through his pads and hit him on his left knee.
articles.title: Not a concern: Akash Deep on Rohit's knee injury
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Four people lost their lives in southwest Turkey on Sunday when an ambulance helicopter crashed into a hospital building. The helicopter was taking off, during heavy fog, from the Mugla Training and Research Hospital, carrying two pilots, a doctor and another medical worker. Footage from the site showed debris from the crash scattered around the area outside the hospital building.
articles.title: 4 die after air ambulance crashes into hospital building in Turkey
articles.subtitle: To watch the video of ambulance

articles.content: The annual Steam Year in Review is in, allowing players to reflect on what games they played and how much time they spent on them. However, players have started noticing an interesting detail: only 15% of the total playtime by all Steam users was spent on new games released in 2024. This comes as Steam registered over 39 million players this year.
articles.title: Only 15% of Steam playtime in 2024 spent on new releases
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: On Sunday, December 22, India pacer Akash Deep revealed plans to tackle Travis Head in 4th Test, who has been looking good in the ongoing series. "I think Travis Head, in particular, struggles against short balls. We won't let him settle at the crease. We'll target specific areas and hope to force him into mistakes, which will create chances for us," he said.
articles.title: Akash Deep reveals plan to dismiss Travis Head ahead of 4th Test
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: In their first outing as an opener pair, Pratika Rawal and Smriti Mandhana set a unique record, becoming only the third Indian pair to put on a 100-run partnership involving a debutant. They joined Reshma Gandhi-Mithali Raj (258*) and Sandhya Agarwal-Gargi Bannerjee (103) in an elite group.
articles.title: Pratika Rawal-Smriti Mandhana set unique partnership record
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Months after Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) denied Team India's travel to Pakistan for the upcoming Champions Trophy 2025, citing security concerns, New Zealand Cricket (NZC) has followed BCCI's footsteps. The NZC has now sent a delegation to Pakistan to assess security arrangements, prior to the ODI tri-series and Champions Trophy 2025.
articles.title: After India, New Zealand send delegation to assess security in PAK
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Syrian army members loyal to ex-President Bashar Al-Assad lined up outside a building in Damascus to surrender their weapons to members of Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS). Men and women also returned state-issued valuables and other items as part of the reconciliation process, Reuters reported. "Those without criminal charges would be allowed to resume normal civilian life," an official said.
articles.title: Ex-Syrian army members surrender weapons to rebel HTS fighters
articles.subtitle: Syrian rebels HTS captured Damascus on Dec 8

articles.content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi highlighted the deep historical and cultural ties between India and Kuwait during his two-day visit. "India and Kuwait share multifaceted ties rooted in history, culture and mutual respect. Our strong relations extend across energy, trade and investments," he said.  "We also have a vibrant Indian diaspora strengthening the friendship further," he added.
articles.title: India, Kuwait share multifaceted ties rooted in history: PM Modi
articles.subtitle: 'I highlighted wide range of issues with KUNA'

articles.content: Uttar Pradesh Power Department has warned Samajwadi Party leader and Sambhal MP Zia Ur Rehman Barq that his property can be attached if he doesn't pay a ₹1.91-crore fine for alleged power theft within 15 days. The power supply to his home has also been disconnected. A meter installed at his residence allegedly showed zero power consumption for six months.
articles.title: Sambhal MP Barq asked to pay ₹2cr fine or face property attachment
articles.subtitle: Barq is also an accused in Sambhal violence

articles.content: According to several reports, India is set to lock horns with Pakistan on February 23 during ICC Champions Trophy 2025. While the tournament will mark its return for the first time since 2017, India and Pakistan are set to renew their highly-anticipated rivalry. However, the ICC is yet to confirm the schedule, which is scheduled to start from February 19.
articles.title: India to face Pakistan in Champions Trophy on February 23: Reports
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Actress Ridhi Dogra said a television director once passed "deflating comments" after she suggested some improvisation. Ridhi said if someone would make her feel small, she'd always fight back. "The director had said, 'Yeh kaunsi Aishwarya Rai hai (Is she Aishwarya Rai)', and I told him, 'Aap kaunsa Mani Ratnam ho (You're no Mani Ratnam)'," she added.
articles.title: TV director said 'Is she Aishwarya?', I said 'You're no Mani Ratnam': Ridhi
articles.subtitle: She was recently seen in 'The Sabarmati Report'

articles.content: CPI (M) leader A Vijayaraghavan alleged that a "communal Muslim alliance" was behind Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi's victory from Wayanad Lok Sabha seat. "Who were in the front and back rows of the processions of Priyanka? The worst extremist elements in the minorities were in them," he added. "They were with the Congress leadership," he further said.
articles.title: 'Communal Muslim alliance' behind Priyanka's Wayanad win: CPI(M)
articles.subtitle: Priyanka won the bypoll to Wayanad LS seat

articles.content: The Indian women's football team is all set to play against Maldives in two FIFA international friendly in Bengaluru on December 30 and January 2, the All India Football Federation (AIFF) confirmed on Friday, December 20. The two matches will be held at the Padukone-Dravid Centre for Sports Excellence in Bengaluru.
articles.title: India women's football team to face Maldives in friendlies
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A 30-year-old police constable named Selvakumar died after iron grills penetrated 30cm into his anus in Chennai. According to police, Selvakumar fell on the grills after he jumped from the second floor of his brother's apartment in an inebriated condition after a quarrel with him and his wife. Selvakumar panicked after his brother and sister-in-law called friends to pacify him.
articles.title: Drunk policeman jumps from 2nd floor, dies after getting penetrated by grills in Chennai
articles.subtitle: Selvakumar had locked brother, his wife in room

articles.content: Following the discovery of an ancient Shiv-Hanuman temple in UP's Sambhal, authorities have now discovered a stepwell, which could be over 150 years old, reports said. It is spread over 400 square metres, has around four chambers and floors made of marble, Sambhal DM Rajender Pensiya said. Ruins of an ancient Banke Bihari temple were found in the area recently.
articles.title: After ancient temple, more than 150-year-old stepwell found in Sambhal
articles.subtitle: 'Structure is currently fully covered in mud'

articles.content: Tesla's market capitalisation has jumped by $572 billion to around $1.4 trillion in less than two months, as per Bloomberg data. The EV maker's shares, which were down 2.3% for the year, are up 69% for 2024 since the US Election Day. The rally comes on the back of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's close relationship with US President-elect Donald Trump.
articles.title: Tesla adds $570 bn in m-cap in under 2 months after Trump's win
articles.subtitle: Musk backed Trump's campaign

articles.content: A passenger bus collided with a truck in Minas Gerais, southeastern Brazil, early Saturday, killing 38 out of 45 onboard, officials confirmed. Thirteen others were injured and taken to hospitals near Teofilo Otoni. Witnesses said the bus lost control after a tyre burst, while others reported a granite block struck the vehicle before the crash, according to the fire department.
articles.title: 38 dead, 13 injured as passenger bus crashes into truck in Brazil
articles.subtitle: A car with 3 onboard also collided with the bus

articles.content: Batter Sam Konstas revealed his parents were emotional after he earned his maiden call-up to the Australian Test team for the remaining two Tests against India. "Mum was in tears, so I was trying not to cry, and Dad was super proud...I’m very grateful for their sacrifices," the 19-year-old said. Konstas has 718 first-class runs at an average of 42.23.
articles.title: Mom was in tears: Sam Konstas on maiden Test call-up for Australia
articles.subtitle: Fourth Australia-India Test will begin on Dec 26

articles.content: China said US is "playing with fire" after it announced $571 million in defence assistance to Taiwan. Chinese Foreign Ministry urged US to stop arming Taiwan and stop what it called "dangerous moves that undermine peace and stability in the Taiwan Strait". US authorised the military aid of Defense Department material and services and military education and training for Taiwan.
articles.title: Playing with fire: China after US grants $571 million to Taiwan
articles.subtitle: China considers Taiwan as its own territory

articles.content: Congress leader Udit Raj reacted after a UP court summoned Congress leader Rahul Gandhi regarding his comments on the caste census during the Lok Sabha poll campaign. "This is a frivolous notice....Such judges should be removed from their posts," Raj said. "It seems like these judges are illiterate...They are probably working under political pressure," Raj added.
articles.title: Illiterate judges: Raj on notice to Rahul over caste census remark
articles.subtitle: 'Should judges be wasting time like this?'

articles.content: While Colombo was touted as a strong choice after being co-host of 2023 Asia Cup, it appears that Sri Lanka will not get the hosting rights for Champions Trophy 2025. As per a report by Cricket Pakistan, all stakeholders have reached an agreement that Dubai will serve as the neutral venue, likely to host five matches, including three of India.
articles.title: Colombo snubbed for CT as PCB, BCCI finalise venue: Reports
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Germany reportedly ignored Saudi Arabia's warning about the suspect behind Magdeburg Christmas Market attack which occurred on Friday and claimed the lives of five people. Saudi officials issued at least three warnings prior to the attack. The complaints against the suspect, Taleb A, included allegations that he tried to persuade Saudi citizens to leave the country and abandon their religion.
articles.title: Germany ignored Saudi's warning on market attack suspect: Report
articles.subtitle: Taleb immigrated from Saudi to Germany in 2006

articles.content: Delhi Police investigation has revealed that the bomb threat emails sent to three schools in the national capital were sent by their own students. According to police, in one case, two brothers sent threatening emails as they wanted to postpone their exams because they were unprepared. In the other case, the student wanted the school to shift to online classes.
articles.title: Students sent bomb threats to postpone exams: Delhi Police
articles.subtitle: 100 schools got bomb threats in 11 days: Reports

articles.content: Team India's seamer Akash Deep has credited Jasprit Bumrah for his promising performance in the third Test against Australia in Brisbane. The right-arm seamer reveals the pace spearhead telling him how it's important not to try too many things in Australia, including saying, "Zyaada excited nahin hona hai."
articles.title: Video: Akash Deep reveals advice from Bumrah before Brisbane Test
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Sam Konstas is all set to make his debut in the MCG Test against India, starting December 26. The 19-year-old will be up against Jasprit Bumrah, which is a challenge he is looking forward to. "I have already seen him a lot. But I am excited to challenge myself and face him," he said.
articles.title: Excited to come up against Jasprit Bumrah: Sam Konstas
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Filmmaker Boney Kapoor, who recently underwent hair transplant, said his late wife Sridevi wanted him to focus on weight loss instead of hair transplant. "Sri would say, 'Boney, first lose weight then you can fix your hair'," he said. "People told me, 'Look, Yash Chopra is also bald but so rich'...I fell for this and remained bald," Boney added.
articles.title: Sridevi said 'First lose weight then you can fix your hair': Boney
articles.subtitle: 'I even suggested it to Akshaye Khanna'

articles.content: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari inaugurated India's first bio-bitumen-based National Highway stretch on NH-44 in Mansar, Nagpur. The initiative, undertaken in collaboration with NHAI, CSIR-CRRI and Oriental is aimed at reducing dependence on bitumen imports. The section of the road was developed using lignin-based bio-bitumen technology by Praj Industries.
articles.title: Govt launches pilot bio-bitumen technology project
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A man has claimed that counters at Bryan Adams' Gurugram concert, organised by Zomato, only accepted cash to buy "unnecessary" coupons to get food and drinks. "Staff insisted on cash...citing 'internet issues'...This was an attempt to avoid taxes - a clear example of corruption," the man said. Payment machines became operational minutes after he "hinted at going live", he added.
articles.title: Man claims 'corruption' at Zomato event, says 'Counter took cash for food coupons to avoid tax'
articles.subtitle: 'Cash is why I've stopped attending concerts'

articles.content: Epigamia's Co-founder Rohan Mirchandani passed away aged 41 due to sudden cardiac arrest. The Greek yogurt maker's parent company, Drums Food International, confirmed his demise, saying, "All of us...will deeply mourn his loss. Rohan was our mentor, friend and leader." Mirchandani had moved to the role of Executive Chairman in December 2023, while Co-founder Rahul Jain took over as CEO.
articles.title: Epigamia Co-founder Rohan Mirchandani dies of cardiac arrest at 41
articles.subtitle: 'Request media to respect privacy of his family'

articles.content: A four-year-old boy was run over by a speeding Creta car driven by a 19-year-old man in Mumbai's Wadala, police said. The victim Ayush Laxman Kinvade and his family live on the footpath in the area and his father is a labourer. The accused driver, identified as Bhushan Sandeep Gole, has been arrested and further investigation is underway.
articles.title: 4-year-old boy run over by speeding car driven by teenager in Mumbai
articles.subtitle: 'Prima facie, the driver was not drunk'

articles.content: A video has surfaced online in which MNS president Raj Thackeray and Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray were seen together at a relative's wedding in Dadar. The two cousins were captured conversing as both families attended the wedding. Notably, in the recently concluded Maharashtra Assembly elections, both leaders launched verbal attacks against each other.
articles.title: Video shows Raj Thackeray, Uddhav conversing at relative's wedding
articles.subtitle: To watch the video

articles.content: Former Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal announced that registration for the Mahila Samman Yojana and Sanjeevani Yojana will start on December 23. Under the Mahila Samman Yojana, eligible women in the city will receive ₹2,100 per month, while Sanjeevani Yojana will offer free treatment for those above 60, Kejriwal said. Teams will conduct door-to-door registrations, he added.
articles.title: Registration for Mahila Samman Yojana to begin tomorrow: Kejriwal
articles.subtitle: 'It is necessary to have Delhi's voter ID card'

articles.content: Pratika Rawal, who made her debut against the West Indies women on December 22, became the 150th capped player for India women. Rawal has quite an interesting tale, a rather unexpected route from studying psychology to playing cricket for Delhi. The right-handed opener has scored 1368 runs, averaging 54.72, at a strike rate of 75.58.
articles.title: Who is Pratika Rawal, India women's newest ODI debutant?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The Indian Express' Shubhra Gupta called 'Girls Will Be Girls' one of the best films of 2024. The three lead players Kesav Binoy Kiron, Preeti Panigrahi and Kani Kusruti carry the film, the review read. "The latter takes our breath away, just like she does in Payal Kapadia's 'All We Imagine As Light'," it added.
articles.title: 'Girls…' one of the best films of 2024, Kani takes breath away: IE
articles.subtitle: IE gave 3.5 stars to the film

articles.content: Tennis legend Rafael Nadal was seen at the next-gen ATP finals in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. This is the first time the legend is touring the city post-retirement and he will be there for the next three days visiting many places. The Spaniard is one of the all-time greats to have played Tennis and is part of the Big Three.
articles.title: Rafael Nadal makes first post-retirement visit to Jeddah
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: US President-elect Donald Trump said fees being charged by Panama for the use of Panama Canal are "ridiculous". He said US bestowed "extraordinary generosity" on Panama, adding, "If the principles...of this magnanimous gesture...are not followed, then we'll demand that the Panama Canal be returned to us." He said the canal is a vital US asset, playing a critical economic role.
articles.title: Trump threatens to take control of Panama Canal, says 'fees are ridiculous'
articles.subtitle: 'Complete rip-off of US will stop'

articles.content: Team India captain Rohit Sharma was seen grimacing in pain after being hit on left knee while training at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) ahead of the Boxing Day Test against Australia. Rohit had an ice pack strapped to his leg, which he rested on a chair. India pacer Akash Deep later told media that such injuries are quite common.
articles.title: Rohit Sharma hit on left knee while training, grimaces in pain
articles.subtitle: The 4th Test will begin on December 26

articles.content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has penned a letter to Ravichandran Ashwin to congratulate the all-rounder on his retirement. "At a time when everyone was looking forward to many more off-breaks, you bowled a carrom ball that bowled everyone," PM Modi wrote. "Each one of the 765 international wickets that you took across all formats was special," he added.
articles.title: PM Modi pens letter to R Ashwin, compares retirement to 'carrom ball'
articles.subtitle: To read the entire letter

articles.content: Central Crime Branch arrested two individuals, Harish and Hemant, for allegedly running an illicit "girlfriend swapping" racket under the guise of private parties in Bengaluru. Their operation, named "swingers", reportedly lured couples and exploited women through coercion and blackmail. A woman filed a complaint, saying she was forced to engage in intimacy with accused and their acquaintances.
articles.title: 'Girlfriend swapping' racket running under guise of parties busted in B'luru, 2 arrested
articles.subtitle: Men threatened her with pvt pics upon refusal
