articles.content: PM Narendra Modi interacted with Indian workers in Kuwait on Saturday. During his interaction, PM Modi said, "Development for me doesn't only mean good roads, good airports. I want toilets in the houses of the poorest of the poor." "For me, the most important thing is the dignity and respect of the poor, they should get all these," he added.
articles.title: For me most important thing is dignity & respect of poor: PM Modi
articles.subtitle: Still, a lot has to be done: PM Modi

articles.content: Families of US Marines killed by Taliban terrorists during Kabul airport attack claimed President Joe Biden slept during the transfer of their bodies at Dover Air Force Base. "We sat in that office for what seemed like an eternity," they said, accusing Biden of making them wait three extra hours. The White House, however, dismissed the allegations, calling them "untrue".
articles.title: Afghan martyrs’ families say Biden took nap as they waited for bodies
articles.subtitle: 13 American soldiers were killed in the attack

articles.content: Curtis Axel revealed in an interview with Going Inside that he is preparing for a comeback and would be open to working as a backstage producer if given the opportunity. "I've actually been training in the ring, taking a few bumps. So, I'm slowly inching my way closer to making a return," said Curtis Axel. In 2020, Axel was released from the company due to COVID-19 budget cuts.
articles.title: Curtis Axel to make a comeback after 4 years
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A car hit a calf and dragged it along a busy road in Chhattisgarh's Raigarh. Soon, a group of cows blocked the road, halting the vehicle's movement, which allowed locals to rush to the car and rescue the animal. Footage of the rescue shows people carefully pulling the calf out. The calf suffered injuries but survived.
articles.title: Car drags calf on Chhattisgarh road; viral video records rescue
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Murhaf Abu Qasra, a senior Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS) commander, has been appointed Syria's new defence minister, officials confirmed. Abu Qasra, known as Abu Hassan 600, played a key role in military operations that led to Bashar al-Assad's ousting. The decision comes after PM Mohammed al-Bashir announced plans to restructure the ministry with former rebel factions and defected officers.
articles.title: HTS commander Abu Qasra named Syria's new defence minister
articles.subtitle: Rebels seized control of Damascus on Dec 8

articles.content: Albania has announced a one-year ban on TikTok following a teenager's killing last month in a fight developed from an online confrontation on social media. "We're going to chase this thug out of our neighbourhood for one year," said PM Edi Rama, adding, "On TikTok outside China we see only scum and mud...The problem isn't children but our entire society."
articles.title: Going to chase this thug out for 1 yr: Albanian PM on TikTok ban
articles.subtitle: TikTok is facing a ban in US next month

articles.content: PM Narendra Modi interacted with Indian workers in Kuwait on Saturday and a video of the same has surfaced online. During his interaction, PM Modi said, "I feel that if [our farmers and labourers] work for 10 hours, then I should...work for 11 hours." "There're 140 crore people in my family, so I've to work a little more," he added.
articles.title: I work little more as my family has 140 cr members: PM in Kuwait
articles.subtitle: To watch the video

articles.content: Bareilly District Court has summoned Congress leader Rahul Gandhi regarding his comments on caste census, during Lok Sabha poll campaign. The court has asked him to appear on January 7. Rahul had said Congress, if elected, would conduct a census to ascertain wealth distribution. Petitioner Pankaj Pathak alleged that Rahul's remarks were like an "attempt to start a civil war."
articles.title: Rahul summoned by UP court over caste census remark, told to appear on Jan 7
articles.subtitle: Case against Rahul in MP-MLA court was dismissed

articles.content: Actress Moushumi Chatterjee said actor Amitabh Bachchan "struggled a lot" and became "big" after a lot of hard work. "But I won't say if he became big for the better. When you receive so much, you behave very differently. You won’t even be able to think about helping others," the 76-year-old added. Amitabh and Moushumi worked together in 'Benaam'.
articles.title: Big B struggled a lot but I won't say if he became big for better: Moushumi
articles.subtitle: 'Amitabh used to be a very quiet person'

articles.content: Tashi Namgyal, the shepherd who alerted Indian Army troops about Pakistani infiltration ahead of the Kargil War in 1999, has passed away at the age of 58. Namgyal had spotted Pakistani soldiers digging bunkers on the Batalik mountain range in May 1999, and promptly informed the Army, thereby playing a crucial role in thwarting Pakistan's plans.
articles.title: Shepherd Tashi who alerted Indian Army during Kargil War passes away at 58
articles.subtitle: Namgyal is survived by his wife & 3 kids

articles.content: British Boxing star Tyson Fury will be required to relinquish nearly half of his earnings from his bout against Oleksandr Usyk on legal grounds. Even as Fury will reportedly earn $75 million from his fight against Uysk in Saudi Arabia, he stands to lose nearly 50% of the money due to the tax regulations in the United Kingdom.
articles.title: Tyson Fury likely to lose half his earnings from fight with Usyk
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Jammu and Kashmir witnessed an intense cold wave on Sunday as temperatures plummeted across the region. Srinagar recorded sub-zero temperatures as the minimum temperature dipped to minus 3.2⁰C at 8:30 am on Sunday, ANI reported. The intense cold also caused the surface of Dal Lake to freeze. Notably, Srinagar recorded its coldest December night yesterday in 50 years at -8.5⁰C.
articles.title: Srinagar records sub-zero temperature at minus 3.2⁰C
articles.subtitle: To read more

articles.content: Former Indian cricket star Aakash Chopra named his top 5 bowlers in the T20I format for the calendar year 2024. Haris Rauf, Lockie Ferguson and Matheesha Pathirana were named in the top 5. Chopra ignored Jasprit Bumrah and Shaheen Afridi while including Abbas Afridi and Arshdeep Singh in the top two.
articles.title: Aakash Chopra names his top 5 T20I bowlers of 2024
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Actress Blake Lively accused 'It Ends With Us' co-star and director Justin Baldoni of sexual harassment and a calculated PR campaign to "destroy" her reputation. She complained during a January meeting that he discussed her weight with her trainer and talked about his sex life. Lively said he repeatedly entered her makeup trailer without permission, "including when she was breastfeeding".
articles.title: What accusations did Blake Lively level against Justin Baldoni?
articles.subtitle: 'Baldoni said he could speak to her dead father'

articles.content: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos will marry his fiancée Lauren Sanchez in a lavish $600-million (₹5,000 crore) wedding in US' Aspen on Saturday, Daily Mail reported. The duo got engaged in May 2023 and will wed in a winter wonderland-themed wedding after celebrating their impending nuptials at sushi restaurant Matsuhisa. Ceremony will take place at actor Kevin Costner's 160-acre Dunbar Ranch.
articles.title: Jeff Bezos to marry Lauren Sanchez in ₹5,000-crore wedding in Aspen on Dec 28: Report
articles.subtitle: Bezos has booked mansions for wedding guests

articles.content: Six people, including the CEO of a software company, died as a container truck fell on the SUV they were travelling in, on the outskirts of Bengaluru. Chandram Yegapagol (46), his wife Gaurabai (42), their two children Gyaan (16) and Deeksha (10), were killed in the accident. The family was travelling to Chandram's native village to visit his ailing father.
articles.title: Tech CEO & his family crushed to death as container truck falls on SUV in B'luru
articles.subtitle: Yegapagol's sister-in-law and niece also killed

articles.content: Union Minister Giriraj Singh on Sunday claimed injured BJP MPs Mukesh Rajput and Pratap Chandra Sarangi told him that Congress MP Rahul Gandhi "attacked them like a bouncer". "This is very shameful...Rahul deliberately wanted to indulge in a scuffle," he added. Giriraj further informed that there is swelling on the back of Rajput's head and Sarangi is "feeling dizzy".
articles.title: Injured MPs told me Rahul attacked them like a bouncer: Giriraj
articles.subtitle: 'The next decision will be taken by the doctors'

articles.content: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge slammed the government's amendment to the Conduct of Election Rules. "Government's audacious amendment...is another assault in...conspiracy to destroy...integrity of Election Commission," he said. Kharge highlighted the removal of the Chief Justice from the ECI selection panel and alleged the government is withholding electoral data despite court orders.
articles.title: Assault on EC's integrity: Kharge on changes in poll conduct rules
articles.subtitle: Centre has restricted public scrutiny of docs

articles.content: British mathematician GH Hardy once took a cab numbered '1729' to visit Indian mathematician Srinivasa Ramanujan in the hospital. While Hardy found it to be an ordinary number, Ramanujan said it's the smallest number that can be expressed as sum of two cubes in two ways. '1729' is sum of cubes of one and 12 and of nine and 10.
articles.title: What is the significance of '1729', the Hardy-Ramanujan number?
articles.subtitle: '1729' is also called the taxicab number

articles.content: According to government data, at least 26% of private schools that were granted permission to open in the last five years have shut down. Between the 2019-20 and 2023-24 academic years, the Department of School Education and Literacy approved 2,905 new private unaided schools, but 762 of these have closed.
articles.title: 26% of private schools closed in five years in Bengaluru
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: India won the inaugural edition of the Under-19 Women's Asia Cup, beating Bangladesh by 41 runs in the final played in Kuala Lumpur. Defending 117, three India left-arm spinners Parunika Sisodia, Aayushi Shukla and Sonam Yadav combined to pick seven of the Bangladesh batters. India opener Gongadi Trisha was the Player of the Match for her 47-ball 52.
articles.title: Left-arm spin trio help India win U-19 Women's Asia Cup final vs BAN
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: India defeated Bangladesh by 41 runs in the final in Kuala Lumpur to win the inaugural Under-19 Women's Asia Cup. Batting first, India scored 117/7 in 20 overs, driven by opener Gongadi Trisha's 52(47). India dismissed Bangladesh for 76 in 18.3 overs, with Aayushi Shukla taking three wickets. Earlier this month, Bangladesh beat India to win Under-19 Men's Asia Cup.
articles.title: India defeat Bangladesh, win inaugural edition of Under-19 Women's Asia Cup
articles.subtitle: To view the match scorecard

articles.content: Two US Navy pilots were shot down in a friendly fire incident over the Red Sea, the US military confirmed. Both pilots survived, though one sustained minor injuries. The incident occurred as the USS Gettysburg mistakenly fired on their F/A-18 during airstrikes targeting Iran-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen, according to US Central Command.
articles.title: 2 US Navy pilots shot down over Red Sea in friendly fire incident
articles.subtitle: The operation involved Air Force & Navy assets

articles.content: External Affairs Minister (EAM) S Jaishankar said India can "never" permit others to have veto on its choices. He said, "Independence should never be confused with neutrality. We'll do whatever is right in our national interest and for global good without being intimidated to conform." He added India will "inevitably" progress but it must do so without losing its "Bharatiyata".
articles.title: India can never permit others to have a veto on its choices: S Jaishankar
articles.subtitle: 'India is an exceptional nation'

articles.content: Authorities uncovered unaccounted assets worth crores, including luxury cars and gold, silver and diamond jewellery, during raids on residences of ex-RTO Constable Saurabh Sharma and his associate Chetan Gaur in MP. Assets and cash worth ₹3.86 crore were found from Sharma's house alone. An abandoned car found earlier with ₹10 crore cash and ₹40-crore gold has been linked to Sharma.
articles.title: Crores in cash, gold & silver, luxury cars found in raid on ex-RTO constable in MP
articles.subtitle: Assets worth ₹4.12 crore found in Gaur's house

articles.content: India pacer Akash Deep said he "wasn't looking to save the follow-on" on Day 4 of the Gabba Test against Australia. "I was just looking not to get out," he added. The 28-year-old further stated, "We come to bat lower down the order, so contributions of 20-25-30 runs are very valuable," he added. Akash scored 31(44) in India's first innings.
articles.title: Wasn't looking to save follow-on, tried not to get out: Akash Deep
articles.subtitle: Third Australia-India Test ended in a draw

articles.content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju said that the 'One Nation, One Election' (ONOE) project was not brought "overnight". "ONOE project was not brought overnight but it was discussed in detail by a high-powered committee chaired by former President Ramnath Kovind," he said. The two Bills on ONOE were passed by Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal in the Lok Sabha on Tuesday.
articles.title: 'ONOE' Bill not brought overnight, was discussed in detail: Rijiju
articles.subtitle: Opposition sought the Bills' withdrawal

articles.content: American author Stephen King has warned about billionaire Elon Musk's influence in US politics. "You can't call Elon Musk the President-elect, because he wasn't elected. In fact, having been born in Pretoria, he is ineligible to become president," said Stephen, adding, "Nonetheless, he is running the show. You know that, but it bears repeating."
articles.title: 'Musk ineligible to be US Prez, still running show', warns Stephen
articles.subtitle: 'I didn't call Musk-man Trump's new 1st lady'

articles.content: Ex-Amazon executive Adam Broda claimed the company's employees in India "happily" worked 60+ hours/week, "as if [it] was totally normal". "I witnessed multiple leaders asking why [employees] were on call at 3:00am...[They'd say,] 'We want to be here'," Broda said. "Take away money...you'll know real reason," a LinkedIn user said. "Many need job so they'll bend over backwards," said another.
articles.title: Ex-Amazon exec says employees in India happily worked 60+ hrs/week, criticised
articles.subtitle: 'That's why 'culture' will 'eat strategy''

articles.content: The Bengaluru Traffic Police (BTP) have launched a new and improved website, https://btp.karnataka.gov.in, aimed at providing a more user-friendly and efficient platform for citizens. The revamped website was unveiled on Friday by City Police Commissioner B. Dayananda, and it promises a streamlined experience with easier navigation, updated features, and a fresh look.
articles.title: Bengaluru traffic police launches new user-friendly website
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: ISRO has unveiled the first images of its Space Docking Experiment (SpaDeX) satellites, set to launch on PSLV-C60. The two 220 kg satellites will enter a 470 km orbit at a 55-degree inclination, operating on a 66-day cycle. This mission will position India among an elite group of nations with autonomous space docking technology.
articles.title: ISRO reveals 1st look of Spadex satellites that will dock in space
articles.subtitle: This will play key role in India's space station

articles.content: Bengaluru has topped the list of districts in Karnataka for the number of individuals booked for spreading fake news. According to a statement by Chief Minister Siddaramaiah in the Legislative Council, between 2021 and 2024, a total of 247 cases were registered across the state. Bengaluru city leads with 99 cases, followed by Mysuru city with 2 cases and Mangaluru city with 6 cases.
articles.title: Bengaluru leads state with highest number of fake news cases
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Delhi International Airport Ltd, on Monday, said the Indira Gandhi International Airport has reached a significant milestone by establishing connectivity to 150 destinations. Almost simultaneously, it has also clocked the best-ever traffic in history. This marks a new beginning for the airport, which had been in the news recently for the collapse of part of the roof at Terminal 1.
articles.title: IGIA becomes India's 1st airport to connect 150 destinations
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The death toll in the building collapse incident in Punjab's Mohali has risen to two after rescuers recovered one more body from the rubble on Sunday morning. The four-storey building collapsed in Mohali's Sohana village on Saturday, with at least five people trapped in its rubble. Meanwhile, police have booked two building owners in the incident and launched an investigation.
articles.title: Death toll in Mohali building collapse rises to 2, owners booked
articles.subtitle: Earlier, a 20-yr-old woman died in the incident

articles.content: Delhi-based dentists Dr Sanjeet Shanker and Dr Devanjali Soin have launched BackupDoc.ai to address the growing lack of trust in healthcare. Born out of frustration with the general patient mistrust in India, the AI-powered platform helps doctors create precise diagnoses, bridges the gap between patients and practitioners, and offers an affordable solution tailored to India’s medical ecosystem.
articles.title: Dentist couple builds AI platform to bridge gaps in healthcare
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Mercedes-Benz is developing solar paint for electric vehicles (EVs) that turns the car's exterior into an energy source. This thin, flexible photovoltaic material could enable an SUV to harvest enough energy for 7,456 miles annually. Unlike traditional panels, it bends around curves, is eco-friendly, and addresses charging concerns, potentially reducing reliance on charging stations.
articles.title: Solar paint will be able to charge electric vehicles, anytime
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: On the Figuring Out podcast, Palki Sharma said that while we have the largest young population, it is a double-edged sword for us because we need to make our population skilled, educate them, and need to create jobs for them otherwise they will get into protest and all sorts of unproductive things.
articles.title: India’s demographic profile is a double-edged sword: Palki Sharma
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif, who worked alongside Ravichandran Ashwin and Steve Smith as DC's assistant coach in 2021, revealed Ashwin refused to bowl to Smith in the nets as he had a camera on his helmet. "Ashwin said, 'He'll record us and analyse it for the World Cup'," he recalled. Kaif added he couldn't notice the camera but Ashwin did.
articles.title: Ashwin refused to bowl to Smith in nets due to helmet camera: Kaif
articles.subtitle: 'Ashwin was ready to help Smith as a teammate'

articles.content: Actor Justin Baldoni has been dropped by his talent agency WME after his 'It Ends With Us' co-star Blake Lively sued him for sexual harassment. Lively cited "severe emotional harm" inflicted upon her and her family by Baldoni, accusing him of sexual harassment and of launching a smear campaign against her. Meanwhile, WME continues to represent Lively as their client.
articles.title: Justin Baldoni dropped by talent agency after Blake Lively sues for harassment
articles.subtitle: Justin Baldoni's lawyer denied the accusations

articles.content: A man claimed US' Delta Air Lines first upgraded him to first-class and then downgraded him to economy class 15 minutes later to make space for a passenger's service dog. "Delta said...there's nothing they can do," he said. "Shame [dog] owner for...being disabled?" a Reddit user said. "Might be a comfort dog but line needs to be drawn," said another.
articles.title: Man claims US airline downgraded his seat from first to economy class for dog, sparks debate
articles.subtitle: What's point of being loyal to this airline: Man

articles.content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju criticised Congress' Rahul Gandhi after two BJP MPs got injured during a scuffle in Parliament, saying Opposition MPs were being forced by Rahul to "toe a negative line". "Even...Opposition parties feel their responsibilities...but one leader of the Congress probably forces them to act in such a manner." "You don’t come to Parliament for...physical fight," he added.
articles.title: One Congress leader forcing Oppn MPs to toe negative line: Rijiju
articles.subtitle: 'You are there to show your vocal power'

articles.content: The first-ever direct flight from Gujarat's Surat to Thailand's Bangkok ran out of liquor and snacks in the middle of the journey, reports said. The passengers on the four-hour Air India Express flight reportedly drank around 15 litres of alcohol worth ₹1.8 lakh. Notably, the sale and consumption of alcohol has been prohibited in Gujarat since 1960.
articles.title: 1st Surat-Bangkok flight runs out of liquor, passengers finish alcohol worth ₹1.8 lakh
articles.subtitle: 'Clear indicator that Gujaratis want to drink'

articles.content: A ferry carrying Christmas travellers capsized on the River Busira in Congo late Friday, leaving 38 dead and over 100 missing. The overloaded boat was part of a convoy travelling through northeast Congo. Ingende's mayor, Joseph Kangolingoli, said most passengers were merchants heading home for the holidays. Rescue efforts have saved 20 people with searches underway.
articles.title: 38 dead, over 100 missing as boat capsizes in Congo's Busira River
articles.subtitle: The death toll is expected to rise

articles.content: Speaking ahead of the ODI series against West Indies Women, Head Coach Amol Muzumdar provided much-anticipated update on Harmanpreet Kaur's injury. "Harmanpreet is going to bat today in the nets... a complete, full nets schedule. We'll take a call once the nets are over, and I'm sure she'll be fine," Muzumdar stated during the pre-series press conference.
articles.title: Amol Muzumdar shares update on Kaur's availability for 1st ODI
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) president Faruque Ahmed says Shakib Al Hasan and Tamim Iqbal are available for selection for the Champions Trophy 2025. "If any player does not retire, then he is definitely available for selection," Faruque said. Both Tamim and Shakib have been out of the side for the last few months due to various reasons.
articles.title: Shakib, Tamim available for Champions Trophy, says BCB president
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Bangladesh interim government's inquiry commission claimed India's involvement in cases of "enforced disappearances" under ousted PM Sheikh Hasina, state-run BSS reported. The commission called India's involvement "matter of public record" and said some Bangladeshi prisoners may still be in Indian jails. It said it found intelligence reports suggesting exchange of captives between two counties.
articles.title: Bangladesh commission claims India's involvement in enforced disappearances under Hasina
articles.subtitle: 'Try to identify jailed Bangladeshis in India'

articles.content: After improving to 'very poor' category on Saturday, Delhi's air quality index (AQI) has again deteriorated to 'severe' on Sunday amid the cold wave. The AQI in the national capital was recorded at 427 at 7 am. The AQI at Jahangirpuri stood at 441, Wazirpur at 434, Bawana at 432, Nehru Nagar at 430 and Anand Vihar at 427.
articles.title: Delhi's air quality back to 'severe', AQI in some areas nears 450
articles.subtitle: The minimum temperature at 7 am was 8°C

articles.content: Former India chief selector Chetan Sharma said he hopes ex-India captain Virat Kohli scores "two more centuries" in the remaining two Tests against Australia. "I had predicted before the series that he would score three centuries in Australia," he added. Sharma further stated that Kohli has "achieved so much" which raises expectations, adding, "I am confident he will perform well."
articles.title: Hope Kohli scores 2 more centuries in next 2 Tests: Chetan Sharma
articles.subtitle: Kohli scored a century in the first Test

articles.content: Scientists have discovered California ground squirrels hunting and eating voles, marking the first recorded evidence of carnivorous behaviour. Previously known as granivores, squirrels were thought to primarily eat nuts and seeds. Research published in the Journal of Ethology suggests they may be opportunistic omnivores, adapting their diet to survive in rapidly changing environments.
articles.title: Squirrels spotted hunting & eating rodents for first time
articles.subtitle: Squirrels of all ages, genders were seen hunting

articles.content: A video has surfaced online showing Kuwaiti singer Mubarak Al Rashed singing Mahatma Gandhi's favourite bhajan 'Vaishnav Jan toh'. He sang the bhajan before Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Kuwait. Notably, PM Modi, who is on a two-day visit to Kuwait, met Emir Sheikh Meshal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah on Saturday and also attended the 26th Arabian Gulf Cup's opening.
articles.title: Kuwaiti singer sings Gandhiji's favourite bhajan 'Vaishnav Jan'
articles.subtitle: To watch the singer's video

articles.content: Actress Alisha Parveen, who played the role of Raahi/Aadhya in 'Anupamaa', has been replaced in the show two months after she joined. "I didn't quit the show...everything was good but I don't know why this suddenly happened, it was shocking for me too," she wrote. Alisha told a portal that producer Rajan Shahi said it was channel's decision.
articles.title: I've no clue why I was suddenly replaced in 'Anupamaa': Alisha
articles.subtitle: Alisha has been replaced by Adrija Roy: Reports

articles.content: Lara Trump, daughter-in-law of US President-elect Donald Trump, announced she's withdrawing from consideration to replace Florida Senator Marco Rubio, who'll become Secretary of State. "After...incredible amount of thought...I've decided to remove my name from consideration for Senate," she wrote on X. This comes days after Trump announced her resignation as Republican National Committee co-chair.
articles.title: Lara Trump pulls out of race to replace Florida senator Rubio
articles.subtitle: She promised to share a big announcement in Jan

articles.content: SJ Logistics has bagged a ₹65 crore logistics contract from EikoVivify Logistics. The contract is for facilitation and management of around 2500 TEU containers of different size and dimension along with other logistics services agreement. SJ Logistics specialises in providing comprehensive logistics and supply chain solutions.
articles.title: SJ Logistics bags ₹65 crore contract from EikoVivify Logistics
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: After singer AP Dhillon claimed that singer Diljit Dosanjh blocked him on Instagram, the latter shared a screenshot claiming he hasn't blocked AP Dhillon. "My issues could be with governments...not with the artistes," Diljit wrote. Dhillon then shared a before-after screen recording showing Diljit unblocked him. "At least we know what's real and what's not," Dhillon wrote.
articles.title: Diljit shares screenshot claiming he hasn't blocked AP Dhillon on Instagram, Dhillon reacts
articles.subtitle: 'First unblock me on Instagram'

articles.content: Supreme Court granted bail to a man who was booked for rape and for threatening the complainant in the name of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi. He presented record of an SP-level police officer's WhatsApp chats/calls with the woman, claiming the case was false. He claimed he was in live-in relationship with the woman who later struck up relationship with the officer.
articles.title: SC frees man accused of rape, links to Lawrence Bishnoi as he shows policeman's chats
articles.subtitle: 'Officer used influence to implicate me'

articles.content: A total of 81 people have been arrested for betting on dog fights after raids at a farmhouse in Rajasthan's Hanumangarh, an official said on Saturday. Police recovered 19 foreign breed dogs, multiple licensed weapons and seized 15 vehicles. As the raid began, many people jumped over the wall to escape. Some dogs were found injured due to the fight.
articles.title: 81 arrested for dog fights at Rajasthan farmhouse, people jump over wall to escape
articles.subtitle: Many arrested people are from Punjab and Haryana

articles.content: A man allegedly threw itching powder into the eyes of a gas agency manager and robbed him of his bag containing about ₹8.5 lakh in Delhi, police said on Saturday. According to police, the incident occurred in the Narela area when the victim was going to deposit the money in a bank on his bike. Police have launched an investigation.
articles.title: Delhi man robbed of ₹8 lakh after being blinded by itching powder
articles.subtitle: The victim works as a manager of 2 gas godowns

articles.content: Director Anil Sharma, who worked with actor Dharmendra and his sons Sunny Deol and Bobby Deol in 'Apne', recalled Dharmendra telling him his sons were "too innocent", adding, "They don't have affairs with actresses." "They don't find anyone. And look at me, all the heroines were after me," he added. Anil stated Sunny and Bobby had left after hearing this.
articles.title: Dharmendra said 'My sons don't have affairs with actresses': Anil
articles.subtitle: 'Apne' released in 2007

articles.content: PM Narendra Modi attended the 26th Arabian Gulf Cup's opening in Kuwait on Saturday as chief guest. He joined Emir Sheikh Meshal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah and senior leaders to witness the biennial football tournament. The event, part of PM Modi's two-day visit, included informal engagements with Kuwait's leadership. The PM also shared a photo of him shaking hands with Al-Sabah.
articles.title: PM Modi attends Arabian Gulf Cup opening, meets Kuwait's Emir
articles.subtitle: 'Pleased to meet His Highness Emir of Kuwait'

articles.content: Actor Vicky Kaushal on Saturday joined Punjabi singer Karan Aujla during his concert in Mumbai. The duo performed on 'Tauba Tauba', a song they collaborated on for 'Bad News'. The singer was seen getting emotional after Vicky praised his journey during a speech. 'Vicky x Aujla a gift that keeps on giving," a fan wrote on social media.
articles.title: Vicky joins Karan Aujla during Mumbai concert, dances to 'Tauba…'
articles.subtitle: Aujla's 'It Was All A Dream' tour to end on Sun

articles.content: Sundar Pichai explained what 'Googleyness' means for Google in 2024 while speaking at an all-hands meeting, Business Insider reported. "Mission first, make helpful things, be bold and responsible, stay scrappy, hustle and have fun, team Google," Pichai said. Googleyness means being humble, having fun and being okay with uncertainty, Google's ex-HR head Laszlo Bock had said in his 2015 book.
articles.title: Sundar Pichai explains what 'Googleyness' means for Google in 2024
articles.subtitle: Google changed hiring guidelines in 2019

articles.content: A 20-year-old woman was killed after a four-storey building collapsed in the Mohali district of Punjab on Saturday. At least five people are said to be trapped in the rubble, and the teams of the Indian Army and NDRF are engaged in the rescue operation. According to preliminary information, the building collapsed due to digging in an adjacent plot.
articles.title: Woman killed as building collapses in Punjab, 5 trapped in rubble
articles.subtitle: 'I am in constant touch with the administration'

articles.content: India's Ministry of External Affairs issued a statement condemning the attack on a German Christmas market that killed at least five people and injured around 200. Calling the attack "horrific and senseless", India said, "Our thoughts and prayers are with the victims. Our Mission is in contact with Indians who are injured." Seven Indians are among those injured, reports said.
articles.title: Horrific & senseless: India in 1st statement on German Xmas market attack that killed 5
articles.subtitle: A Saudi man ran people over with BMW

articles.content: At least seven Indians are among more than 200 people who were injured in a Saudi doctor's car attack at a Christmas market in Germany's Magdeburg, reports said. Three of the seven Indians have been discharged from the hospital and the Indian Embassy is in touch with all injured Indians. The embassy called the attack "horrific and senseless".
articles.title: 7 Indians among over 200 injured in car attack at German Christmas market: Report
articles.subtitle: 5, including 9-year-old boy, died in the attack

articles.content: Ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh said there was never any fight, quarrel or disagreement between him and Ravichandran Ashwin. "If people twist things on Twitter and make it seem as if I've...problem with Ashwin, then it's their point of view," he added. "Because I am vocal about pitches in India...people think I have a problem with one individual," he added.
articles.title: There was never any fight, quarrel or disagreement between us: Harbhajan on Ashwin
articles.subtitle: 'Ashwin has been a phenomenal bowler for India'

articles.content: A man shared a picture on X and wrote, "Captured by my mother: Ladies coach in Salem-Mayiladuthurai MEMU express was filled with men, leaving no space for elderly women." "Despite requests, many refused to vacate. Please take strict action to ensure women's safety and comfort," he added. Railway Seva asked the Railway Protection Force to look into the matter.
articles.title: Man posts pic taken by mother, says 'train's ladies coach filled with men'; Railways responds
articles.subtitle: The man also shared a video

articles.content: As the mega event WrestleMania 41 draws near, rumours of Brock Lesnar's possible comeback have resurfaced. According to Dr Chris Featherstone, "I have been told that there have been no internal discussions regarding Brock Lesnar returning to WWE." He further stated that Lesnar is not expected to return "any time in the foreseeable future."
articles.title: Brock Lesnar's WWE status revealed ahead of WrestleMania 41
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: India will soon have the second largest metro network in the world, Union Housing and Urban Affairs Minister Manohar Lal Khattar has said, underlining that 997 kilometres of metro rail is currently under construction in the country. He also said that urban mobility is an important aspect to tackle the rising urban population.
articles.title: India to soon have 2nd largest metro network in world: Khattar
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Bihar minister Sumit Singh said RJD's 'Mai, Bahan Maan Yojana' doesn't sound like a scheme but more like an abuse. RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav's announced that party will provide ₹2,500 monthly to eligible women if it comes to power in Bihar. RJD condemned Singh's remark and said that people who think this way hate identity and dialect of the state.
articles.title: Sounds like abuse: Bihar Minister on RJD's 'Mai Bahan Maan Yojana'
articles.subtitle: 'Scheme appears to be more of an insult'

articles.content: Railways Ministry has reported significant delays in several railway infrastructure projects across West Bengal, primarily due to challenges in land acquisition, an official statement said. "Despite a substantial increase in funding, with allocations rising three times from ₹4,380 crore during 2009-14 to ₹13,941 crore in 2024-25, the pace of project execution remains hindered, the ministry added.
articles.title: Land acquisition issues delaying projects in WB: Railways Ministry
articles.subtitle: '43 railway projects in WB as of April, 2024'

articles.content: Saudi Arabia had warned German authorities about Taleb al-Abdulmohsen who rammed the car into a crowd at a Christmas market, killing at least five people and injuring over 200, Reuters reported quoting a Saudi source. Saudi had informed Germany after the 50-year-old attacker had posted extremist views on his personal X account that threatened peace and security.
articles.title: Saudi warned Germany about Christmas market attack suspect: Report
articles.subtitle: The accused was a doctor from Saudi Arabia

articles.content: Google has proposed to loosen its deals with companies including Apple which make Google's search engine the default on their devices. This comes after a US judge ruled in August that Google holds an illegal monopoly in online search. Following the ruling, the US government proposed to the judge to force Google to sell its Chrome browser.
articles.title: Google offers to loosen deals with Apple, others in antitrust case
articles.subtitle: To know what more Google has proposed

articles.content: Speaking of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's performances in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy, Sunil Gavaskar advised the duo to watch videos of all the innings where they have scored brilliant centuries. "I want that positivity to come into their thinking," he added. While Kohli has scored 126 runs, Rohit has made 19 runs in the two matches he has played.
articles.title: Virat, Rohit should watch videos where they scored tons: Gavaskar
articles.subtitle: Kohli scored a ton in 1st Test

articles.content: A 28-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly beheaded his one-year-old son with a knife in US' California. The police, who were initially responding to a domestic disturbance call, found the man's wife outside the house and she told them her son was still inside. The police said that deputies found the severed child's head in the bedroom.
articles.title: Man beheads 1-year-old son with knife in US, police find baby's head in bedroom
articles.subtitle: 'Wife claimed man assaulter her & her mother'

articles.content: Allu Arjun addressed the press to clarify recent statements against him in Sandhya Theatre stampede case. "This is a low point in my life...I have a kid of the same age (as the victim in coma), am I not a father? Don't I understand how the father feels?" he questioned. "I am unable to even go to work," he added.
articles.title: 'This is a low point, am I not a father?': Allu Arjun on allegations in stampede case
articles.subtitle: 'This is character assassination'

articles.content: A 55-year-old school principal allegedly died by suicide after being caught drinking alcohol inside classroom in Maharashtra's Nanded. The principal was found hanging inside his house by his family members. He was caught in inebriated condition inside the classroom. The villagers recorded his video and made it viral.
articles.title: Maha school principal dies by suicide after being caught drinking
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Raynaud's phenomenon, also known as Raynaud's disease or Raynaud syndrome, is a common condition during winter season that causes decreased blood flow to fingers. The change in colour, from the standard pigment to often dark red or pale white, is majorly due to this common disease. Symptoms include change in skin colour, feeling numb or cold, tingling and painful sores.
articles.title: What is Raynaud's Syndrome, a condition triggered by cold weather?
articles.subtitle: It has 2 types

articles.content: Liberal Party MP Chandra Arya, in a letter, said that he believes the time has come for PM Justin Trudeau to step aside as the "leader of the Liberal caucus immediately". Arya stated that under Chrystia Freeland's leadership, the party can preserve Trudeau's legacy. "Freeland's dedication to building relationships...gives her a unique ability to unite the party," Chandra added.
articles.title: Time for you to step aside: Party MP Chandra Arya to PM Trudeau
articles.subtitle: Chrystia recently resigned as Deputy PM

articles.content: An 18-year-old girl allegedly died by suicide at her home after her friend's death in Uttar Pradesh's Banda on Friday, according to police. The deceased's friend had also died by suicide the same day reportedly because she was unable to buy warm clothes, an officer said. Police got to know about girl's death while preparing for friend's postmortem, officer added.
articles.title: Teen dies by suicide after friend's suicide over not being able to buy warm clothes in UP
articles.subtitle: 'Girls had tattoos of each other's names'

articles.content: Telangana cinematography minister Komatireddy Venkat Reddy said Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa 2: The Rule' only succeeds in ruining the youth. "I watched [the film]...I've decided not to watch any films other than historic, devotional, Telangana movies from now," he added. He earlier banned benefit shows of all films following the death of a woman in a stampede at 'Pushpa 2' premiere.
articles.title: 'Pushpa 2' only succeeds in ruining youth: Telangana minister
articles.subtitle: The film has collected ₹1004.9 cr (net) so far

articles.content: Ten people, including four children, were killed in a stampede in Nigeria’s Abuja after a crowd gathered to collect food and clothing items distributed by church at an annual Christmas event. Police stated over 1,000 people were evacuated from the church after the incident. Earlier, at least 35 children were killed in a stampede at school fair in the country.
articles.title: 10 people killed in stampede at Christmas charity event in Nigeria
articles.subtitle: 'Some injured people are receiving medical care'

articles.content: Despite living in tropical climate, many Indians suffer from lack of vitamin D. "Most people in urban areas spend...majority...time indoors," explained Dr Minesh Mehta, Consultant Emergency Medicine. This means less direct sunlight exposure. Cultural practices, like wearing clothes that cover most of the body, further limit skin exposure to the sun. High levels of dust, smog also block UVB rays.
articles.title: Why do Indians suffer from vitamin D deficiency despite plenty of sunlight?
articles.subtitle: Increasing use of sunscreen also a reason

articles.content: A 12-year-old student of a private school allegedly sent a bomb threat e-mail to the institution in an attempt to shift to online classes, police said on Saturday. "He said that he had mistakenly sent the mail without understanding the gravity of his actions. The student is cooperating with the investigation and a probe is underway," a spokesperson said.
articles.title: Student sends bomb threat email to school in Gurugram to shift classes online
articles.subtitle: An FIR was registered

articles.content: Over 15% of India's high-net-worth individuals (HNIs), those with investable assets worth $1 million or more, are under 30, a study by consultancy firm Anarock showed. It further stated that nearly 30% of new HNIs owe their fortunes to technology, fintech, and startups. The number of HNIs in India is likely to double to 1.65 million by 2027, it added.
articles.title: Over 15% of super rich in India are aged under 30: Report
articles.subtitle: 'India currently has over 8,50,000 HNIs'

articles.content: The GST Council on Saturday recommended that no GST will be levied on transactions of vouchers as they are neither supply of goods nor supply of services. However, where vouchers are distributed on a principal-to-agent basis, any amount charged by the agent will be taxable. Additional voucher-related services such as marketing and promotion will also attract GST.
articles.title: No GST on transaction of vouchers, says GST Council
articles.subtitle: Unredeemed vouchers to not attract GST

articles.content: Ex-Australia captain Greg Chappell labelled Virat Kohli's struggle with form as Elite Performance Decline Syndrome (EPDS). "The first visible sign of EPDS is...subtle but unmistakable shift in...player’s approach at...crease," he said. He stated EPDS is a syndrome where desire to avoid mistakes overshadows instinct to dominate. "The only cure...is to rekindle the thinking of your youth," he added.
articles.title: Greg Chappell labels Virat Kohli's struggle with form as 'EPDS', suggests cure
articles.subtitle: 'Confidence is everything'

articles.content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who is on two-day official visit to Kuwait, said India has the skill, technology, innovation, and manpower needed for 'new' Kuwait. "Kuwait through trade and innovation, wants to be a dynamic economy. India is also focusing on innovation and strengthening its economy," he said. PM said India and Kuwait will become partners in prosperity.
articles.title: India has skill, technology, manpower that 'new' Kuwait needs: PM
articles.subtitle: PM said this at the 'Hala Modi' event

articles.content: Pakistan military court convicted 25 supporter of former PM Imran Khan over attacks on military installations during riots that erupted following the arrest of the 72-year-old leader in May last year. At least eight people were killed during the violence. The ruling comes days after Khan was indicted by an anti-terrorism court on charges of inciting attacks against the military.
articles.title: Pak court convicts 25 supporters of ex-PM Imran Khan over 2023 unrest
articles.subtitle: Khan is currently in prison since August 2023

articles.content: Shri Banke Bihari Mandir in Uttar Pradesh's Vrindavan has urged people to not wear "indecent" clothes to its premises and also put up banners for the same. "Attire such as mini skirts, torn jeans, half pants, and night suits is inappropriate for the temple setting, as it undermines the sanctity and dignity of the place," temple authorities said.
articles.title: Temple asks visitors to not wear mini skirts & torn jeans in UP, calls it 'indecent'
articles.subtitle: 'Doesn't follow temple's respect for tradition'

articles.content: Congress leader Okram Ibobi Singh alleged that the BJP-led Manipur government was violating provisions of the Constitution by not holding the Winter Session of the state Assembly. "As an opposition party, we will not remain mute spectators if government does not discharge its duties timely and responsibly," the former CM added. "Memorandums have been submitted to the governor," he added.
articles.title: Manipur govt violating constitutional provisions by not holding Winter Session: Congress
articles.subtitle: 'We are compelled to raise this issue'

articles.content: Nana Patekar recalled shooting for 'Pratighaat', in which Sooraj Barjatya served as assistant director. He shared that one day Barjatya brought his shoes. "I said, 'Don't do this...I can get my...shoes.' He said, 'No, sir (with folded hands).' I said 'Sooraj, you're...heir to this big organisation (Rajshri Productions), don't do this.' He said, 'I'm...assistant, this is my job'," Nana said.
articles.title: Sooraj Barjatya picked up my shoes, told him not to do this: Nana
articles.subtitle: 'He hasn't changed one bit, he's just as simple'

articles.content: Actor Josh Heuston shared his experience of working with Tabu in 'Dune: Prophecy'. He said, "Tabu used to...hang out with me at the front of the trailer. And she'd bring me, like, authentic Indian dishes...every day. So we...built a little bit of rapport because she kept me alive and fed me." Heuston plays Tabu's son in the series.
articles.title: Tabu fed me authentic Indian food, kept me alive: Dune's Heuston
articles.subtitle: Tabu plays Sister Francesca

articles.content: India’s first writers' village, Lekhak Gaon, has been officially opened on the outskirts of Dehradun. Former President Ram Nath Kovind, alongside Uttarakhand Governor Lt Gen Gurmit Singh, Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami, and Censor Board chairman Prasoon Joshi inaugurated the village. The initiative, designed as a space for writers, has a main building, library, museum and writers' cottage.
articles.title: Lekhak Gaon, India’s first writers' village, opens in Dehradun
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Ex-cricketer Robin Uthappa has clarified after getting arrest warrant in a PF fraud case. A regional PF commissioner in Bengaluru alleged Uthappa hasn't paid PF dues of employees of Centaurus Lifestyle Brands. Uthappa said he had resigned from the company's directorship years ago. He added he had also initiated legal proceedings against the company as it failed to repay funds.
articles.title: Robin Uthappa issues clarification after getting arrest warrant in PF fraud case
articles.subtitle: 'I did not have an active executive role'

articles.content: United States (US) deported around 271,000 illegal immigrants in the fiscal year 2024 under President Joe Biden's administration, the highest since 2014, according to US Immigration and Customs Enforcement's report. The tally was the highest since Biden took office in 2021 and higher than any year of President-elect Donald Trump's 2017-2021 administration, according to the US government data.
articles.title: Biden govt deports more migrants than Trump's, hits 10-year high
articles.subtitle: Report comes weeks before Trump takes office

articles.content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said Elon Musk is a "legendary entrepreneur" but is a "bully". "He...likes to get into fights," Altman stated, adding that Musk has previously fought with many others including Jeff Bezos, Bill Gates and Mark Zuckerberg. "Right now, it's me," he said, referring to Musk's current lawsuit that seeks to stop OpenAI from becoming a for-profit company.
articles.title: Elon Musk is a bully, likes to get into fights: Sam Altman
articles.subtitle: Musk co-founded OpenAI

articles.content: A 90-year-old woman died after her blanket caught fire due to the closely-kept room heater in Madhya Pradesh's Mauganj. She was rushed to the hospital in critical condition, where she died. Around 3 o'clock, when the family was in deep sleep, they sensed a burning smell, said Rajesh Tiwari, son of deceased Lalita Tiwari.
articles.title: 90-year-old woman burnt to death after closely-kept heater ignites fire in blanket in MP
articles.subtitle: Police have sent the body for the post-mortem

articles.content: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday addressed 'Hala Modi' event in Kuwait. "Since the time I have stepped here, I'm feeling a different sense of belonging...it seems as if a mini Hindustan has come in front of me," PM said during the community event. "India was one of the first countries in world to recognise Kuwait after its independence," he added.
articles.title: Seems like mini Hindustan: PM during Kuwait's 'Hala Modi' event
articles.subtitle: 'Indian PM came here after 4 decades'

articles.content: BJP-led Mahayuti government in Maharashtra on Saturday announced portfolio allocation with Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis keeping the Home Ministry. Deputy CMs Eknath Shinde got Urban Development, Housing and Public Works, while Ajit Pawar got Finance and Planning departments. Announcement came hours after Fadnavis said that the portfolio allocation has been finalised.
articles.title: Fadnavis keeps Home Ministry, Shinde gets Urban Development in new Maha Cabinet
articles.subtitle: Hasan Sakina gets Medical Education dept

articles.content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said states rejected a proposal to bring aviation turbine fuel (ATF) under the GST regime. "States did not feel comfortable. They see ATF as part of the crude, petroleum and diesel basket, and therefore they said that alone can't be taken out," she stated. ATF currently attracts an excise duty and a value added tax (VAT).
articles.title: States rejected bid to bring aviation turbine fuel under GST: FM
articles.subtitle: Central excise duty on ATF is currently at 11%

articles.content: Justin Trudeau's key ally Jagmeet Singh has said that he would vote in favour of a motion of no-confidence against the Canadian PM. If Trudeau resigns, members of his Liberal Party will name an interim leader to take over as PM. The party will then set up a special leadership convention to select a new leader.
articles.title: What happens if Justin Trudeau resigns amid political crisis in Canada?
articles.subtitle: 'I called for Trudeau to resign and he should'

articles.content: Actor Allu Arjun has said that "nobody is at fault" and he doesn't blame anyone over the stampede at a theatre during 'Pushpa 2' premiere in which a woman died. He added that a "lot of misinformation" is being spread and his "character assassination" is being done. Furthermore, he said he's being updated hourly about the injured boy's condition.
articles.title: My character assassination is being done: Allu Arjun on 'Pushpa 2' stampede
articles.subtitle: 'Not true that I was being irresponsible'

articles.content: A French court sentenced eight people to jail in connection with the beheading of teacher Samuel Paty, who had shown caricatures of Prophet Mohammad in a class debate on freedom of expression. The court handed down prison terms ranging from one to 16 years to the accused. Paty was killed by a Chechen assailant in October 2020 over prophet's cartoons.
articles.title: 8 convicted for teacher's murder over prophet caricature in France
articles.subtitle: Assailant was shot by police after the incident

articles.content: The US' Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has recognised tea from the Camellia sinensis plant as a healthy beverage. "We are happy to know that tea derived from Camellia sinensis has got this recognition," Bidyananda Barkakoty, ex-vice chairman of Tea Board of India, said. "Research worldwide has found the health benefits of drinking tea," he added.
articles.title: Tea from Camellia sinensis plant recognised as healthy by US' FDA
articles.subtitle: Camellia sinensis is native to Asia

articles.content: During his two-day visit to Kuwait, PM Narendra Modi visited the Gulf Spic labour camp and interacted with Indian workers. PM Modi also had snacks and beverage during his interaction with Indian workers in Gulf nation. Earlier, the PM met Abdul Lateef Al Nesef and Abdullah Al Baroun, who published and translated the Arabic versions of the Ramayana and Mahabharata.
articles.title: PM Modi visits labour camp and meets Indian workers in Kuwait
articles.subtitle: It's 1st visit of Indian PM to Kuwait in 43 yrs

articles.content: Basram Meena, whose sister Anita Meena died in the Jaipur tanker-truck accident fire, said he identified his sister's body with her toe ring after a six-hour-long search. Anita, a police constable with the Rajasthan Armed Constabulary (RAC), was among the victims in the incident. An LPG tanker collided with a truck on Friday, sparking a massive fireball.
articles.title: Recognised sister's body by her toe ring: Man on Jaipur LPG tanker crash
articles.subtitle: 'Her body was severely burned & unrecognisable'

articles.content: Varun Dhawan opened up about the time he was stalked by a fan. He shared that the woman who was stalking him was the "wife of a very powerful man". "She was being catfished...Someone was talking to her using my name. She knew everything about my house and she thought I was going to leave my family...It became...scary," Varun recalled.
articles.title: The wife of a powerful man stalked me, entered my house: Varun Dhawan
articles.subtitle: He said he had to call police afterwards

articles.content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday said payment aggregators handling transactions below ₹2,000 are eligible for GST exemptions. She added that this exemption does not extend to payment gateways and other fintech services. Additionally, penal charges levied and collected by banks and NBFCs from borrowers for non-compliance with loan terms will not attract GST.
articles.title: Payment aggregators doing under ₹2,000 transactions get GST relief
articles.subtitle: Decisions were taken at 55th GST Council meet

articles.content: When Raj Shamani asked Palki Sharma if India can become the 3rd largest economy in the world by 2030, she said that it is a doable bet. She said, "As we are growing in a sustainable way, our strengths are growing startups and innovation which will speed up our growth." She also talked about the India's demographic dividend on the podcast.
articles.title: India can become 3rd largest economy by 2030: Palki Sharma
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Congress on Saturday criticised the Election Commission of India (ECI) for amending some rules linked to electronic documents, including inspection of CCTV footage and video footage of candidates. "Why is ECI so afraid of transparency?" Congress General Secretary asked. "This move of ECI will be challenged legally right away," Jairam wrote on X sharing the amended notification.
articles.title: Why is ECI afraid of transparency: Congress on changed poll rules
articles.subtitle: Law ministry notified the change on December 20

articles.content: Blake Lively has sued her 'It Ends With Us' co-star Justin Baldoni for sexual harassment. In the lawsuit, the actress alleged that Baldoni attempted to mount a smear campaign against her and claimed that his behaviour caused her and her family "severe emotional distress". Meanwhile, a lawyer for Baldoni called the suit "shameful" and full of "categorically false accusations".
articles.title: Actress Blake Lively sues 'It Ends With Us' co-star Justin Baldoni for sexual harassment
articles.subtitle: Suit accuses Baldoni of 'social manipulation'

articles.content: Rashmika Mandanna opened up about filming the song 'Peelings' for 'Pushpa 2' and shared that it was not an easy decision to do the song. "I'm someone who has...phobia of being lifted, I wasn't very comfortable with people lifting me and here's the song where I'm only being lifted," she added. "I was like, 'Let's just do it'," said Rashmika.
articles.title: Not comfortable with people lifting me, have phobia: Rashmika
articles.subtitle: 'Once you trust the man, it becomes fun'

articles.content: A 16-year-old girl died of suffocation while she was taking a bath due to a geyser gas leak at her house in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh. The girl's brother said the bathroom door was locked from outside as a precaution due to her previous fainting episodes. As per the family, the girl's mother had gone to a shop when incident occurred.
articles.title: 16-year-old girl dies of suffocation while bathing due to geyser gas leak in UP
articles.subtitle: Girl had reportedly fainted similarly 2 yrs ago

articles.content: AIMIM MLA Akbaruddin Owaisi claimed that Allu Arjun was informed about the stampede which happened during the premiere of 'Pushpa 2' at a Hyderabad theatre. "Police told him that there was a stampede and two children have fallen, one woman is dead. The film star turned to them, smiled and said, now the film will be a hit," he said.
articles.title: Allu was told a lady died, he said 'film will be hit': Akbaruddin
articles.subtitle: 'That gentleman went waving'

articles.content: Centre has amended Conduct of Election Rules, restricting public access to election-related documents such as CCTV footage as well as video recordings of candidates. Law Ministry said a court case was what prompted government to amend rules. However, documents such as nomination forms and election account statements mentioned in Conduct of Election Rules will be available for public inspection.
articles.title: Centre amends poll rules to curb public scrutiny of video records
articles.subtitle: Law ministry notified the change on December 20

articles.content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the 55th GST Council meeting has deferred the decision about tax rates on food delivery by online and quick commerce platforms. She added that the Group of Ministers (GoM) will further discuss the topic. Earlier there were reports that GST on food delivery charges could be reduced to 5% from 18%.
articles.title: GST panel defers decision on tax rate on food delivery charges
articles.subtitle: The meeting took place in Rajasthan

articles.content: Billionaire Elon Musk, who's set to join US President-elect Donald Trump's administration as an outside adviser, said that the Christmas market attack in Germany is a "deliberate mass murder". Earlier, the Tesla CEO called German Chancellor Olaf Scholz an "incompetent fool" and asked him to resign "immediately" over the attack. At least 5 people were killed in the incident.
articles.title: Deliberate mass murder: Elon Musk on German market attack
articles.subtitle: Over 200 people were injured in the attack

articles.content: George Eastham, a member of England's 1966 World Cup-winning squad, has died at 88, his former club Stoke City said on Friday. Son of England international George Senior, midfielder and inside forward Eastham played for Newcastle United, Arsenal and Stoke City in the English top-flight league in a professional career spanning two decades, and earned 19 international caps.
articles.title: England’s football legend George Eastham dies at 88
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The GST Council recommended exempting gene therapy from GST. Additionally, agriculturists like farmers and plantation workers who sell black pepper and raisins won't face the tax. It also suggested 18% GST on the resale of second-hand EVs by registered car sellers and exemption from GST for transactions between individuals. It also suggested GST reduction to 5% for fortified rice kernels.
articles.title: What gets costlier and cheaper after GST Council meet?
articles.subtitle: 55th GST Council meeting was held in Rajasthan

articles.content: Ex-India coach Ravi Shastri joked that Australia batter Travis Head's new surname is Head'ache'. "They're looking for balms in India. For foot problems, ankle problems (and) even a headache they are looking for a balm...He's ideal for that," he added. Head is the leading run scorer in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy, having scored 409 runs at an average of 81.8.
articles.title: Travis Head's new surname is Head'ache',  jokes Ravi Shastri
articles.subtitle: 'He is very smart'

articles.content: Swiggy's ₹11,327-crore IPO, which was India's second-largest IPO this year, delivered roughly 50% returns since market debut in November, data compiled by YourStory showed. Shares of Ola Electric and FirstCry are up 25% and 30%, respectively, from their issue prices. Go Digit, Awfis, Ixigo and Zinka Logistics shares have jumped 22%, 89%, 70% and 82%, respectively, since market debut.
articles.title: How have major startup IPOs of 2024 performed since market debut?
articles.subtitle: MobiKwik is 94% above issue price

articles.content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday announced that GST on sale of all old and used vehicles, including electric vehicles (EVs), will increase from 12% to 18%. The rate will apply to the supplier's margin, meaning the difference between the purchase and selling prices. She further stated that no GST will be applicable on used EVs when sold among individuals.
articles.title: All used vehicles, including EVs, to attract 18% GST: Sitharaman
articles.subtitle: New EVs attract 5% GST

articles.content: Actress Shruti Haasan walked out of Adivi Sesh-starrer 'Dacoit' due to 'over-involvement of her co-star' rather than scheduling conflicts, according to a report. "The other actor was involved too much in the script, just like he does for his every film. Shruti...wasn't comfortable," a source was quoted as saying. The film stars Mrunal Thakur opposite Adivi.
articles.title: Shruti quit 'Dacoit' due to 'over-involvement of co-star': Report
articles.subtitle: It is directed by Shaneil Deo

articles.content: Miscreants attacked three Hindu temples and vandalised eight idols inside them in two days in Bangladesh's Mymensingh and Dinajpur districts, PTI reported. Police stated a 27-year-old man has been arrested in connection with the attacks, adding that an investigation is underway. Earlier this month, Bangladesh confirmed 88 incidents of communal violence against minorities, mostly Hindus.
articles.title: 3 Hindu temples attacked, idols vandalised in B'desh,1 arrested
articles.subtitle: Earlier, a Hindu monk was arrested in Bangladesh

articles.content: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy, while addressing the state Assembly, alleged that actor Allu Arjun attended the 'Pushpa 2' premiere at the theatre on December 4 despite police denying permission. A woman was killed in the stampede at the theatre. Allu Arjun didn't leave the hall even after the woman's death and police had to "force him out", he claimed.
articles.title: Allu Arjun didn't leave theatre even after woman's death, police forced him out: Telangana CM
articles.subtitle: 'He waved from car, causing jostling among fans'

articles.content: Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut said his party might contest upcoming BMC elections independently. "Talks are on between Uddhav Thackeray and other party leaders (about whether to go solo) for BMC polls. Workers want the party to contest the polls solo," Raut added. Even before Sena split, when party was in alliance with BJP, it contested BMC polls independently.
articles.title: Workers want party to contest BMC polls solo: Sena (UBT)'s Raut
articles.subtitle: Mahayuti alliance to contest poll together

articles.content: The GST Council has recommended varying GST rates on popcorn depending on its flavour and packaging. While pre-packaged popcorn mixed with salt and spices will have 12% GST, the same popcorn will be taxed at 5% GST if sold unpackaged. Popcorn with sugar, like caramel-coated popcorn, will attract a higher GST of 18% as it'll be considered a sugar confectionery.
articles.title: What are the different GST rates for popcorn?
articles.subtitle: The 55th GST Council meet was held in Rajasthan

articles.content: The suspect in the car-ramming attack at a Christmas market in Germany that killed five people is an "Islamophobe", the country's Interior Minister Nancy Faeser said. German media named the suspect, a 50-year-old doctor from Saudi Arabia, as Taleb A. As per reports, he is thought to have worked to help fellow Saudis leave their home country.
articles.title: Saudi doctor who attacked German Xmas market killing 5 is an Islamophobe: Minister
articles.subtitle: Around 200 people injured in the attack

articles.content: After temple authorities refused to return an iPhone to a devotee after accidentally fell into donation box, Tamil Nadu Minister Sekar Babu stated any item deposited in the offering box goes into God's account. "Rules do not permit the administration to return the offerings back to the devotees," Babu added. The temple offered the devotee the SIM card.
articles.title: Offerings go into God's account: Babu as iPhone fell in temple box
articles.subtitle: 'Phone fell while pulling out notes from pocket'

articles.content: Mumbai skipper Shreyas Iyer hammered a total of 10 sixes to record a blistering 51-ball century in Vijay Hazare Trophy 2024-25. Mumbai were up against Karnataka in another exciting fixture of the tournament. The cricketer, who had a remarkable 2024 with the bat, came up with a solid knock of unbeaten 114 runs, where he slammed 10 maximums and five boundaries.
articles.title: Shreyas Iyer hits 10 sixes to score 51-ball century vs Karnataka
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy on Saturday criticised film personalities for going to meet actor Allu Arjun after his arrest in the 'Pushpa 2' stampede case but not showing "empathy" to visit a boy, who was injured in the incident, undergoing treatment at a hospital. "I appeal to the top film personalities that they should not be inhuman," Reddy added.
articles.title: Film personalities met Allu Arjun after arrest, but not injured boy in hospital: Telangana CM
articles.subtitle: Reddy was addressing the T'gana Assembly

articles.content: Samsung has reportedly fired multiple employees for leaking the images of its upcoming Galaxy S25+ smartphone. As per a report by PhoneArena, Samsung identified the employees through a device identification number visible in one of the leaked images. Samsung is expected to unveil its flagship Galaxy S25 smartphone series in January 2025.
articles.title: Samsung fires employees for leaking Galaxy S25+ images: Report
articles.subtitle: 'Samsung's Unpacked event is on Jan 22'

articles.content: PM Narendra Modi met 101-year-old former IFS officer Mangal Sain Handa in Kuwait after receiving a request from his granddaughter on social media platform X. A few hours ahead of his scheduled arrival in Kuwait, PM Modi responded to a message from his granddaughter, requesting him to meet her grandfather. "Nana...is a great admirer of yours," she had written.
articles.title: PM Modi meets 101-year-old ex-IFS officer in Kuwait after granddaughter's request
articles.subtitle: PM also met other members of Indian diaspora

articles.content: A multi-storey building collapsed in Sohana area of Punjab's Mohali on Saturday, in which several people are feared trapped. As per preliminary information, the building collapsed after a basement was dug up nearby. Sohana's former sarpanch said that he came to know that a gym was damaged and at the time of the incident some youngsters were inside gym.
articles.title: Multi-storey building collapses in Punjab; several feared trapped
articles.subtitle: Rescue teams have reached the spot

articles.content: WWE Champion Cody Rhodes was spotted wearing a neck brace at his wife's Brandi Rhodes studio, Naked Mind Yoga and Pilates in Atlanta, Georgia. The WWE Champion was witnessed clicking a lot of pictures with his beloved fans. Rhodes had to wear a neck brace following the brutal attack by Kevin Owens on the recent WWE Saturday Night's Main Event.
articles.title: Cody Rhodes makes public appearance after Kevin Owens' attack
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Bengaluru-based space startup Unimech Aerospace and Manufacturing's ₹500-crore IPO will be the sole issue in the mainboard segment next week. The IPO will open on December 23, with a price band of ₹745-785 per share. The SME segment will see IPOs from Solar91 Cleantech and Anya Polytech. The week will also see the listing of eight companies.
articles.title: Which IPOs will hit the stock market next week?
articles.subtitle: Solar91 aims to raise ₹106 crore

articles.content: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday met Abdul Lateef Al Nesef who published the Arabic versions of the Ramayana and Mahabharata during his two-day visit to Kuwait. PM Modi also met Abdullah Al Baroun, who translated Ramayana and Mahabharata into the Arabic language. It is the first visit to the Gulf nation by an Indian Prime Minister in 43 years.
articles.title: PM meets translator, publisher of Ramayana in Arabic in Kuwait
articles.subtitle: PM also met 101-year-old ex-IFS officer

articles.content: Two people have been arrested for allegedly plotting to harm Zambia's President Hakainde Hichilema using witchcraft, police said. They were allegedly hired by brother of lawmaker Jay Banda, who escaped from police custody in August 2024 while facing charges of aggravated robbery. "The suspects were found in possession of assorted charms, including a live chameleon," police said.
articles.title: Chameleon used as charm in witchcraft plan against Zambia President
articles.subtitle: Banda's whereabouts are unknown

articles.content: Film producer Boney Kapoor opened up about undergoing a hair transplant and shared that his female following has increased after the procedure. "Earlier, only boys or those who knew me used to ask for photos. But nowadays females also approach me for...same," he added. "Who doesn't like female attention? All in all, it has been a wonderful experience," said Boney.
articles.title: My female following has increased after hair transplant: Boney
articles.subtitle: I am looking even better: Boney

articles.content: Lok Sabha lost 65 hours in Winter Session due to disruptions over various issues including Opposition's protest against Amit Shah's alleged insult to BR Ambedkar. The time lost during Winter session was highest compared to Budget Session in which 5:37 hours were lost and Monsoon session in which 1:53 hours were lost. Over 71 hours lost in all three sessions.
articles.title: Lok Sabha lost 65 hours due to disruption in Winter Session
articles.subtitle: Winter Session started on November 25

articles.content: Arjun Kapoor dismissed the claim that Salman Khan is a bully, adding, "When you're not always openly warm in...first few minutes, you feel they're being a certain way." "There is...lots of warmth to that man. It's just he might not give it in...first second. But you'll have to allow that to happen," he said in a chat with Raj Shamani.
articles.title: Salman is not a bully, there's lots of warmth to that man: Arjun
articles.subtitle: 'He is the most fearless man in the world'

articles.content: SaaS company Freshworks' Co-founder and Executive Chairman, Girish Mathrubootham, has sold roughly $40 million worth of the company's shares. According to SEC filings, he sold nearly 2.5 million shares in multiple transactions at an average price range of $15.33 to $16.50 per share. Earlier this year, Girish stepped down as the CEO of Freshworks.
articles.title: Freshworks' Girish Mathrubootham sells shares worth $40 million
articles.subtitle: Freshworks' shares are down 30% this year

articles.content: An investigation has been opened after an air hostess fell down, not realising that the stairs were not placed at the aircraft door at UK's East Midlands Airport. Emergency services were called to the scene following the incident, which happened at around 4.30 pm on Monday. Investigators visited the airport to understand more about the circumstances.
articles.title: Air hostess falls from plane at UK airport as stairs not attached to door
articles.subtitle: She was taken to a hospital

articles.content: A woman in MP was allegedly assaulted by her husband and in-laws, who burned her private parts with a hot iron rod and applied chilli powder, police said. The in-laws tortured the woman, blaming her after they witnessed another man misbehaving with her at their home in Rajgarh. Police have registered a case against the in-laws and the alleged molester.
articles.title: Husband, in-laws torture woman with hot iron, rub chilli powder in genitals in MP
articles.subtitle: The incident took place on December 13

articles.content: Ex-Australia cricketer Michael Hussey recalled having "one stern word" with Jasprit Bumrah after the latter gave AB De Villiers a "big send-off" after taking his wicket during IPL 2014 season. "AB wasn't too happy about it," he said. "I...pulled Bumrah aside and said, 'You don't need to do that...Getting wicket is enough...That's the biggest sledge you can give'," Hussey added.
articles.title: Had stern word with Bumrah after he gave AB a big send-off in IPL: Hussey
articles.subtitle: 'I remember facing Bumrah in the nets'

articles.content: A man, named Akash, died by suicide for allegedly gambling away his mother's cancer treatment savings in an online rummy game in Tamil Nadu's Chennai, according to a Times of India report. After being scolded by his brother and mother for stealing ₹30,000 cash, the 26-year-old deceased went missing and was later found hanging on the terrace of the house.
articles.title: Man gambles away mom’s cancer funds in TN, dies by suicide: Report
articles.subtitle: Akash was addicted to online games

articles.content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis said a good detention centre would be built in Mumbai to keep illegal Bangladeshi migrants. "We've seen that in drug cases, illegal entry cases, illegal Bangladeshis are foreign nationals and they cannot be kept directly in our jails," he said adding that they have asked BMC to provide land that conforms to norms of detention camps.
articles.title: Good detention centre to be built in Mumbai for illegal Bangladeshis: Maha CM
articles.subtitle: A Bangladeshi couple was arrested on Friday

articles.content: Actress Mandira Bedi revealed choreographer Saroj Khan told her she was dancing like Sunny Deol while shooting the 'Mehndi Laga Ke Rakhna' song from Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge (DDLJ). "Khan said, 'Sunny shakes his shoulders...You shake your shoulders really well but as a woman and as a female actress you need to learn how to shake your hips'," Bedi recalled.
articles.title: Saroj said I was dancing like Sunny during 'DDLJ' shoot: Mandira
articles.subtitle: 'DDLJ' released in 1995

articles.content: A couple was threatened and extorted by a group after being caught in an objectionable position in a secluded area in MP's Rewa. A video of the perpetrators molesting woman and forcing couple to pay money has surfaced. The incident reportedly took place near Purwa Falls. Rewa Superintendent of Police said efforts are underway to locate victims and assured confidentiality.
articles.title: Couple threatened and extorted, woman molested at Madhya Pradesh picnic spot
articles.subtitle: 'The culprits will face stringent action'

articles.content: Winter skin struggles like dryness and eczema worsen due to cold air and low humidity. Dermatologist Dr Shireen Furtado recommends moisturising with ceramides, using humidifiers, and avoiding hot showers. For eczema, hydrate skin, avoid triggers, and consult experts for severe cases. A proper skincare routine ensures healthy, comfortable skin during chilly months.
articles.title: How to beat dryness and eczema in winter?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Brazil's 18-year-old tennis player Joao Fonseca met Rafael Nadal and recreated a picture that he clicked with the former Spain tennis player 14 years ago. Joao first met Nadal with his mother when he was four years old. The Brazilian, currently ranked 145, called Nadal a legend and said, "My coach is a Rafa fan...My phone unlock screen is Rafa."
articles.title: Brazilian tennis player Fonseca recreates 14-yr-old pic with Nadal
articles.subtitle: Nadal retired from tennis in October this year

articles.content: Boxer Tyson Fury's wife Paris Fury revealed that the boxer has "cut himself off" from the family after his last fight in which he was defeated by Oleksandr Usyk in May this year. She stated that Tyson is "very determined" for the rematch. The rematch between the two boxers will take place on Saturday.
articles.title: He has cut himself off from us after last fight: Tyson Fury's wife
articles.subtitle: Fury lost for the 1st time in his career in May

articles.content: US President-elect Donald Trump moved around $4 billion stake he owns in Trump Media & Technology, Truth Social’s parent company, to a revocable trust of which he is the sole beneficiary. Trump transferred 114.75 million shares, which is 53% of the company's stock, as a “bona fide gift” to his trust, according to the US Securities and Exchange Commission's filing.
articles.title: Trump moves $4 billion stake in Trump Media into revocable trust
articles.subtitle: Trump Media has mcap of around $7.7 billion

articles.content: Two abandoned temples have been found in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh within 36 hours. One of the temples was found in the Sarai Rehman locality, while the other was found in Sarai Miyan.
