The locks on the gate of the temple found on Thursday evening were broken in the presence of the police and the temple was cleaned up and purified.
articles.title: 2 abandoned temples found within 36 hours in Aligarh
articles.subtitle: No report of any unpleasant incident: Police

articles.content: Punjab batter Anmolpreet Singh on Saturday smashed the fastest hundred by an Indian in 50-over cricket (List A) history. The 26-year-old took 35 deliveries to reach the three-figure mark against Arunachal in their Vijay Hazare Trophy 2024-25 match. Anmolpreet, who had gone unsold in IPL 2025 mega auction, was batting with his cousin Prabhsimran Singh, when he broke the record.
articles.title: Batting with his cousin, Anmolpreet hits fastest-ever ton by an Indian in 50-over cricket
articles.subtitle: The previous record was held by Yusuf Pathan

articles.content: On being asked about young Indian chess players Gukesh D, R Praggnanandhaa and Arjun Erigaisi being called "Vishy's army" and "Vishy's children", five-time world champion Viswanathan Anand said, "Too creative an interpretation." "They are following their dreams," he stated. Anand was Gukesh's mentor in World Chess Championship which Gukesh won by defeating Ding Liren.
articles.title: Creative interpretation: Anand on Gukesh, Arjun being called 'Vishy's army'
articles.subtitle: Gukesh became youngest-ever world champion

articles.content: BESCOM has scheduled power outages in several Bengaluru areas on Sunday (December 22), for maintenance and reconductoring works. The outages, lasting 2 to 8 hours, will affect Kallahalli, Alagavai, Challakere Road, Kamanabavi Badavane, Jogimatti Road, Bramhasandragollarahatti, Jodidevarahally, Doddaagrahara, Chikkaagrahara, Halavudara, Obalapura, Chikkagangawadi, Doddagangawadi, and nearby areas.
articles.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face power cut on Sunday, list of affected areas released
articles.subtitle: To check entire list of places to be affected

articles.content: The Israeli military said it failed to intercept a missile from Yemen on Saturday that fell near Tel Aviv, injuring 14 people. Yemen's Houthi rebels claimed responsibility for the attack, stating their solidarity with Palestinians and vowing to continue such actions until the blockade of Gaza ends. This comes after Israel launched strikes against infrastructure in Houthi-held parts of Yemen.
articles.title: Houthi missile evades Israeli defences, injures 14 in Tel Aviv
articles.subtitle: The missile landed in Tel Aviv's Bnei Brak

articles.content: The Central Board of Film Certification cleared Varun Dhawan-starrer 'Baby John' after suggesting some changes to it. Reportedly, two dialogues involving the names of Mahatma Jyotiba Phule and Lal Bahadur Shastri were censored in the film. A scene showing a character kicking a 'kalash' (pot) was also modified. The film also stars Wamiqa Gabbi, Sanya Malhotra and Keerthy Suresh.
articles.title: Scene showing a character kicking 'kalash' modified in 'Baby John'
articles.subtitle: It will be released on December 25

articles.content: Days after Karnataka BJP leader CT Ravi was arrested in derogatory remarks case, he made the allegations that Karnataka government is tracking his phone and demanded an investigation over the matter. CT Ravi was arrested on Thursday for allegedly using derogatory words against state minister Laxmi Hebbalkar and was granted bail on Friday by the High Court.
articles.title: My phone being tracked: K'taka BJP leader CT Ravi after his arrest
articles.subtitle: 'Is Belagavi a Banana Republic?'

articles.content: Talking about India batter Virat Kohli's form, former South Africa batter Herschelle Gibbs said, "Kohli's standards are still high." "You do not play for years and score 9,000 Test runs without knowing what you're doing wrong," he stated. Kohli has scored 126 runs in the three Tests of the ongoing five-match series against Australia.
articles.title: You don't score 9,000 runs without knowing where you're wrong: Gibbs on Kohli
articles.subtitle: Kohli has scored 9,166 runs in Tests so far

articles.content: Delhi Health Minister Saurabh Bhardwaj rejected reports claiming a prosecution sanction against Arvind Kejriwal in the excise policy case, stating that no such sanction has been issued. He said, "I am shocked...don't they have the basic knowledge that prosecution sanction is required to prosecute a chief minister or a minister?" Bhardwaj called it part of a political conspiracy.
articles.title: No prosecution sanction issued against Kejriwal: AAP's Bhardwaj
articles.subtitle: 'If LG has given any sanction, make it public'

articles.content: Singer Abhijeet Bhattacharya revealed actor Shah Rukh Khan's contemporaries never considered him a star, adding that they'd call him 'hakla' (stammered) behind his back. "There were a few stars who told me, 'hakle ke liye gaa raha hai na tu' (You're singing for the stammered)?" he stated. Abhijeet added he "lost interest" in playback singing for stars "after that experience".
articles.title: SRK's fellow stars would call him hakla behind his back: Abhijeet
articles.subtitle: 'I started focusing on my shows and concerts'

articles.content: A uniformed police officer was spotted riding as a pillion passenger on a two-wheeler, with the rider not wearing a helmet. The bike, which displayed a 'police' sticker, was seen on the streets of Mumbai. "No helmet, triple seat, and police in uniform. What is the fine or charge? Is this legal only for the police?" the Reddit post read.
articles.title: Cop rides triple seat with helmetless biker in Mumbai
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Former Indian captain Virat Kohli is reportedly planning to move to London with his family. Speculation about his relocation to the UK has been circulating for the past few months. Robin Uthappa, Farokh Engineer, Rusi Surti, Budhi Kunderan and Unmukt Chand are few Indian cricketers who have settled abroad.
articles.title: 5 Indian cricketers who have settled abroad
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: LinkedIn COO Daniel Shapero revealed that a key job interview question candidates are being asked this year is - "Tell me a story about how you used AI at the workplace or at home". He added that employers are looking for people who're comfortable with AI. "You hear about people planning family trips...[or] summarising meeting notes," he said.
articles.title: LinkedIn COO Shapero reveals key job interview question candidates are being asked
articles.subtitle: 'They know they've to bring AI into day-to-day'

articles.content: Congress leader Sachin Pilot condemned Union Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks on Babasaheb Ambedkar, calling them insulting. Pilot said, "The feelings that the Home Minister has for Ambedkar Saheb, came out on his tongue inside the House." Highlighting widespread protests across the country in response to Shah's comments, Pilot added, "The entire BJP should apologise."
articles.title: Feelings that Shah has for Dr Ambedkar have come out: Pilot
articles.subtitle: Various parties called for protests against Shah

articles.content: Two people were injured on Saturday after a parcel containing an electronic circuit and batteries delivered to a house exploded in the Sabarmati area of Gujarat's Ahmedabad. Police said the person who delivered the parcel as well as the recipient were injured in incident, adding the accused has been arrested. The bomb disposal squad and forensic teams arrived at spot.
articles.title: 2 injured after parcel explodes in Gujarat's Sabarmati, 1 arrested
articles.subtitle: 'There was an internal dispute between the two'

articles.content: Akheram, whose brother Radheshyam was injured after an LPG truck exploded following a collision in Jaipur and killed 14 people, said he was woken up at 5:50am and informed of the incident. "People told me [my brother] walked 600 metres from explosion site...Instead of helping, most bystanders just made videos," Akheram told TOI. "Radheshyam was conscious, talking coherently," he added.
articles.title: My brother walked 600 metres, bystanders just made videos: Kin of Jaipur fire victim
articles.subtitle: 'He gave number to the caller who alerted me'

articles.content: King Charles III, who has been undergoing cancer treatment, on Friday interacted with community members during a recent engagement in east London. He joked "I am still alive" when an Indian-origin man enquired about his health at the venue. The query came amid reports that the 76-year-old monarch will continue his cancer treatment into the upcoming year.
articles.title: I am still alive, jokes King Charles as Indian-origin man asks 'How are you?'
articles.subtitle: His cancer diagnosis was announced in February

articles.content: Amid the political controversy surrounding US billionaire George Soros, Union minister Hardeep Singh Puri claimed that Congress MP Shashi Tharoor invited Soros to dinner in the US in 2009. Responding to it, Tharoor said, "Our recollections differ...All I remember hearing from him at that occasion was his strong objection to our Government’s stand on the West’s responsibility for global warming!"
articles.title: Puri says 'Tharoor invited Soros for dinner'; latter responds
articles.subtitle: Tharoor was MoS External Affairs at that time

articles.content: Gukesh D's chief trainer Grzegorz Gajewski said Gukesh will "never be a player like Magnus Carlsen in the sense of being an intuitive kind of a player". "He will never play in the Magnus style, but he can very well mimic it," Gajewski stated. Gukesh defeated Ding Liren in World Chess Championship to become the youngest-ever world champion.
articles.title: Gukesh will never play in Magnus style, but can mimic it: Gajewski
articles.subtitle: Carlsen is five-time World Rapid champion

articles.content: Talking about BJP MPs Pratap Sarangi and Mukesh Rajput who were injured during a scuffle in Parliament, SP leader Jaya Bachchan said they were doing "drama" and acting awards should be given to them. Notably, FIR was registered against Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for allegedly pushing the MPs during a protest against Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks on BR Ambedkar.
articles.title: Doing drama, they deserve acting awards: Jaya on injured BJP MPs
articles.subtitle: 'It has become fashion to say Ambedkar'

articles.content: Sachin Tendulkar shared a video on 'X' featuring a young girl delivering a ball with an extraordinarily fast bowling action. Tendulkar compared her action to that of Zaheer Khan. Zaheer reposted it, saying, "You’re spot on with that, and I couldn’t agree more. Her action is so smooth and impressive—she’s showing a lot of promise already!"
articles.title: Sachin compares girl's bowling action to Zaheer's style, he reacts
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Pakistan batter Ahmed Shehzad recently opined that the country had a chance to host India during the Champions Trophy, but Pakistan Cricket Board missed the opportunity by agreeing for hybrid model. "Pakistan had golden chance to host India. PCB has missed the chance I think. We should forget that the Indian team will ever come to Pakistan now," he said.
articles.title: PCB missed the chance, India will never come to Pak now:  Shehzad
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: BJP leader Navya Haridas has filed a petition in the Kerala High Court challenging Priyanka Gandhi's election from Wayanad in recent by-polls. Haridas claims discrepancies in her nomination and alleged inaccurate disclosure of her family's assets, violating the Model Code of Conduct. Haridas, who lost by over five lakh votes, accused Priyanka of misleading voters and engaging in corrupt practices.
articles.title: BJP's Navya Haridas moves HC challenging Priyanka's Wayanad win
articles.subtitle: Kerala HC is set to hear the case in Jan 2025

articles.content: Kidney issues aren't limited to adults; children can face them too. Symptoms like swelling, frequent urination, or fatigue shouldn't be ignored. Early detection can prevent severe complications. Nephrologist Dr Arun Kumar J emphasizes on the importance of hydration, balanced nutrition, and timely check-ups in protecting kids'health.
articles.title: How to spot early kidney issues in children?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Mexican wrestler Rey Misterio, the uncle of WWE legend Rey Mysterio, passed away aged 66. Misterio, whose real name was Miguel Angel Lopez Dias, gained prominence in lucha libre scene in Mexico, earning championship titles with prominent organisations such as World Wrestling Association and Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide. In November, Rey Mysterio had lost his father Roberto Gutierrez.
articles.title: Wrestler Rey Misterio, uncle of WWE legend Rey Mysterio, passes away at 66
articles.subtitle: Rey Misterio was also known as Misterio Sr

articles.content: Infosys Founder Narayana Murthy said cities like Bengaluru, Pune and Hyderabad have become "extremely challenging to live in, difficult to navigate and have witnessed rising pollution levels". "They're heading towards becoming unliveable," he said. He added that in case India fails to control climate change, there'll be "mass migration from rural parts of states" to these cities.
articles.title: Bengaluru, Pune, Hyderabad are becoming unliveable: Narayana Murthy
articles.subtitle: 'We must ensure there's no mass migration'

articles.content: The US avoided a government shutdown as the Congress passed a stopgap funding bill, which extends government funding into March. The US Senate passed the bill after the funding deadline, averting a shutdown that would have had widespread impacts. The bill, which was passed by the House on Friday evening, will now be sent to US President Joe Biden.
articles.title: US avoids government shutdown
articles.subtitle: Biden will sign it into a law

articles.content: Taiwan has received 38 M1A2T Abrams tanks from the US amid increasing tensions with China. This marks the first US tank delivery to the island in 23 years. The shipment is part of a larger order of 122 tanks expected over the next two years. The M1A2T is reportedly regarded as one of the most advanced main battle tanks globally.
articles.title: Taiwan gets world's most advanced tanks from US amid China threat
articles.subtitle: M1A2T Abrams is an advanced version of M1 Abrams

articles.content: All five passengers escaped unhurt after their car flipped at least eight times in an accident on a highway in Rajasthan's Nagaur on Friday. The passengers reportedly got out of the car after it landed near a showroom, then walked inside and requested tea. "As soon as they came in, they asked for tea like nothing...happened," a showroom employee said.
articles.title: Passengers escape unhurt after car flips 8 times in Rajasthan, then go ask for tea
articles.subtitle: 'No one was hurt, not even a single scratch'

articles.content: Fazalhaq Farooqi has been fined 15 per cent of his match fee for breaching Level 1 of the ICC Code of Conduct during second ODI against Zimbabwe. Fazalhaq was found to have breached Article 2.8 of the ICC Code of Conduct for Players and Player Support Personnel, which relates to "showing dissent at an Umpire's decision during an International Match."
articles.title: Fazalhaq Farooqi fined for showing dissent in second ODI vs ZIM
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Ukrainian drones hit several buildings in Russia's Kazan in a 9/11 style attack, with videos surfacing on social media. Officials said that eight drones attacked the city. Six hit residential buildings, one hit an industrial facility and one was shot down over a river, the statement by the officials added.
articles.title: Russian buildings hit in 9/11 style attack by Ukrainian drones
articles.subtitle: To watch the videos

articles.content: South Africa's Heinrich Klaasen has been fined 15 percent of his match fee for kicking the stumps after being dismissed in the 2nd ODI against Pakistan in Cape Town.  Klaasen was found to have breached Article 2.2, which relates to 'abuse of cricket equipment or clothing, ground equipment or fixtures and fittings during an international match'.
articles.title: Heinrich Klaasen fined for kicking stumps in second ODI vs Pak
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Srinagar recorded -8.5⁰C, marking its coldest December night since 1974 as the 40-day Chillai-Kalan period of intense coldwave set in. This marks the third-lowest December temperature in Srinagar in 133 years. South Kashmir’s Shopian and Anantnag recorded even harsher temperatures at -10.4⁰C and -10.5⁰C respectively, while the minimum temperature at Pulwama settled at -10.3⁰C and -6.8⁰C in Kulgam.
articles.title: Srinagar records its coldest December night in 50 years at -8.5⁰C
articles.subtitle: Many water bodies including Dal lake were frozen

articles.content: Actress Mandira Bedi, who was a presenter at the ODI World Cup 2003, revealed she was worried and nervous during the first week, adding she would cry after every show. "[The legends would answer] whatever the hell they wanted to...nothing connected to my question...I felt disrespected," she recalled. Mandira further stated that she also didn't believe that she belonged there.
articles.title: Would cry after presenting every show: Mandira on cricket WC 2003
articles.subtitle: 'One week went by with fumbles & mistakes'

articles.content: A temple's authorities in Tamil Nadu's Thiruporur refused to return an iPhone to a devotee after it fell into the donation box or 'hundi', saying it was "property of the deity". Devotee claimed his phone accidentally fell into 'hundi' while pulling out currency notes from his pocket. The temple, however, offered him the SIM card and access to download data.
articles.title: Temple refuses to return iPhone that fell in donation box in TN, says 'Deity's property'
articles.subtitle: Video shows iPhone in 'hundi' with notes

articles.content: A woman requested Prime Minister Narendra Modi to visit her 101-year-old former IFS officer grandfather Mangal Saini Handa while on his visit to Kuwait. "Nana is a great admirer of yours. Details have been emailed to your office," the woman posted on X. Replying to her, PM Modi said, "Absolutely! I look forward to meeting Handa ji in Kuwait today."
articles.title: Woman requests PM Modi to visit her 101-year-old grandfather in Kuwait, he responds
articles.subtitle: 'Nana ji is overjoyed'

articles.content: The Indian Express gave one and a half out of five stars to Anil Sharma's directorial 'Vanvaas', starring Nana Patekar and Utkarsh Sharma. The family drama starts in Varanasi, ends in Palampur in Himachal Pradesh, and feels every metre of that 1,391-km distance, the review read. "In parts, Anil suggests he's capable of a more thoughtful film," it read.
articles.title: Nana Patekar-starrer Vanvaas a plodding affair: The Indian Express
articles.subtitle: The film was released on December 20

articles.content: John Abraham penned a letter to Badri Prasad Pandey, the Minister of Culture, Tourism and Civil Aviation of Nepal, requesting him to cancel the elephant games at Chitwan Elephant Festival. He wrote these "intelligent, sensitive animals" often undergo "harsh training methods" and endure "immense physical and emotional strain" during these games. Elephant football and polo are played at festival.
articles.title: John urges Nepal to cancel elephant games at festival citing abuse
articles.subtitle: 'They are a national treasure in so many ways'

articles.content: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has clarified that his $100-million (nearly ₹850 crore) underground bunker in US' Hawaii "is just a little shelter". "I think the whole thing got blown out of proportion as if the whole ranch was some kind of doomsday bunker," Zuckerberg said. He added that he ranching in Hawaii and wants to create the world's "highest-quality beef".
articles.title: Zuckerberg says his ₹850-crore underground bunker is 'just a little shelter'
articles.subtitle: Hawaii property has 11 tree houses, 2 mansions

articles.content: Six people, including two children, were killed on Saturday after a container truck overturned and fell on a car and a two-wheeler on a national highway in Karnataka's Bangalore Rural district, police said. The victims were on their way to Vijayapura for vacation when the road accident took place. Following the accident, vehicular traffic on the national highway was affected.
articles.title: 6 dead as truck overturns and falls on car, two-wheeler in B'luru
articles.subtitle: 'Kindly co-operate'

articles.content: A Hindu marriage is a sacrament and not a commercial venture, the Supreme Court said on Thursday, highlighting concerns over the misuse of penal laws in matrimonial disputes. It clarified that alimony cannot be sought as a means to equalise wealth between spouses, even if the husband has achieved financial success post-separation.
articles.title: Wife cannot seek alimony to equalise husband's current wealth: Supreme Court
articles.subtitle: 'A Hindu marriage is a sacred institution'

articles.content: GST Council on Saturday postponed a decision on tax cuts for life and health insurance premiums. Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Samrat Choudhary said one more meeting of the Group of Ministers (GoM) is required to decide on taxation of group, individual and senior citizens' policies. "We (GoM) will meet in January again," he stated.
articles.title: GST Council defers decision on tax cuts for life, health insurance
articles.subtitle: GoM last met in November

articles.content: Abhinav Arora, 10-year-old self-proclaimed spiritual guru, filed a complaint in Mathura against YouTubers who "harassed" and "trolled" him on social media. "We will not spare them, even if we have to take the case to Supreme Court or High Court," Arora's lawyer said. Earlier in October, Abhinav's family claimed that he received a life threat from Lawrence Bishnoi gang.
articles.title: Abhinav Arora seeks FIR against YouTubers who trolled him
articles.subtitle: 'I am not so bad, like people blamed me'

articles.content: BSP Chief Mayawati on Saturday called for nationwide protests on December 24 over Union Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks on Babasaheb Ambedkar. She said, "His disrespect by Amit Shah hurts the hearts of the people." Mayawati demanded that Shah retract his statement, stating that people across all sections are angry and that the BSP is pressing for an apology.
articles.title: Mayawati calls for nationwide protest against Shah's remarks on Ambedkar
articles.subtitle: 'People across are quite agitated'

articles.content: AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal announced Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar Samman Scholarship for Dalit students ahead of Delhi assembly elections amid row over Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks on Ambedkar in parliament. The scholarship will fund Dalit students' education, travel and lodging after securing admission to a university in India or abroad. "AAP aims to honour struggles of Dr Ambedkar," Kejriwal said.
articles.title: Kejriwal announces scholarship for Dalit students amid Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar row
articles.subtitle: 'Amit Shah has made fun of Dr Ambedkar'

articles.content: Two men seen outside Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut's bungalow in Mumbai on Friday were testing mobile networks for Jio, police said. Initially suspected of conducting surveillance, they were found to be employees of 'Cellplan' and 'Insta ICT'. Police contacted the firms which confirmed that they were on routine network test, dispelling security concerns raised earlier in the day.
articles.title: 2 men seen outside Raut's home were testing mobile network: Police
articles.subtitle: CCTV footage showed the men lingering there

articles.content: Actor Nana Patekar, in an interview with The Lallantop, revealed Akshay Kumar needs a board to read his lines, adding, "How is it a problem?" "Everybody has their own style and preferences...For me, I don't look at the screen," Patekar stated. He added that it's difficult to read and emote at the same time which is something he cannot do.
articles.title: So what if Akshay Kumar reads his lines off a board?: Nana Patekar
articles.subtitle: Akshay & Patekar worked together in 'Welcome'

articles.content: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's two-day visit to Kuwait which began on Saturday, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said people in Manipur continue to wait "while frequent flyer PM is off to Kuwait". Notably, over 220 people have lost their lives in ethnic conflict in Manipur that first broke out in May last year. PM Modi is yet to visit Manipur.
articles.title: People in Manipur wait, frequent flyer PM off to Kuwait: Jairam
articles.subtitle: PM Modi 1st Indian PM in 43 yrs to visit Kuwait

articles.content: Australian media has criticised India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja for not speaking in English at a press conference. After the conference, India's media team said the conference was for "travelling Indian media only", 7News claimed. Indian journalist Subhayan Chakraborty, who was present at the press conference, said that Australian media is "always" trying to stir an unnecessary controversy.
articles.title: Ravindra Jadeja answers only in Hindi during press conference in Australia
articles.subtitle: 'India has been particularly fickle with media'

articles.content: Virat Kohli's Bengaluru pub 'One8 Commune' has received BBMP's second notice in one month over alleged fire safety violations and for operating without fire department's NOC. The pub failed to reply to the first notice, issued on November 29, and now has seven days to reply. An FIR was registered against One8 in July for operating beyond the 1:00am deadline.
articles.title: Kohli's B'luru pub functioning without fire dept NOC, gets 2nd BBMP notice in 1 month
articles.subtitle: 'Don't know how proactive BBMP, dept will be'

articles.content: Ukraine on Saturday launched a series of drone strikes that targeted high-rise residential buildings in Russia's Kazan. The strikes reportedly occurred in rapid succession, hitting several multi-storey buildings and causing fire. The Russian government has accused Ukraine of being behind the drone attack. Following the attack, residents were evacuated from the affected buildings.
articles.title: Pics show Ukrainian drone crashing into building in Russia's Kazan
articles.subtitle: There have been no reports of any casualties yet

articles.content: Reacting to controversy over Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks on BR Ambedkar, BJP leader Manoj Tiwari said Shah only pointed out that Congress only takes Ambedkar's name but don't follow his principles. "What is wrong in that?" he stated. Shah had said it has become "fashion to say Ambedkar Ambedkar". The remarks also led to a scuffle in Parliament.
articles.title: What is wrong in it: Manoj on Shah's 'fashion' remark on Ambedkar
articles.subtitle: 'Opposition only use Ambedkar's name for vote'

articles.content: The Winter Session of Parliament, which began on November 25, concluded on December 20. Lok Sabha's productivity was 57.87%, according to its secretariat. More than 65 hours were lost due to interruptions, highest in all the three sessions of the year. Rajya Sabha functioned for 43 hours and 27 minutes and its productivity was 40.03%.
articles.title: Parliament's Winter Session ends, Lok Sabha sees 58% productivity
articles.subtitle: Lok Sabha lost 5 hour 37 minutes in session 1

articles.content: Indian batter KL Rahul was recently seen receiving treatment from a physio after sustaining a blow to his hand during net practice. The incident occurred during the training session ahead of the Boxing Day Test against Australia. The fourth Test of the series will begin on December 26 at the MCG in Melbourne.
articles.title: KL Rahul faces injury scare ahead of Boxing-Day Test
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The body of a seven-year-old boy, who went missing three days ago when an Indian Navy speedboat collided with a ferry in Mumbai, has been found. The confirmation of the death of the child, Johan Mohammad Nisar Ahmed Pathan, has taken the death toll of the collision to 15. Of 113 persons on board the vessels, 98 were rescued.
articles.title: Body of 7-year-old boy, missing for 3 days after ferry-speedboat crash, found
articles.subtitle: 'Ferry's capacity was 84 people, had 100 people'

articles.content: Actor Pankaj Tripathi revealed producers had told him that they would give him a bonus if 'Stree' works "really well". "That amount was crossed in four days for the first part," he added. "I didn’t even know when the makers had put that same clause in my contract for 'Stree 2' too [as] I never read the agreement," Tripathi stated.
articles.title: Producers said they'll give me bonus if 'Stree' works well: Pankaj
articles.subtitle: 'The figure for 'Stree 2' was crossed in 2 days'

articles.content: IMD said dense fog is forecasted to persist over Himachal Pradesh, East Rajasthan and Jharkhand till December 22. It predicted ground frost over Himachal Pradesh till December 24 and Uttarakhand, Arunachal Pradesh and Meghalaya till December 21. Cold wave is forecasted over Himachal Pradesh, J&K-Ladakh-Gilgit-Baltistan-Muzaffarabad till December 26 and over Punjab and Rajasthan till December 21.
articles.title: IMD issues dense fog, ground frost & cold wave warning for several states, UTs
articles.subtitle: Dense fog likely over Punjab, H'yana till Dec 25

articles.content: Days after Ravichandran Ashwin's retirement from international cricket, his wife Prithi took to Instagram to share pictures and pen note for her husband. "As you end your wonderful international run, I only want to tell you that it’s all good. It is all going to be good. It is time to set the burden of being you down," she wrote.
articles.title: R Ashwin's wife Prithi pens note for him after his sudden retirement
articles.subtitle: To view Prithi's entire note

articles.content: Nadine, a survivor of the Christmas market attack in Germany, recalled she was holding her 39-year-old boyfriend in her arms when "he was torn" from her side by the car. "We didn't hear the car," she added. "Everyone was lying on the ground- children, men, injured. It's unimaginable," a bystander said. At least two people were killed in the incident.
articles.title: My boyfriend was torn from my side: German market attack survivor
articles.subtitle: 'The world is sick'

articles.content: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena has approved ED's request to prosecute AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal in the excise policy case. The approval comes weeks before the Delhi Assembly elections. The case stems from a CBI investigation involving allegations that former chief minister Kejriwal's government altered liquor policy rules to favour certain licence holders, leading to financial irregularities.
articles.title: ED gets LG's sanction to prosecute Kejriwal in excise policy case
articles.subtitle: 'Kejriwal is kingpin of the excise policy scam'

articles.content: India’s biotech ecosystem has grown to nearly 9,000 startups from just 50 back in 2014 with the bioeconomy witnessing remarkable growth in the last 10 years, Union Minister Jitendra Singh said on Friday. He said that India’s bioeconomy has seen remarkable growth, growing from $10 billion in 2014 to over $130 billion in 2024 in just about 10 years.
articles.title: Biotech startups in India grew from 50 to 9,000: Jitendra Singh
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: An arrest warrant has been issued against ex-India cricketer Robin Uthappa in an alleged Provident Fund (PF) cheating case. Uthappa, who's associated with Centaurus Lifestyle Brands, allegedly deducted PF contributions from employee salaries but failed to deposit the funds into their respective accounts. The warrant was issued by PF Regional Commissioner Shadakshari Gopal Reddy in Bengaluru.
articles.title: Arrest warrant issued against ex-cricketer Robin Uthappa for PF fraud
articles.subtitle: Uthappa now lives in Dubai with his family

articles.content: EK Janaki Ammal was the first woman botanist in India, best known for her contributions to making sugarcane sweeter. She was also one of the first women scientists to receive the Padma Shri in 1977. Originally from Kerala, she used to teach at a women's college when she received a scholarship from the University of Michigan in US.
articles.title: Who was Janaki Ammal, India's first woman botanist?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) has directed schools to identify children of illegal Bangladeshi migrants and prevent them from obtaining birth certificates. The MCD also ordered the removal of encroachments by illegal migrants across all zones. The Public Health Department was asked to ensure no birth certificates are issued to illegal Bangladeshi migrants.
articles.title: Delhi schools ordered to identify kids of illegal B'desh migrants
articles.subtitle: Schools were asked to submit a report by Dec 31

articles.content: Singer Abhijeet Bhattacharya said that Shah Rukh Khan and he are like husband and wife, adding that one would've to patch up. Adding that his voice is made for Shah Rukh, Abhijeet said, "Husband and wife fight...and they’ll have to patch up, isn’t it?"  Earlier, Abhijeet revealed he stopped singing for Shah Rukh after he wasn't credited for his work.
articles.title: Shah Rukh Khan and I are like husband and wife, one would have to patch up: Abhijeet
articles.subtitle: 'Why wouldn’t I want to patch up?'

articles.content: Rajasthan CM Bhajanlal Sharma has directed the officials to address black spots at the cost of ₹2,350 crore and improve road safety throughout the state. He directed the Public Works Department (PWD) to ensure quality in repair work and ensure timely completion of the work. This comes after 14 people died in a tanker crash in Jaipur on Friday.
articles.title: Rajasthan CM orders black spots to be fixed after tanker crash
articles.subtitle: Over 30 people were injured in the accident

articles.content: Anupam Mittal called work-life balance a "lie" and said it stinks and "is destroying a whole generation". Speaking on 'Humans of Bombay Show', he said he feels bad the new generation hasn't seen a crisis as crises shape entire generations. Interrupting Mittal, Namita Thapar said, "That's b******t." Founders obviously work 20 hours/day as they're making lot of money, she added.
articles.title: 'Work-life balance a lie, it stinks', says Anupam; Namita replies 'That's b******t'
articles.subtitle: 'Employees don't have upside to overwork'

articles.content: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) on Friday released recommendations on assignment of additional spectrum to Indian Railways for its safety and security applications. Indian Railways has sought an additional 5 MHz of paired spectrum in the 700 MHz band, free of cost, for enhancing its safety and security systems, according to Ministry of Communications.
articles.title: TRAI recommends additional spectrum for Railways to boost safety
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has revealed that Ravichandran Ashwin didn't even give him a hint that he is retiring despite both of them spending the whole day together. "I got to know about the retirement at the last moment, five minutes before the press conference. It was shocking," he added. "We all know how Ashwin’s mind works," Jadeja further said.
articles.title: We spent the whole day together, he didn't even give me a hint: Jadeja on Ashwin's retirement
articles.subtitle: Ashwin retired from int'l cricket on Wednesday

articles.content: The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs hiked the MSP for fair average quality of milling copra to ₹11,582 per quintal and for ball copra to ₹12,100 per quintal for 2025. The MSP has been increased in accordance with the government’s decision that mandates the MSP for crops will be fixed at levels of at least 1.5 times the all-India weighted average cost of production, the statement said.
articles.title: Cabinet hikes MSP for Copra to ₹12,100 per quintal
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A Christmas market opened in Syria's capital Damascus days after President Bashar al-Assad's government was ousted. Several people were seen flocking to the market, enjoying Christmas decorations and taking pictures. Yaza al-Sahour, a Syrian man at the market with his partner, expressed his hope for Syria to be rebuilt as a "country for all sects and religions".
articles.title: Christmas market opens in Syria's Damascus days after Assad's exit
articles.subtitle: Assad's government fell earlier this month

articles.content: The Indian government and the Asian Development Bank (ADB) on Friday signed an agreement for a $350 million policy-based loan under the second subprogramme of the Strengthening Multimodal and Integrated Logistics Ecosystem (SMILE) programme, to strengthen the domestic manufacturing sector and improve the resilience of supply chains.
articles.title: Centre, ADB sign $350 million loan to boost India's supply chains
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: As many as 25,202 public charging stations for electric vehicles (EVs) have been installed in the country to date, the government said on Friday. Karnataka leads with 5,765 EV public charging stations, followed by Maharashtra at 3,728 and Uttar Pradesh at 1,989, Minister of State for Heavy Industries and Steel, Bhupathiraju Srinivasa Varma, told the Rajya Sabha in a written reply.
articles.title: India now has 25,202 public charging stations for EVs: Govt
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Sam Konstas, who is in line for a Test debut after being selected in Australia's squad for the last two India Tests, could break a 95-year-old Australia record. At 19 years and 85 days, Konstas would become the fourth-youngest Australian to play men's Test cricket. He could become the youngest opener from Australia ever, breaking Archie Jackson's record from 1929.
articles.title: Konstas could become Australia's youngest Test opener in 95 years
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Over 10 crore rural poor households have been mobilised into over 90 lakh Self-Help Groups (SHGs) under the Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana – National Rural Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NRLM), according to a report presented in the Lok Sabha by Minister of State for Rural Development, Chandra Sekhar Pemmasani, on Tuesday.
articles.title: 10 crore rural households mobilised into SHGs under DAY
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The investments in the urban sector in India have increased 16-fold as the government aims to achieve the 'Viksit Bharat' goal by 2047, the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs said on Friday. Under the Smart Cities Mission, work orders have been issued in 8,066 projects amounting to ₹1,64,669 crore, of which 7,352 projects have been completed.
articles.title: Urban sector investments in India surge 16-fold: Centre
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Pride of Cows said that it embodies the 'Single Origin' ideology, ensuring all its premium products are produced from one farm and one breed of cows, raised with utmost care. Pride of Cows also mentioned that at its farm, cows are pampered with superior nutrition and unparalleled attention, producing the purest milk that remains untouched and unadulterated.
articles.title: Discover the purity of 'Single Origin' Milk: Pride of Cows
articles.subtitle: Pride of Cows: One Farm. One Breed. One Origin

articles.content: A girl attempted suicide in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi after her boyfriend allegedly refused  to watch Allu Arjun-starrer 'Pushpa 2'. The couple was visiting Varanasi when the girl, student of a Banaras Hindu University-affiliated college, demanded to watch the movie and jumped from a hotel's third floor after her boyfriend's refusal. Police arrested the girl's boyfriend and launched a probe.
articles.title: BHU student attempts suicide after boyfriend allegedly refuses to watch 'Pushpa 2' in UP
articles.subtitle: Police is questioning the girl, hotel staff

articles.content: Ex-India cricketer Ravi Shastri said India have been kept alive "single-handedly" by pacer Jasprit Bumrah in the series against Australia. Bumrah has picked 21 wickets in the three Tests of the five-match series. He was the stand-in captain in the first Test which India won by 295 runs. The series is currently levelled at 1-1.
articles.title: India kept in series vs Aus single-handedly by Bumrah: Shastri
articles.subtitle: 4th Test will begin on Dec 26

articles.content: Billionaire Elon Musk, who's set to join US President-elect Donald Trump's administration as an outside adviser, on Friday called on German Chancellor Olaf Scholz to resign "immediately" over the attack at a German Christmas market. He further called Scholz an "incompetent fool". At least two people were killed and around 70 were injured after a car ploughed into the market.
articles.title: Scholz an incompetent fool, must resign: Musk after market attack
articles.subtitle: The driver of the car has been arrested

articles.content: The delay in allocating portfolios to the newly sworn-in 39 ministers of the Maharashtra cabinet has sparked sharp criticism from the opposition Maha Vikas Aghadi. "What's happening in government, it's is difficult to understand...there are a lot of law and order issues...who is accountable...despite having so much majority why is so much delay?"  Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut said.
articles.title: Why delay despite having majority: Raut on portfolio allotment
articles.subtitle: Portfolios to be announced after winter session

articles.content: Talking about batter Virat Kohli's form in the ongoing series against Australia, ex-India cricketer Sanjay Bangar said, "Sometimes you need to keep your status as a batter in control a little." "When you surrender slightly to...game, spend a little time...that's the sign of a big player," he stated. Kohli has scored 126 runs in the three Tests of the series.
articles.title: You need to keep your status as batter in control: Bangar on Kohli
articles.subtitle: 'Play balls close to front pad'

articles.content: Ex-US President Barack Obama released a list of his favourite movies of 2024, with Payal Kapadia's 'All We Imagine As Light' featuring in the list. It also includes 'Conclave', a conspiracy thriller on the papacy, and American drama film 'The Piano Lesson'. 'The Promised Land', 'The Seed Of The Sacred Fig' and 'Dune: Part Two' are also on the list.
articles.title: Obama includes 'All We Imagine As Light' in list of his favourite movies of 2024
articles.subtitle: 'Anora', 'Didi', 'Sugarcane' features on list

articles.content: A study published in the journal Archaeology International stated that Stonehenge may have served as a monument of unification for the Britishers. People from Scotland and Wales brought local stones as part of their contribution to assembling the structure and establishing "political unification", it added. The landmark, situated around 140 km from London, is said to be 5,000 years old.
articles.title: Stonehenge may have had unifying purpose for Britishers: Study
articles.subtitle: Stonehenge was constructed in several phases

articles.content: In a conversation with Raj Shamani, actor Arjun Kapoor shared that he fears losing people close to him. He explained that this fear stems from his childhood experiences — witnessing his parents' separation, having a strained bond with his father, and eventually losing his mother. These early heartbreaks have left him with a deep fear of loss in relationships.
articles.title: I have a fear of loss in relationships: Arjun Kapoor
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: After an MCA official alleged that Prithvi Shaw used to remain out at nights and used to come to team hotel in the mornings during SMAT 2024, the batter penned a cryptic post on his Instagram Stories. "If you don't understand it fully, don't speak on it. Too many people have full opinions, with half the facts...FRIYAY," the post read.
articles.title: Prithvi Shaw pens cryptic 'Friyay' post after MCA official's allegations
articles.subtitle: Shaw has been dropped from Mumbai one-day team

articles.content: Gautam Adani-led Adani Group is planning to invest ₹20,000 crore in setting up a super critical thermal power plant in Bihar. The announcement was made by Pranav Adani, Director, Adani Enterprises Ltd, at the Bihar Business Connect 2024. He stated the "massive project" will create 12,000 jobs in the pre-commissioning phase and 1,500 skilled jobs during the operational phase.
articles.title: Adani Group to invest ₹20,000 cr in thermal power plant in Bihar
articles.subtitle: 'We're investing in smart meter manufacturing'

articles.content: Prime Minister Modi announced ₹2 lakh compensation for the families of those killed and ₹50,000 for the injured in the Jaipur LPG tanker fire. Expressing sorrow, the Prime Minister's Office stated, "Deeply saddened by the loss of lives...Condolences to those who lost their loved ones." The fire, triggered by a tanker-truck collision, killed at least 13 and damaged 37 vehicles.
articles.title: PM announces ₹2 lakh ex-gratia for Jaipur LPG tanker fire victims
articles.subtitle: Around 28 were hospitalised in a critical state

articles.content: Australia opener Nathan McSweeney said on Saturday that he was “devastated” after being cast out of the team after just three Tests against India. He said, “It’s the game we are in. If you don’t take your opportunity, and you are not performing as well as you want to, your position is never safe.”
articles.title: Your position is never safe: Nathan on being dropped from BGT Test
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: India's food safety regulator Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) has ordered country's licensed food manufacturers as well as importers to submit data of rejected and expired food items on a quarterly basis. The step has been taken to prevent the resale of such food items for human consumption, which is sometimes done under guise of cattle feed.
articles.title: FSSAI asks food businesses for expired food data to prevent resale
articles.subtitle: The data need to be submitted on FOSCOS

articles.content: The US on Friday said it has decided to drop a $10 million reward it had offered for the capture of Syrian rebel leader Ahmed al-Sharaa. Notably, al-Sharaa's forces led the ouster of President Bashar al-Assad earlier this month. The announcement comes after the first face-to-face meeting between US diplomats and the HTS leadership since the regime change.
articles.title: US drops $10 mn bounty offered for capture of Syrian rebel leader
articles.subtitle: The meeting took place in Syria's Damascus

articles.content: India and several other countries on Earth's Northern Hemisphere are observing the Winter Solstice, the shortest day and longest night of the year, today. A Solstice is an astronomical event when tilt of Earth's axis with respect to Sun is maximum. This day also marks the longest day of the year in Southern Hemisphere, called Summer Solstice for the region.
articles.title: India, several other countries witness 2024's shortest day today
articles.subtitle: N Hemisphere's Summer Solstice occurs on June 21

articles.content: A couple from Chhattisgarh's Kapu village solemnised their marriage by taking an oath on Indian Constitution, forgoing traditional 'sath pheras'. The couple exchanged vows before a portrait of Dr Ambedkar, known as the architect of the Indian Constitution, with their families and the community offering blessings. "This type of marriage saves on extravagant expenses," the groom, Eman Lahre, said.
articles.title: Chhattisgarh couple skips pheras, takes oath on Constitution
articles.subtitle: 'We decided to avoid unnecessary expenditure'

articles.content: A CCTV video has surfaced showing the exact moment a Saudi doctor drove his BMW car 400 metres into a Christmas market in Germany's Magdeburg. The car can be seen hitting dozens of people in the market before turning and driving further while ramming through crowds. Reports said the doctor, Taleb al-Abdulmohsen, "drove in a zig-zag motion...to hit [maximum people]".
articles.title: Video shows moment Saudi doctor drove car 400 metres into Christmas market in Germany
articles.subtitle: At least 2 dead, over 70 injured in incident

articles.content: Actor Ali Fazal, in a recent interview, revealed he and his wife Richa Chadha had to break their fixed deposits (FDs) to produce the film 'Girls Will Be Girls'. "We're all from a country that is famous for its 'jugaad'...We [also] asked for money from here and there," he added. The film, released in January this year, starred Preeti Panigrahi.
articles.title: Richa & I had to break our FDs to produce 'Girls...': Ali Fazal
articles.subtitle: It also featured Kani Kusruti, Kesav Binoy Kiron

articles.content: Taleb al-Abdulmohsen is a 50-year-old psychologist arrested for driving a BMW car into a Christmas market in Germany's Magdeburg, killing at least two. As per reports, Taleb is an anti-Islam doctor who arrived in Germany in 2006 and was recognised as refugee in 2016. Reports suggest he'd rented the car just before the attack and didn't have known Islamist ties.
articles.title: Who is Taleb, doctor arrested for driving BMW into Christmas market in Germany?
articles.subtitle: Police found explosives in Taleb's car: Report

articles.content: Ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said policy paralysis in the Congress-led UPA government was the reason for bank non-performing assets piling up. Rajan, who was RBI chief from 2013 to 2016, said an asset quality review (AQR) that started in 2015 led to bad loans "tumbling out". He added ex-Finance Minister Arun Jaitley gave him permission to "clean up" the system.
articles.title: Policy paralysis in UPA years caused NPAs to pile up: Raghuram
articles.subtitle: 'Projects didn't get land & build NPAs'

articles.content: Tamil Nadu BJP President K Annamalai and other leaders were detained in Coimbatore on Friday during protests against 1998 blast mastermind SA Basha's funeral. Other leaders arrested include, Hindu Munnani State chief Kadeshwara Subramaniam and Vishwa Hindu Parishad District President Sivalingam. "DMK is carrying...vote bank politics by providing security for funeral of terrorist," Annamalai said.
articles.title: Annamalai detained during protest over 1998 TN blast mastermind's funeral
articles.subtitle: 'TN people will soon respond to DMK's drama'

articles.content: Singer Honey Singh dismissed rumours that actor Shah Rukh Khan slapped him for misbehaving at a US concert, saying he himself hit a coffee mug on his head as he suffered a mental breakdown. "Shah Rukh loves me, he'll never raise his hand on me," he added. Honey revealed he had shaved his head as he didn't want to perform.
articles.title: I hit mug on my head: Honey Singh on rumours of SRK slapping him
articles.subtitle: 'I was sure that I was going to die'

articles.content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi begins his two-day visit to Kuwait today, marking the first visit by an Indian PM in 43 years. He will hold bilateral talks with Kuwaiti leaders to strengthen ties in defence, trade, and other key areas. Modi will also visit an Indian labour camp, address the Indian community, and attend the Gulf Cup opening.
articles.title: PM Modi to start Kuwait visit today, 1st by Indian PM in 43 years
articles.subtitle: Defence cooperation pact will also be discussed

articles.content: UP CM Yogi Adityanath, while addressing a gathering in Ayodhya, said Sanatan Dharma is "the national religion of India" and it is the "collective responsibility of every citizen to protect it". He stated the descendants of Mughal ruler Aurangzeb are driving rickshaws and their plight is the result of Aurangzeb's destructive actions as he destroyed temples in the past.
articles.title: Sanatan Dharma is the national religion of India: UP CM Adityanath
articles.subtitle: 'Temples have been destroyed time and again'

articles.content: On Thursday, Customs officials at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport arrested two individuals, Mohammad Ansar and Syed Pasha, for attempting to smuggle four agile gibbons stuffed into trolley bags. The duo, residents of Bengaluru, had traveled from Kuala Lumpur and are currently under investigation.
articles.title: Customs officials bust gibbon smuggling attempt in Bengaluru
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: US House approved a funding bill for Joe Biden-led government and sent it to the Senate for an expected speedy approval, hours before a midnight deadline for government shutdown. The bill would fund government at current levels till March. President-elect Donald Trump, however, said, "Let [shutdown] begin now," as the bill didn't include his demand for a debt limit increase.
articles.title: US House approves funding bill, sends it to Senate hours before govt shutdown
articles.subtitle: Bill adds $100 billion in disaster aid

articles.content: At least two people were killed and around 70 were injured after a BMW car ploughed into a Christmas market in Germany's Magdeburg on Friday. The driver of the car has been arrested. He has been identified as Taleb A, a 50-year-old doctor from Saudi Arabia. Local officials have described the incident as a terror attack.
articles.title: Doctor from Saudi Arabia ploughs BMW car into Christmas market in Germany, 2 killed, 70 injured
articles.subtitle: Suspect has been living in Germany since 2006

articles.content: Amazon delayed its return-to-office mandate in US for unspecified number of its 3.5 lakh employees as it doesn't have enough seats for them, Bloomberg reported. The company informed employees in seven cities that their return dates have been delayed by four months. While announcing mandate in September, Amazon had said work areas for employees would be ready by January 2.
articles.title: Amazon delays return-to-office mandate as it doesn't have enough seats in US: Report
articles.subtitle: 'Amazon struggling to host staff 3 days/week'

articles.content: Bengaluru Police's Central Crime Branch (CCB) has apprehended two men, Harish and Hemant, accused of running a "girlfriend swapping" racket disguised as private parties in Bengaluru. The scheme targeted couples, coercing them into exchanging partners for sexual activities and exploiting women through threats and blackmail. Police said the accused used WhatsApp groups to organise private parties.
articles.title: Bengaluru Police arrest two men over 'girlfriend swapping' racket
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A video showing people breaking windows of Mumbai bound Antyodaya express in Uttar Pradesh has surfaced on social media. The video also showed a man breaking a door's glass with a stone. As per sources, this happened as passengers inside a coach locked the door from inside to prevent additional boardings at the Basti railway station.
articles.title: People seen breaking windows, door of train with stone as passengers inside lock door in UP
articles.subtitle: To watch the video

articles.content: A Russian missile attack on the Ukrainian capital Kyiv damaged six embassies, as per Ukrainian officials. Ukraine's Foreign Ministry said that the embassies of Albania, Argentina, Palestine, North Macedonia, Montenegro and Portugal, housed in the same building, were damaged. There were no casualties among diplomatic staff, the ministry further said.
articles.title: Which 6 embassies were damaged by Russian missile attack on Ukraine?
articles.subtitle: 1 person killed, 12 wounded in the attack

articles.content: Titan marked its 40th anniversary with the announcement of India's first flying Tourbillon timepiece, featuring the 7TH1 Caliber. Alongside this, Titan has also launched a collection of reimagined bestsellers in the Classique, Moonphase, and Gold Mechanical watches. Each of these timepieces is available in very limited numbers to commemorate 40 years of timekeeping excellence.
articles.title: Titan unveils India’s first flying Tourbillon to celebrate 40 years
articles.subtitle: Limited edition watches celebrate Titan's legacy

articles.content: The Supreme Court has set aside a National Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission's (NCDRC) 2008 decision through which it barred commercial banks from implementing an interest rate of more than 30% per year on late credit card payments. This means that now charging interest rates of over 30% per year on late payments won't be counted as an unfair trade practice.
articles.title: Supreme Court removes 30% interest rate limit on late credit card payments
articles.subtitle: 'Can't justify not controlling banks'

articles.content: A video on social media showing that Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is promoting cryptocurrency products to earn daily income easily is fake and was altered using AI, according to PIB Fact Check. In the alleged video, Nirmala Sitharaman was heard saying that investment can help earn from ₹10,000 to ₹30,000.
articles.title: Clip showing FM Sitharaman promoting crypto to earn money is fake
articles.subtitle: 'Beware of videos promoting crypto products'

articles.content: NDP leader Jagmeet Singh said his party will vote to bring down PM Justin Trudeau's government and give "Canadians a chance to vote for a government who will work for them". "Trudeau failed in the biggest job a Prime Minister has: to work for people [and] not the powerful," Trudeau's former ally added. Earlier, Jagmeet called for Trudeau's resignation.
articles.title: NDP will vote to bring Trudeau's govt down: Ex-ally Jagmeet Singh
articles.subtitle: Canada's Deputy PM has already resigned

articles.content: AAP MP Sanjay Singh on Friday criticised BJP alleging that the party insulted UP, Bihar, and Purvanchal people in Parliament by calling them "Rohingyas". "We people of UP, Bihar and Purvanchal have been staying in Delhi for the last 30-40 years...are they Rohingyas and Bangladeshis?" Singh said, adding that he will take out yatra to protest against BJP's remark.
articles.title: Will not tolerate BJP's insult to UP, Bihar people: AAP MP Sanjay
articles.subtitle: Singh had also criticised Nadda over his remark

articles.content: North Korea will send divorced couples to a labour training camp for one to six months to stabilise social order, according to a Radio Free Asia report. Divorce cases have increased in country since the onset of COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 due to poor economic conditions. Divorce is considered an anti-socialist act and is generally frowned upon in North Korea.
articles.title: North Korea to send divorced couples to labour camps
articles.subtitle: N Korea had initiated campaign to stop divorces

articles.content: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar-led JD(U) responded to AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal's letter to Kumar asking him to "deeply reflect" on Union Home Minister Amit Shah’s remarks on Dr BR Ambedkar in the Parliament. Responding to Kejriwal’s letter, JD(U) chief Sanjay Kumar Jha said that Kejriwal neglected Dalits in Punjab and Delhi, saying "Why did he not make any Dalit CM?"
articles.title: Kejriwal neglected Dalits: JDU on his letter to Nitish Kumar
articles.subtitle: 'Kejriwal had no right to question Nitish Kumar'

articles.content: Delhi NCR-based unicorns hired the most number of employees (18,554) across all major Indian startup hubs between August 2023 and August 2024, a PrivateCircle report stated. It was followed by Chennai (4,785) and Bengaluru (2,384). Meanwhile, unicorns in Mumbai, Pune and Hyderabad saw their net headcount decline by 7,024, 643 and 66 employees, respectively.
articles.title: Delhi-NCR unicorns hired more than B'luru in 12 months: Report
articles.subtitle: Unicorns are startups valued at or above $1 bn

articles.content: Australia batter Sam Konstas is set to replace Nathan McSweeney in the Boxing Day Test against India. The 19-year-old, who's from a Greek family, has 718 first-class runs at an average of 42.23. He also scored a century against India in 2-day Warm-up game, which took place during ongoing Border-Gavaskar series. He has been mentored by ex-Australia batter Shane Watson.
articles.title: Who's Sam Konstas who's set to play Boxing Day Test against India?
articles.subtitle: Kerry O’Keeffe calls him 'Greek Freak'

articles.content: Delhi Police transferred FIR filed by BJP against Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to Crime Branch. BJP filed FIR against Rahul claiming that their two MPs - Pratap Chandra Sarangi and Mukesh Rajput - suffered head injuries after Rahul pushed one of them after a scuffle between BJP and Congress. BJP MPs Hemang Joshi, Anurag Thakur and Bansuri Swaraj filed case.
articles.title: Delhi Police transfer BJP's FIR against Rahul to crime branch
articles.subtitle: Congress filed a counter-complaint

articles.content: China Manned Space Agency has confirmed that two of its astronauts, Cai Xuzhe and Song Lingdong, onboard the Tiangong space station completed a nine-hour-long spacewalk on Tuesday, breaking NASA's record for the longest spacewalk. The previous record was held by US astronauts James Voss and Susan Helms who conducted a spacewalk in 2001 that lasted 8 hours and 56 minutes.
articles.title: Chinese astronauts complete 9-hour-long spacewalk, breaking NASA's record
articles.subtitle: Video shows Chinese astronauts doing spacewalk

articles.content: The National Stock Exchange of India (NSE) will exclude 16 stocks from the futures and options (F&O) segment, effective February 28, 2025. No contracts will be available for trading in these stocks from this date. PVR INOX, Abbott India, Bata India, IndiaMART InterMESH, Dr Lal PathLabs, Coromandel International, Sun TV Network and United Breweries are among the affected securities.
articles.title: NSE to remove PVR INOX, Abbott, 14 others from F&O starting Feb 28
articles.subtitle: To know the full list of affected stocks

articles.content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) filed a money laundering case against ex-minister and BRS leader KT Rama Rao in connection with a case related to alleged financial irregularities linked to the Formula-E race. This comes after the Telangana High Court directed the Anti-Corruption Bureau officials to not arrest the BRS leader till December 30 in the same case.
articles.title: ED files money laundering case against KTR in Formula-E case
articles.subtitle: Formula-E race was held in Hyderabad in 2023

articles.content: India's foreign exchange reserves dipped by roughly $2 billion to $652.8 billion in the week ended December 13, the latest RBI data showed. The decline for the second consecutive week brought down the reserves to the lowest level since late June. The drop was led by foreign currency assets, which fell by $3 billion to $562.5 billion.
articles.title: India's forex reserves dip by $2 billion to near six-month low
articles.subtitle: Gold reserves rose to $68 billion

articles.content: Rapper Yo Yo Honey Singh recalled battling bipolar disorder and suffering from "psychotic symptoms". "I'd get scared even when my maid used to come thinking she'd be laughing at me, she was wiping blood off...floor," he said, calling it a "weird feeling". "I thought I'd never be able to meet my parents again...I wished for death every day," Honey said.
articles.title: Thought maid was wiping blood off floor: Honey on bipolar disorder
articles.subtitle: 'I saw hell'

articles.content: CISF constable Amol Savant revealed that he and his two colleagues became the "first responders" after a Navy speedboat crashed into a passenger ferry off Mumbai's coast. "We saw people...ready to throw their children in the ocean...thinking...they'd be saved from the sinking ship. I asked them not to panic," he said. The jawan added that he too felt "shaken".
articles.title: Saw parents ready to throw kids in water to save them from sinking ferry in Mumbai: CISF jawan
articles.subtitle: I saw children hanging dangerously: Jawan

articles.content: The UP Tourism Department said the state drew 47.61 crore tourists between January and September 2024. Among the tourist destinations in the state, Ayodhya was the most sought-after, overtaking Agra's Taj Mahal. Ayodhya drew 13.55 crore domestic tourists and 3,153 international tourists. Agra received 12.51 crore visitors, including 11.59 crore domestic and 9.24 lakh international tourists.
articles.title: Ayodhya surpasses Taj Mahal as UP's top tourist spot in 2024
articles.subtitle: Ram Temple consecration was held in January

articles.content: Ex-Pakistan captain Javed Miandad reacted after ICC confirmed a hybrid model for the Champions Trophy 2025 and shared that India and Pakistan won't visit each other for ICC tournaments till 2028. He said PCB took the "sensible approach" instead of "doing something rash". "It opted for a solution where I think PCB has gained more than the BCCI," Miandad said.
articles.title: PCB gained more than BCCI: Miandad after ICC confirms hybrid model
articles.subtitle: Schedule for CT 2025 will be announced soon

articles.content: Mumbai Police on Friday launched a probe after two motorcycle-borne allegedly conducted recce of Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut's bungalow in Bhandup, officials said. "There have been repeated instances of reconnaissance at my house...I have informed Amit Shah about this by sending him a letter," Raut said after the incident. Few people waiting outside house spotted the two suspects.
articles.title: 2 bike-borne men conduct 'recce' of Raut's home, probe launched
articles.subtitle: To watch CCTV footage of the bike-borne men

articles.content: Pakistan cricketer Ahmed Shehzad joked that there should be a stadium on the border with one gate in India and the other in Pakistan. "Their players can enter from there and our cricketers from here," he added. "I think...BCCI and...Indian government will have...problem with that...They'll say...if our players come to their side of...ground, visa won't be given," Ahmed sarcastically said.
articles.title: 'A stadium should be on border with 1 gate in India, 1 in Pak,' jokes Shehzad
articles.subtitle: ICC announced a hybrid model for India-Pak games

articles.content: A Russian missile attack damaged a historical cathedral, six embassies and other buildings across Ukraine's capital Kyiv on Friday. The head of Kyiv's military administration said that residents in the city centre heard loud explosions and fires broke out in several buildings. Kyiv city military administration said one person was killed and 12 others had been wounded.
articles.title: Russian missile attack damages 6 embassies in Ukraine
articles.subtitle: 5 of those injured had been taken to hospital

articles.content: The staff at the White House covered up President Joe Biden's apparent mental health decline since the start of his presidency on January 20, 2021, according to The Wall Street Journal report. The staffers reportedly managed the 82-year-old president's schedule and limited interactions to shield him. The White House reportedly hired a voice coach to improve Biden's tone.
articles.title: White House staff hid Biden's mental decline from day 1: Report
articles.subtitle: Biden is the US' oldest president to take office

articles.content: US reported its first "severe" human case of bird flu (H5N1) after a Louisiana resident was hospitalised in critical condition following a suspected contact with an infected backyard flock. California has declared an emergency over H5N1 infection. US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said the country has reported 61 human cases of bird flu since April this year.
articles.title: US reports first-ever 'severe' human bird flu case
articles.subtitle: Most of infected patients are dairy farm workers

articles.content: OpenAI has launched a number to talk to its AI chatbot ChatGPT or message it on WhatsApp. The startup said people can dial 1-800-CHATGPT (1-800-242-8478) with a US or Canada number or message the same number on WhatsApp from supported countries, including India. Meta-owned WhatsApp already features an AI chatbot called Meta AI.
articles.title: OpenAI launches ChatGPT for WhatsApp
articles.subtitle: 'Not possible to add ChatGPT to group chats'

articles.content: A 'swimming mouse', a spiny mouse, eight types of fish and 10 types of butterflies were among the 27 new species discovered by scientists in Peru's Amazon, according to Conservation International. The spiny mouse has stiff fur while 'amphibious mouse' has partially webbed feet that eat aquatic insects. A dwarf squirrel that fits 'in the palm of...hand' was also discovered.
articles.title: 'Swimming mouse' among 27 new species discovered in Peru's Amazon
articles.subtitle: The new species were found in Alto Mayo

articles.content: Maharashtra Congress president Nana Patole on Friday asked CM Devendra Fadnavis to provide a list of "urban Naxal" organisations that took part in Rahul Gandhi-led 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. Patole's remark came after Fadnavis told the Assembly that 40 of the 180 outfits that took part in 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' were named as frontal organisations (of urban naxals).
articles.title: Provide list of naxal organisations: Patole on Fadnavis' claim
articles.subtitle: Patole wrote letter to Fadnavis over the matter

articles.content: The 55th GST Council meeting on Saturday (December 21) is expected to consider reducing GST rates on life and health insurance premiums. The council could also lower the tax on food delivery platforms. Meanwhile, luxury items, like high-end wristwatches and shoes, sin goods such as cigarettes, and old and used electric vehicles could attract higher taxes.
articles.title: What are the key expectations from upcoming GST Council meeting?
articles.subtitle: '148 items likely to face rate changes'

articles.content: World Bank has approved an $800 million (about ₹6,800 crore) loan under the Amaravati Integrated Urban Development Program. The project aims to develop the Andhra Pradesh city as a well-managed, climate-resilient economic hub. World Bank said the loan requested by the Indian government has a final maturity period of 29 years, including a grace period of 6 years.
articles.title: World Bank approves ₹6,800 crore loan for Amaravati's development
articles.subtitle: 'Govt will avail financing in Japanese Yen'

articles.content: Shah Rukh Khan, Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan grooved to 'Om Shanti Om' song 'Deewangi Deewangi' at their children AbRam and Aaradhya's school annual function. In a video, they were seen surrounded by children and dancing to the song. Many social media users reacted to the video, with one writing, "Wholesome moment."
articles.title: SRK, Aishwarya groove to Deewangi at children's school function
articles.subtitle: To watch the video

articles.content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis claimed that 13 naxal organisations are associated with Rahul Gandhi's Bharat Jodo Yatra. He further claimed that 40 frontal organisations (of urban naxals) were also part of Bharat Jodo Abhiyan. Fadnavis claimed to have evidence of meeting held in Nepal  where individuals linked to Bharat Jodo Yatra discussed plans to destabilise Maharashtra government.
articles.title: 13 Naxal organisations took part in Rahul's yatra: Fadnavis
articles.subtitle: Fadnavis said this in the Maharashtra Assembly

articles.content: Japan's Fukushima has passed new regulations to publicly name and shame people and businesses, who break garbage rules. Under new rules to be implemented starting March 2025, those who don't sort their garbage bags correctly will first receive a verbal warning followed by a written advisory. Persistent offenders will have their names published on the government website.
articles.title: People who break garbage rules to be shamed in Japan's Fukushima
articles.subtitle: City reported 9,000 trash-related cases in 2023

articles.content: A now-viral video showed a man severely injuring himself while attempting to do a somersault in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch. The incident, reportedly, took place on December 13. As per reports, while performing the stunt, the 18-year-old youth landed head-first and broke his neck. After being admitted to a hospital for 6 days, he succumbed to his injuries during the treatment.
articles.title: Man breaks his neck while attempting somersault in MP, dies
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over the alleged scuffle between MPs outside the Parliament, saying that 'pushing around' a parliamentarian was not a sign of 'mardangi' (masculinity). BJP accused Rahul Gandhi of pushing two of its MPs inside Parliament premises during protests by NDA and INDIA bloc MPs over Amit Shah's remark on BR Ambedkar.
articles.title: Pushing around MPs no sign of 'mardangi': Rijiju to Rahul Gandhi
articles.subtitle: 'Heated exchanges happening since 1952'

articles.content: Colombian politician Cathy Juvinao was caught vaping inside the country's parliament during a healthcare debate. The video of Juvinao using her vape and trying to hide it when the camera was pointed at her has gone viral. "I apologise to the citizens for what happened yesterday in the plenary session," she later said.
articles.title: Politician Cathy seen vaping inside Colombian parliament during healthcare debate
articles.subtitle: To watch the video

articles.content: The over 300-year-old tomb of Mary Haddock in UK's Essex, linked to the popular 'Adventures of Tintin' comic series, has been recognised as a historical monument. Mary's son Admiral Richard Haddock is believed to have inspired author Hergé to create the character of Captain Haddock in the comics. Captain Haddock is known for phrases like "blue blistering barnacles".
articles.title: Over 300-year-old tomb linked to Tintin comics gets historic site status in UK
articles.subtitle: Mary Haddock died in 1688

articles.content: After being granted interim bail in a derogatory remarks case, BJP MLC CT Ravi said the Congress-led-Karnataka government acted as a dictator and he was treated like a terrorist. "There is a full stop to everything, dictatorship won't last long," Ravi added.  He was arrested by Police for allegedly using derogatory remarks against Minister Laxmi Hebbalkar in the Legislative Council.
articles.title: Treated like terrorist: Ravi after bail in derogatory remarks case
articles.subtitle: 'This is the victory of truth'

articles.content: Allu Arjun-starrer 'Pushpa 2: The Rule' created history by becoming the highest-net-grossing film ever at the Hindi box office. The Sukumar directorial made the record in just 15 days of its release. 'Pushpa 2: The Rule' has collected ₹621 crore at the Hindi box office, surpassing the collections of 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion', 'K.G.F: Chapter 2', 'Stree 2' and 'Jawan'.
articles.title: 'Pushpa 2' creates history, becomes biggest Hindi net grosser in 15 days
articles.subtitle: The film was released on December 5

articles.content: Filmmaker Anil Sharma opened up about Priyanka Chopra's botched nose surgery and shared that he was under the impression that she got it to look like Julia Roberts. "I scolded her also," he added. However, she had an issue with her nose. "It was a medical operation that went bad so it wasn't her fault," Anil further said.
articles.title: Priyanka didn't get nose surgery to look like Julia Roberts: Anil
articles.subtitle: 'She was fired from projects'

articles.content: Former IMF chief Rodrigo Rato has been sentenced to nearly five years in prison for various crimes related to corruption. Rato previously spent two years in jail in a separate embezzlement case. The sentencing by a Spanish court can be challenged in the Supreme Court so Rato will not go to prison until there is a final ruling.
articles.title: IMF's ex-chief Rodrigo Rato gets 5-year jail for corruption
articles.subtitle: Rato chaired the IMF from 2004 to 2007

articles.content: Bombay High Court has dismissed a petition challenging a tender awarded to Adani Group to redevelop the Dharavi slum. The petition was filed by UAE-based Seclink Technologies, which won the tender in 2018 before it was cancelled by the Maharashtra government and reissued in 2022. "The grounds raised in the petition lack force and effort," the court said.
articles.title: HC dismisses plea against Adani Group's Dharavi redevelopment bid
articles.subtitle: 'Seclink will move the Supreme Court'

articles.content: The Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Limited (UPPCL) has imposed a fine of ₹1.91 crore on SP leader and Sambhal MP Zia Ur Rehman after booking him for alleged electricity theft. The corporation cut the power supply to his residence and lodged a case against his father for allegedly threatening its employees during a raid on Thursday.
articles.title: Sambhal MP Zia Ur Rehman Barq fined ₹1.9 crore for electricity theft
articles.subtitle: At least 2 meters found to be tampered

articles.content: Karnataka High Court on Friday granted interim bail to BJP MLC CT Ravi, who was arrested for allegedly using derogatory remarks against the state's Women and Child Development Minister Laxmi Hebbalkar in Legislative Council. Earlier, Ravi refuted the allegations against him and said the arrest was a conspiracy to "murder" him. Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar called him "filthy mouth".
articles.title: K'taka HC grants bail to BJP's CT Ravi in derogatory remarks case
articles.subtitle: Minister had filed a complaint against Ravi

articles.content: Haryana government declared three days of state mourning (December 20-22) as mark of respect to former CM Om Prakash Chautala who passed away on Friday. "During this period, the national flag will fly at half-mast throughout the state on all buildings where it is flown regularly," the state government's order said. Chautala was Haryana CM for four times.
articles.title: 3-day state mourning in Haryana over Om Prakash Chautala's death
articles.subtitle: Haryana govt declared Saturday as public holiday

articles.content: Seven Bills were passed in Parliament in Winter Session, which ended today. Lok Sabha passed Banking Laws (Amendment) Bill, Railways (Amendment) Bill, Disaster Management (Amendment) Bill and Appropriation Bill. Meanwhile, Rajya Sabha passed - Bharatiya Vayuyan Vidheyak, Oilfields(Regulation and Development) Amendment Bill and Boilers Bill. One Nation One Election Bill was introduced in Lok Sabha.
articles.title: What Bills were passed in Parliament during this Winter Session?
articles.subtitle: ONOE Bill has been sent to JPC

articles.content: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has approved UltraTech Cement's acquisition of India Cements. In July, UltraTech announced it will acquire a 32.72% stake in India Cements for ₹3,954 crore. It had also announced plans for a ₹3,142.35 crore open offer to acquire another 26% stake in India Cements from its shareholders.
articles.title: UltraTech Cement's acquisition of India Cements approved by CCI
articles.subtitle: UltraTech earlier got a CCI notice over the deal

articles.content: The world's loneliest gorilla, Bua Noi, will spend its 36th Christmas trapped in a concrete cage at Pata Zoo in Thailand's Bangkok. The female gorilla has been imprisoned inside the zoo, which is located at Pata Pinklao Department Store on the sixth and seventh floor, since 1988.
