"Bua Noi is suffering from extreme psychological distress in...enclosure," a PETA official claimed.
articles.title: World's loneliest gorilla to spend 36th Christmas in Thai mall zoo
articles.subtitle: Gorilla's lifespan is around 35-40 years

articles.content: While dissolving a marriage, the Supreme Court observed that provisions in criminal laws are for protecting women and not "means to chastise, threaten, domineer or extort from their husbands". It also ordered the man to pay ₹12 crore permanent alimony to his estranged wife in a month. The estranged wife had sought a permanent alimony equivalent to her husband's wealth.
articles.title: Laws not meant to extort husbands: SC as it orders man to pay ₹12 cr to ex-wife
articles.subtitle: Ex-wife claimed man paid ₹500cr to 1st wife

articles.content: Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said there is no national security rationale for giving $25 billion in subsidies to chip foundries. "Chip foundries aren't necessary in the chip supply chain," he said, adding India will still be dependent on others for wafers and rare earth minerals. "We've 3 lakh chip designers...expand them...Create your own chip firm," he added.
articles.title: Investing $25 bn in chip foundries has no national security rationale: Rajan
articles.subtitle: 'We need high quality universities to create IP'

articles.content: The world’s steepest cable car commenced operations in Switzerland, connecting Stechelberg and Mürren. This remarkable engineering achievement boasts an unprecedented gradient of 159.4% and traverses 775 metres in height over a distance of nearly 1,194 metres. The Austrian-built cable cars each accommodate 85 passengers with an hourly capacity of 800 people.
articles.title: World’s steepest cable car now open in Switzerland
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Varun Dhawan shared an incident from Team India's 2018 tour of England, revealing that Anushka Sharma saw Virat Kohli "really down, like literally crying" when India lost the Birmingham Test by 31 runs. "He took the whole thing on himself that I failed, when he was....highest scorer. He was the captain," he added. Kohli scored a ton in the Test.
articles.title: Anushka saw Kohli down, literally crying: Varun on 2018 Eng tour
articles.subtitle: Kohli was highest scorer in the match

articles.content: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh on Friday said for Congress Parliament's productivity in the winter session was 100% because the entire country got to know what Union Home Minister and Narendra Modi think about Dr Ambedkar. Ramesh's remark came as several leaders both from the opposition and BJP blamed each other for disrupting Parliament session due to protest.
articles.title: For us Parliament's productivity was 100%, it exposed BJP: Jairam
articles.subtitle: The winter session of Parliament ended today

articles.content: Democrats sarcastically dub Elon Musk "President Musk," highlighting unease over his growing sway in US politics. From opposing bipartisan budget deals to influencing GOP policies, Musk's actions spark fears of billionaire overreach. Speculation about Musk entering formal politics grows as debates intensify over his role in shaping government decisions and its implications for democracy.
articles.title: Why Democrats are calling Elon Musk 'President Musk'
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: India has responded after Mahfuj Alam, a leader in the Bangladesh interim government, posted about "annexing Indian territories". "We have registered our strong protest on this issue with the Bangladesh side...We would like to remind all concerned to be mindful of their public comments," Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said, adding that the post has now been deleted.
articles.title: India responds after Bangladesh govt leader's post on 'annexing Indian territories'
articles.subtitle: To know what else Jaiswal said

articles.content: Yo Yo Honey Singh's sister revealed that the rapper's ex-wife Shalini Talwar was forcing him to perform during a US tour when he was battling mental illness. She said Honey told her that something wasn't right with him. "He said, 'Please save me.' [Shalini] said, 'He has to do this show. You convince him.' I said I can't," she added.
articles.title: Honey's ex-wife was forcing him to perform when he wanted help: Sister
articles.subtitle: 'Later, he was admitted with stitches in head'

articles.content: The Indian online gaming industry is at a crossroads as tax authorities gear up to issue final tax demands by February 5, 2025, based on the pending show-cause notices. As the deadline nears, many gaming companies have already been served tax notices by authorities. The demands pertain to the 28% GST levied on betting amounts, an issue currently being deliberated by the Supreme Court.
articles.title: Indian gaming industry faces tax demands by Feb 2025
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: US President-elect Donald Trump on Friday said that the European Union (EU) will face tariffs if the bloc does not cut its growing deficit with the US by purchasing oil and gas. Reacting to Trump's statement, an EU spokesperson said that the bloc is committed to phasing out energy imports from Russia and diversifying their sources of supply.
articles.title: Tariffs all the way if you don't buy US oil and gas: Trump to EU
articles.subtitle: US already supplied EU's 47% LNG in 2024's Q1

articles.content: In a recent episode of 'Prakhar ke Pravachan' podcast, entrepreneur Bryan Johnson revealed that a very important part of his daily longevity supplement stack is the Type 2 Diabetes drug - Metformin. Although the drug's effects on longevity are still under study, Bryan claimed that it shows promising evidence of potentially increasing human lifespan.
articles.title: Bryan Johnson reveals crucial longevity supplement he uses

articles.content: Several BJP leaders and supporters shared a cropped video of Congress MP Rahul Gandhi, to falsely show it as Gandhi admitting to pushing BJP MP Pratap Sarangi at the parliament. BOOM found that a video of Rahul Gandhi was edited to falsely suggest he admitted to pushing BJP MP Pratap Chandra Sarangi outside Parliament.
articles.title: Video of Rahul Gandhi admitting to pushing BJP MP is edited
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A total of 2,200 cases of violence against Hindus and other minorities have been reported in Bangladesh this year till December 8, Minister of State for External Affairs Kirti Vardhan Singh said in Rajya Sabha. In Pakistan, the number of cases of violence against Hindus and other minorities stood at 112 till October 2024, Singh added.
articles.title: 2,200 cases of violence against Hindus, other minorities in Bangladesh in 2024
articles.subtitle: 302 such cases were reported in 2023 in B'desh

articles.content: Winter poses digestive challenges due to heavier meals and reduced activity. Gastroenterologist Dr Amit Yelsangikar advises incorporating fibre-rich foods like root vegetables, probiotics like yogurt, and warming spices like ginger and turmeric. Stay hydrated with herbal teas and bone broth, and engage in light physical activity to maintain a healthy gut and overall well-being.
articles.title: How to maintain gut health during winter?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai told employees this week that the company had reduced the number of managers, directors, and VPs by 10%, Business Insider reported. He stated that Google made changes over the past couple of years to be more efficient. Some of the affected roles were transitioned to individual contributor roles, while others were eliminated, a Google spokesperson said.
articles.title: Google reduced managerial roles by 10%, CEO Pichai tells employees
articles.subtitle: Google laid off 12,000 employees in Jan 2023

articles.content: Reacting to BJP MLC CT Ravi's arrest for allegedly using derogatory word against Minister Laxmi Hebbalkar, ex-Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said it took two months to make arrests when "Pakistan Zindabad" was raised in Assembly. "[In case of Ravi's arrest] no procedure was followed...there is Police raj in Karnataka," Bommai added. Ravi termed his arrest as conspiracy to "murder" him.
articles.title: Took 2 months to arrest when Pak Zindabad slogan was said: Bommai
articles.subtitle: 'Probe must be done and truth must come out'

articles.content: The uncle of 28-year-old Congress worker who died during the party's protest in Lucknow said his nephew's life could have been saved had the people in party office paid attention and took him to the hospital on time. Reacting to Mallikarjun Kharge's call to the family expressing his condolence, Manish Pandey said, "Condolences will not suffice. My nephew has gone."
articles.title: He could’ve been saved: Uncle of Congress worker who died in UP
articles.subtitle: 'He died due to suffocation'

articles.content: Journalist Sucheta Dalal shared a video on X and wrote, "Breaking news! The Worli-Bandra bridge has vanished!! Yes-vanished into thick smog." Meanwhile, a social media user wrote, "This winter in Mumbai has been so much more enjoyable than last year's. The cooler temperatures...have been a welcome change. But this recent smog...it's unlike anything I've ever seen here."
articles.title: Bandra-Worli sea link disappears amid thick smog in Mumbai
articles.subtitle: To see the video posted by Sucheta Dalal

articles.content: Talking about India captain Rohit Sharma's form, ex-Australia captain Michael Clarke said Rohit is an "exceptional player". "When he's confident and backing himself, playing with aggressive intent, that's where he is at his best," Clarke stated. Rohit has scored 19 runs in the two Tests he has played in the ongoing five-match series against Australia.
articles.title: Rohit is at his best when he plays with aggressive intent: Clarke
articles.subtitle: Rohit has scored 4,289 runs in Tests so far

articles.content: Reacting to Pope Francis suggesting that international community should study whether Israel's military offensive in Gaza constitutes a genocide of Palestinians, Israeli minister Amichai Chikli said it's trivialisation of the term "genocide". "As a people who lost six million of its sons and daughters in...Holocaust...a trivialisation that comes dangerously close to Holocaust denial," Chikli said.
articles.title: Trivialisation of term: Israel minister on Pope's genocide remark
articles.subtitle: Over 45,000 people have been killed in Gaza

articles.content: Sensex fell nearly 4,100 points and Nifty dipped about 5% in one week till Friday. As per Moneycontrol, the main reasons behind this are US Federal Reserve's rate cuts, high valuations, sluggish earnings growth and breach of key technical support level. Additionally, FIIs have resumed aggressive selling and turned net sellers this month, further contributing to the dip.
articles.title: Why did Sensex fall nearly 4,100 points and Nifty about 5% in one week?
articles.subtitle: Sensex has ended in red in the last 5 sessions

articles.content: Gukesh D, who became youngest world chess champion, will face Arjun Erigaisi and R Praggnanandhaa in Tata Steel Chess 2025 (January 7-February 2). Gukesh will then face Viswanathan Anand and Magnus Carlsen in Freestyle Chess Grandslam 2025 (February 7-February 14). Gukesh will participate in Norway Chess 2025 (May 26-June 6) where he will face Magnus Carlsen and Arjun Erigaisi.
articles.title: What competitions will chess champ Gukesh participate in 2025?
articles.subtitle: Gukesh beat Ding Liren to become world champion

articles.content: During a meeting with Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif in Cairo on Thursday, Bangladesh's interim government's chief advisor Muhammad Yunus said that both countries needed to settle the issues of the 1971 war to move forward. During the meeting, both leaders agreed to expand and deepen bilateral ties. Bangladesh gained independence from Pakistan after a war in 1971.
articles.title: Settle issues of 1971 to move forward: B'desh's Yunus to Pak PM
articles.subtitle: 'I want a summit of SAARC leaders'

articles.content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis on Thursday said he and his deputies Ajit Pawar and Eknath Shinde would work 24/7 in shifts. "Ajit Pawar will work in the morning since he is an early riser. I am on duty from 12 noon to midnight" Fadnavis said in Assembly. Speaking about Shinde, Fadnavis said he would work through the night.
articles.title: Will work 24/7 in shifts, Ajit in morning, I till midnight: Maha CM
articles.subtitle: 'You will be Chief Minister someday'

articles.content: Talking about KL Rahul who has scored 235 runs in the three Tests of the ongoing series against Australia, ex-India cricketer Dinesh Karthik said, "I believe in him." "We have the opener that India wants. People need to value what he is doing today, and that matters a lot," Karthik stated. Rahul has scored 3,216 runs in Tests so far.
articles.title: People need to value what Rahul is doing, that matters a lot: DK
articles.subtitle: Rahul has smashed 8 Test tons so far

articles.content: The income tax (IT) department has recovered 52 kg gold worth ₹40.47 crore from an abandoned car in Mindori forest in Bhopal, an official said on Friday. The recovery was made during ongoing raids on real estate businesses by the Enforcement Directorate (ED), Lokayukta and the IT department. The action was carried out following a tip-off.
articles.title: 52kg gold worth over ₹40 cr recovered from abandoned car in Bhopal
articles.subtitle: 'Car registered in the name of a builder'

articles.content: Amid reports of differences between the two, US President-elect Donald Trump was seen kissing his wife Melania in an undated picture. A recent report claimed that Melania has demanded a separate bedroom in White House. A source had said that Trump and Melania stayed in separate rooms during his first term as the US President.
articles.title: Pic shows Donald Trump kissing wife Melania amid reports of differences
articles.subtitle: Trump will take office on January 20, 2025

articles.content: Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) commander Mazloum Abdi said non-Syrian Kurdish fighters who came to Syria to support Syrian Kurdish forces will leave if a ceasefire is reached with Turkey in northern Syria. Members of the Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK), a designated terrorist group by Turkey, were also supporting the SDF in the uprising against ousted President Bashar al-Assad.
articles.title: Non-Syrian Kurd rebels to leave Syria if truce agreed with Turkey: SDF
articles.subtitle: SDF group is backed by United States

articles.content: Ex-Pakistan cricketer Rashid Latif called R Ashwin "a genius of the game", adding that he is on a different level. He added that  Ashwin is capable of heading BCCI and ICC. "He is very humble, and you wouldn't even realise that he's such a big cricketer. Best wishes to him from my side, from Pakistan," said Latif.
articles.title: He could take over BCCI or ICC: Latif on Ashwin's retirement
articles.subtitle: 'He's had an outstanding career'

articles.content: Cold weather increases heart attack risks due to vessel constriction, high blood pressure, and clot formation. Interventional Cardiologist Dr Sanjay Bhat advises dressing warmly, staying hydrated, avoiding smoking, and eating heart-healthy foods. Regular check-ups and active lifestyles can safeguard heart health during winter.
articles.title: Why are heart attacks more common in winter?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Nifty lost 364 points to end at 23,587.5 on Friday, declining for the fifth straight day and recording the worst week of 2024. Sensex also lost 1,176 points to close at 78,041.5. The drop this week led to investors losing roughly ₹19 lakh crore. Nestle India and Titan were the sole gainers on Sensex on Friday, while IT stocks declined.
articles.title: Investors lose ₹19 lakh crore as Nifty records worst week of 2024
articles.subtitle: Nifty IT index fell 2.6% on Friday

articles.content: PM Narendra Modi on Friday took to X to condole former Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala's demise, saying he constantly tried to carry forward the work of his late father Chaudhary Devi Lal. "My deepest condolences to his family and supporters in this hour of grief. Om Shanti," he added. Chautala passed away after suffering a cardiac arrest in Gurugram.
articles.title: He tried to carry forward work of Devi Lal ji: PM Modi on Om Prakash Chautala's demise
articles.subtitle: Chautala had been INLD chief since 2001

articles.content: Benchmark index Sensex dipped nearly 4,100 points this week, ending today's trade 1.5% lower at just over 78,000. Sensex had closed at 82,133 on Friday, December 13 and has closed in red for five consecutive sessions since then. The index has recorded a decline of nearly 1,800 points so far this month, rising in seven and falling in eight sessions.
articles.title: Sensex falls 4,100 points in one week
articles.subtitle: Top losers on Friday were Tech Mahindra, M&M

articles.content: A Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA) official, while criticising Prithvi Shaw's fitness, said Mumbai played with 10 fielders in SMAT and they were forced to hide Shaw in the field. "The ball would pass near him and he'd barely be able to get to it," the official said. "Even while batting...we could see he had trouble reaching to...ball," he added.
articles.title: We were playing with 10 fielders, were forced to hide Prithvi Shaw in the field: MCA official
articles.subtitle: 'His fitness, discipline, and attitude are poor'

articles.content: During the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, batter Prithvi Shaw used to spend most of his nights out and used to show up at Mumbai team hotel at 6 in the morning, as per a report. Even the seniors in the team have started complaining about his attitude now, the report added. Notably, Shaw went unsold in IPL 2025 mega auction.
articles.title: Shaw spent most nights out, used to show up at Mumbai team hotel at 6 am: Report
articles.subtitle: Shaw last played for India in 2021

articles.content: Delhi High Court has allowed the Serious Fraud Investigation Office to continue its investigation against Hero Electric Vehicles in an alleged FAME-II EV subsidy fraud. This comes after settlement talks between the company and the Heavy Industries Ministry failed. Hero Electric, which received ₹133.5 crore in subsidy, allegedly violated rules by importing certain restricted parts from China.
articles.title: HC allows govt probe into Hero Electric over ₹133 cr subsidy fraud
articles.subtitle: Hero, 2 others' premises were searched earlier

articles.content: Pakistan on Thursday criticised the recent US sanctions on the country's ballistic missile program, calling them "discriminatory". The sanctions could have "dangerous implications for the strategic stability of our region and beyond", Pakistan's Ministry of Foreign Affairs said in a statement. A White House official had said Pakistan's ballistic missile program is an "emerging threat" to the US.
articles.title: US sanctions on ballistic missile program discriminatory: Pakistan
articles.subtitle: US imposed sanctions on four Pakistani entities

articles.content: The mother of Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash, who died by suicide after accusing his wife and in-laws of harassment, filed a habeas corpus petition in Supreme Court to secure custody of her four-year-old grandson, NDTV reported. As per the petition, the child's whereabouts are allegedly unknown. The court issued notices to Uttar Pradesh, Haryana, and Karnataka governments over the matter.
articles.title: Atul Subhash's mother moves Supreme Court for her 4-yr-old grandson's custody
articles.subtitle: 'Atul's wife, in-laws not disclosing location'

articles.content: A fan of Mahesh Babu brought a cat to a theatre showing the Telugu-dubbed 'Mufasa: The Lion King', in which the actor voiced Mufasa. A video has surfaced showing the fan lifting the cat up like Simba. Another video showed fans throwing confetti inside the theatre whenever Mahesh speaks. The film was released on December 20.
articles.title: Mahesh's fan brings cat to 'Mufasa' show, holds it up like Simba
articles.subtitle: Mahesh will next be seen in a SS Rajamouli film

articles.content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said that Parliament has failed to fulfil its responsibilities and let the country's people down. "Most of our MPs are disappointed. I think there are a lot of major issues to be discussed in our country...Sadly, most of this time has been wasted in disruption," he added. Congress and BJP protested against each other in Parliament.
articles.title: We have let people of India down: Tharoor on Parliament standoff
articles.subtitle: 'Hope this is not repeated in Budget session'

articles.content: The sequel to '3 Idiots' is in the works, Vidhu Vinod Chopra said. The film, titled '2 Idiots', is currently in the writing stage, he added. He's also working on the third instalment of 'Munna Bhai'. Vidhu said he could've made a lot of sequels to both films by now but he didn't want to compromise just to mint money.
articles.title: '3 Idiots' sequel '2 Idiots' in works, reveals Vidhu Vinod Chopra
articles.subtitle: '3 Idiots' was released in 2009

articles.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin was asked if he would change his decision to send troops to Ukraine in February 2022 if he could go back in time, to which he replied that Russia should have done it earlier. Putin said the decision to launch the military campaign was made without much preparation because Russia "could no longer tolerate" Ukraine's behaviour.
articles.title: I should have invaded Ukraine before 2022: Putin
articles.subtitle: Need long-lasting peace with Ukraine: Putin

articles.content: To increase production of green hydrogen to meet India's decarbonisation target, an investment to the tune of INR 8-10 trillion would be needed by 2030. According to a study by SBI Caps, annual use of hydrogen will go up to 15-20 million tonnes by 2030. Additionally INR 4.5 trillion would be needed to set up renewable energy capacity to fuel these new factories.
articles.title: India needs INR10 trillion for hydrogen production by 2030: Report
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: After police arrested Karnataka BJP MLC CT Ravi, he said this was a conspiracy to "murder" him. "If something happens to me, Congress Govt must take responsibility," he added. Ravi was arrested after an FIR was registered against him, for allegedly using a derogatory word against Minister Laxmi Hebbalkar. Meanwhile, Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar called him "filthy mouth".
articles.title: Conspiracy to murder me: BJP leader CT Ravi after arrest
articles.subtitle: 'They're treating me like a criminal'

articles.content: Malaysia has agreed in principle to resume the search for the wreckage of the missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370, the country's Transport Minister Anthony Loke Siew Fook said. The Boeing 777 aircraft, carrying 227 passengers and 12 crew members, vanished en route from Kuala Lumpur to Beijing on March 8, 2014. "We hope this time will be positive," Fook added.
articles.title: Malaysia to resume search for wreckage of missing flight MH370
articles.subtitle: 'Our obligation is to the next of kin'

articles.content: A 37-year-old man from Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore arrived at a family court with ₹80,000 in coins after he was ordered to pay an interim alimony of ₹2 lakh to his estranged wife. However, a judge directed him to submit the amount in currency notes instead. A video purportedly showing him carrying bags of coins out of the court has surfaced.
articles.title: Man reaches court with ₹80,000 in coins to pay alimony in TN, ordered to return with notes
articles.subtitle: Man reportedly carried 20 bags of ₹1 & ₹2 coins

articles.content: BJP leader Anurag Thakur said "arrogance" was visible on Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's face when he was taken to the injured MP after a scuffle in Parliament. "Rahul's statement was that pushing and shoving keeps happening," Thakur stated. BJP-led NDA and Congress-led I.N.D.I.A bloc parties were holding parallel protests over Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks on BR Ambedkar.
articles.title: Arrogance visible on Rahul's face when he met injured MP: Thakur
articles.subtitle: FIR against Rahul for allegedly injuring 2 MPs

articles.content: BJP MP Aparajita Sarangi on Friday gifted a bag labelled '1984 riots' to Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra in the Parliament. Sarangi did this over Priyanka carrying bags with references to Palestine and Bangladeshi Hindus earlier this week in Parliament. Pointing to the 1984 anti-Sikh riots, Sarangi said that the present generation should know what Congress did in the past.
articles.title: BJP MP gifts '1984 riots' bag to Priyanka after she brings Palestine bag to Parliament
articles.subtitle: To watch a video showing Sarangi gifting the bag

articles.content: Javed Akhtar shared how nervous he was before penning Ramlila song 'Pal Pal Hai Bhaari' for Ashutosh Gowariker's 'Swades'. He said when Ashutosh called him to discuss the song, he told the filmmaker, "You've made...perfect arrangement for my murder....Do you realise...[it's] a very sensitive subject...I told him...I can't do it," he said. However, Javed wrote the song in two hours.
articles.title: Told Swades maker you've arranged my murder: Javed on Ramlila song
articles.subtitle: 'Met someone who knew Ramcharitmanas'

articles.content: Five people, including three women, were killed and 27 others sustained injuries after a private bus they were travelling in overturned in Maharashtra's Raigad on Friday. The accident occurred while members of a family were going from Pune to Birwadi to attend a wedding. "The injured were rushed to Mangaon Rural Hospital where they're undergoing treatment," a police officer said.
articles.title: 5 dead, 27 injured as bus carrying family to wedding overturns in Maharashtra
articles.subtitle: 'An FIR against the driver will be filed soon'

articles.content: Bibek Pangeni, a social media influencer and a PhD candidate in Physics and Astronomy at the University of Georgia, has passed away after a prolonged and valiant battle with a brain tumour. He was diagnosed with the condition in 2022. Throughout his journey in battling the malignant tumour, Pangeni's wife, Srijana Subedi, remained his unwavering support.
articles.title: Nepali influencer Bibek Pangeni passes away at 32
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Mozez Singh's 'Yo Yo Honey Singh: Famous', which dives into the rapper's downfall, does a decent job in giving audiences a peek inside his troubled mind, The Indian Express wrote in its review. It resembles a documentary and is not merely a collection of talking heads gushing about whoever the subject happens to be, the review read.
articles.title: Yo Yo Honey Singh: Famous peeks inside rapper's troubled mind: IE
articles.subtitle: The publication gave it 3/5 stars

articles.content: Actor Sonu Sood, talking about an interaction with Aishwarya Rai during the shoot of the 2008 film 'Jodhaa Akbar', said Aishwarya told him that he reminds her of her father-in-law Amitabh Bachchan. "She's very sweet, great co-star...I share a great rapport with the whole family," Sonu said. Calling the Bachchan family "great people", the 51-year-old added, "You've fun with them."
articles.title: Aishwarya told me I remind her of father-in-law Big B: Sonu Sood
articles.subtitle: 'I've worked with Abhishek in 'Happy New Year''

articles.content: A video has surfaced showing the moment fire erupted near a petrol pump on the Jaipur-Ajmer highway after a chemical-carrying truck collided with an LPG tanker. The fire claimed at least nine lives and injured dozens while engulfing around 40 vehicles, including trucks, buses and cars. The video showed the fire engulfing neighbouring properties within seconds.
articles.title: Video shows moment fire erupted after chemical-carrying truck hit LPG tanker in Jaipur
articles.subtitle: Flames were visible from a kilometre away

articles.content: Ride-hailing platform Rapido has fixed a flaw that exposed personal data, including phone numbers and email addresses, of thousands of drivers and users. The flaw, discovered by a security researcher, was related to a feedback form, TechCrunch reported. "This could have led to a big scam involving scammers or hackers," Researcher Renganathan P said.
articles.title: Rapido's flawed form exposes thousands of drivers, users' data
articles.subtitle: 'Exposed data related to one of Rapido's APIs'

articles.content: Actor Eijaz Khan's spokesperson, in a statement on behalf of Eijaz, said religion "was never a factor" in Eijaz and actress Pavitra Punia's relationship. The remarks came as Eijaz's father has been reportedly receiving calls from people inquiring if his son put pressure on Pavitra to convert to Islam. "His father was very happy about their relationship," the statement added.
articles.title: Religion was never a factor in my breakup with Pavitra: Eijaz Khan
articles.subtitle: Pavitra earlier refuted similar claims

articles.content: Director Anil Sharma, in a recent interview with Siddharth Kannan, revealed actress Ameesha Patel wasn't happy with less screen space in the 2023 film 'Gadar 2'. "She couldn't understand the age and the time. When you're Jeete's mother, you'll also have to become [a] mother-in-law," he added. Anil further stated that he understands Ameesha is "beautiful" but "she's an actor".
articles.title: Ameesha wasn't happy with less screen space in 'Gadar 2': Director
articles.subtitle: 'Gadar 2' also starred Sunny Deol, Manish Wadhwa

articles.content: Actress Sambhavna Seth has revealed that she suffered a miscarriage during the first trimester of her pregnancy. "In the recent scan, doctors couldn't find the heartbeat. Nobody could figure out why it happened," her husband Avinash said. "I did everything and took all precautions that were required of me to have this baby," the actress said.
articles.title: Actress Sambhavna Seth suffers miscarriage
articles.subtitle: Doctors were shocked: Avinash

articles.content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar expressed disappointment over disruptions in Parliament saying, world watches our democracy, yet we fail our citizens through our conduct. "Where reasoned dialogue should prevail, we witness only chaos. I urge every MP, regardless of party, to examine their conscience," Rajya Sabha Chairman added. BJP and Opposition held protests and counterprotests today.
articles.title: World watching us: VP Dhankhar on disruptions in Parliament
articles.subtitle: Congress protested over FIR against Rahul Gandhi

articles.content: A brother and his sister, along with an uncle and his niece, were found to be preparing to marry each other in exchange for money from Chief Minister Mass Marriage Scheme in UP's Moradabad. The fraudulent applications were discovered and cancelled after scrutiny, as per reports. A total of 3,451 couples from Moradabad are expected to participate in the scheme.
articles.title: Uncle-niece, brother-sister try to marry each other for money from govt scheme in UP
articles.subtitle: Investigation into fake applicants is ongoing

articles.content: A woman, who was expecting electronic appliances, received a parcel with an unidentified dead body inside and an extortion letter demanding ₹1.3 crore in Andhra Pradesh's West Godavari. The box was delivered to her family's under-construction house on Thursday night, as per the police. An investigation has been launched into the matter by the police.
articles.title: Woman expecting electronics gets parcel with dead body & letter demanding ₹1.3cr in Andhra
articles.subtitle: Woman was allegedly told parcel had electronics

articles.content: Several people were injured after a stampede broke out during Pandit Pradeep Mishra's Shiv Mahapuran katha at Partapur ground in UP's Meerut on Friday. It was the sixth day of the katha. According to initial reports, many women and senior citizens are said to be injured. The stampede reportedly broke out after a scuffle between a devotee and a bouncer.
articles.title: Several injured after stampede at Pandit Pradeep Mishra's Shiv Mahapuran katha in UP
articles.subtitle: 'The situation is completely under control'

articles.content: Talking about Jaipur fire accident which claimed the lives of eight people and injured over 35, a witness said he saw "a man engulfed in flames" and called it a "frightening scene". Another witness said he heard a blast when he woke up at around 5:30 am and that a "whole lane of 100-200 metres was burned".
articles.title: Saw a man engulfed in flames: Witness on Jaipur fire accident
articles.subtitle: Truck collided with other vehicles

articles.content: Cars24 CEO Vikram Chopra sparked a debate online after asking engineers, who can't speak Kannada despite residing in Bengaluru for years, to come to Delhi. "We're not saying Delhi-NCR is better...It really is," Chopra said. "Provide one aspect in which Delhi-NCR is better than Bengaluru and I'll work for you for free," an X user said. "Great initiative," said another.
articles.title: 'Can't speak Kannada in B'luru? Come to Delhi, it's better', says Cars24 CEO; sparks debate
articles.subtitle: 'Basically you want north Indians/Delhiites?'

articles.content: Actress Sriya Reddy said she has "some beautiful scenes" with actor and Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan in their upcoming film 'They Call Him OG'. "What really attracted me to him is that he's so intelligent, well-mannered, and dignified. He has such an electric personality," she added. The 41-year-old stated the way Kalyan conducts himself and talks is "interesting".
articles.title: Pawan Kalyan & I've beautiful scenes together in 'OG': Sriya Reddy
articles.subtitle: The film is expected to be released next year

articles.content: Former India cricketer Subramaniam Badrinath has said that Ravichandran Ashwin was seemingly not treated fairly within the Indian dressing room and he wanted to leave when Washington Sundar was played ahead of him in the Perth Test.  Badrinath said, "I am shocked. I think, to be honest, he wasn't treated fairly. On many occasions, efforts were made to sideline him."
articles.title: Efforts were made to sideline Ashwin: S Badrinath
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A principal in Bihar's Vaishali district was caught on video stealing eggs meant for the school's mid-day meal program. The education department confirmed the theft and issued a notice seeking an explanation. The principal denied the allegations, but the cook contradicted his denial. The incident occurred on December 13.
articles.title: Principal caught stealing eggs meant for mid-day meal in Bihar
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Pakistan is developing long-range ballistic missile capabilities that could allow it to strike targets beyond South Asia, making it an "emerging threat" to the US, senior White House official Jon Finer said. "We're going to keep the pressure on Pakistan," he added. Finer's remarks come after the US sanctioned four Pakistan-based entities for contributing to the country's ballistic missile program.
articles.title: Pak's ballistic missile program emerging threat to US: WH official
articles.subtitle: 'Threat posed to the US is up to a decade away'

articles.content: Los Angeles Lakers player LeBron James, who scored 19 points, six rebounds and seven assists against Sacramento Kings, broke record for playing most minutes in NBA history. James, who spent 34 minutes against Kings, now has 57,471 in his career, moving past Hall of Famer Kareem Abdul-Jabbar (57,446) for the record. Los Angeles Lakers won the match 113-100.
articles.title: LeBron James breaks record for playing most minutes in NBA history
articles.subtitle: James made his NBA debut in 2003

articles.content: Reacting to Ravichandran Ashwin's retirement after third Test against Australia, ex-India cricketer WV Raman said it came as a "surprise" and it "was not something hinted at any time". "However, what happens is that no cricketer can predict when it's enough," he stated. Ashwin wasn't part of the playing XI in first and third Tests.
articles.title: Surprise, it wasn't hinted at any time: Raman as Ashwin retires
articles.subtitle: Ashwin represented India in 106 Tests

articles.content: At least 35 children have been killed and six others sustained critical injuries in a stampede at a school fair in Nigeria's Ibadan, police said. Eight people, including the event's main sponsor, have been arrested for their alleged involvement in the incident, police added. The organisers reportedly expected to host 5,000 children below the age of 13 at the event.
articles.title: 35 children dead, 6 injured in stampede at school fair in Nigeria
articles.subtitle: 'A homicide investigation has been launched'

articles.content: A man was arrested for hiding a mobile phone inside the changing room of a diagnostic centre and secretly recording women's videos in Bhopal. The accused is a staff member of an MRI centre who hid a camera in the false ceiling of the changing room. Police recovered several video clips-- showing females changing clothes, from the phone.
articles.title: Camera found in changing room of MRI centre in Bhopal, one held
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Ashish Kacholia's portfolio rose by nearly 89% to ₹2,247 crore, making him biggest wealth creator among top Indian investors in 2024, primeinfobase.com's data showed. He was followed by Mukul Agrawal, whose wealth rose by 46% to ₹6,909 crore, and Akash Bhanshali (43%). Anuj Sheth, Yusuffali Abdul Kader, Nemish Shah and Ashish Dhawan's net worths rose 25-30% in 2024.
articles.title: Which top Indian investors were the biggest wealth creators in 2024?
articles.subtitle: Radhakishan Damani's portfolio value down 19%

articles.content: Former Haryana Chief Minister Om Prakash Chautala passed away after suffering a cardiac arrest in Gurugram on Friday. Chautala was the son of sixth Deputy Prime Minister of India, Chaudhary Devi Lal. Chautala had been the President of Indian National Lok Dal (INLD) since 2001. He was reportedly in his early nineties.
articles.title: Former Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala passes away
articles.subtitle: He became CM for the 1st time in 1989

articles.content: Tabla maestro Zakir Hussain, who passed away aged 73 in a hospital in the US, was laid to rest in San Francisco on Thursday. The tabla legend was suffering from a chronic lung disease. Percussionist Anandan Sivamani was among those who attended the funeral of Zakir Hussain. Sivamani and several other musicians paid a musical tribute to Zakir Hussain.
articles.title: Zakir Hussain laid to rest in San Francisco
articles.subtitle: He is survived by his wife and 2 daughters

articles.content: A study published in Nature Aging reveals that today's 70-year-olds are as healthy as 60-year-olds from previous generations. This shift, seen in English seniors born after WWII, highlights improvements in cognitive, physical, and psychological health due to better education, nutrition, and medical advancements. Experts caution against complacency, noting rising obesity rates as a threat.
articles.title: 70 is the new 60: Study reveals revolutionary shift in aging
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Australia have named two vice-captains for the last two Test matches against India, with Travis Head and Steve Smith being Pat Cummins' deputies. Most teams name one deputy, but Australia have instituted the practice of co-vice-captains for nearly six years now, naming two players to form part of the leadership group along with the captain himself.
articles.title: Why both Smith and Head are named Australia Test vice-captains
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: US Attorney Breon Peace, who brought bribery charges against Gautam Adani and Adani Group, will resign from office ahead of President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration. "It has been the honour of a lifetime...in upholding the rule of law," Peace said in a statement. This comes weeks after Peace brought conspiracy, securities and wire fraud charges against Adani and his associates.
articles.title: US attorney Peace, behind Adani bribery charges, to resign before Trump takes office
articles.subtitle: Carolyn Pokorny to temporarily replace Peace

articles.content: A Rapido driver called a Mumbai-based techie 'bhikhari ki aulad (beggar's kid)' and threatened her for refusing to pay extra fare. The techie claimed the driver demanded extra fare for bringing a 'premium' cab despite her booking an 'economy' cab. "Cancel kardo warna pel dunga khade khade (Cancel the ride or I'll beat you)," the driver messaged the techie.
articles.title: Rapido driver calls Mumbai techie 'beggar's kid', threatens her for not paying extra fare
articles.subtitle: 'Rapido has worst drivers', an X user said

articles.content: Reacting to Ravichandran Ashwin's retirement after third Test against Australia, ex-Australia cricketer Michael Clarke said captain Rohit Sharma and coach Gautam Gambhir probably told Ashwin he will not play in next two Tests of series. "So he decided to make that decision," Clarke stated. Ashwin wasn't included in the playing XI in first and third Tests.
articles.title: He was probably told he may not play in next 2 Tests: Clarke as Ashwin retires mid-series
articles.subtitle: Ashwin picked 537 wickets in Tests

articles.content: A new ICU ward has been opened at Sawai Man Singh (SMS) Medical College to treat victims of the Jaipur fire accident, the hospital's Principal, Dr Deepak Maheshwari, said. "As of now...35 people have been admitted to the burn ward...The burns are extremely serious," he added. A truck had collided with vehicles near a petrol pump on the Jaipur-Ajmer highway.
articles.title: New ICU ward opened at SMS hospital for Jaipur accident victims
articles.subtitle: At least 5 people have been killed in incident

articles.content: Punjabi singer Diljit Dosanjh, during his Mumbai concert on Thursday, opened up about the advisory that was issued to him ahead of the concert, saying he'll make sure his fans have "double the fun". "Don't worry, all advisories are for me," he added. "I've learnt...that no matter how much poison...people throw at you, you shouldn't take that inside," Diljit stated.
articles.title: Will ensure fans have double fun: Diljit on Mumbai show advisory
articles.subtitle: 'No drug, alcohol songs at Mumbai concert'

articles.content: A Pinterest post claims that using coconut oil can reverse tooth cavity. However, upon being fact-checked, it was found that it is a false claim. Coconut oil offers benefits like antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory properties, making it a helpful addition to oral hygiene routines. However, it cannot reverse cavities or repair decayed teeth. Dentists have refuted this claim and called it false.
articles.title: Can using coconut oil reverse tooth cavity?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A blast occurred near the Bakshiwal police chowki in Amritsar on Wednesday night, with the Khalistan Zindabad Force (KZF) claiming responsibility in a social media post. Forensic experts are investigating, and authorities suspect a grenade was hurled from an auto-rickshaw. Despite seven similar blasts in 25 days, officials deny intelligence failure, as the chowki was already closed.
articles.title: Punjab witnesses seventh explosion in 25 days
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Many pregnant women remain unaware of the seriousness of gestational diabetes (GDM). Research says that nearly 13% of pregnant women in India suffer from it. GDM increases the risk of developing type 2 diabetes later in life for both the mother and the child. Thus, self-monitoring of blood glucose is crucial for diabetes management in pregnant women.
articles.title: Why self-monitoring gestational diabetes matters for moms & babies
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Mudit Agarwal, a 36-year-old entrepreneur from Siliguri, is transforming bamboo’s image through his startup GrassPly. Launched in 2013, the company manufactures eco-friendly products like bamboo flooring tiles, mat boards, etc. GrassPly’s innovation, driven by Mudit’s decade-long journey in the industry, aims to challenge the stigma around bamboo and offer it as a timber alternative.
articles.title: Siliguri-based entrepreneur turns bamboo into sustainable products
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Ravichandran Ashwin took to X to respond to Virat Kohli's tribute post for him on his retirement. "Thanks buddy! Like I told you, I'll be walking out with you to bat at the MCG," Ashwin wrote. "I've played with you for 14 years and when you told me today you're retiring, it made me a bit emotional," Kohli had written.
articles.title: Ashwin responds to Kohli's post, says 'I will be walking out with you to bat at the MCG'
articles.subtitle: Ashwin retired after Gabba Test

articles.content: Israel on Thursday refuted claims that the country is using water in "acts of genocide" by denying clean water to Palestinians in Gaza. Calling the accusations "baseless", it stated that millions of litres of water flow into the Gaza Strip through three Israeli water pipelines. Israel added that it facilitated hundreds of water infrastructure repairs in northern and southern Gaza.
articles.title: Israel denies claims of using water for 'acts of genocide' in Gaza
articles.subtitle: 'This libellous claim is an egregious lie'

articles.content: Three people, including a 70-year-old woman and her son, have been arrested for allegedly illegally selling a property in Dwarka's Sector 6, using forged documents after the original owner died in 2023. "The complainant claimed...documents were forged after...death of his brother-in-law in 2023. He further said his sister died in 2019 and the couple had no children," police stated.
articles.title: 3 held for selling dead man’s house by forging documents in Delhi
articles.subtitle: The property is in Badhwar Apartment

articles.content: A massage therapist was arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting and abusing a Spanish national and her Indian friend in Mumbai. The alleged incident occurred at Madh Island. Police officials also said that the accused recorded inappropriate photos and videos of both women during massage in Madh Island.
articles.title: Man sexually assaults Spanish national during massage in Mumbai
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A deficiency of magnesium can lead to many health issues, which include high blood sugar levels, migraines, constipation, the risk of fractures, anxiety and even heart diseases. And so, doctors recommend taking magnesium supplements for proper mineral absorption, energy production, muscle and nerve function, and DNA production.
articles.title: 6 health conditions magnesium supplements can help with
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Mumbai Police has written to Indian Navy and the Maharashtra Maritime Board, seeking detailed information about the incident where a Navy speedboat collided with a ferry and killed 14 people. The police asked who gave permission for conducting a trial run on such a busy maritime route. Police is reportedly also probing if the ferry had exceeded its passenger capacity.
articles.title: Who gave permit for speedboat's trial on busy maritime route?: Mumbai Police to Indian Navy
articles.subtitle: Navy claimed speedboat suffered engine failure

articles.content: Discussing Jaipur fire accident that claimed lives of five people and injured 35, Rajasthan CM Bhajanlal Sharma said he visited the hospital and asked the staff to admit all those who have been injured. "The government will provide all necessary help. We've issued helpline number. This is a tragic incident," he stated. Two trucks had collided outside a petrol pump.
articles.title: Tragic incident, we've issued helpline: Raj CM on Jaipur accident
articles.subtitle: Incident took place around 5:30 am today

articles.content: SEBI banned finfluencer Ravindra Balu Bharti and his firm, Ravindra Bharti Education Institute, from the securities market till April 4, 2025 and imposed a ₹9.5-crore fine for giving unregistered investment advice. Bharti's YouTube channels allegedly influenced sale of multiple plans to same clients, limiting their input in trade decisions. The channels also failed to inform clients about risks.
articles.title: Finfluencer Ravindra Bharti fined ₹9.5 crore for giving unregistered investment advice
articles.subtitle: SEBI banned 3 other people in relation to case

articles.content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that after construction of Ayodhya's Ram Temple, some people think they can become leaders of Hindus by raking up mosque-temple disputes in new places. He added this cannot continue. "Ram Temple was constructed since it was a matter of faith for all Hindus," he stated. "There is no majority or minority [in India]," he remarked.
articles.title: Some think they can become leaders of Hindus by raking up mosque-temple disputes: Bhagwat
articles.subtitle: 'The days of hegemony are gone'

articles.content: Australia have dropped opening batter Nathan McSweeney in favour of teenager Sam Konstas for the last two Tests of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. McSweeney has struggled at the top so far with 72 runs in six innings while Konstas has been in good form in domestic cricket. Pacer Jhye Richardson was added in place of the injured Josh Hazlewood.
articles.title: Australia drop McSweeney, call up Sam Konstas for remaining Tests
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The parliamentary standing committee on railways recommended adjusting AC class fares to align with operating costs while keeping general class travel affordable. It also suggested optimizing operational expenses, eliminating catering inefficiencies, and increasing private sector involvement in infrastructure to improve financial performance and modernize Indian Railways' operations.
articles.title: AC ticket fares should be increased, recommends standing committee
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A 25-year-old man has been arrested in Gujarat's Surat after a 1,500-km chase. The man was accused of administering an intoxicating substance to a woman on the pretext of trust and raping her in Delhi while capturing explicit photos and videos. He was arrested in a raid after Delhi Police received actionable intelligence that he was hiding in Surat.
articles.title: Man who drugged, raped woman in Delhi caught in Surat after 1,500-km chase
articles.subtitle: Accused studied till class 8, works as welder

articles.content: L'Oréal Professionnel announced that its Absolut Repair Molecular range rebuilds the hair's molecular structure to repair up to 2 years of damage* in one use and restore strength & elasticity. Powered by 2% peptides bonder + 5 amino acids, this sulfate-free range re-injects whole peptides into the hair for a complete repair solution, it added.
articles.title: A Sulfate-free formula to repair damaged hair: Absolut Repair Molecular
articles.subtitle: Try now for healthy, repaired & damage-free hair

articles.content: The overall AQI at around 8 am on Friday in Delhi stood at 434, categorised in 'severe' category, amid cold weather and a layer of smog. However, Rohini, RK Puram, Sirifort, and Dwarka Sector 8 were among those that recorded an AQI of over 450, the 'severe-plus' level according to the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB).
articles.title: Delhi's air quality remains 'severe', AQI over 450 in some areas
articles.subtitle: Wazirpur also recorded AQI of over 450

articles.content: Accenture added 24,697 employees in Q1FY25, increasing its total headcount to 7,99,000. This marks the third consecutive quarter of workforce growth, with most hiring concentrated in India. Their first-quarter revenue of $17.7 billion exceeded analyst expectations of $17.12 billion.
articles.title: Accenture adds more than 24,000 new employees in Q1FY25
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Ravichandran Ashwin took to X to share picture of his phone's call log after his retirement from international cricket. He wrote, "If someone told me 25 years ago...I would've a smartphone...and...call log on...last day of my career as...Indian cricketer would look like this...I would've had a heart attack then only." He added, "Thanks Sachin Tendulkar and Kapil Dev paaji...#blessed."
articles.title: R Ashwin shares pic of his phone's call log after retirement, says 'Blessed'
articles.subtitle: Ashwin retired from int'l cricket on Wednesday

articles.content: Reacting to FIR against Rahul Gandhi for allegedly injuring two BJP MPs during a scuffle in Parliament, Congress General Secretary KC Venugopal said case against Rahul for defending Ambedkar's legacy is a "badge of honour". On Thursday, the protests by BJP-led NDA and Congress-led I.N.D.I.A parties inside Parliament premises on the alleged insults to BR Ambedkar resulted in scuffle.
articles.title: Badge of honour: Congress on FIR against Rahul in scuffle case
articles.subtitle: 'FIR nothing but a diversionary tactic'

articles.content: Oil prices fell in early trading on Friday on worries about demand growth in 2025, especially in top crude importer China, putting global oil benchmarks on track to end the week down more than 2%. Brent crude futures fell by 31 cents, or 0.43%, to $72.57 a barrel by 0139 GMT. US West Texas Intermediate crude futures fell 26 cents, or 0.26%, to $69.12 per barrel.
articles.title: Oil falls on demand growth concerns, robust dollar
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A new wellness trend that aims to maximize the amount, quality and quantity of sleep you must get every night is a rage among youngsters and Gen Z. Known as sleepmaxxing, there are several people who swear by its health benefits, while experts are raising concerns. Mouth taping, nostril expanders and magnesium supplements can do more harm than benefit.
articles.title: Is sleepmaxxing, the Gen Z sleep trend, safe for health?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Auto fares in Bengaluru may soon increase as unions demand a revision to combat inflation and rising fuel costs. According to a report, drivers are pushing for an increase in the minimum fare from ₹30 to ₹40 for the first two kilometres and a hike in subsequent kilometre charges from ₹15 to ₹20. A key meeting with the RTA is scheduled for December 23.
articles.title: Auto rickshaw fares may rise as unions demand revision in B'luru
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Fitness influencer and YouTuber Rajveer Shishodia was arrested by Noida police after a video of him assaulting a man during a road rage incident went viral. The video, initially uploaded on Rajveer's official social media account, quickly gained attention but was later deleted. It captured Shishodia violently assaulting a man allegedly involved in a hit-and-run case.
articles.title: YouTuber arrested for thrashing man in road rage incident
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Delhi Public School in Dwarka received a bomb threat on Friday morning resulting in classes being shifted to online mode for the day, officials said. The emergency response teams rushed to the campus and began an investigation. "We received a call regarding the bomb threat at 5.02 am from DPS, Dwarka in Sector 23," a Delhi Fire Services official said.
articles.title: Delhi Public School in Dwarka receives bomb threat, probe underway
articles.subtitle: 'Dog squad is also participating in the search'

articles.content: While recalling shooting the 2002 film 'Saathiya', actor Vivek Oberoi said he had shot for 22-23 hours "non-stop", adding that only Rani Mukerji used to get the makeup van. "I had to go and change in restaurant bathrooms...I did the touch-ups on the streets," he stated. Vivek revealed he used to put newspapers on the bench and take a nap.
articles.title: Shot for 23 hrs for 'Saathiya', had no makeup van like Rani: Vivek Oberoi
articles.subtitle: 'Saathiya' also starred Shah Rukh Khan, Tabu

articles.content: The crash of Mi-17 V5 helicopter on December 8, 2021, which led to the death of General Bipin Rawat, India's first CDS, was caused by "human error," a parliamentary panel report said. In January 2022, the IAF stated spatial disorientation of the pilot due to bad weather caused the accident. The IAF's investigation ruled out negligence, mechanical failure, or sabotage.
articles.title: Human error caused chopper crash that killed CDS Bipin Rawat: Parliamentary panel report
articles.subtitle: General Rawat's wife also died in the crash

articles.content: The driver of the Indian Navy speedboat, which collided with a ferry and killed 14 people, was in a playful mood and was "showing off", said a survivor whose aunt died in the crash. "The driver...zig-zagged through the water," he said. Contesting the Navy's "engine failure" claim, he said, "[Speedboat's passengers] wouldn't have been so relaxed...if there'd been a problem."
articles.title: Navy speedboat's driver was showing off, zig-zagged through water: Mumbai ferry crash survivor
articles.subtitle: 'Driver must've felt he'd pass ferry narrowly'

articles.content: In 20 months, the Indian Income Tax Department recovered ₹37,000 crore from individuals evading taxes despite having a taxable income. Monitoring of high-value transactions like property and luxury purchases through the Non-Filer Monitoring System revealed discrepancies. A stricter tax collection system and advanced data analytics helped uncover evasion, boosting direct tax collections by 15.4%.
articles.title: IT Dept tracks spending data to recover ₹37,000 crore income tax
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Discussing rising temple-mosque disputes in India, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said following the construction of Ram Temple in Ayodhya, some people think they are the "leaders of Hindus" and it is "not acceptable". "How can this be allowed? This cannot continue," he stated. Notably, the Supreme Court, on December 12, issued nationwide directive restraining courts from allowing surveys of mosques.
articles.title: This is not acceptable: Bhagwat on rising temple-mosque disputes
articles.subtitle: 'India needs to show that we can live together'

articles.content: A chemical-carrying truck collided with vehicles near a petrol pump in Rajasthan's Jaipur on Friday, killing four people and injuring several others after an LPG tanker caught fire. Videos showed several vehicles ablaze after the collision, which took place on Jaipur-Ajmer highway. Multiple people sustained burn injuries and were rushed to the hospital. CM Bhajanlal Sharma also visited injured.
articles.title: 4 dead as truck hits LPG tanker at petrol pump in Jaipur, CM visits injured
articles.subtitle: Efforts are on to extinguish the flames

articles.content: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has announced the removal of all wrongly built speed breakers across the city to improve traffic flow and reduce congestion. The decision follows a survey revealing widespread violations of road design standards. The move is expected to enhance traffic speed, reduce bottlenecks, and promote safer and more efficient commuting in Pune.
articles.title: Pune municipal body to remove all wrongly built speed breakers
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin called for a Russia-US missile face-off, claiming that Russia's new Oreshnik hypersonic ballistic missile could defeat any US missile defence system. Reacting to this, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "Do you think he is a sane person? B*****ds." Putin asked US to choose a target for Russia in Ukraine and protect it.
articles.title: B*****ds: Ukraine President after Putin calls for Russia-US missile face-off
articles.subtitle: Zelenskyy said this at European Council meeting

articles.content: During a Q&A session, Russian President Vladimir Putin was asked to name deceased world leaders he would like to have tea with. Putin said that he had very warm memories of former German Chancellor Helmut Kohl, ex-French President Jacques Chirac, and former Italian PM Silvio Berlusconi. Talking about Chirac, Putin said, "I learned much from him."
articles.title: Putin names 3 deceased world leaders he would like to have tea with
articles.subtitle: Kohl was a figure of international scale: Putin

articles.content: The CAT 2024 result was declared on Thursday with 14 candidates scoring 100 percentile. Maharashtra has the highest number of candidates with 100 percentile score at five, followed by two candidates from Telangana. Andhra Pradesh, Delhi, Haryana, Kerala, Madhya Pradesh, Odisha and Uttar Pradesh have one candidate each with 100 percentile score.
articles.title: Which states have the highest number of CAT 2024 100 percentile scorers?
articles.subtitle: Thirteen 100 percentile scorers are male

articles.content: An aerial footage showing preparations in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj for the Maha Kumbh Mela has surfaced online. The video showed preparations at Sangam VIP Ghat. The mela will be held from January 13 to February 26 and include several ceremonies attracting crores of people. The mela will include traditional procession of Akharas and 'Shahi Snaan' among other activities.
articles.title: Aerial footage shows preparations for Maha Kumbh
articles.subtitle: To watch the video of the preparations

articles.content: A man in Bihar's Saharsa got his wife of 12 years married to her boyfriend after he found out about their love affair, with a video of the ceremony going viral on social media. As per reports, the woman has three children with her first husband. Her boyfriend has two kids, the reports added.
articles.title: Man gets his wife of 12 years married to her boyfriend in Bihar
articles.subtitle: To watch the video

articles.content: Advocate Deepak Somani stated that police from a different state cannot directly arrest you. He added that if police from another state come to arrest you based on FIR (First Information Report) filed in that state, they must first report their arrival to the local police station and make an entry in the station's diary to make a lawful arrest.
articles.title: Outstation police cannot directly arrest you: Advocate Somani
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Psychiatrist Dr Sarthak Dave explains that Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD) involves involuntary, intrusive thoughts, images or urges known as obsessions that cause significant distress as they often conflict with one’s moral values. To reduce this anxiety, individuals engage in repetitive actions or behaviors known as compulsions. This cycle of obsession and compulsion defines OCD.
articles.title: What is OCD or Obsessive Compulsive Disorder?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Tottenham manager Ange Postecoglou said that being a football manager is more difficult than being Prime Minister. When asked if management is more difficult than being Prime Minister, he said, "Oh yeah, how many times does [Prime Minister] have an election? I have one every weekend. We have an election every weekend and either get voted in or out."
articles.title: Being manager harder than being Prime Minister: Tottenham manager
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Jimmy Donaldson aka MrBeast's much-awaited game show 'Beast Games' is streaming now on Amazon Prime Video. MrBeast is one of the most popular YouTubers in the world with 337 million subscribers. The 10-episode series will feature 1,000 contestants competing in elaborate challenges, while living inside a complex, for $5,000,000 cash prize, the biggest payout in television history.
articles.title: 1,000 contestants, $5M prize: ‘Beast Games’ hits Amazon Prime Video
articles.subtitle: Watch now

articles.content: Karnataka BJP MLC CT Ravi was taken into custody for allegedly using derogatory word against minister Laxmi Hebbalkar in the Legislative Council, police said. After the minister filed the police complaint, the BJP leader refuted the allegation and termed it "false". "Ravi used a filthy word for minister and it amounts to a criminal offence," Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah said.
articles.title: K'taka BJP MLC allegedly makes derogatory remark against minister Laxmi; held
articles.subtitle: 'Let the audio and videos get verified'

articles.content: California has declared a state of emergency over the spread of bird flu, which is tearing through dairy cows in that state and causing sporadic illnesses in people in the US. Also known as Type A H5N1, avian influenza was detected for the first time in US dairy cattle earlier this year and since then has been confirmed in at least 866 herds in 16 states.
articles.title: California declares statewide emergency over bird flu
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The Indian Institute of Management, Calcutta announced the result of the Common Admission Test (CAT) 2024 on Thursday. As many as 2.93 lakh students appeared for the exam, of which 14 students, including 13 male students and one female student, scored 100 percentile. Thirteen of these students are engineers, the official release stated.
articles.title: CAT 2024 results declared; 14 students get 100 percentile
articles.subtitle: 29 students got 99.99 percentile

articles.content: 'Pushpa 2' director Sukumar visited the hospitalised eight-year-old boy who was critically injured in a stampede during the premiere of the Allu Arjun-starrer movie. The director and his wife also offered ₹5 lakh to the family as financial assistance. Earlier, the father of Allu Arjun and producer Aravind had also paid a visit to the hospitalised boy.
articles.title: Director Sukumar meets 'Pushpa 2' stampede victim, donates ₹5 lakh
articles.subtitle: The boy is currently on a ventilator in ICU

articles.content: Actor Arjun Kapoor, in 'Figuring Out With Raj Shamani' podcast, claimed people critical of him wanted him to fail in his life, adding that he was judged based on his surname and personal life. "The perception was that I didn’t like working, didn’t care about my work, wasn’t interested in improving, and didn’t deserve to be an actor," Arjun added.
articles.title: Was judged because of my surname, people wanted me to fail: Arjun
articles.subtitle: Arjun was recently seen in 'Singham Again'

articles.content: Indian Navy ordered a "Board of Inquiry" to investigate the collision of a passenger ferry and a Navy speedboat off the coast of Mumbai. This comes after the speedboat that was under engine trials at sea, lost control and hit the ferry carrying 110 people. At least 14 people were killed in the accident and over 75 people were rescued.
articles.title: Navy orders Board of Inquiry after ferry crash off Mumbai coast
articles.subtitle: Ferry was taking passengers to Elephanta Island

articles.content: Actress Ridhi Dogra revealed she was in tears after watching her movie 'The Sabarmati Report' in Parliament's Balayogi Auditorium on December 2. "[Co-actors] Vikrant Massey and Raashii Khanna, who were with me, asked if I was okay. I don’t know what happened, a lot of emotions were coming out because I’m a bit of an intense person," Dogra added.
articles.title: I was in tears: Ridhi on watching 'The Sabarmati..' in Parliament
articles.subtitle: PM Narendra Modi had attended film's screening

articles.content: Delhi HC has directed Union Bank of India to unfreeze bank account of a chhole bhature vendor, whose account was frozen after ₹105 was credited to it from an account connected with cyber fraud worth ₹71,000. The transaction was traced to a cyber fraud registered in Andhra Pradesh. Court directed that lien of ₹105 be marked while unfreezing the account.
articles.title: Eatery owner's account frozen after ₹105 credited from suspicious account, HC grants relief
articles.subtitle: The vendor called the hassle 'unjustified'

articles.content: After 'Laapataa Ladies' failed to make it to the Oscars 2025 shortlist, actor Sohum Shah said that the Oscar is not a parameter to tell how a film should be made. "It is not something to be so desperate and focused about. It’s an award function which has its own rhythm, they choose their own kind of films," Shah added.
articles.title: Oscar isn't a parameter: Sohum on 'Laapataa..' exiting Oscar race
articles.subtitle: 'Laapataa..' was India's official entry

articles.content: Actor-director Monty Nath revealed Raj Kapoor changed the ending of 'Bobby' after his father Prem Nath suggested that Rishi Kapoor and Dimple Kapadia's character shouldn't die in end. "My father suggested that don’t keep it as a sad ending. Let my character save Rishi and Pran save Dimple. They both swim into the water and save the kids," Monty added.
articles.title: Raj Kapoor changed 'Bobby' ending after my dad's suggestion: Monty
articles.subtitle: Raj Kapoor was the director of 'Bobby'

articles.content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday attended Christmas celebrations at Union Minister George Kurian's residence. "Attended the Christmas celebrations at the residence of Union Minister Shri George Kurian Ji. Also interacted with eminent members of the Christian community," PM Modi wrote. He also shared pictures from the celebrations.
articles.title: PM Modi shares pics after attending Christmas celebrations
articles.subtitle: A video of the celebrations has also surfaced

articles.content: After two BJP MPs Pratap Sarangi and Mukesh Rajput were hospitalised after LoP Rahul Gandhi allegedly pushed them during the scuffle, Union Minister Shivraj Chouhan said the Congress leader behaved like a goon. "Will physical power be used in the Parliament instead of logic," Chouhan added. BJP MP Phangnon Konyak also accused Rahul Gandhi of coming too close to her.
articles.title: Behaved like goon: Shivraj after Rahul allegedly pushed 2 BJP MPs
articles.subtitle: 'Speaker said she approached him while crying'

articles.content: Indian-American Congressman Shri Thanedar has sought targeted sanctions against Bangladesh over the sporadic violence against the minority communities in the country. "When we receive a global call for help, we must respond appropriately as the world's bellwether of human rights," he said. Earlier this month, Bangladesh confirmed 88 incidents of communal violence against minorities, mostly Hindus.
articles.title: US lawmaker seeks targeted sanctions against Bangladesh
articles.subtitle: 'Must urge Muhammad Yunus to restore peace'

articles.content: Delhi Police on Thursday registered FIR against Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi following a complaint by BJP, holding him responsible for injuring two BJP MPs during a clash in Parliament premises. "Police have only removed section 109 (attempt to murder) of BNS. All other sections are the same as given in the complaint," said Delhi Police.
articles.title: FIR against Rahul for allegedly injuring BJP MPs, 'attempt to murder' section removed
articles.subtitle: The injured BJP leaders are in the hospital

articles.content: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport in Mumbai reported impressive numbers in the last month. In November 2024, the airport witnessed an overall 4.77 million passenger traffic, including 3.40 million domestic and 1.37 million international travellers. Just like in previous months, it was successful in continuing its momentum and reporting exceptional growth in several aspects.
articles.title: Mumbai airport sees 4.77 million passengers in November
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: TikTok star Beandri Booysen has died at the age of 19 due to progeria, a rare genetic disease that causes children to age rapidly. "It is with deep sadness that we announce the passing of Beandri Booysen, one of South Africa's most beloved and inspirational young women," her mother Bea Booysen wrote.
articles.title: TikTok star Beandri Booysen dies aged 19 due to progeria
articles.subtitle: 'Beandri radiated hope and joy of life'

articles.content: Diljit Dosanjh has secured the top spot in the UK list of Top 50 Asian Celebrities in the World. As per Eastern Eye's list, which was released earlier this month, Diljit surpassed celebrities like Shah Rukh Khan and Allu Arjun. Diljit took to Instagram Story to share a post about it. It was accompanied by the song 'Born To Shine'.
articles.title: Diljit Dosanjh beats Shah Rukh Khan, Allu Arjun to become UK's 'Top Asian Celebrity'
articles.subtitle: He shared another story with the song 'Don'

articles.content: In a first for India, conservationists were successfully able to geotag a Ganges river dolphin in Assam on Wednesday. On December 18, a 40-member team of conservation experts along with trained fishermen and veterinarians successfully satellite-tagged a Ganges river dolphin in Assam. They caught a healthy male dolphin at the Kulsi, a tributary of the Brahmaputra.
articles.title: India geotags endangered Ganges river dolphin in Assam
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The Gujarat Metro Rail Corporation Limited (GMRC) has launched the Ahmedabad Metro app to make travel easier for all commuters. The user-friendly app is now available on the Google Play Store for Android users. This new app will make travel convenient for passengers as it aligns with the recent expansion of metro services in Ahmedabad and Gandhinagar.
articles.title: GMRC launches Ahmedabad Metro app for commuters' ease
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Many women in China are enlisting the services of bodyguards group, also known as "white mafia", to assist them in dealing with troublesome ex-boyfriends or dishonest landlords. They employ various methods similar to intimidation and persuasion to address issues such as domestic violence and bullying, according to reports. Initially they were providing security for celebrities and public figures.
articles.title: Women hiring 'white mafia' to deal with abusive ex-boyfriends, landlords in China
articles.subtitle: Their team also has retired military officers

articles.content: Members of BJP's Yuva Morcha vandalised the Congress' office in Mumbai's Azad Maidan on Thursday, alleging that Congress had insulted BR Ambedkar. The incident led to clashes between protesters and law enforcement officers, leading the police to resort to lathi-charge. Earlier today, a scuffle broke out in parliament over Congress protesting against Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks on Ambedkar.
articles.title: BJP workers vandalise Congress' Mumbai office amid Ambedkar row
articles.subtitle: Attack was planned: Congress MLC Bhai Jagtap

articles.content: Rahul Gandhi wore blue T-shirt to Parliament to express support for BR Ambedkar, an advocate of Dalit community. Dalit activist SR Darapuri said besides being Ambedkar's favourite colour, blue was also the colour of flag of the party floated by Ambedkar, All India Scheduled Castes Federation in 1942. Political parties like BSP also embraced blue as part of its branding.
articles.title: Why is blue colour associated with Dalit identity?
articles.subtitle: Opp'n protested over 'Ambedkar fashion' remark

articles.content: Congress MP Hibi Eden wrote to Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla and refuted BJP MP Phangnon Konyak's claim that LoP Rahul Gandhi came very close to her and made her uncomfortable during protest in Parliament. Eden termed her allegation "entirely fabricated and devoid of facts", adding that the claim was a malicious attempt to belittle the integrity of LoP.
articles.title: BJP woman MP's claims fabricated, devoid of facts: Congress' Eden
articles.subtitle: Rahul also accused of pushing 2 BJP MPs

articles.content: In an interview with RT, Russian President Vladimir Putin commented on if the country should introduce a blanket ban on adult content. "They watch adult content everywhere in the world...This problem exists everywhere," he said. Putin further said that the only real remedy is offering alternatives to adult content, adding there should be "something more interesting".
articles.title: Putin calls for alternatives to adult content, says ‘Need something more interesting’
articles.subtitle: 'A person should say I want something else'

articles.content: India on Thursday recorded their highest total in women's T20I cricket history. India put up a total of 217/4 against West Indies in the third T20I at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai to set the record. Smriti Mandhana top-scored for India with 77 runs off 47 deliveries, while Richa Ghosh scored 54 runs off 21 deliveries.
articles.title: India record their highest total in women's T20I cricket history
articles.subtitle: To view the match scorecard

articles.content: A Shanghai court has ruled that a man, surnamed Li, is not obligated to return the 300,000 yuan (approximately ₹35 lakh) his ex-girlfriend, Xu, transferred to him in an effort to save their relationship. The decision comes after Xu, who had cheated on Li multiple times—including with his nephew—claimed the money was a conditional gift meant for their eventual marriage.
articles.title: Chinese man wins legal battle to keep ₹35 lakh after ex-girlfriend cheats with his nephew
articles.subtitle: Li and Xu began dating in 2018

articles.content: The Supreme Court stayed restrictions imposed by Kerala High Court on use of elephants in temple festivals, calling them "impractical". The apex court stated that the rules exceeded judicial authority. The HC had mandated for minimum 3-metre gap between two elephants, an 8-metre distance between elephants and the public, and a 100 metre buffer from areas where fireworks are used.
articles.title: SC stays Kerala HC's restrictions on elephants in temple festivals
articles.subtitle: To know more

articles.content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis, while addressing the state assembly on Thursday, said that deputy CM Ajit Pawar would also occupy chief ministerial post "someday", PTI reported. "You are called 'permanent deputy CM'...but my wishes are with you," Fadnavis told Pawar. Pawar took oath as Maharashtra deputy CM for the sixth time on December 5, along with deputy CM Eknath Shinde.
articles.title: You will be CM one day: Maharashtra CM Fadnavis tells Ajit Pawar
articles.subtitle: Pawar and Shinde work in 24/7 shifts: Fadnavis

articles.content: In alignment with the Act East Policy, India has resumed operations at its embassy in North Korea's Pyongyang, a report in The Tribune has claimed. The report added that the reopening comes after nearly three and a half years and a team of technical and diplomatic staff have reached North Korea.
articles.title: India reopening its embassy in North Korea's Pyongyang: Report
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: After Ravichandran Ashwin's father Ravichandran told a news channel that Ashwin was being humiliated for a long time and that could have been the reason behind his retirement, Ashwin tweeted, "My dad isn't media trained." Ashwin further wrote, "Request you all to forgive him and leave him alone." Ashwin retired from international cricket mid-Border Gavaskar Trophy on Wednesday.
articles.title: Request you to forgive & leave him alone: Ashwin on father's remark on his retirement
articles.subtitle: He said he made decision on Day 4 of Gabba Test
