articles.content: A man shared a video to call out fellow Indians' unruly behaviour on a flight to Thailand. The video showed men standing in groups inside the flight, which was air bound, to gossip and eat food. "Indians love to insult themselves everywhere. They've turned the flight into a train or bus. They're standing and travelling," he said in video.
articles.title: Man shows fellow Indians' behaviour on flight to Thailand, says 'They converted plane to train'
articles.subtitle: To watch the video of the passengers in flight

articles.content: During his end-of-year news conference on Thursday, Russian President Vladimir Putin said that his country needed long-lasting peace with Ukraine and not a temporary truce. He further said that a ceasefire would allow "the enemy to strengthen its troops" and give Ukraine a chance to bring in reinforcements and ammunition.
articles.title: Need long-lasting peace with Ukraine: Putin
articles.subtitle: 'Ready to compromise with Trump on Ukraine war'

articles.content: Amid rumours of trouble in Aishwarya Rai and Abhishek Bachchan's wedding, the actress was seen attending daughter Aaradhya's school function with Abhishek and father-in-law Amitabh Bachchan. Aishwarya was seen arriving at the event and then escorting Amitabh inside Dhirubhai Ambani International School. "Now this rests all the rumours once for all," a social media user reacted.
articles.title: Aishwarya Rai attends Aaradhya's school event with Abhishek & Amitabh amid divorce rumours
articles.subtitle: To watch the video of the family

articles.content: If the US Congress fails to prevent a government shutdown, government services would be disrupted and hundreds of thousands of federal workers would be told not to work, however, workers deemed essential would remain on the job. All federal employees' pay could be disrupted during a shutdown. National parks, monuments and other sites would be closed to the public.
articles.title: What will happen in a US government shutdown?
articles.subtitle: Some airports may have to suspend operations

articles.content: A school in Bengaluru reportedly locked students over non-payment of fees. Parents have condemned the treatment, stating it could negatively affect academic performances of their wards. The allegations have led to complaints being filed with Education Department and Child Safety & Protection Department. The school reportedly warned students of severe consequences if they file formal complaints.
articles.title: Bengaluru school accused of locking students in dark room over unpaid fees
articles.subtitle: Incident also reported at other schools: Report

articles.content: Former Team India captain Kapil Dev has said that Ravichandran Ashwin, who retired from international cricket on Wednesday, deserved a fitting farewell. "I wish I had been there...I wouldn't have let him go like that. I would have sent him with a lot of respect and happiness," he added. "Ashwin looked unhappy, and that was sad," Kapil Dev further said.
articles.title: I would have sent him with a lot of respect and happiness: Kapil Dev on R Ashwin
articles.subtitle: Ashwin returned to India from Australia on Thurs

articles.content: In a French league match, Monaco defender Wilfried Singo apologised for the risky challenge that caused several wounds and facial injuries to PSG goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma. "My gesture was obviously not intentional, but I was able to see afterwards that he had a significant injury to his face. I wish you a good recovery," he posted on Instagram story.
articles.title: Wilfried Singo expresses regret for his foul on Gigi Donnarumma
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: BJP MP Phangnon Konyak, who said Congress leader Rahul Gandhi had made her feel uncomfortable after alleging that he came very close to her while she was protesting in parliament, is Nagaland's first female Rajya Sabha MP. Konyak studied English Literature at Daulat Ram College, University of Delhi. Konyak serves on several committees, including Committee on Transport, Tourism and Culture.
articles.title: Who is BJP MP Konyak, who said Rahul made her uncomfortable?
articles.subtitle: Rahul hurt my dignity and self esteem: Konyak

articles.content: Afghanistan beat Zimbabwe by 232 runs and registered their biggest ODI win by runs on December 19 against Zimbabwe in Harare. Before this win, Afghanistan's biggest ODI win was by 177 runs, which came against South Africa in Sharjah in September 2024. Zimbabwe were bowled out for 54 chasing 287 to win.
articles.title: Afghanistan beat Zimbabwe to register their biggest ODI win
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: North Korea’s 11th Army Corps reportedly suffered approximately 200 casualties in recent assaults on Ukrainian positions in Russia’s Kursk Oblast, according to Andriy Kovalenko, head of Kyiv’s Center for Countering Disinformation. This development underscores the evolving role of drone warfare and highlights vulnerabilities in traditional infantry tactics against modern technologies.
articles.title: Korean losses in Ukraine highlighted by festive drone strikes
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: An alleged explosion occurred outside Bakshiwal police station in Punjab's Gurdaspur on Wednesday, prompting police to launch probe. The police station had reportedly remained shut for the last two weeks. Notably, a blast-like noise was reported at Islamabad police station in Amritsar on Tuesday, while a hand grenade was also lobbed at a police post in Nawanshahr earlier this month.
articles.title: 'Blast' outside police station in Punjab's Gurdaspur; probe launched
articles.subtitle: Forensic experts reached spot to probe incident

articles.content: The Everett Leader Herald, a Massachusetts newspaper with a 139-year legacy, has shut down after settling a defamation lawsuit for $1.1 million. The paper was accused of publishing fabricated stories against Everett Mayor Carlo DeMaria. The settlement highlights concerns over journalistic integrity, the erosion of trust in local media, and the impact on community accountability.
articles.title: 139-year-old Massachusetts newspaper closes after defamation case
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Actor Amitabh Bachchan, in a Kaun Banega Crorepati 16 episode, revealed he wore his own clothes during shooting of 'Kabhi Kabhie' movie. "I asked Yash Chopra about what I would wear for...film. His response was, ‘Wear your own clothes. They’ll look good.’ And that’s exactly what I did," Bachchan added. Shashi Kapoor and Rakhee Gulzar also starred in the movie.
articles.title: I wore my clothes during the shooting of 'Kabhi Kabhie': Amitabh
articles.subtitle: 'Kabhi Kabhie' was released in February 1976

articles.content: Binance Co-founder Changpeng Zhao responded after 5ireChain posted a picture of him with their CEO Pratik Gauri and wrote, "What's cooking?" "This is exactly how not to use a selfie with me. Nothing is cooking. Didn't even have a chat. Just a selfie," Zhao wrote. "Note: This post is not intended to imply any collaboration," 5ireChain later clarified.
articles.title: How not to use a selfie with me: Binance Co-founder on Indian CEO's pic with him
articles.subtitle: It is purely an appreciation post: 5ireChain

articles.content: Veteran actor Govind Namdev quashed rumours of his relationship with 31-year-old actress Shivangi Verma. The speculation began after Shivangi shared a picture with the 70-year-old actor on Instagram, and captioned it, "Pyaar knows no age, no limits." However, Govind has clarified that the photo was related to their upcoming film, in which they portray characters who are romantically involved.
articles.title: 70-yr-old Govind Namdev refutes rumours of dating 31-year-old actress Shivangi Verma
articles.subtitle: 'This is not real-life love, it's reel'

articles.content: Ghaziabad Police have arrested a 38-year-old MBA graduate, Faraz Athar Ali, from Noida for allegedly abetting a woman's suicide and forcing her to convert to his religion in order to marry her. Police also said he allegedly made the woman undergo abortion. "We've recovered various religious...books that were given to the woman to learn ways of his religion," police said.
articles.title: Noida MBA graduate forces woman to convert, arrested after she dies by suicide
articles.subtitle: He was flouting anti-conversion rules: Police

articles.content: US President-elect Donald Trump could issue an executive order to redefine Birthright Citizenship, which grants citizenship to anyone born in US. While Trump could direct agencies to withhold passports/other documents unless the person met new requirement, they could challenge it legally. If courts decided the Constitution protected Birthright Citizenship, then only an amendment could change that.
articles.title: Can President-elect Donald Trump end US' Birthright Citizenship?
articles.subtitle: Trump has vowed to end Birthright Citizenship

articles.content: Ahead of the second ODI of the three-match series against Pakistan, the CSA announced that Keshav Maharaj has been ruled out of the contest due to a left adductor strain. Furthermore, the left-arm off spin bowler won’t be playing the final ODI of the series either, and he is scheduled to head home to rehabilitate from the injury.
articles.title: Keshav Maharaj ruled out of SA’s final two ODIs against PAK
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: After BJP MP Phangnon Konyak accused LoP Rahul Gandhi of making her feel uncomfortable by coming very close to her during protest in Parliament, Asom Gana Parishad (AGP) MP Birendra Baishya said it's an assault on Northeastern people. "The incident which happened...is an insult to democracy and...elected member of Parliament," Baishya added. Konyak is a Rajya Sabha MP from Nagaland.
articles.title: Assault on Northeast: AGP on woman BJP MP's 'Rahul came too close' claim
articles.subtitle: 'Rahul came close to me, felt uncomfortable'

articles.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said that his country is ready to compromise with US President-elect Donald Trump on Ukraine war. Putin also said that he had no conditions for starting talks with the Ukrainian authorities. Trump has vowed to swiftly end the conflict, but hasn't given any details on how he might achieve that.
articles.title: Ready to compromise with Trump on Ukraine war: Putin
articles.subtitle: Russia not in a weak position: Putin

articles.content: Commenting on health condition of injured BJP MPs Pratap Sarangi and Mukesh Rajput, RML Hospital's MS Dr Ajay Shukla said the two suffered head injuries and they've been given medication. "Rajput ji's blood pressure is still high...Sarangi ji's an elderly person..[he has also been] a cardiac patient," the doctor said. Both MPs alleged Congress leader Rahul Gandhi had pushed them.
articles.title: BJP MPs Sarangi, Rajput have head injuries, given medicine: Doctor
articles.subtitle: We are doing our best: Doctor

articles.content: A 29-year-old newly married man from Maharashtra's Thane district suffered injuries after his father-in-law flung acid at him following a dispute over his honeymoon destination, an official said. The son-in-law, Ibad Atik Falke, is admitted to a hospital. According to the FIR, Falke wanted to visit Kashmir, but his father-in-law wanted the couple to travel to Mecca and Medina.
articles.title: Man throws acid at son-in-law in Maharashtra after dispute over honeymoon destination
articles.subtitle: Accused Jaki Gulam Murtaza Khotal is on the run

articles.content: Lok Sabha Leader of Opposition and Congress' Rahul Gandhi claimed BJP MPs were armed with sticks and didn't let Congress MPs and other Opposition leaders enter Parliament. This comes after a scuffle occurred as I.N.D.I.A bloc leaders and BJP MPs staged protests in Parliament after Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks on BR Ambedkar. Two BJP MPs sustained injuries during scuffle.
articles.title: BJP MPs armed with sticks, didn't let us enter Parliament: Rahul
articles.subtitle: Rahul allegedly pushed BJP MPs during scuffle

articles.content: Reacting to the scuffle that broke out in Parliament, Congress MP Pramod Tiwari said the BJP was present in Parliament in the form of terrorists and stopped the Opposition MPs from going to Parliament. "During pushing, [Congress President] Mallikarjun Kharge fell and received an injury to his knee. It was similar to...terrorist attack on Parliament [in 2001]," Tiwari added.
articles.title: BJP was present in form of terrorists in Parliament: Congress MP on scuffle
articles.subtitle: Two BJP MPs were hospitalised after scuffle

articles.content: A group of activists demanding justice for Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash chased Congress MP Rahul Gandhi's cavalcade in Delhi to draw his attention to the issue. The activists said that his entourage shouted at them before the MP agreed to talk to them while their vehicles were moving. Rahul heard them and responded by throwing a chocolate.
articles.title: Activists seeking justice for Atul Subhash chase Rahul's car; MP listens & throws chocolate
articles.subtitle: 'Just google to know about his case'

articles.content: An investigation was ordered after a man was caught performing 'black magic' over a patient in ICU at Gujarat's biggest public sector hospital in Ahmedabad. Mukesh Bhuvaji claimed in a now-viral video that doctors were unable to treat the patient but his rituals cured him. Gujarat Health Minister Rushikesh Patel said measures will be taken to prevent such incidents.
articles.title: Man seen performing 'black magic' in Ahmedabad hospital ICU, probe ordered
articles.subtitle: 'Important to prevent spread of blind faith'

articles.content: Actor Ram Kapoor shared pictures of his weight loss on Instagram and wrote, "Hi guys, sorry for the slightly long absence from Insta was working on myself quite extensively." Reacting to the pictures, social media users wrote, "What a drastic change," "Wow the change is phenomenal," and "How did u do it?"
articles.title: Actor Ram Kapoor shares pics after weight loss
articles.subtitle: 'Amazing transformation'

articles.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin said whatever is happening in Syria isn't a "defeat for Russia". Putin, who granted asylum to ex-Syrian President Bashar al-Assad, also said he hasn't met Assad yet but will do so. Putin's comments came as Syria's transitional government said there's no place for Russian presence in Syria, adding that it should reconsider its troops in country.
articles.title: What's happening in Syria is not a defeat for Russia: Putin
articles.subtitle: Russia has 2 military bases in Syria

articles.content: The Indian cricket team departed from Brisbane to Melbourne on December 19, ahead of the fourth Test of the 2024-25 Border-Gavaskar Trophy (BGT). A video shared by Star Sports showed the team at the airport, featuring captain Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul, Akash Deep, Mohammed Siraj, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Sarfaraz Khan, and head coach Gautam Gambhir, alongside other players and support staff.
articles.title: Team India seen leaving Brisbane following 3rd BGT Test draw
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: During a press conference, Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge alleged that BJP MPs pushed him to the ground outside parliament, following which he lost his balance, while protesting against Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks on BR Ambedkar. "I was pushed, and then we were accused of attacking them. I won't stand for...lies," he said. Kharge reportedly suffered injuries to his knee.
articles.title: BJP MPs pushed me to the ground, I lost my balance: Kharge
articles.subtitle: Congress filed police complaint against BJP MPs

articles.content: Team India captain Rohit Sharma cheekily predicted that Ravichandran Ashwin might join the cricket broadcast team in the next couple of years. After the off-spinner exited the press conference, Rohit was asked about the team missing the talismanic cricketer. In his trademark style, Rohit replied, "Ashwin, I am sure, aap logon ke saath hi rahega woh ek do saal mein."
articles.title: Rohit Sharma hints at Ashwin’s career after his retirement
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Allu Arjun revealed that he runs for 45 minutes to one hour on an empty stomach. "Exercising during fasting increases lipolysis (breakdown of fats) in adipose tissue while stimulating peripheral fat oxidation, resulting in increased fat utilisation and weight loss," said  Dr Sudhir Kumar, Apollo Hospitals, Hyderabad. Glycaemic status improves when running in a fasted state," Kumar added.
articles.title: What are the benefits of running on an empty stomach?
articles.subtitle: It can also reduce LDL cholesterol levels

articles.content: Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Priyanka Chaturvedi reacted to the parliament scuffle and alleged that BJP had tried to create a "face-off" during Congress' protests over Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks on BR Ambedkar. "There was no confrontation...we have only one question, when will...Shah apologise [and] resign?" she said. Two MPs alleged receiving injuries after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi pushed them.
articles.title: BJP tried to create face-off during Ambedkar protests: Chaturvedi
articles.subtitle: To know what else she said

articles.content: India and Pakistan won't visit each other for ICC tournaments till 2028, Jay Shah-led ICC announced on Thursday. India and Pakistan's matches in events to be hosted in India or Pakistan till 2028 will be played at neutral venue proposed by the tournament host, ICC added. The ICC further said that it will announce schedule for Champions Trophy 2025 soon.
articles.title: India and Pakistan will not visit each other for ICC tournaments till 2028, announces ICC
articles.subtitle: PCB gets hosting rights of Women's T20 WC 2028

articles.content: Supreme Court ruled in a 15-year-old dispute that coconut oil in small packages can be classified as edible oil and will be taxed at lower rate. If coconut oil is packaged in small bottles and labelled for use on hair, it should be classified as hair oil, SC added. Cooking oil attracts 5% GST, while hair oil attracts 18% GST.
articles.title: Supreme Court classifies small packages of coconut oil as edible
articles.subtitle: To read more

articles.content: Amit Bhatia from ABP gave three stars to 'Mufasa: The Lion King', the prequel to 'The Lion King'. The review noted that Shah Rukh Khan, his sons Aryan and AbRam, who voiced Mufasa, Simba and young Mufasa, brought life to the film. "It's crafted in an engaging way, with stunning visuals and excellent voiceovers that give it...'desi' feel," it added.
articles.title: SRK, Aryan & AbRam Khan bring 'Mufasa: The Lion King' to life: ABP
articles.subtitle: 'The film is a great choice for a family outing'

articles.content: A video showed PM Narendra Modi's phone call to BJP MP Mukesh Rajput, who was admitted to ICU after he alleged that he was pushed by Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi during protest in the Parliament premises. "Poori care karna. Jaldi bilkul matt karna (Take proper care and don't rush the treatment)," PM Modi could be heard telling the MP.
articles.title: Video shows PM Modi's phone call to BJP MP in ICU after Rahul allegedly pushed him
articles.subtitle: To watch the video of the interaction

articles.content: A Google Street View image helped Spanish Police discover dismembered body of a man who disappeared in November 2023. The image, taken in October 2024, caught the suspect, who has now been arrested, loading a body-shaped package into a car's boot. The body was found buried in a cemetery, which was a 12-minute drive from where the image was taken.
articles.title: Murder suspect caught on Google Maps while loading body into car in Spain, arrested
articles.subtitle: Victim's wife & her boyfriend have been arrested

articles.content: US is facing a government shutdown after Republican President-elect Donald Trump rejected a bipartisan deal on Wednesday. Trump pressured his fellow Republicans in Congress to reject a stopgap bill to keep the government funded past the deadline of midnight on Friday. US government will begin a partial shutdown on Saturday that would disrupt everything from air travel to law enforcement.
articles.title: US faces government shutdown
articles.subtitle: US Congress has two days to avert it

articles.content: A groom sought help from police after the bride demanded beer and marijuana during 'muh dikhai' after their marriage in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur. The groom had reportedly agreed to bring her a beer, however he informed his family members after she asked for marijuana. The two parties were counselled at the police station.
articles.title: Bride demands beer, marijuana during 'muh dikhai' in UP; groom reaches police station
articles.subtitle: Both sides refused to file a complaint

articles.content: Supreme Court has criticised Punjab government for not conducting medical tests of farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, who has been on an indefinite fast at Punjab-Haryana border since November 26. "Persuade Dallewal to take treatment for a week at least and others can continue with the protest," the SC told Punjab government.
articles.title: Persuade Dallewal to take treatment for a week: SC to Punjab govt
articles.subtitle: Court will talk to Dallewal once he is safe: SC

articles.content: Real Madrid defeated Mexican team Pachuca 3-0 in the Intercontinental Cup final on Wednesday. This was the club's fourth Intercontinental Cup title, with their previous wins coming in 1960, 1998 and 2002. The victory marked manager Carlo Ancelotti's 15th title with the club, surpassing the 14 trophies won by Miguel Munoz. Kylian Mbappe and Vinicius Jr scored for Real Madrid.
articles.title: Real Madrid clinch Intercontinental Cup title for the 4th time
articles.subtitle: Rodrygo also scored for Madrid

articles.content: A delegation of Congress MPs, including women MPs, filed a police complaint over alleged misbehaviour towards party chief Mallikarjun Kharge in parliament on Thursday. Kharge wrote to Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, alleging that he suffered injuries to his knee as BJP MPs pushed him inside the parliament. Separately, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was accused of pushing two BJP MPs.
articles.title: Congress files police complaint over 'misbehaviour' with Kharge
articles.subtitle: To know more

articles.content: Authorities have made life jackets mandatory for all people taking boat rides from the Gateway of India. The order came a day after a collision between a ferry and a Navy vessel off the Mumbai coast claimed the lives of 13 people on Wednesday. The accident took place when the speedboat lost control and hit a ferry carrying 110 people.
articles.title: Life jackets mandatory for ferry rides from Gateway of India
articles.subtitle: A case filed against driver of Navy speedboat

articles.content: A UP man who visited a police station in Jhansi allegedly to seek justice got repeatedly slapped by the Station House Officer (SHO). The SHO reportedly slapped him 31 times in 41 seconds. After the video of the incident surfaced, action was taken against him. He was suspended for slapping the man who came to the station seeking justice.
articles.title: Man visiting police station in UP slapped by SHO 31 times in 41 seconds, SHO suspended
articles.subtitle: Footage was reportedly filmed by the man himself

articles.content: Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge criticized Union Home Minister Amit Shah, calling him incompetent over remarks on BR Ambedkar. He accused Shah of arrogance and promoting Manusmriti ideology. Congress MPs, led by Mallikarjun Kharge, demanded action, filing a privilege motion and holding protests in Parliament.
articles.title: Priyank Kharge calls Amit Shah 'incompetent' over Ambedkar remarks
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Dot plot is a graph that indicates how many times a particular value occurs, using dots. US Federal Reserve's dot plot indicates what the 19 members of Federal Open Market Committee believe should be the appropriate interest rate over various periods. Latest chart indicated 12 out of the 19 officials believe rates should be cut at least once next year.
articles.title: What is the US Fed dot plot?
articles.subtitle: 5 members believe in more than two rate cuts

articles.content: BJP has filed a police complaint against Congress MP and Lok Sabha LoP Rahul Gandhi, for allegedly causing injuries to BJP MPs during a scuffle in Parliament on Thursday. The complaint has been filed under assault and incitement, attempt to murder and other charges. BJP MPs Pratap Sarangi and Mukesh Rajput were hospitalised with injuries, as Rahul allegedly pushed them.
articles.title: Attempt to murder complaint filed against Rahul for allegedly injuring BJP MPs
articles.subtitle: Anurag Thakur, Bansuri Swaraj filed a complaint

articles.content: After announcing his retirement from international cricket, all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin said Ashwin the "Indian cricketer has probably called it time" but Ashwin the cricketer is not done. "I'm going to play for CSK. Don’t be surprised if I try and aspire to play for as long as I can," Ashwin added. He announced retirement after India's Gabba Test against Australia.
articles.title: Ashwin the cricketer is not done, I'm aspiring to play for CSK as long as possible: Ashwin
articles.subtitle: CSK bought Ashwin for ₹9.75 cr during auction

articles.content: Among Team India support staff and squad members in Australia, only Rohit Sharma and Gautam Gambhir knew that Ravichandran Ashwin would retire after the Gabba Test, as per a report by The Indian Express. "The decision came as a shock for the rest," the report added. The report added that Ashwin had been contemplating retirement for a long time.
articles.title: Rohit, Gambhir were the only ones to know Ashwin would retire; all others were shocked: Report
articles.subtitle: Ashwin took 765 wickets in international cricket

articles.content: The much-awaited sequel to De De Pyaar De, titled De De Pyaar De 2, is set to hit theatres on November 14, 2025. Starring Ajay Devgn, Rakul Preet Singh, and R Madhavan, the romantic comedy will showcase a blend of humor, romance, and family drama. Directed by Anshul Sharma, the film is shot across locations in Punjab, Mumbai, and London.
articles.title: 'De De Pyaar De 2' to release in November 2025 with Ajay & Rakul
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Overthinking feels like a maze of endless thoughts, fueling worry and doubt. Pause, reflect, and consider other perspectives. Psychiatrist Dr Sarthak Dave says, writing down or sharing thoughts can bring clarity and shift focus toward hope. Acceptance and reflection help restore control.
articles.title: What is overthinking? How to deal with it?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: AAP's Arvind Kejriwal questioned BJP allies- Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu and Bihar CM Nitish Kumar over their stand on Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks on BR Ambedkar. "People...want to ask 'Do you support the insult of BR Ambedkar done by Amit Shah?'" Kejriwal said in a letter. "People expect you to deeply reflect on this issue," he added.
articles.title: Do you support Ambedkar's insult: AAP to BJP allies Naidu & Nitish
articles.subtitle: 'Babasaheb is the soul of our nation'

articles.content: Talking about Australia declaring and setting a target of 275 runs in 54 overs against India on Day 5 of third Test in Brisbane, ex-Australia cricketer Mitchell Johnson said all three results were possible. "Anything could have happened," he stated. Bad light and rain forced play to be abandoned after 2.1 overs in fourth innings.
articles.title: All 3 results were possible: Johnson on Aus' declaration on Day 5
articles.subtitle: The series is levelled at 1-1

articles.content: Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has rejected allegations against Rahul Gandhi, who has been accused of pushing two BJP MPs outside the Parliament. "Now, only to save Union Home Minister Amit Shah ji, they have started this conspiracy that Bhaiya (Rahul Gandhi) pushed someone," Priyanka said. The two BJP MPs have sustained injuries and were hospitalised following the incident.
articles.title: To save Shah: Priyanka on BJP's claim that Rahul 'pushed' 2 MPs
articles.subtitle: BJP has demanded Rahul Gandhi's apology

articles.content: A video showing a woman slapping a drunk man at least 25 times for harassing her on a bus in Pune has surfaced on social media. The man was later handed over to police. Reacting to the video, social media users wrote, "He should have been slapped at least 100 times," and "He should have been beaten with a slipper."
articles.title: Woman slaps drunk man 25 times for harassing her on bus in Pune
articles.subtitle: To watch the video

articles.content: Actress-politician Kangana Ranaut lashed out at Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for allegedly 'attacking' BJP MPs in the Parliament. Calling him a 'disgrace', Kangana said, "He comes like a gym trainer to the Parliament flexing biceps and now he started to push and punch people as well. This is shameful." Kangana added that an MP also received stitches amid the scuffle.
articles.title: 'Gym trainer' Rahul Gandhi is a disgrace: Kangana Ranaut
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Markets plummeted for the fourth consecutive session on Thursday, falling more than 3% over the week so far and erasing over ₹10.5 lakh crore investor wealth. On Thursday, Sensex ended at 79,218 (-964), while Nifty ended at 23,951 (-247). Markets fell as US Fed cut interest rates by 25 bps and hinted at just two more rate cuts next year.
articles.title: Investors lose ₹10.5 lakh crore in 4 days as markets fall
articles.subtitle: Gold prices tumbled 2% in trade as well

articles.content: All-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin's father Ravichandran had booked flight tickets to watch the Boxing Day and New Year Tests in Australia, expecting his son to finish the series, The Indian Express reported. Ashwin phoned his father to inform them that December 18 would be his last day as an international cricketer. Ashwin retired mid-series, following the conclusion of the Gabba Test.
articles.title: Ashwin's father had booked flight tickets to watch Boxing Day and New Year Tests: Report
articles.subtitle: Ashwin took 765 wickets in international cricket

articles.content: SpaceX lawyers advised executives not to seek higher security clearance for Elon Musk, fearing he'd have to answer government's questions about drug use, The Wall Street Journal reported. His current clearance was reportedly obtained after years due to his use of marijuana and ketamine. Musk isn't allowed to enter most SpaceX facilities where classified work is done, the report said.
articles.title: Musk not allowed to enter some SpaceX facilities due to his drug use: Report
articles.subtitle: Musk smoked marijuana during a 2018 podcast

articles.content: Priyanka Gandhi criticized BJP MPs in Parliament, urging them to chant Jai Bhim and accused them of not protecting the Constitution. She defended Rahul Gandhi, alleging BJP MPs blocked him while holding Ambedkar's photo. Protests escalated with allegations of injuries and conspiracy to shield Amit Shah, intensifying tensions.
articles.title: Priyanka Gandhi challenges BJP with 'Jai Bhim' in Parliament
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Actress and BJP MP Kangana Ranaut reacted to the parliament scuffle as two party MPs Pratap Sarangi and Mukesh Rajput were admitted to ICU after sustaining injuries, and alleged that Congress' "violence" had reached the parliament. "This is shameful. One of our MPs has received stitches," she said. Sarangi and Rajput alleged they were pushed by Congress leader Rahul Gandhi.
articles.title: Congress' violence has reached parliament: Kangana as BJP MPs hurt
articles.subtitle: Congress' lies have been always busted: Kangana

articles.content: Actor Sebastian Stan, who is playing Donald Trump in 'The Apprentice', said director Ali Abbasi was originally "going to cast a woman to play Trump". "And I'm looking at him, 'Why are you telling me two weeks before [shoot] I'm gonna die!'" he recalled. Stan added he consumed a lot of ramen and Coca Cola to gain weight for role.
articles.title: The Apprentice maker was going to cast a woman to play Trump: Stan
articles.subtitle: 'I was having panic attacks every night'

articles.content: Goa CM Pramod Sawant emphasized the importance of eco-friendly tourism on Goa Liberation Day. He highlighted efforts to preserve Goa's natural heritage through sustainable tourism practices. With initiatives like Swayampurna Goa and a focus on environmental conservation, the state aims to balance tourism growth while safeguarding its rich ecological and cultural legacy for future generations.
articles.title: CM Pramod Sawant observes Goa Liberation Day
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Talking about classical chess (slow chess), five-time world chess champion Magnus Carlsen said it is the "worst way" to measure the best player overall. "Classical chess is too forgiving. It's too easy to mask the deficiencies in your game," he stated. Notably, the 14-game World Chess Championship between Ding Liren and Gukesh D was held in classical chess format.
articles.title: Classical chess too forgiving, easy to mask deficiencies: Carlsen
articles.subtitle: Gukesh won the championship

articles.content: The no-confidence motion of the Opposition against Vice President and Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar has been rejected. Deputy Chairman Harivansh dismissed the motion citing several reasons. Some of the reasons were that a 14-day notice was not given before moving the resolution and Dhankhar's name was not spelt correctly.
articles.title: No-confidence motion against Rajya Sabha Chairman rejected over wrong spelling
articles.subtitle: The motion was moved by Oppn MPs

articles.content: A French court has convicted Dominique Pelicot, 72, of drugging his then-wife for nearly a decade, as well as inviting at least 80 strangers to rape her for over 10 years while she was unconscious. He has been sentenced to 20 years in prison. The court also convicted all other 50 defendants in the mass rape trial, with no acquittals.
articles.title: Husband found guilty of drugging, inviting 80 strangers to rape wife in France
articles.subtitle: Dominique had pleaded guilty to the charges

articles.content: Holiday spots like Thailand, Vietnam, London, Bali and Abu Dhabi are recording 80-174% year-on-year growth in flight bookings by Indians for Christmas & New Year celebrations, Moneycontrol reported. Abu Dhabi, Phuket, Bangkok have seen highest increase in flight bookings, ixigo data showed. Azerbaijan & Malaysia have witnessed 248% and 100% growth in searches, respectively, showed MakeMyTrip data.
articles.title: Which foreign destinations are Indians travelling to for Christmas, New Year?
articles.subtitle: Canada, Maldives see drop in bookings by Indians

articles.content: Israel responded with a picture of Mahsa Amini, who died in 2022 in custody of Iran's morality police, after Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei posted, "A woman is a delicate flower...A flower needs to be cared for." The death of Amini, who was taken into custody for allegedly flouting Iran's Islamic dress code, had unleashed months of protests.
articles.title: 'A woman is a delicate flower,' says Iran's Supreme Leader Khamenei; Israel responds
articles.subtitle: Woman is responsible for childbearing: Khamenei

articles.content: Pratap Chandra Sarangi, who alleged that he sustained injuries following an altercation involving Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, is a BJP MP representing Odisha's Balasore constituency. Born in January 1955 in Gopinathpur village, Sarangi earned a Bachelor of Arts degree in 1975. He began his political journey as a volunteer for RSS. He served two terms as an MLA from Nilgiri.
articles.title: Who is Pratap Sarangi, BJP MP who accused Rahul of injuring him?
articles.subtitle: He also worked in VHP and Bajrang Dal

articles.content: At least 100 North Koreans deployed to fight for Russia against Ukraine in war have been killed since entering combat in December, South Korean lawmaker Lee Seong-kweun stated. "The National Intelligence Service also reported that the number of injured is expected to reach nearly 1,000," Lee added. Approximately, 10,000 North Korean troops were recruited by Russia to fight in Ukraine.
articles.title: 100 North Korean troops killed while fighting in Ukraine: S Korea
articles.subtitle: 'Russia burning faces of dead N Korean troops'

articles.content: 'Baby John' producer Atlee said there is no clash happening between the Varun Dhawan-starrer and Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa 2'. "We're releasing Baby John in the fourth week of December, not head-to-head...We're all professionals, and we know how to handle this," said Atlee. Calling Allu Arjun a "good friend", Atlee said the actor congratulated him and spoke to Varun as well.
articles.title: There is no clash with 'Pushpa 2': 'Baby John' producer Atlee
articles.subtitle: 'We’re aware Pushpa 2 shifted from Aug to Dec'

articles.content: Congress MPs have written to Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, alleging that Rahul Gandhi was physically manhandled by three MPs of the ruling party on Thursday. "This is a clear violation of the privileges extended to the Leader of the Opposition and infringes on the rights accorded to him in his official capacity as an MP," they said.
articles.title: Rahul physically manhandled by 3 MPs of ruling party: Congress
articles.subtitle: Party MPs KC Venugopal, K Suresh signed letter

articles.content: A man sparked a debate after he posted about a 2025 pass out from his college "not addressing him as Sir" in LinkedIn message. "Son, you are 2025 pass out and address 1994 pass out with first name," he wrote. Reacting to his post, people wrote, "Stop overreacting," and "What exactly have you done for him to call you Sir?"
articles.title: Man posts about fresher 'not calling him Sir' in LinkedIn message; sparks debate
articles.subtitle: 'It's not disrespectful at all'

articles.content: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said he believes the 36-year-old will play for the next five years and represent India at 2027 ODI World Cup. "He's still...fit...That's why I can say...he still has a lot of cricket left in him," Sharma added. Kohli has scored 126 runs in first three Tests of Border-Gavaskar Trophy so far.
articles.title: I believe Virat will play for 5 more years, he’ll also play 2027 WC: Childhood coach
articles.subtitle: 'Two more tons to come from his bat in 2 Tests'

articles.content: BJP MP Phangnon Konyak has accused Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi of hurting her dignity and self-esteem while she was protesting in Parliament. Konyak said, "Rahul with other Congress members came in front of me...He misbehaved with me in a loud voice and his physical proximity to me was so close that I being a lady member felt extremely uncomfortable."
articles.title: Rahul came very close to me during protest, I felt very uncomfortable: Female BJP MP Konyak
articles.subtitle: Passage was created for Rahul: Konyak

articles.content: Amid the ongoing war with Russia, Ukraine has unveiled a new laser-based air defence weapon called 'Tryzub', which is the Ukrainian term for 'trident'. The weapon is reportedly capable of downing aircraft at distances of more than two kilometres. As per reports, Tryzub would also be able to counter Russian hypersonic missiles, which can travel as fast as 6,115 kmph.
articles.title: What is 'Tryzub' laser weapon that Ukraine has unveiled?
articles.subtitle: Israel, UK among other nations with laser arms

articles.content: A video has shown BJP MP Nishikant Dubey shouting at Congress MP Rahul Gandhi after BJP MP Pratap Sarangi fell and sustained injuries, allegedly due to Rahul's push. "Aren't you ashamed? You engage in hooliganism. You made an old man fall," Dubey was heard telling Rahul as he came to inquire about Sarangi. Rahul was seen walking away after that.
articles.title: 'Aren't you ashamed? You pushed an old man' BJP MP Dubey seen telling Rahul amid scuffle
articles.subtitle: 'Sarangi had pushed me,' Rahul said in the video

articles.content: BJP shared a picture on X in which it replaced BR Ambedkar with US billionaire George Soros in Congress' protest picture in Parliament. The Congress was protesting against Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks on BR Ambedkar. "We fixed the image for you," BJP tweeted. The BJP has been alleging that the Congress works with Soros to destabilise the country.
articles.title: BJP replaces Ambedkar with George Soros in Congress' protest pic
articles.subtitle: 'You're welcome'

articles.content: Filmmaker Vidhu Vinod Chopra said he's admitting that his film 'Zero Se Restart' failed to perform but makers in Bollywood use deceptive marketing tactics to lure audience. "They pay influencers to say whatever they want them to say," said Vidhu, adding, "Their shows are running empty, so they buy their own tickets and spread lies about the box office collections."
articles.title: Makers buy their own tickets, spread lies about collections: Vidhu
articles.subtitle: 'Nobody admits that their film failed to open'

articles.content: Rajkumar Sharma, Virat Kohli's childhood coach, has said that the cricketer, his wife Anushka Sharma, and their children Vamika and Akaay are set to move to London soon. "He's going to leave India soon and shift to London," Sharma told Dainik Jagran. "Virat is still very fit...I believe that Virat will play cricket for five more years," he further said.
articles.title: Kohli leaving India, to move to London with Anushka and kids soon, says childhood coach
articles.subtitle: 'Virat still has a lot of cricket left in him'

articles.content: The US Department of Agriculture (USDA) has announced that northern giant hornets, commonly known as "murder hornets", have been eradicated from the country. "Murder hornets" can destroy a honeybee hive in as little as 90 minutes, and their extremely painful stings have occasionally been fatal to human beings. "The eradication success was the result of a multiyear effort," USDA said.
articles.title: 'Murder hornets' eradicated from US
articles.subtitle: The effort began in 2019

articles.content: Ravichandran Ashwin and Virat Kohli contradicted India captain Rohit Sharma's remark on Ashwin's retirement, sparking confusion. Rohit said that Ashwin said he wanted to retire after Perth Test, however, he convinced him to stay for the pink-ball Test. Kohli stated he came to know about Ashwin's retirement on Wednesday and Ashwin also stated it was an impulsive decision.
articles.title: Kohli and Ashwin contradict Rohit's remark on Ashwin's retirement, spark confusion
articles.subtitle: Ashwin retired after Brisbane Test

articles.content: Two bus accidents involving a fuel tanker and a truck on a highway through central Afghanistan killed 52 people and injured 65, the Taliban government spokesmen said on Thursday. The accidents happened in Ghazni province on the same highway between the capital Kabul and southern Kandahar city. Some of the injured people are in serious condition.
articles.title: 2 buses collide with fuel tanker & truck in Afghanistan, 52 dead
articles.subtitle: Accidents happened late on Wednesday

articles.content: Actor and YouTuber Prasad Behera was arrested in Hyderabad on Wednesday on charges of sexually harassing a woman who acted with him in a web series, police said. The case against Behera was registered based on a complaint by the woman. According to the police, the woman said that Behera abused, misbehaved with, and sexually harassed her on multiple occasions.
articles.title: Actor, YouTuber Prasad Behera arrested for alleged sexual harassment of co-star
articles.subtitle: He was sent to police custody for 14 days

articles.content: Union Minister Shivraj Chouhan, after visiting BJP MPs Mukesh Rajput and Pratap Chandra Sarangi at RML hospital after they sustained injuries during clash with I.N.D.I.A bloc leaders, said it's "black day in parliamentary history". "Decorum has been torn apart," he stated. The scuffle occurred as both sides staged protests in Parliament after Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks on BR Ambedkar.
articles.title: Black day in parliamentary history: Shivraj on Parliament scuffle
articles.subtitle: 'Democracy has been shredded'

articles.content: Talking about his son retiring from international cricket, all-rounder R Ashwin's father Ravichandran said only Ashwin knows why he retired from international cricket at the last minute. "Maybe [because of] humiliation," he added. "The way he gave his retirement, one part of me was very happy, another part of me was not happy because he should have continued," Ravichandran added.
articles.title: Maybe because of humiliation: Ashwin’s father on why he suddenly announced retirement
articles.subtitle: Ashwin took 765 wickets in international cricket

articles.content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said the stand-off between NDA and the Opposition over the Babasaheb Ambedkar controversy is "unfortunately". "This is becoming a bit absurd on both sides. We need to move on to the problems of today and tomorrow," he said. Notably, the controversy escalated after Congress shared a clip of Amit Shah's speech, alleging that he insulted Ambedkar.
articles.title: A bit absurd on both sides: Tharoor on Opposition-NDA stand-off
articles.subtitle: Congress demanded Amit Shah's apology

articles.content: BJP MP Giriraj Singh reacted after BJP MP Pratap Chandra Sarangi alleged that he sustained injuries after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi pushed another MP who was standing near him. "The physical attack on MPs Pratap Sarangi Ji and Mukesh Rajput Ji by Rahul and his supporters is reprehensible and unacceptable," Giriraj said. "The country will never forgive this," he added.
articles.title: Country won't forgive: Giriraj as MPs injured after 'Rahul's push'
articles.subtitle: The BJP MPs were admitted to ICU

articles.content: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge wrote to Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, saying he was injured as BJP MPs pushed him inside Parliament. "I lost my balance and was forced to sit down...This inflicted injury on my knees...I limped to the House," said Kharge, urging an inquiry. Two BJP MPs were hospitalised after Rahul Gandhi allegedly pushed them during the scuffle.
articles.title: Injured my knees as BJP MPs pushed me, had to limp: Kharge on scuffle in Parliament
articles.subtitle: 'My knees have already undergone surgery'

articles.content: Bangladesh's interim government is planning to renegotiate power sharing deal with Adani Power, Reuters reported. It claims Adani Power didn't inform of changes in power plant's tax status and is concerned over potential savings worth $28.6 million from tax exemptions that the government should've received from it. Bangladesh may use fallout from US' bribery charges to press for resolution.
articles.title: B’desh planning to reopen Adani deal over tax benefits: Report
articles.subtitle: Adani Power not accused of wrongdoing in B'desh

articles.content: During a highly anticipated Ligue 1 clash, Paris Saint-Germain (PSG), goal-keeper Gianluigi Donnarumma suffered a horrific injury to his face at the hands of Monaco defender Wilfried Singo. After being replaced in goal by his teammate Matvey Safonov, the medical personnel had to put 10 staples to close the wounds on the right side of Gianluigi Donnarumma’s face.
articles.title: PSG’s Gianluigi Donnarumma suffers horrific face injury vs Monaco
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A viral image claims Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi's bag read "I don't care about Bangladeshi Hindus" as she carried it to Parliament. DFRAC fact-checking reveals the original bag featured "Palestine," symbolizing solidarity with Palestinians. Later, Priyanka carried a bag supporting Bangladeshi minorities, debunking the misleading claims. Thus the viral image is edited.
articles.title: Viral claim on Priyanka Gandhi's bag about Bangladesh is false
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Union Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju on Thursday accused Lok Sabha's Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi of injuring two BJP MPs - Pratap Chandra Sarangi and Mukesh Rajput - in the Parliament. Rijiju asked Rahul Gandhi, "Did you learn Kung fu, Karate to injure other MPs?" Notably, Rahul Gandhi holds a black belt in Aikido, a Japanese martial art.
articles.title: Did you learn Kung fu, Karate for this?: Rijiju asks Rahul as BJP MPs injured
articles.subtitle: 'Rahul Gandhi pushed MP who fell on me'

articles.content: Italy PM Giorgia Meloni said she can be a friend of billionaire Elon Musk and at the same time lead Italy's first government that made "new law to regulate private activity in space". Meloni stated she has good relationships with many people but she "doesn't take orders from anyone". Meloni has met Musk frequently after coming to power in 2022.
articles.title: I am Elon Musk's friend but I don't take orders: Italy PM Meloni
articles.subtitle: Meloni met Musk to bring investments in Italy

articles.content: Actress Pavitra Punia said religious differences weren't the reason for her breakup with Eijaz Khan. "I did tell him that I'm not going to convert myself," said Pavitra, adding she wanted to remain loyal to her religion. "Our relationship reached a point where we tried and tried, but it didn't work. How much could we keep trying?" she said.
articles.title: I told Eijaz I'm not going to convert: Pavitra Punia on breakup
articles.subtitle: 'If a man keeps suppressing, he's a narcissist'

articles.content: BJP MPs Pratap Sarangi and Mukesh Rajput were admitted to ICU after sustaining injuries as a scuffle broke out in Parliament premises, during BJP and INDI Alliance's protests. Both MPs have blamed Rahul Gandhi, saying they fell after he pushed BJP MPs while trying to enter Parliament. PM Narendra Modi, meanwhile, called the MPs to inquire about their condition.
articles.title: BJP MPs Sarangi, Mukesh Rajput in ICU with injuries after 'Rahul's push' in Parliament
articles.subtitle: 'Mukesh ji fell unconscious, has dizziness'

articles.content: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli was involved in verbal fight with a reporter at Melbourne airport. Kohli appeared to be upset by presence of cameras directed at his family. "With my kids...I need some privacy...you can't film without asking me," Kohli was reportedly heard saying. Kohli reportedly later shook hands with the reporter after being assured his children weren't being filmed.
articles.title: Virat Kohli involved in verbal fight with reporter at Melbourne airport
articles.subtitle: India-Aus Melbourne Test to begin on Dec 26

articles.content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah responded to Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge's protest over the former's remarks on BR Ambedkar. "I request Mallikarjun Kharge to not support his party in this, especially since he comes from a community BR Ambedkar worked to uplift," Shah said. "I'm very sad that you're also involved in this under pressure from Rahul Gandhi," he added.
articles.title: I urge Kharge to not support Congress: Shah on Ambedkar remark row
articles.subtitle: 'Congress twisted & distorted my statement'

articles.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy met NATO Chief Mark Rutte and French President Emmanuel Macron in Brussels to enhance Ukraine's air defence amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Zelenskyy discussed security guarantees and unity in Europe, emphasizing the need for coordinated efforts to achieve lasting peace.
articles.title: Zelenskyy meets NATO, Macron to strengthen Ukraine's defence
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Winter poses health challenges for kids due to cold weather and increased indoor contact. Paediatrician Dr Parimala V Thirumalesh highlights common illnesses like cold, flu, bronchiolitis, ear infections, and norovirus. To prevent winter illnesses, ensure hand hygiene, timely vaccinations, healthy diet, proper hydration, warm clothing, and adequate rest. Consult a doctor if severe symptoms arise.
articles.title: Paediatrician shares winter health tips for kids
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: American tennis star Tien made a remarkable debut at the Next Gen ATP Finals, securing a thrilling five-set victory against Jakub Mensik in Jeddah on Wednesday. Before the match, renowned Russian personality Hasbulla Magomedov added to the spectacle by participating in the event. Magomedov performed the coin toss and later posed for photographs with the two rising tennis stars.
articles.title: Hasbulla Magomedov performs the coin toss at Next Gen ATP finals
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Huawei has overtaken Apple in total shipments of wrist-worn devices during the first nine months of 2024, according to IDC's latest Worldwide Wearables Quarterly Tracker report. In the first three quarters of this year, Huawei shipped 23.6 million smartwatches and wristbands, compared to Apple's 22.5 million units shipped worldwide. Xiaomi ranked 3rd in global smartwatch shipments and Samsung 4th.
articles.title: Apple loses world's top smartwatch brand title
articles.subtitle: Overall, 139 million units shipped globally

articles.content: Rashtriya Janta Dal (RJD) Chief Lalu Prasad Yadav on Thursday criticised Union Home Minister Amit Shah over his remarks on Dr BR Ambedkar. "Amit Shah has gone mad. He must have hatred for Babasaheb Ambedkar. We condemn this madness of his," Lalu said. "Babasaheb Ambedkar is great. [Amit Shah] should renounce politics and leave," he added.
articles.title: Shah has gone mad, should leave politics: Lalu amid Ambedkar row
articles.subtitle: 'Congress twisted & distorted my statement'

articles.content: ED has recorded statements of actresses Mallika Sherawat and Pooja Banerjii in connection with a money laundering probe against a betting website, owned by Pakistani nationals. The portal 'Magicwin' "illegally" broadcast Men's T20 World Cup matches. The actresses had undertaken some promotional activity related to 'Magicwin' and they are, prima facie, not found to be an accused in the case.
articles.title: ED questions Mallika Sherawat, Pooja Banerjii in case linked to Pak betting site
articles.subtitle: 'Several B'wood celebs attended Magicwin launch'

articles.content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju reacted after BJP MP Pratap Chandra Sarangi alleged that he sustained injuries after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi pushed another MP who was standing near him. Rijiju said Rahul used physical strength against BJP MPs, adding, "It's a gross misuse of his anger". "Rahul must apologise...We're not retaliating physically only because we believe in democracy," he added.
articles.title: Rahul used physical strength against MPs; misuse of anger: Rijiju
articles.subtitle: 'MPs are not weak, we believe in non-violence'

articles.content: CISF patrol boat 'Shera 1' rescued 35 passengers of the ferry that sank after a Navy speedboat crashed into it. A CISF officer on the patrol boat said the initial passengers were saved within minutes as they were nearby when the crash occurred. They then sent SOS to other agencies for larger rescue operation, saving around 72 lives in total.
articles.title: How did CISF save dozens of lives after speedboat-ferry collision?
articles.subtitle: 13 killed, 99 were rescued after the crash

articles.content: Actress Devoleena Bhattacharjee and her husband Shanawaz Shaikh have been blessed with their first child, a baby boy. The couple shared a post on Instagram, writing, "Hello world! Our little angel BOY is here." Several celebrities, including Arti Singh, Paras Chhabraa and Kajal Pisal, congratulated the couple. Devoleena tied the knot with her gym trainer Shanawaz Shaikh in December 2022.
articles.title: Devoleena Bhattacharjee, husband Shanawaz Shaikh blessed with baby boy
articles.subtitle: To view the post shared by the couple

articles.content: The Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) has highlighted significant deficiencies in the training of Indian Air Force pilots in a report. The report raised concerns over outdated equipment and critical issues such as engine oil leaks in the basic trainer aircraft. The report added that the trainer aircraft reported 38 engine oil leaks between 2013 and 2021.
articles.title: CAG report flags deficiencies in training of IAF pilots
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Pocahontas in our minds comes out as the adventurous Disney princess whose carefree nature and valour stay alive. Pocahontas, however, was a real-life woman belonging to the Powhatan tribe of the indigenous Native Americans. She lived around 400 years ago, yet her involvement in bridging the gap between Europeans and Native Americans gave her the remembrance.
articles.title: True story of Native American Pocahontas who bridged cultural gap
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: All-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin announced his retirement from international cricket after the third BGT 2024-25 Test between India and Australia. In a heartwarming video shared by Team India, Ashwin is seen having fun with teammates and support staff, inviting them to bowl in an indoor net session while offering tips and creating memorable moments filled with laughter and camaraderie.
articles.title: Ashwin invites support staff for a fun net session during BGT
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Mexican driver Sergio Perez has officially parted ways with Red Bull Racing after four years following a mutual agreement. Notably, Perez signed a contract extension in May, which was expected to keep him with the team until 2026. He had failed to secure a single race win this season. "Driving for Red Bull has been an unforgettable experience," Perez said.
articles.title: Sergio Perez & Red Bull part ways months after contract extension
articles.subtitle: 'I'm grateful for past 4 years with Red Bull'

articles.content: Ravichandran Ashwin received a grand welcome at his home in Chennai after his return from Brisbane a day after announcing his retirement from international cricket. Ashwin was welcomed by his family and friends with music and garlands. A video has surfaced on social media showing Ashwin's father kissing him and his mother tearing up.
articles.title: Ashwin receives grand welcome at home in Chennai; father kisses him, mother tears up
articles.subtitle: To watch the video

articles.content: The Leader of the Opposition in the Rajya Sabha and Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge has submitted a privilege notice against the Union Home Minister Amit Shah over the remarks he made on Dr BR Ambedkar. "Such conduct by the Home minister is tantamount to a breach of privilege, and contempt of House," said Kharge in the privilege notice.
articles.title: Congress President Kharge moves privilege notice against Amit Shah
articles.subtitle: TMC MP also moved privilege notice against Shah

articles.content: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami has directed to open Uttarakhand Niwas in Delhi to the public. The guest house showcases Uttarakhand's culture, art, and organic products. CM Dhami emphasized revising room reservation rules and rates, ensuring accessibility for the common man while promoting state heritage.
articles.title: CM Dhami opens Uttarakhand Niwas in Delhi for public use
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Perplexity AI, an artificial intelligence startup co-founded by Indian-origin Aravind Srinivas, has closed a $500-million round of funding that triples its valuation to $9 billion, Bloomberg reported. In April, Perplexity was valued at $1 billion, a figure that jumped to $3 billion in June after investment from SoftBank Group's Vision Fund 2. Perplexity, founded in 2022, is rival of ChatGPT.
articles.title: Perplexity AI's value triples to $9 bn in latest funding round
articles.subtitle: Institutional Venture Partners led latest round

articles.content: Arvind Kejriwal urged Bihar and Andhra Pradesh CMs to address Amit Shah's remarks on Ambedkar. He called the statement disrespectful to Ambedkar's legacy and hurtful to millions. INDIA Bloc MPs, led by Rahul Gandhi, protested in Parliament, demanding Shah's resignation and an apology over the controversial comment.
articles.title: Kejriwal urges action on Amit Shah's Ambedkar remark
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Severe cold conditions have gripped Uttar Pradesh, with temperatures dropping to 7°C in Bareilly and 9°C in Prayagraj and Varanasi. Locals are using bonfires to stay warm as fog and chill intensify. The India Meteorological Department warns of continued low temperatures, impacting cities across the state.
articles.title: Severe cold wave grips Uttar Pradesh; temperatures drop to 7°C
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: MPs of I.N.D.I.A bloc on Thursday staged a protest inside Parliament premises against Union Home Minister Amit Shah's comments on BR Ambedkar. In a video, Opposition MPs can be seen climbing the walls of Makar Dwar at the Parliament and protesting with placards. They demanded Shah's resignation and an apology for his comments. BJP MPs also protested against the Opposition.
articles.title: Oppn leaders climb Parliament wall amid protest over Shah's remark
articles.subtitle: 'Congress twisted & distorted my statement'

articles.content: India chess grandmaster Gukesh D, who became the youngest-ever world champion, said becoming the best player in the world "is actually what I care about the most now". "It helps to know that this is not the end of the road," he stated. Gukesh had earlier said that Magnus Carlsen is the best player in the world.
articles.title: Becoming best player in the world is what I care about now: Gukesh
articles.subtitle: Gukesh beat Ding Liren in championship match

articles.content: MobiKwik has more than doubled the money of investors who invested in the company's recently concluded  ₹572-crore IPO. MobiKwik shares were trading at ₹588 apiece on BSE on Thursday, a 110% premium over the IPO issue price of ₹279. MobiKwik shares made their market debut on Wednesday, listing at ₹442.25 apiece on BSE, a premium of 58.51% over issue price.
articles.title: MobiKwik doubles investors' money in 2 days
articles.subtitle: The shares closed at ₹530 on BSE on Wednesday

articles.content: Online retail giant Amazon exited Shoppers Stop on Wednesday by selling its entire 4% stake for ₹276 crore through an open market bulk deal. Amazon had bought stake into Shoppers Stop in January 2018 through a private placement. Through this bulk deal, Amazon made a gain of nearly ₹97 crore, at a profit of almost 54%.
articles.title: Amazon exits Shoppers Stop, sells entire 4% stake for ₹276 cr
articles.subtitle: Amazon offloaded 44 lakh shares at ₹627.6 apiece

articles.content: BJP MP Pratap Chandra Sarangi was injured during BJP and opposition protests in Parliament on Thursday. "Rahul Gandhi pushed an MP who fell on me after which I fell down," Sarangi told reporters, as visuals showed a wound on his head. Rahul, meanwhile, said that BJP MPs pushed him and tried to stop him from entering Parliament.
articles.title: 'Injured due to Rahul's push' says BJP MP amid Parliament protest, Congress MP replies
articles.subtitle: 'I have right to go inside Parliament'

articles.content: In Vietnam's Hanoi, 11 people were killed and 2 injured in a suspected arson attack at a cafe and karaoke bar. Police arrested a suspect who confessed to starting the fire, and rescue teams saved seven individuals, two of whom were hospitalized. Investigations into the incident are ongoing as the blaze spread rapidly, leaving witnesses helpless.
articles.title: 1 dead, 2 injured in suspected arson at Hanoi karaoke bar
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Hyderabad FC and head coach Thangboi Singto have mutually parted ways after nearly five years. Singto, who became head coach in July 2023 after serving as assistant coach and Technical Director (Youth) since 2020, led the team to historic achievements, including their first ISL win with an all-Indian squad. Assistant coach Shameel Chembakath will serve as interim coach.
articles.title: Hyderabad FC and Thangboi Singto mutually part ways
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Actor Varun Dhawan charged ₹25 crore fee for his upcoming action film 'Baby John' while actress Keerthy Suresh was paid ₹4 crore, 123telugu reported. Jackie Shroff and Rajpal Yadav were paid ₹1.5 crore and ₹1 crore, respectively. Meanwhile, Sanya Malhotra and Wamiqa Gabbi were paid ₹1 crore and ₹40 lakh, respectively. Notably, Salman Khan did a cameo for free.
articles.title: Varun charged ₹25 cr for 'Baby John', Keerthy got ₹4 cr: Report
articles.subtitle: The film will release on December 25

articles.content: A case has been registered against Samajwadi Party MP Zia Ur Rehman Barq for electricity theft in Sambhal. Barq was booked after Uttar Pradesh Electricity Department inspected his residence on Thursday. A meter installed at his residence allegedly showed zero power consumption for six months despite being functional. Notably, he's an accused in the violence over mosque survey in Sambhal.
articles.title: Sambhal MP Barq booked for power theft, meter shows zero reading
articles.subtitle: Earlier, old meters were removed from his house

articles.content: Investment & Precision Castings Limited, which manufactures investment and vacuum castings for sectors like Defence and Aerospace, saw a 5% increase in stock price. This rise followed the company securing a long-term contract with Israel Weapons Industries for the export of precision investment casting components.
articles.title: Investment & Precision Castings soars 5% on contract with Israel
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The University Grants Commission (UGC) has released guidelines to integrate skill-based courses into higher education curricula. This initiative aims to enhance employability by aligning academic programs with industry needs, encouraging institutions to offer certificate, diploma, and degree courses focused on practical skills.
articles.title: UGC issues guidelines for skill-based courses in colleges
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Alleged Wisconsin shooter Natalie 'Samantha' Rupnow, 15, was a member of twisted site 'Watch People Die'. The site, which features images of people getting shot to death and being run over, has more than three million registered users. The 15-year-old had opened fire in a school in US' Wisconsin, killing a fellow student and a teacher and injuring six others.
articles.title: Wisconsin shooter was member of morbid site 'Watch People Die'
articles.subtitle: Natalie shot herself dead with the same handgun

articles.content: Pushpa 2: The Rule has crossed a massive ₹1,450 crore milestone at the global box office in just 14 days. The film, starring Allu Arjun and directed by Sukumar, has shattered records and continues to perform exceptionally well. Allu Arjun's immense star power and the creative partnership with Sukumar have contributed to the film's unprecedented success.
articles.title: Allu Arjun’s Pushpa 2 shatters records, crosses ₹1450 cr worldwide
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Israeli fighter jets targeted Houthi sites in Yemen following missile and drone attacks on Israel. The IDF stated the strikes disrupted Houthi military operations, preventing weapon transfers. Israeli Defense Minister warned Houthi leaders, emphasizing Israel's readiness to act against threats.
articles.title: Israel strikes Houthi targets in Yemen after drone attacks
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Tata Play's (formerly Tata Sky) CEO Harit Nagpal's recent social media post, where he wrote, "Don't build careers. Rent people," sparked an online debate. "Many employees don't just want to 'rent' their skills—they aspire to build lasting careers," a person commented. "If we don't build careers, we'll never have leaders," said another. "Truly resonates in today's world," one said.
articles.title: 'Don't build careers, rent people,' says Tata Play CEO; sparks debate
articles.subtitle: 'I am a freelance contractor for last 24 years'

articles.content: A survivor of the Mumbai speedboat-ferry crash that killed 13, has revealed that one of the speedboat's passengers was thrown into the air due to the collision's impact. Gautam Gupta said the speedboat passenger's body landed beside him on the ferry and that it was "badly mutilated". Gupta is receiving treatment along with his cousin, while his aunt is missing.
articles.title: Speedboat passenger's mutilated body thrown into air, lands on ferry after crash
articles.subtitle: 99 passengers on ferry rescued after crash

articles.content: Union Minister Rajeev Ranjan Singh accused Congress of distorting Home Minister Amit Shah's speech to create negative publicity. He highlighted examples of Congress disrespecting Babasaheb Ambedkar. The controversy escalated as Congress leaders demanded Amit Shah's resignation, sparking political debates.
articles.title: Congress distorting Amit Shah's speech, says Union Minister
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Kareena Kapoor recently opened up on her second pregnancy while shooting for Laal Singh Chaddha during the COVID pandemic. She revealed that Saif Ali Khan suggested that she speak to her co-star and producer Aamir Khan. Saif said, "Things happen. We’ve been at home for like a year and a half."
articles.title: Kareena recalls getting pregnant while shooting Laal Singh Chaddha
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: On the Figuring Out podcast, MrBeast talked about his chocolate brand Feastables and its initial journey. He said, "The first year we were only online which was obviously dumb because no one goes online to buy chocolates." He further stated that Feastables made around $20 million in a year.
articles.title: Sold chocolates online in the first year, it was dumb: MrBeast
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A thick layer of fog covered parts of Delhi as the minimum temperature in the national capital was recorded at 7°C on Thursday morning. IMD has issued an orange alert for dense fog in the Delhi-NCR region for today and tomorrow. Meanwhile, Delhi's AQI was recorded at 448 this morning, bringing the national capital close to the 'severe plus' category.
articles.title: Dense fog alert issued for Delhi, air quality nears 'severe plus'
articles.subtitle: A yellow alert issued for Sat amid fog in Delhi

articles.content: On being asked about whether he had planned his retirement, ex-India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin said that he is very impulsive. "I decided on Day 4 of the Gabba Test," he added. Ashwin announced his retirement after the conclusion of the Test. Notably, Ashwin wasn't a part of India's playing XI in the Test. Ashwin took 765 wickets in international career.
articles.title: I am very impulsive, I decided on Day 4 of Gabba Test: Ashwin on retirement
articles.subtitle: Ashwin arrived in India on Thursday

articles.content: Film Federation of India (FFI) jury head Jahnu Barua defended the jury's decision to pick 'Laapataa Ladies' as India's official entry for Oscars 2025 over Payal Kapadia's 'All We Imagine As Light'. "The jury felt that her film was very poor technically," he added. FFI is facing criticism after 'Laapataa Ladies' failed to get shortlisted for Oscars.
articles.title: 'All We Imagine As Light' was very poor technically: FFI jury head
articles.subtitle: 'That is very uncalled for actually'

articles.content: The Indian Navy has revealed the possible reason behind its speedboat's crash into a passenger ferry off the coast of Mumbai. Officials said an engine malfunction resulted in the driver losing control of the speedboat, after which it crashed into the ferry, killing 13 people. The speedboat was conducting routine trial of a new engine during the crash.
articles.title: What caused Navy boat & ferry's crash that killed 13?
articles.subtitle: 6 people were on speedboat, 110 were on ferry

articles.content: IPL Founder Lalit Kumar Modi took to X to wish Vijay Mallya as he turned 69 on December 18. "Wishing you my friend #vijaymallya a very #happybirthday - life sure has its ups and downs we've both seen it. This too shall pass," Lalit wrote. Mallya responded, "We both have been wronged in a Country we tried to contribute to."
articles.title: Lalit Modi wishes Mallya on b'day, says 'We've seen ups, downs'; Mallya responds
articles.subtitle: May the year ahead be your year: Lalit to Mallya

articles.content: Reacting to Ravichandran Ashwin announcing retirement after third Test against Australia, ex-Australia cricketer Brad Haddin said Ashwin may have been frustrated with three spin changes made in three Tests. "More will come out when Ashwin has his opportunity to speak," Haddin stated. Washington Sundar, Ravichandran Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja played in first, second and third Test respectively.
articles.title: Ashwin may be frustrated with spin changes in the 3 Tests: Haddin
articles.subtitle: Ashwin picked 537 wickets in 106 Tests

articles.content: In 1989, Vandana Luthra started Vandana Luthra Curls and Curves (VLCC) with ₹20,000, as a scientific transformation company and opened her first center in Safdarjung Enclave, Delhi. By 10 January 2023, VLCC had expanded to 210 centres and PE firm Carlyle Group acquired a majority stake for ₹2,500 crore. Today, it has 311 centres and is valued at ₹4,500 crore.
articles.title: Vandana Luthra started her company with ₹20,000 in 1989
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The IMD issued heavy rainfall and cold wave warnings for several states/UTs. Heavy rainfall is likely over Andhra Pradesh and Puducherry on Friday. Severe cold wave warning has been issued for Himachal Pradesh, Punjab and Rajasthan, and cold wave warning for Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh, Haryana and Chandigarh for Friday. Ground frost conditions are likely in Himachal Pradesh and Rajasthan.
articles.title: Heavy rainfall and severe cold wave warnings issued for several states, list released
articles.subtitle: To read the entire bulletin issued by IMD

articles.content: Tech billionaire Peter Thiel said the Silicon Valley companies ended the remote working practice because employees weren't working. "When people didn't come into the office, they weren't working," he said. "After two years, companies fired a bunch of these people and reasserted control because you realise, wow, there were all these people we hired and they're not working," explained Thiel.
articles.title: Those who didn't come to office, didn't work: Billionaire Thiel
articles.subtitle: Peter Thiel is the Co-founder of PayPal

articles.content: Former India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin contradicted Rohit Sharma's remarks in the press conference and left for India from Brisbane the same day he announced his retirement. Rohit had said that Ashwin would be leaving a day after. A proper gathering for Ashwin wasn't possible at the team hotel due to lack of time, a TOI report stated.
articles.title: Ashwin contradicts Rohit, leaves from Brisbane the same day he announced retirement
articles.subtitle: Ashwin retired mid-series

articles.content: Reacting to India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin announcing his international retirement, Australia pacer Mitchell Starc said Ashwin has always been "a bit of a thorn in the flesh" for them in India. "He has been an incredible bowler for India for a long time," Starc stated. Ashwin picked 115 wickets in 23 Test matches against Australia.
articles.title: Ashwin has been bit of a thorn in flesh for us in India: Starc
articles.subtitle: 'Congratulations on his career'

articles.content: A tick specimen from the Betta Basavani forest area in Thirthahalli, Shivamogga district, has tested positive for Kyasanur Forest Disease (KFD), commonly known as monkey fever. This marks the season’s first reported case. In response, health officials have activated standard protocols, including systematic tick collection and monitoring a 5-km radius around the detection site for fever symptoms.
articles.title: Kyasanur Forest Disease case detected in Shivamogga
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: On Wednesday, December 18, Real Madrid won the FIFA Intercontinental Cup after defeating Mexican side Pachuca in the final in Qatar with a 3-0 margin. Kylian Mbappe scored the first goal in the first half of the match. The other two goals were scored by Rodrygo and and Vinicius Jr in the second half of the match.
articles.title: Real Madrid win FIFA Intercontinental Cup after defeating Pachuca
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: New Zealand's economy sank into recession in the third quarter as economic activity plummeted far more sharply than expected. GDP dived 1.0% in the September quarter from the prior quarter, dwarfing market forecasts of a 0.2% contraction. Additionally, the June quarter was revised to show a fall of 1.1%. Two straight quarters of decline is the technical definition of recession.
articles.title: New Zealand falls into recession
articles.subtitle: Local dollar hit fresh two-year low of $0.5614

articles.content: US sanctioned four Pakistan-based entities for contributing to the country's ballistic missile program. State-owned defence agency National Development Complex, which oversees the program, and three firms- Akhtar and Sons, Affiliates International and Rockside Enterprise- have been sanctioned. US said the move came "in light of...proliferation threat of Pakistan's long-range missile development".
articles.title: US sanctions 4 entities for contributing to Pakistan's missile program
articles.subtitle: Sanctions freeze US properties owned by entities

articles.content: Drinking three cups of coffee each day may extend a person's health span by nearly two years, according to a new review published in the journal Ageing Research Reviews. The analysis at the University of Coimbra in Portugal indicates that three cups of coffee daily is associated with an additional 1.84 years of life spent without serious illness.
articles.title: Drinking three cups of coffee daily can extend health span: Study
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: SP MLA Atul Pradhan has been suspended from the Uttar Pradesh Assembly's winter session by Speaker Satish Mahana for using derogatory language. However, Pradhan alleged that the ruling party used objectionable language against the opposition. Pradhan also claimed that the UP Deputy CM made objectionable statements against the LoP.
articles.title: SP MLA Atul Pradhan suspended from UP Assembly session
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: S&P 500 shed 3% to fall below the 6,000-mark in its worst Fed policy day since 2001. Dow Jones fell 1,100 points or 2.6%, marking worst day since August. This is the longest losing streak for the index since 1974. This comes after US Fed said it'll cut rates only twice in 2025 compared to four given in previous forecast.
articles.title: S&P 500 sees worst dip on Fed decision day in 23yrs, Dow dips 2.6%
articles.subtitle: BSE Sensex crashed over 1000 points
