articles.content: Australia's Beau Webster has said he's well-prepared and ready to go should he debut at MCG, having spent time studying the Indian bowlers. "I don’t want to go in blind, I am doing some research," Webster said. "If I did get the nod, I think I'd be well-prepared and give it a good crack if it does happen," he added.
articles.title: Been doing research on Indian bowlers: Australia's Beau Webster
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: PM Narendra Modi expressed grief over the loss of 13 lives following a collision between a passenger ferry and a Navy speedboat off Mumbai coast. "The boat mishap...is saddening. Condolences to the bereaved families. I pray...the injured recover soon," he said. He also announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each for the victims' families and ₹50,000 assistance for injured individuals.
articles.title: PM expresses grief over Mumbai boat tragedy; announces ₹2 lakh aid
articles.subtitle: The passenger ferry was carrying 110 people

articles.content: Talking about pacer Mohammad Shami's return to Team India, captain Rohit Sharma said, "I think it's high time somebody from NCA talks about him, where he's rehabbing." He added, "I understand he's playing a lot of cricket back home...but there have been...complaints about his knee." "Unless we're like, not 100%, 200% sure...we're not going to take any risk," he said.
articles.title: It is high time that somebody from NCA talks about him: Rohit Sharma on Mohammad Shami
articles.subtitle: Shami last played an int'l match in Nov 2023

articles.content: Sensex crashed over 1,000 points on Thursday, trading at around 79,180, while the Nifty tumbled 275 points to trade at 23,924. The market indices fell following the US Federal Reserve's decision to cut interest rates by 25 bps to the 4.25-4.50% range, signalling fewer rate cuts in 2025. Asian Paints, Tata Steel, SBI, Infosys and M&M were biggest Sensex losers.
articles.title: Sensex crashes 1,000 points
articles.subtitle: Hindalco, Wipro among top Nifty losers

articles.content: The Indian government is re-examining a surge in gold imports that widened the country's trade deficit to a record in November and pushed the rupee to an all-time low, two government sources aware of the matter reportedly told Reuters. Bloomberg News reported that officials might have double-counted gold shipments following a change in counting methodology in July.
articles.title: India re-examining sudden surge in November gold imports: Reports
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: North Korea has denounced US and its allies for "reckless provocation" over their criticism for North Korea's support to Russia in war against Ukraine, including its military personnel deployment. North Korea accused 10 nations and European Union of "distorting and slandering" its "normal cooperative" relationship with Russia. North Korea has deployed thousands of troops to support Russia's war.
articles.title: US-led criticism for Russia support reckless provocation: N Korea
articles.subtitle: Russia invaded Ukraine in 2022

articles.content: India and China held the 23rd Special Representatives meeting in Beijing, agreeing to resume the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra, enhance cross-border river cooperation, and Nathula trade. Both sides pledged to maintain peace along the border, strengthen diplomatic talks, and plan a follow-up meeting in India next year.
articles.title: India, China agree to resume Kailash Yatra and border trade
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: US President-elect Donald Trump said subsidies to Canada to "the tune of over $100,000,000 a year" make "no sense". He also stated that Canada becoming the 51st state of US is "a great idea". Trump's remarks came amid rising tensions between two countries, especially after his announcement to impose 25% tariffs on Canada for not addressing trade and immigration issues.
articles.title: Subsidies to Canada make no sense, it should be 51st state: Trump
articles.subtitle: 'Many Canadians want Canada to be 51st state'

articles.content: The Indian rupee hit a record low of 85 against the US dollar on Thursday. This comes after the US Federal Reserve cut interest rates by 25 bps to the 4.25-4.50% range and signalled fewer rate cuts in 2025, sending the dollar index to its highest in two years. Overnight, US equities plunged, with Dow Jones falling 1,100 points.
articles.title: Rupee hits all-time low of 85 against US dollar
articles.subtitle: Rupee closed at 84.95 against USD on Wednesday

articles.content: Congress leaders received notices from social media platform X for sharing video clips of Home Minister Amit Shah's Parliament speech, reports said. BJP has alleged that Congress shared edited and cropped video of Shah's speech to misrepresent his remarks. Congress demanded Shah's resignation after he said it had become "fashion" among opposition to take BR Ambedkar's name.
articles.title: Congress leaders get notices from X for sharing 'edited' clips of Shah's speech
articles.subtitle: 'Notices issued on request from Home Ministry'

articles.content: Vijay Mallya has questioned Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's claim that ₹14,131 crore has been recovered from Mallya. "The Debt Recovery Tribunal adjudged KFA debt at ₹6,203 crore including ₹1,200 crore interest," Mallya posted on X. "Unless the ED and Banks can legally justify how they have taken more than two times the debt, I am entitled to relief," he added.
articles.title: How they've taken 2X the debt?: Mallya on FM's ₹14,000 crore recovery claim
articles.subtitle: '₹8,000 crore has been recovered from me'

articles.content: Five terrorists were killed in an encounter with security forces in J&K's Kulgam district on Thursday, officials said. Two soldiers sustained injuries in the operation. The gunfight began after security forces launched a cordon and search operation in the district on Wednesday following information about the presence of suspected terrorists there. The gun battle started as terrorists opened fire.
articles.title: 5 terrorists killed in encounter with security forces in J&K
articles.subtitle: The encounter took place in the Behibagh area

articles.content: Home Minister Amit Shah accused Congress of twisting facts. He said, "My statement in Rajya Sabha was twisted and distorted by Congress...I come from a party that can never disrespect Ambedkar." Shah added he'll explore legal action, inside and outside Parliament, against Congress. Notably, the controversy escalated after Congress shared a clip of Shah's speech, alleging that he insulted Ambedkar.
articles.title: Congress distorted my statement, will explore legal actions: Shah
articles.subtitle: 'They want to mislead people'

articles.content: The US Federal Reserve on Wednesday reduced the interest rates for the third consecutive time. The Fed slashed interest rates by 25 bps to a range between 4.25-4.50%. The policymakers now see the benchmark rate reaching an average of 3.75-4% by the end of 2025, implying only two quarter-percentage-point cuts, according to the median estimate.
articles.title: US Fed cuts interest rates by 25 bps to 4.25-4.50% range
articles.subtitle: S&P 500 shed 3% to fall below 6,000

articles.content: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said India would not have been bowled out inside 50 overs on Day 5 of the third Test against Australia. He stated Australia had "the better of the Test". India were asked to chase target of 275 runs in 54 overs but bad light and rain forced play to be abandoned in 2.1 overs.
articles.title: We wouldn't have been bowled out in 50 overs: Gavaskar on 3rd Test
articles.subtitle: The match was played in Brisbane

articles.content: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari during a conversation with YouTuber Samdish said, "Live-in relationships are wrong..they will destroy society."  Gadkari added, "If you don't marry, how will you have children? If you dismantle the societal structure, what kind of impact will it have on people?" Gadkari also said, "It's the duty of parents to have children and raise them properly."
articles.title: Live-in relationships wrong, they will destroy society: Gadkari
articles.subtitle: 'There are certain rules in the society'

articles.content: Police filed a case against the driver of the Navy speedboat that crashed into a passenger ferry off the coast of Mumbai, killing 13 people. The accident took place when the speedboat that was under engine trials at sea, lost control and hit a ferry carrying 110 people. Causing death by negligence is among BNS sections invoked in the FIR.
articles.title: Navy speedboat driver booked as crash with ferry kills 13 off Mumbai coast
articles.subtitle: 'No life jackets, safety instructions given'

articles.content: The death toll from an unknown illness in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district rose to eight after a child succumbed to the mysterious disease in a hospital on Wednesday. A Biosafety Level 3 (BSL-3) mobile laboratory has been sent to Rajouri. Additionally, a central team of experts has been constituted to assist J&K administration in investigating the cases and fatalities.
articles.title: Unknown disease kills 8 in J&K; Centre rushes expert team
articles.subtitle: Child died after being hospitalised for 6 days

articles.content: After being dubbed Disease X for weeks, the Democratic Republic of Congo has finally identified the mysterious flu-like disease that killed more than 143 people is severe malaria. "The mystery has finally been solved. It's a case of severe malaria in the form of a respiratory illness," Congo's health ministry declared in a statement on Tuesday.
articles.title: Mysterious flu-like Disease X in Congo found to be severe malaria
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A non-smoker British man was wrongly diagnosed with anxiety and prescribed medicine, while he actually had terminal lung cancer, signs of which doctors kept missing. However, 36-year-old Liam Handley passed away after his cancer spread to other organs and despite treatments like chemotherapy and immunotherapy, the disease became unstoppable.
articles.title: British man misdiagnosed with anxiety dies of lung cancer
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: After pollution curbs were enforced again in Delhi-NCR over 'severe+' air quality in the region, pictures showing monuments in Delhi before and after smog have surfaced. Air Quality Index (AQI) in Delhi was 445 on Wednesday while the AQI was 359 in Noida. Meanwhile, AQI was 400 in Gurugram on Wednesday.
articles.title: Pics show Delhi monuments before and after smog
articles.subtitle: To see more pictures of the monuments

articles.content: WhatsApp users across the country may have received a new message that claims to give free laptops to eligible students as a part of an ongoing Free Laptops Scheme 2024. The message asks people to fill up a form by clicking on link provided in the message. PIB Fact Check has highlighted that this message is fake and a scam.
articles.title: WhatsApp message offering free laptops to students is fake, can lead to loss of money
articles.subtitle: 'Never click on such suspicious links'

articles.content: Two Congress workers died due to "police action" during protests in Guwahati and Lucknow on Wednesday, the party claimed. "Democracy and Constitution have been murdered again in BJP ruled Assam and Uttar Pradesh," Rahul Gandhi said. However, police in both cities said the deaths did not occur because of their actions and no injury marks were found on deceased's body.
articles.title: Congress says 2 party workers died due to police action in UP, Assam; police denies
articles.subtitle: Protest was held over Amit Shah's remark

articles.content: Chandigarh administration has reported breach of noise regulations during Diljit Dosanjh's concert held on December 14, recommending strict action against violators. Punjab and Haryana High Court had granted permission for the event a day earlier, with the condition that noise levels must not exceed 75 decibels. The administration monitored the noise levels at various locations during the concert.
articles.title: Diljit Dosanjh's concert breached noise limits, Chandigarh informs High Court
articles.subtitle: HC adjourned matter for further hearing in Jan

articles.content: Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah said there is no discussion in INDIA bloc regarding a leadership change and that a meeting of the constituents has not been held. "There has been no meeting of INDIA bloc; where will the talk of leadership change happen?" he added. Abdullah's remark comes after some INDIA bloc parties backed Mamata's name for leadership.
articles.title: No discussion in INDIA bloc on change of leadership: Omar Abdullah
articles.subtitle: RJD, SP, Sena (UBT) backed Mamata's name

articles.content: Yang Tengbo, a 50-year-old Chinese businessman, suspected to be a spy with close links to UK's Prince Andrew, is listed as director of a business consultancy advising UK-based companies on their operations in China. He has been photographed with ex-PMs David Cameron and Theresa May. Yang worked as a junior civil servant in China before arriving in UK in 2002.
articles.title: Who is the alleged Chinese spy with close ties to Prince Andrew?
articles.subtitle: Yang strongly denied the espionage claims

articles.content: A Class 9 student from Bihar's Muzaffarpur discovered a sum of ₹87.65 crore on checking his bank balance. The incident occurred when he decided to withdraw ₹500. The incident lasted only five hours, as the balance had returned to normal. It's suspected fraudsters might have exploited the student's account for some time, leading to the false credit.
articles.title: Student mistakenly becomes crorepati for 5 hours in Bihar as he finds ₹87 cr bank balance
articles.subtitle: The account was subsequently frozen

articles.content: Zing, an app that delivers freshly prepared food in 10 minutes using AI-driven demand forecasting, has launched in Gurugram. Founded by Tarun Arora, former COO of Inshorts, and Rachit Sahi, the app is backed by Inshorts Co-founder and Shark Tank India judge Azhar Iqubal. "Zing delivered 600 orders in November alone...This number could more than double in December," said Arora.
articles.title: Zing, a 10-minute food delivery app, launches in Gurugram
articles.subtitle: Zing plans to launch in other cities soon

articles.content: Dr Shama Mohamed, a member of Congress party, highlighted issue of expensive flight tickets in an X post. She shared a screenshot which shows that a direct IndiGo flight from Delhi to Kannur will cost ₹22,018. "It's cheaper to go to Dubai!" she wrote. While some people supported her, others cited peak holiday season as a reason behind high fares.
articles.title: Delhi to Kannur flight ticket for ₹22,000 sparks debate
articles.subtitle: 'This is what monopoly does'

articles.content: Actress Chhaya Kadam, who played the role of 'Manju Maai' in 'Laapataa Ladies' expressed her shock and dismay over the film exiting the Oscar 2025 race. “I had a lot of expectations. I was a little shocked today. But, it's ok," she said. 'Laapataa Ladies' was India's official entry for Oscars 2025 in the Best International Feature Film category.
articles.title: Had many expectations: Chhaya on 'Laapataa..' exiting Oscar race
articles.subtitle: With more strength, we move ahead: Chhaya

articles.content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju on Wednesday said that he is first Buddhist after BR Ambedkar to hold position of Union Law Minister. Rijiju said this while criticising Congress for protesting against Amit Shah. "Congress has been taking out a small part of speech...and trying to mislead people...Congress has no moral right to take the name of BR Ambedkar," Rijiju said.
articles.title: I'm first Buddhist to become Law Minister after Babasaheb: Rijiju
articles.subtitle: 'Congress should stop misusing Ambedkar's name'

articles.content: Two cases of monkeypox have been reported in Kerala, state Health Minister Veena George said on Wednesday. The patients had recently returned to Kerala from the United Arab Emirates (UAE), the minister added. Meanwhile, Health Department instructed those who came into contact with the patients to monitor themselves. Kerala reported few monkeypox cases in September this year.
articles.title: 2 monkeypox cases reported in Kerala, patients travelled from UAE
articles.subtitle: Both patients are currently undergoing treatment

articles.content: A Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) for 'One Nation, One Election' Bills has been formed and includes 21 MPs from Lok Sabha and 10 from Rajya Sabha. The members include Anurag Singh Thakur, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, Sambit Patra, Supriya Sule, Bansuri Swaraj, Manish Tewari and Kalyan Banerjee among others. The Bills were referred to JPC on Tuesday.
articles.title: Parliamentary panel on 'One Nation, One Poll' Bills formed; includes Priyanka, Anurag
articles.subtitle: To see the complete list of members

articles.content: Recently, Ranbir Kapoor faced backlash for purportedly ignoring his wife, actress Alia Bhatt at Raj Kapoor's 100th birth anniversary celebrations. Gauahar Khan, who worked with Ranbir in 'Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year', took to Instagram and re-shared a reel defending Kapoor, titled, 'The Ranbir Kapoor they don't post about'. "Seriously so unfair!...Ranbir is a gentleman," she wrote.
articles.title: Gauahar Khan defends Ranbir Kapoor after backlash for ignoring wife Alia Bhatt at event
articles.subtitle: 'I'm glad there are such posts'

articles.content: Father of actor Allu Arjun and producer Aravind visited the hospitalised eight-year-old boy who was gravely injured in the stampede during 'Pushpa 2' premiere. "I have spoken to the doctors looking after him. The boy has been recovering slowly in the last 10 days," Aravind said. "We're ready to support in any way to help him recover," he added.
articles.title: Allu Arjun's father visits 'Pushpa 2' stampede victim in hospital
articles.subtitle: I was advised not to visit victim: Allu Arjun

articles.content: Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu said Israeli troops will occupy Mount Hermon, part of a buffer zone in Syria, until "another arrangement is found that will ensure Israel's security". Netanyahu made the comments from Mount Hermon itself, which is about 10 kilometres from border with Israel-held Golan Heights. Israeli troops entered the buffer zone after ex-Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's ouster.
articles.title: Israeli troops to occupy Syria buffer zone for now: Netanyahu
articles.subtitle: Israel Defence Minister also went to Mt Hermon

articles.content: National Security Advisor Ajit Doval on Wednesday met Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi in Beijing for the 23rd round of the Special Representatives' Talks and the two held talks on resumption of the Mansarovar yatra. They also discussed cross-border river cooperation and Nathula border trade and agreed to continue to take measures to maintain peace and tranquillity in border areas.
articles.title: Mansarovar yatra, border issues discussed at Doval-Wang meet
articles.subtitle: To know what else was discussed

articles.content: Some media reports claimed Indian Railways will allow passengers to travel free of cost during Maha Kumbh Mela that is scheduled to be held in UP's Prayagraj starting January 13. However, Indian Railways refuted the claim and called it "baseless". The statement emphasised that travelling without valid ticket is strictly prohibited under Indian Railways' rules and is a punishable offense.
articles.title: Claim that Railways will provide free travel for Kumbh Mela false
articles.subtitle: Maha Kumbh Mela will end on February 26

articles.content: Supreme Court on Wednesday directed Punjab government to ensure medical aid for farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, who has been on an indefinite fast at Punjab-Haryana border since November 26. "There can't be any leniency. Do not delay it...Look at the very serious repercussions," SC told Punjab government. Dallewal is protesting over farmers' demands including a legal guarantee of MSP.
articles.title: Don't delay medical aid to fasting farmer leader: SC to Punjab govt
articles.subtitle: 'Time is critical in this case'

articles.content: A homestay owner in Goa recently shared his experience with guests who left the property in complete mess and shared a before-after video of the property. The mess included dirty dishes and kitchen slab and unclean induction cooktops. "We don't expect things to be untouched but leaving such a mess is...beyond...reasoning...We can at least be...a little thoughtful," the caption read.
articles.title: Homestay owner in Goa shares video after guests leave property in a mess
articles.subtitle: The clip also included the guest's response

articles.content: The UK police can seize over £2 million from internet personality Andrew Tate and his brother Tristan over unpaid tax, a London judge ruled. The duo reportedly didn't pay anything in taxes on £21 million of revenue from their online businesses. Last year, Tate was indicted for human trafficking, rape and forming a criminal gang to sexually exploit women.
articles.title: Andrew Tate, brother to have £2 mn seized for unpaid tax: UK court
articles.subtitle: He had denied those allegations

articles.content: Responding to a reporter who asked whether there will be more surprises during Australia tour following Ravichandran Ashwin's retirement, India captain Rohit Sharma said, "No, nothing for now." Ashwin announced his retirement from international cricket following the conclusion of India's Gabba Test against Australia. The 38-year-old played 287 matches for India across formats.
articles.title: Nothing for now: Rohit to reporter asking whether there will be more surprises on tour
articles.subtitle: He took 765 international wickets

articles.content: Ravichandran Ashwin retired from international cricket on Wednesday, announcing his decision after India's third Test in the five-match series against Australia. MS Dhoni had announced his decision to retire from Tests mid-series during the 2014-15 BGT. Some other prominent cricketers to have retired mid-series are India's Anil Kumble, England's Graeme Swann and Australia's Mitchell Johnson.
articles.title: Which cricketers have retired mid-series?
articles.subtitle: Ashwin took 765 wickets in international cricket

articles.content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has said that at least 13 people, including 3 Navy personnel, have died and 101 people have been rescued after a passenger ferry named Neelkamal and a Navy speedboat collided off Mumbai coast. The ferry was taking passengers from the Gateway of India to Elephanta Island. The boat reportedly went out of control while undergoing trials.
articles.title: 13, including 3 Navy personnel, dead after ferry-speedboat collision near Gateway of India
articles.subtitle: A video of the collision surfaced

articles.content: Humans aren't immune to motion sickness even in space. This is why some astronauts may experience Space Adaptation Syndrome in outer space. "Sudden transition from Earth's gravity to space poses several physical and physiological effects...This can include...symptoms that can cause discomfort, including nausea, dizziness, headache," said Dr Anup Khatri, senior consultant, orthopedics.
articles.title: Do astronauts experience motion sickness in space?
articles.subtitle: Astronauts may also feel extremely tired

articles.content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Wednesday responded to Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge's demand for his resignation over a remark on BR Ambedkar. "I would have resigned, but it will not end his problems because he will have to sit in the opposition for the next 15 years," Shah said. Kharge had asked PM Modi to sack Shah by midnight.
articles.title: Even if I resign, Congress will be in Oppn for 15 yrs: Amit Shah
articles.subtitle: 'Saying Ambedkar, Ambedkar now a fashion'

articles.content: Director Atlee said his upcoming film 'A6' is going to be the "proudest film" of India. "Definitely, I am going to surprise everyone with the casting...But you are going to really get surprised," Atlee said during a recent interview. His remarks come amid speculations and reports that actor Salman Khan may be cast in the film.
articles.title: It's going to be the proudest film of India: Atlee on 'A6'
articles.subtitle: We want a lot of blessings: Atlee

articles.content: Actress Shahana Goswami's film 'Santosh', which is UK's official entry in Oscar 2025, said "India has every reason to be proud" of the film getting shortlisted in the International Feature Film category. "There is a huge Indian team involved...I don't think it is a country specific thing...It's about storytelling and diversity...the story is still rooted in India," she said.
articles.title: India has reason to be proud: Shahana on 'Santosh' Oscar shortlist
articles.subtitle: The film was shot in India

articles.content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised Union Home Minister Amit Shah, saying that his remarks against BR Ambedkar were "derogatory" and insult to millions who look up to Babasaheb Ambedkar. "The mask has fallen!...Amit Shah chose to TARNISH this occasion," Banerjee wrote on X. "This is a display of BJP's CASTEIST and ANTI-DALIT mindset," Banerjee added.
articles.title: Insult to millions who look up to Ambedkar: WB CM on Shah's remark
articles.subtitle: 'Saying Ambedkar, Ambedkar now a fashion'

articles.content: A video has surfaced online, showing the moment a speedboat crashed into a ferry off the Mumbai coast before it sank on Wednesday. The speedboat can be seen taking a u-turn before colliding into the ferry. Indian Coast Guard has said that two people have died in the incident and 77 people have been rescued.
articles.title: Video shows moment speedboat crashed into ferry after taking u-turn, sinking it in Mumbai
articles.subtitle: To watch the video of the incident

articles.content: In the weeks after Cyclone Fengal’s devastation in early December 2024, Bengaluru is confronting a significant mosquito crisis that has residents across multiple neighbourhoods deeply concerned. Areas including Chandra Layout, Annasandra Palya, HAL, Vignana Nagar, Bellandur, Wilson Garden, and Vinoba Nagar have become hotspots for mosquito proliferation, prompting urgent calls for intervention.
articles.title: Mosquito menace on rise after Cyclone Fengal in Bengaluru
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Six friends who leased a mine after pooling their resources four years ago in Madhya Pradesh's Panna unearthed a 17.11-carat diamond said to be worth ₹60 lakh. With the proceeds from selling the diamond, one of the men said that they plan to start a business and create a steady source of income.
articles.title: 6 friends find diamond worth ₹60 lakh in MP mine
articles.subtitle: Diamond has been deposited for auction

articles.content: A customer recently shared on X that after ordering shawarma from a Bengaluru restaurant, he was charged extra ₹12 for packaging by Zomato. However, when the food arrived, it was packed in a box featuring advertisement for Bengaluru FC. Bengaluru FC's goalkeeper and captain of the Indian national football team, Gurpreet Singh Sandhu responded, "Share your GPay number...I'll refund ₹12."
articles.title: Man complains about ₹12 packaging fee for food wrapped in Bengaluru FC ad, Sandhu responds
articles.subtitle: 'Why do I need to pay for their advertisement?'

articles.content: Hollywood actor Tom Cruise received the Department of the Navy Distinguished Public Service (DPS) Award, which is the US Navy's highest civilian honour. Cruise was given the award for his "outstanding contributions to the Navy and the Marine Corps" through his work in 'Top Gun', 'Born on the Fourth of July', 'A Few Good Men', and the 'Mission: Impossible' franchise.
articles.title: Tom Cruise receives US Navy's highest civilian honour
articles.subtitle: Cruise got the award in UK

articles.content: At least two people died and five were reported missing after a ferry carrying 80 passengers from Gateway of India to Elephanta Caves capsized off Mumbai coast on Wednesday. The incident occurred when a speedboat collided with the ferry. A total of 15 boats have been deployed in the area for rescue, including 11 Navy boats, 3 Marine Police boats.
articles.title: 2 dead, 5 missing as ferry capsizes off Mumbai coast
articles.subtitle: 73 people have been reportedly rescued

articles.content: Actress Rashmika Mandanna showered praises on 'Animal' director Sandeep Reddy Vanga and said he respects women. "Vanga and Sukumar (director of 'Pushpa' and 'Pushpa 2') think that a woman standing up against a man who can kill 200 people is possible because of their respect towards women," she said. Mandanna will next be seen with Salman Khan in 'Sikandar'.
articles.title: He thinks women are powerful: Rashmika on 'Animal' director Vanga
articles.subtitle: To know what else she said

articles.content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge asked PM Narendra Modi to remove Union Minister Amit Shah before midnight over his remarks on BR Ambedkar. "PM instead of reprimanding Amit Shah...is defending him," Kharge said. Shah criticised Congress for repeatedly taking name of BR Ambedkar saying, if the party had taken God's name so many times they could have earned place in heaven.
articles.title: PM should sack Shah by midnight if he respects Ambedkar: Kharge
articles.subtitle: 'They support each other's misdeeds'

articles.content: Russia has detained a man from Uzbekistan, who investigators say placed the bomb inside a scooter which killed General Igor Kirillov, head of Russia's Nuclear, Biological, and Chemical Defence Forces. The man was reportedly paid approximately ₹85 lakh by Ukrainian security services. Ex-Russian President Dmitry Medvedev said the assassination was an act of terrorism and sought 'immediate revenge'.
articles.title: Man accused of killing Russian general Kirillov was paid ₹85 lakh
articles.subtitle: The suspect's identity has not been revealed

articles.content: The BCCI has shared a video showing Ravichandran Ashwin's retirement speech in the dressing room at the Gabba in Brisbane. In the speech, Ashwin said, "Trust me guys everybody's time comes and today was truly my time." "I have thoroughly enjoyed it...built some great friendships and relationships over the last five years...notably," he added. Ashwin also cut a farewell cake.
articles.title: Ashwin gives retirement speech in dressing room, says 'Trust me everybody's time comes'
articles.subtitle: To watch a video of his speech

articles.content: China has built at least 22 villages inside Bhutanese territory since 2016, according to several reports. Of these, eight have reportedly been constructed near disputed Doklam plateau since 2020. Notably, Doklam was the site of 73-day India-China standoff in 2017, when India intervened to stop China from building a road that would've given it access to southern part of plateau.
articles.title: China building villages near disputed Doklam plateau: Reports
articles.subtitle: Plateau's south near 'chicken's neck' corridor

articles.content: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Wednesday announced that Uniform Civil Code (UCC) will be implemented in Uttarakhand from January 2025. For public convenience a mobile application and portal have been prepared to implement UCC, Chief Minister's Office said. This will make Uttarakhand the first Indian state to implement UCC after Independence.
articles.title: UCC to be implemented in Uttarakhand from January 2025: CM Dhami
articles.subtitle: The bill has seven schedules and 392 sections

articles.content: Actress Shraddha Kapoor was seen losing her cool when a journalist asked her about her dating life at a recent event. The actress attended an event hosted by Aaj Tak on Saturday. During the conversation, the actress was asked about her relationship status. "Are you sure we're at Agenda Aaj Tak? Do you have a question for me?" she responded.
articles.title: Shraddha Kapoor loses cool after journalist asks if she's dating someone at event
articles.subtitle: 'Are you dating someone?' asked journalist

articles.content: Congress MPs Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, Manish Tewari, Sukhdeo Bhagat and Randeep Singh Surjewala will be in the Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) for deliberations on the 'One Nation, One Election' Bills, according to reports. The Bills were referred to the JPC after being introduced in the Parliament following a division vote.
articles.title: Priyanka Gandhi to be part of parliamentary panel on 'One Nation, One Election' Bills: Report
articles.subtitle: 269 MPs voted in favour of Bills, 198 against it

articles.content: Chennai-born Indian American Caitlin Sandra Neil has been crowned Miss India USA 2024. The 19-year-old is a second-year student at the University of California, Davis. Caitlin has spent the last 14 years in the United States. She wants to be a web designer and also pursue a modelling and acting career.
articles.title: Who is Caitlin Sandra, the 19-year-old crowned Miss India USA 2024?
articles.subtitle: Arshita Kathpalia was named Miss Teen India USA

articles.content: A ferry with around 60 people onboard started sinking near the Gateway of India in Mumbai, with efforts being made to rescue the passengers. The boat was travelling from the Gateway of India to Elephanta Island. Teams of the Indian Navy, Jawaharlal Nehru Port Authority (JNPA), Coast Guard, Yellow Gate police station and local fishermen are rescuing the passengers.
articles.title: Ferry with 60 onboard starts sinking near Gateway of India; rescue on
articles.subtitle: Video shows people in life jackets being rescued

articles.content: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant took to social media to pen a note for Ravichandran Ashwin after the latter announced his retirement from international cricket. "A true legend of the game. It’s been amazing sharing the field with you, learning from your craft and witnessing your greatness," he wrote.  "C'mon Ash...C'mon Ash forever," he added.
articles.title: Pant pens note for Ashwin after his retirement, says 'C'mon Ash, C'mon Ash forever'
articles.subtitle: Ashwin took 765 wickets in int'l cricket

articles.content: Canada has announced new border security rules amid US President-elect Donald Trump's threat to impose a 25% tariff on Canadian goods if the country doesn't secure its border to curb outflow of migrants. Canada will invest 1.3 billion CAD towards border security. A plan with an emphasis on surveillance, intelligence and technology has been privately presented to Trump’s incoming administration.
articles.title: Canada announces border security rules amid Trump's tariff threat
articles.subtitle: To know more

articles.content: A discomforting, thick mucus in your throat and chest is a common symptom of respiratory viruses like the flu. The mucus lines the moist surfaces of your body, like lungs and sinuses, and helps you fight illness. However, when you are down, doctors suggest it is better to spit out excess mucus.
articles.title: Should you spit out mucus when you cough?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: BJP national spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla criticised INDIA bloc and its partner DMK in Tamil Nadu over the state government allowing SA Basha's funeral procession. "Why was Basha's Janaza allowed? Because INDI puts vote bank security above national security," Poonawalla said. Over 1,500 police personnel were deployed in Tamil Nadu for Basha's funeral procession.
articles.title: INDI put vote bank above national security: BJP on Basha's funeral
articles.subtitle: 'DMK indulged in minority appeasement'

articles.content: The Indian rupee fell 3 paise to close at an all-time low of 84.94 against the US dollar on Wednesday. This comes ahead of the upcoming interest rate decision of the US Fed, which is expected to cut interest rates by 25 bps. At the interbank foreign exchange, the rupee opened at 84.92 and touched 84.95 during intra-day trade.
articles.title: Rupee falls to all-time low of 84.94 against US dollar
articles.subtitle: BSE Sensex closed at 80,182.20, down 502 points

articles.content: Zomato has surpassed automobile major Tata Motors and Bajaj Auto in terms of market capitalisation. As of Wednesday, Zomato's m-cap stood at ₹2.83 lakh crore compared to Tata Motors' ₹2.79 lakh crore and Bajaj Auto's ₹2.5 lakh crore m-cap. This comes ahead of Zomato's inclusion in the BSE Sensex's 30-share frontline index by replacing JSW Steel on Sensex.
articles.title: Zomato surpasses Tata Motors in m-cap
articles.subtitle: 'Zomato to see inflows worth $513 million'

articles.content: Team India captain Rohit Sharma took to Instagram to pen a note for Ravichandran Ashwin following his retirement from international cricket. "I am sure we'll have a lot of upcoming young bowlers with the classic Ashwin action," he wrote. "You're a true OG & legend of Indian cricket and world cricket and this team will miss having you," he added.
articles.title: I am sure we'll have a lot of upcoming young bowlers with classic Ashwin action: Rohit
articles.subtitle: 'You have been a match winner since match 1'

articles.content: Talking about age shaming, Sonakshi Sinha said male actors don't face this even when they romance actresses who're 30 years younger than them. "I've dealt with actors who are older than me who said that 'Oh she looks older than us'," said Sonakshi, adding, "I just want to thank them. I don't want to work with a person like you."
articles.title: I’ve dealt with actors older than me calling me older: Sonakshi
articles.subtitle: 'There's always an actress who's season's trend'

articles.content: AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal criticised PM Narendra Modi for "rubbing salt into the wound" after his attack on Congress following an uproar over Union Home Minister Amit Shah’s remarks on Dr BR Ambedkar. "What kind of explanation is this from the Prime Minister of the country?" he asked. PM Modi said Congress indulged in "dirty tricks" to obliterate Ambedkar's legacy.
articles.title: Rubbing salt to the wound: Kejriwal on PM's remark on Congress
articles.subtitle: PM also listed Congress' sins against Ambedkar

articles.content: DMart's Radhakishan Damani topped Hurun India's Top 200 Self-made Entrepreneurs of the Millennia 2024 list. He's followed by Zomato's Deepinder Goyal, Swiggy's Sriharsha & Nandan, MakeMyTrip's Deep Kalra & Rajesh Magow, Max's Abhay Soi, PolicyBazaar's Yashish & Alok, Dream11's Harsh Jain & Bhavit Sheth, Zerodha's Nithin & Nikhil Kamath, Razorpay's Harshil & Shashank and Nykaa's Falguni Nayar.
articles.title: Who are India's top 10 self-made entrepreneurs according to Hurun?
articles.subtitle: Zepto's Kaivalya youngest among the 200 on list

articles.content: Content delivery network (CDN) companies, including Netflix, Amazon, Universal Studios and Warner Bros have reportedly opposed the telecom regulator proposal to regulate them. They argued that they are not telecom operators and therefore do not fall under the regulator's jurisdiction, as per an ET report.
articles.title: Netflix, Amazon oppose TRAI’s proposal to regulate them
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Fintech Lendingkart reported a 97.2% decline in its consolidated net profit to ₹3.25 crore in the financial year 2023-24 (FY24) from ₹118.8 crore a year ago, primarily due to sharp increase in impairment loss on financial assets, loans and advances. Lendingkart first achieved profitability in FY23.
articles.title: Fintech Lendingkart reports 97% decline in profit in FY 2023-24
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: PM Narendra Modi shared a list of Congress' sins towards Dr BR Ambedkar on X. "Getting him defeated in elections not once but twice. Pandit Nehru campaigning against him and making his loss a prestige issue," PM Modi wrote. "Denying him a Bharat Ratna. Denying his portrait a place of pride in Parliament's Central Hall," he added.
articles.title: PM Modi shares 'list of Congress' sins' towards Dr BR Ambedkar
articles.subtitle: 'Congress did nothing to empower SCs and STs'

articles.content: Turkey and its militias are reportedly preparing for a large-scale military incursion into the Syrian territory controlled by the US-backed Kurdish Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF). The development comes amid the tensions between the Kurdish militias and the Turkish-backed militias, despite a pact that was struck between the SDF and the new Syrian government.
articles.title: Turkey preparing to attack US-backed troops in Syria: Reports
articles.subtitle: Turkey & US are NATO members

articles.content: Malayalam actor Mohanlal, in an interview with Galatta Plus, recalled performing Kathakali in 'Vanaprastham' even though he wasn't trained in it. "Even Amitabh Bachchan asked, 'Mohanlal, how did you do the Kathakali?'" the actor recalled. "I said, 'Sir I don't know'," he added. Mohanlal said he doesn't give strain to his thought process and brain by preparing a lot.
articles.title: Big B asked, 'How did you do Kathakali?': Mohanlal on Vanaprastham
articles.subtitle: 'Did a play in Sanskrit without knowing it'

articles.content: Indian consumers across tier-2 and 3 towns and cities focus on value and prefer tangible value-for-money offers as per a Bernstein report. The trend for consumers across metros and tier-1 cities was more towards convenience and faster deliveries. The research also highlighted the focus on accessibility and digital adoption for consumers from emerging markets.
articles.title: Tier-2 and 3 consumers focus on value over convenience: Report
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Two people (both pilots) were killed after a plane lost control and crashed into a vacant building near the Daniel K Inouye International Airport on Tuesday afternoon in Hawaii, US. The flight was a Kamaka Air Cessna 208 Caravan plane that was conducting a training flight when it suddenly went out of control and crashed.
articles.title: Video shows plane crashing into vacant building in US, 2 killed
articles.subtitle: The building was slated for demolition

articles.content: Singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh recently performed in Chandigarh. Days after his show, the organisers of Dosanjh's concert were fined ₹25,000 for creating a mess at the Sector-34 Exhibition Ground by Chandigarh municipal corporation. "No permission was granted for December 15 or December 16, but still the ground was full of garbage...The boundary fencing was found broken," Councillor Prem Lata said.
articles.title: Diljit Dosanjh's Chandigarh concert organisers fined for creating mess
articles.subtitle: Concert also allegedly breached noise limits

articles.content: Team India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin took to social media to share his first post following his retirement from international cricket. Sharing a video showing glimpses from his career, Ashwin wrote, "The love we give away is the only love we keep." Ashwin finished his international career as the second-highest wicket-taker, taking 765 wickets.
articles.title: The love we give away is the only love we keep: Ashwin in 1st post after retirement
articles.subtitle: Ashwin made his international debut in 2010

articles.content: A Delhi court granted interim bail to former JNU student Umar Khalid in 2020 Delhi riots conspiracy case. The bail has been granted for 7 days (December 28 to January 3) for attending a marriage in the family. Earlier this month, Khalid had questioned Delhi High Court regarding the basis on which he was made an accused in UAPA case.
articles.title: Umar Khalid gets 7 days interim bail in Delhi riots case
articles.subtitle: Northeast Delhi riots happened in February 2020

articles.content: All-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin, who retired on Wednesday, took 765 wickets in international cricket. Ashwin holds the record for dismissing left-handed batters the most times (268) in Test cricket. He is the fastest bowler to reach 250, 300 and 350 wickets in Test cricket. He has won the joint-most Player of the Series awards (11) in Test cricket.
articles.title: What records does R Ashwin hold in international cricket?
articles.subtitle: Ashwin had made his India debut in 2010

articles.content: India captain Rohit Sharma, during a press conference, forgot that Ajinkya Rahane and Cheteshwar Pujara haven't retired from international cricket. While answering a question on Team India missing Ravichandran Ashwin, Rahane and Pujara, Rohit talked about the trio. Rohit then remembered that Rahane and Pujara haven't retired, following which he jokingly told the reporter, "You'll get me killed."
articles.title: Rohit forgets Rahane, Pujara haven't retired, jokingly tells reporter 'You'll get me killed'
articles.subtitle: Ashwin retired from int'l cricket on Wednesday

articles.content: Sri Lankan Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath said the country will likely "re-negotiate" China's Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) projects, "recalibrate" old commitments. "Discussions will include plans for [projects], which [were] previously agreed upon as...grant," he said. Notably, Sri Lanka President Anura Kumara Dissanayake recently visited India on his first bilateral visit since assuming power.
articles.title: We'll likely renegotiate BRI with China: Sri Lankan Foreign Minister
articles.subtitle: Dissanayake to visit China in January

articles.content: Reacting to shooting in a school in US' Wisconsin in which two people were killed and six were injured, Vice President Kamala Harris said "senseless gun violence again visited our classrooms". Kamala stated she is praying for all those who are injured. A 15-year-old girl had opened fire in the school. She also shot herself dead with the same handgun.
articles.title: Gun violence again visited classroom: Kamala on Wisconsin shooting
articles.subtitle: 'Mourning for those who were killed'

articles.content: Congress leaders brought a tea kettle to the Madhya Pradesh Assembly premises on Wednesday to protest against the ruling BJP. Opposition leader Umang Singhar said the act was intended to raise the issue of unemployment. He said, "Youth are unemployed in the state. What will they do for their daily bread? They will have to sell tea under compulsion."
articles.title: Opp'n leader takes kettle to MP Assembly, says youth will sell tea
articles.subtitle: 'The government should tell what it is doing'

articles.content: A child's heart is resilient, adapting to congenital defects without symptoms for years. Interventional Cardiologist Dr Ravindranath Reddy notes that efficient oxygen use, lower demands, and the absence of comorbidities help children tolerate heart defects. However, as the body grows, hidden defects can surface. Regular monitoring and early diagnosis are crucial for long-term heart health.
articles.title: How children’s hearts adapt to defects?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A video claiming to show employees lying flat on their office floor to welcome their boss in China has gone viral on social media. "Qiming branch welcomes Boss Huang! Whether in life or death, we will not fail our work mission," they chanted. While the company denied the incident, local government is investigating the company's policies and the video's authenticity.
articles.title: Employees seen lying on floor, chanting slogans to welcome boss in China
articles.subtitle: Video sparked toxic work culture debate in China

articles.content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said that Enforcement Directorate has, in total, restored properties worth ₹22,280 crore to pay back debts of major wanted economic offenders. Around ₹1,052 crore has been restored to banks from Nirav Modi and ₹2,565.90 crores from Mehul Choksi and others. Around ₹14,131 crore from Vijay Mallya has been restored to the Public Sector Banks.
articles.title: How much money has been seized from Vijay Mallya, Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi?
articles.subtitle: ₹185 crore restored from Surya Pharmaceuticals

articles.content: TMC MP Derek O'Brien has filed a notice of a question of privilege against Union Home Minister Amit Shah over the remarks he made on Dr BR Ambedkar in the Rajya Sabha on Tuesday. Derek O'Brien said that the remarks undermined the legacy of Ambedkar and the dignity of the House and sought action against Shah.
articles.title: TMC moves privilege notice against Amit Shah over Ambedkar remarks
articles.subtitle: Opposition has demanded Amit Shah's apology

articles.content: Maharashtra Deputy CM Eknath Shinde has reacted after Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray met CM Devendra Fadnavis in Nagpur on Tuesday. Speaking to reporters, Shinde said, "It’s good. Many people meet the CM but they should look inside themselves and remember what all they had said about him in the last 2.5 years."
articles.title: Remember what they said about him: Shinde as Uddhav meets Fadnavis
articles.subtitle: Uddhav's son Aaditya Thackeray also met Fadnavis

articles.content: Over 1,500 police personnel were deployed in Tamil Nadu to control crowd that gathered to take part in the funeral procession of SA Basha, the mastermind of the 1998 Coimbatore serial bomb blasts. Basha died on Monday evening due to age-related ailments, police said. Basha and 16 others from Al-Umma had been serving life imprisonment in connection with 1998 blasts.
articles.title: 1,500 police personnel deployed for Coimbatore blasts mastermind Basha's funeral in TN
articles.subtitle: 84-year-old Basha was on parole

articles.content: Ukraine has alleged that Russian soldiers are burning the faces of dead North Korean soldiers to conceal their identities and hide their presence. President Volodymyr Zelenskyy took to X to share a purported video, saying, "This madness must be stopped." Ukraine's HUR military intelligence agency reported recently that North Korean units fighting for Russia suffered at least 30 casualties.
articles.title: Russia burning faces of dead N Korean soldiers, claims Zelenskyy; shares video
articles.subtitle: Russia hasn't commented on Ukraine's claims

articles.content: Actress Deepti Naval said when she learnt that legendary filmmaker-actor Raj Kapoor passed away, she just ran from where she was then. "I just barged in. His last rites were being performed...I stood there, silent and devastated," she added. Deepti said she later realised she was the only woman present as women weren't allowed by the family at the funeral.
articles.title: I was the only woman present at Raj Kapoor's last rites: Deepti
articles.subtitle: 'I breached even this divide to bid him goodbye'

articles.content: Reacting to India's celebrations in the dressing room after avoiding follow-on in Gabba Test, ex-Australia cricketer Brad Haddin said, "That reaction surprised me, all they did was pass the follow-on." Jasprit Bumrah and Akash Deep stitched a 39-run partnership for the 10th wicket and helped India avoid the follow-on in the match which eventually ended in a draw.
articles.title: All India did was pass the follow-on: Brad Haddin on celebrations
articles.subtitle: The match was played in Brisbane

articles.content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju has criticised the Congress party as it staged a protest over Union Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks on BR Ambedkar in Rajya Sabha. "Congress and its allies have taken a small clip from Amit Shah's speech in the Rajya Sabha yesterday, distorted it, and made it viral. I want to condemn it," he said.
articles.title: Congress distorted Amit Shah's speech, made it viral: Kiren Rijiju
articles.subtitle: 'Shah stated how Congress humiliated Ambedkar'

articles.content: A Bangladesh court has commuted the death penalty of Paresh Baruah, chief of banned terror organisation United Liberation Front of Assam (ULFA), to life term in a 2004 arms smuggling case. The case involved smuggling of weapons, intercepted during the rule of ex-Bangladesh PM Khaleda Zia, intended for anti-India militant groups. The court also acquitted ex-minister Lutfozzaman Babar.
articles.title: B'desh court cancels death penalty for ULFA chief Paresh Baruah
articles.subtitle: Five others also acquitted in case

articles.content: A mysterious disease locally referred to as 'Dinga Dinga', which translates to 'shaking like one is dancing', is spreading in Uganda's Bundibugyo district, reports said. Its symptoms include fever and shaking of the body, leading to difficulties in walking. Since its outbreak several months ago, more than 300 people have been infected, most of whom are women and girls.
articles.title: What is 'Dinga Dinga', mysterious disease spreading in Uganda?
articles.subtitle: 'Mostly self-healing, tackled with antibiotics'

articles.content: Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray said he felt bad for NCP's Chhagan Bhujbal who has been excluded from Maharashtra's expanded ministerial cabinet. "I feel bad for Bhujbal and for several others. Some of them had...gotten new suits to wear during oath-taking," Uddhav said. "⁠I've learned...my lesson in 2019 [elections]. Those who're unhappy now, are learning their lesson," he added.
articles.title: I learned lesson in 2019, they're learning now: Uddhav on Bhujbal
articles.subtitle: Undivided Shiv Sena left BJP's alliance in 2019

articles.content: Chennai-born Indian American Caitlin Sandra Neil has won Miss India USA 2024 during the annual pageant held in New Jersey. "I want to leave a positive lasting impact on my community and focus on women's empowerment and literacy," Caitlin stated in a media release. The pageant was organised by the India Festival Committee (IFC).
articles.title: 19-year-old Indian-American Caitlin Sandra crowned Miss India USA 2024
articles.subtitle: Sanskriti Sharma was crowned Mrs India USA

articles.content: Aamir Khan Productions penned a note after Kiran Rao directorial 'Laapataa Ladies' failed to make it to the Oscars 2025 shortlist. "We are of course disappointed, but equally we're immensely grateful for the incredible support...we've received throughout this journey...For us, this is not the end but a step forward," the note read. Several filmmakers extended their support to the team.
articles.title: Not the end: Aamir Khan Productions on 'Laapataa…' missing Oscars shortlist
articles.subtitle: The film starred Pratibha Ranta & Nitanshi Goel

articles.content: The director of a play school in Noida was arrested for allegedly spying on women as they used the loo, officials said. The camera was discovered by a teacher, who informed the accused director, Navnish Sahay. After he didn't take any action, she spoke to the security guard who blamed the director. Sahay allegedly watched footage from the camera live.
articles.title: School director installs spy camera in washroom to watch female teachers; held
articles.subtitle: Sahay had ordered the camera online

articles.content: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday hit out at Congress after it accused Home Minister Amit Shah of insulting BR Ambedkar and even sought the minister's resignation. "If Congress and its rotten ecosystem think their malicious lies can hide their...insult towards Dr Ambedkar, they're gravely mistaken!" said PM. Congress indulged in "dirty tricks" to obliterate Ambedkar's legacy, he added.
articles.title: Malicious lies, rotten ecosystem: PM as Congress asks Shah to quit over Ambedkar remark
articles.subtitle: PM listed Congress' sins against Ambedkar

articles.content: Millionaire Barbara Corcoran, known for being a judge on US' Shark Tank, has revealed that she refuses to fly first class because a coach ticket costs 25% less. Adding that she gets free miles which she gives away to her family, she said, "What's more important, that everybody gets free vacations or that I'm comfortable in first class?"
articles.title: Millionaire Barbara Corcoran reveals why she won't fly first class
articles.subtitle: 'I guess I could afford to do both, but I won't'

articles.content: Police said a case has been filed against a woman after she slapped a six-year-old kid who had fight with her child in a residential complex in Greater Noida. The woman then slapped another woman who was recording her and asking, "You tell us, why did you hit the child?" The child reportedly got a bruise on his cheek.
articles.title: Woman slaps 6-yr-old child, then slaps woman recording her in Greater Noida society
articles.subtitle: 'I'll slap him whenever I see him,' she said

articles.content: Ex-NCB officer Sameer Wankhede said Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan's case is "one of the smallest cases" of his career. "I don't agree that it's the 'elephant in the room', I'd rather think it as...a microorganism in the room," said Wankhede. "They aren't the only people I've handled. There are other 3,400 cases that I've dealt with," he added.
articles.title: Aryan Khan's case is one of the smallest of my career: Wankhede
articles.subtitle: Aryan was arrested in 2021 in a cruise drug case

articles.content: Dell CEO Michael Dell, during 'In Good Company' podcast, said humour is "incredibly" important in his company. "If you can't laugh, joke around, play tricks on people, you're doing it wrong," said Dell, adding, "You have to be able to laugh at yourself." Talking about overworking, Dell said, "I learned...that there's a diminishing return to the number of hours worked."
articles.title: If you can't joke around at work, you're doing it wrong: Dell CEO
articles.subtitle: 'If you're going to do something for long time'

articles.content: AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal announced on Wednesday 'Sanjeevani Yojna', under which all senior citizens aged above 60 in Delhi will receive free medical treatment in both private and government hospitals. He said the scheme will be implemented if AAP wins the upcoming Delhi polls. There will be no upper limit on the treatment cost, the former CM said.
articles.title: Free treatment for those above 60 at all Delhi hospitals if AAP wins poll: Kejriwal
articles.subtitle: 'Registration for this will start in 1-2 days'

articles.content: Reacting to India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin announcing his retirement from international cricket, commentator Harsha Bhogle said, "One of the greatest to have played our game." "What you leave behind puts you among the best and there is a page in the Hall of Fame for you," he stated. Ashwin picked 537 wickets in 106 Test matches.
articles.title: There is a page in Hall of Fame for you: Bhogle as Ashwin retires
articles.subtitle: Ashwin picked 156 wickets in 116 ODIs

articles.content: All-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin retired from international cricket aged 38 on Wednesday. His net worth is estimated to be more than ₹135 crore. He has Grade A contract with BCCI, earning an annual salary of ₹5 crore. His home in Chennai is valued to be around ₹9 crore. He was bought by CSK in IPL mega auction for ₹9.75 crore.
articles.title: What is R Ashwin's net worth?
articles.subtitle: Ashwin took 765 wickets in international cricket

articles.content: In a major operation targeting narcotics distribution, the Mangaluru City Crime Branch (CCB) arrested a Nigerian national, Michael Okafar Odikpo, for allegedly supplying cocaine from Goa to Mangaluru. The 44-year-old was apprehended with 30 grams of cocaine, cash, and a vehicle linked to the illegal trade.
articles.title: Mangaluru police arrest Nigerian national for supplying cocaine
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) has extended the deadline for free online Aadhaar updates to June 14, 2025. The free online document upload facility is available only for modifying demographic details such as name, date of birth, address and mobile number via the myAadhaar portal. Biometric updates require a visit to Aadhaar centres, where nominal fee is charged.
articles.title: Deadline to update Aadhaar details online for free extended
articles.subtitle: The initial deadline for free updates was Dec 14

articles.content: Elon Musk has funded a school called 'Ad Astra' and will soon open it in Texas, US. The school's website says it offers a "progressive learning environment that emphasises the integration of Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics (STEM) into its curriculum" to children aged 3-9. In 2014, Musk opened a private school for his kids and the children of SpaceX employees.
articles.title: World's richest man Elon Musk to soon open school for kids
articles.subtitle: Musk has fathered at least 12 children

articles.content: Farmers blocked Railway tracks across Punjab as part of their three-hour 'rail roko' protest in 23 districts of the state, including Moga and Faridkot. Organised by the Samyukta Kisan Morcha (Non-Political) and Kisan Mazdoor Morcha, the protest will continue till 3 pm. Farmers have been protesting for a few months on their demands, including legal guarantee of MSP on crops.
articles.title: Farmers begin rail roko protest in Punjab, train services affected
articles.subtitle: Earlier, farmers' march to Delhi was stopped

articles.content: BSE and NSE are in discussions to keep the stock markets operational on the Budget Day next year on February 1, which falls on a Saturday, reported CNBC-TV18. The report added the exchanges are exploring this option to ensure smooth market operations. Markets were kept open on Saturday, February 1, 2020, and on Saturday, February 28, 2015 for Budget announcements.
articles.title: BSE, NSE may remain open on Sat, Feb 1 for Budget 2025: Report
articles.subtitle: 'Trading hours may follow usual market timings'

articles.content: Several MPs of the I.N.D.I.A bloc, including Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, staged a protest in Parliament premises on Wednesday against Home Minister Amit Shah's comments on BR Ambedkar. They accused Shah of insulting Ambedkar and demanded his resignation and an apology. Meanwhile, BJP has refuted the charges and said, "Clipped video won't change the reality of Congress which hates...Ambedkar."
articles.title: Oppn stages protest, demands Shah's apology for remark on Ambedkar
articles.subtitle: 'Again a cheap trick of the Congress Party'

articles.content: Congress leader Rohin Reddy criticised BRS leaders' protest for auto drivers led by KTR. Speaking to ANI, he said, "Congress is always standing beside the auto drivers. Nine auto unions are with the Congress party. [KT Rama Rao] is just trying to create drama in the Assembly. I'm suggesting that he stop doing all this and stand for public issues."
articles.title: Congress' Rohin Reddy slams KTR's protest for auto drivers
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: BRS leader KT Rama Rao and MLAs protested dressed as auto drivers, demanding the Telangana government fulfil promises made to auto drivers. They claimed that the promises made to auto drivers involved creation of a welfare board, ₹12,000 monthly aid, and insurance.
articles.title: BRS demands Telangana govt fulfil promises made to auto drivers
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Ola Founder Bhavish Aggarwal warned his employees over their poor attendance. "It's shocking that a lot of people have very poor attendance. I'd imagine everyone has the basic self-respect to not fleece the company by not even turning up for work," he told the employees. "Those who misused freedom so far, HR will have a conversation with you," he added.
articles.title: Shocking, don't fleece the company: Ola's Bhavish warns staff for poor attendance
articles.subtitle: 'More stringent attendance expectation to start'

articles.content: Academy Award winner Guneet Monga-produced live-action short film 'Anuja' has been shortlisted for the Best Live Action Short Film category at Oscars 2025. The film sheds light on the important issue of child labour in the garment industry and features Ananya Shanbhag and Sajda Pathan in key roles. 'Anuja' will be competing with 14 other short films.
articles.title: Guneet Monga-backed Anuja shortlisted for Best Live Action Short Film at Oscars
articles.subtitle: 'Laapataa Ladies' out of Oscars 2025 race

articles.content: Delhi High Court issued notice to ED on Leena Paulose's bail plea in a ₹200 crore laundering case. Detained for over three years, she cited rights violations. ED must respond by January 22, 2025. The case links to extortion of Aditi Singh, wife of Religare promoter Shivinder Singh.
articles.title: Delhi HC issues notice to ED on Leena Paulose's bail plea
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: On Wednesday, a tragic house fire in Kathua district, Jammu & Kashmir, claimed the lives of six family members, including two children, due to asphyxiation. The fire broke out late at night while the family was asleep. All victims were found unconscious and later declared dead at the hospital. Authorities are investigating the cause of the incident.
articles.title: Six, including two children, die in Kathua house fire
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: BJP responded to Congress' criticism over Home Minister Amit Shah's comment that taking Constitution architect BR Ambedkar's name has become "fashion". Congress claimed BJP 'hates' Ambedkar, after which BJP shared Shah's full speech, wherein he talked about Ambedkar leaving Pandit Nehru's Cabinet due to 'false assurances'. "Is it appropriate to take his name if your party opposed him?" asked Shah.
articles.title: BJP shares Shah's full speech as Congress criticises him for 'fashion' remark on Ambedkar
articles.subtitle: Congress demanded apology from Shah

articles.content: India experienced a 73% increase in electronic waste (e-waste) generation, rising from 1.01 million metric tonnes (MT) in 2019-20 to 1.751 million MT in 2023-24. The data was shared by Tokhan Sahu, Minister of State for Housing and Urban Affairs, during a session in the Rajya Sabha on December 16.
articles.title: India’s e-waste surges by 73% in 5 years
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The Enforcement Directorate raided the residence and office of Khirod Mallik, brother of BJD leader Pramila Mallik, in a ₹231 crore loan fraud case. The raids occurred at three locations. The loan was secured in the name of Bharat Integrated Social Welfare Agency (BISWA), an NGO run by him.
articles.title: ED raids BJD leader Pramila Mallik's brother in loan fraud case
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: All-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin, while announcing his retirement sitting alongside captain Rohit Sharma, said, "We are the last bunch of OGs left out in the dressing room." He stated, "I've had a lot of fun. I must say I have created a lot of memories alongside Rohit [Sharma] and several of my other teammates," Ashwin took 765 wickets in international cricket.
articles.title: We are the last bunch of OGs in the dressing room: Ashwin during retirement announcement
articles.subtitle: Ashwin had made his India debut in 2010

articles.content: Punjab police have revealed that terror groups are collaborating with gangsters behind a series of blasts in the state. Six blasts have occurred in just 25 days since November 23 in the Majha region. DGP Gaurav Yadav visited Amritsar and Jalandhar to take stock of the situation.
articles.title: Terror groups involving gangsters in Punjab blasts, say police
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: India-made film Santosh has been nominated for the Oscars 2025 under the 'Best International Feature' category, representing the United Kingdom. The Hindi-language crime drama is a feature-film debut for director Sandhya Suri, a prominent British-Indian filmmaker known for documentaries and short films like 'I for India' and 'The Field'. The film stars Shahana Goswami and Sunita Rajwar.
articles.title: Who is Sandhya Suri, director of Oscar nominated film 'Santosh'?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticized the government for prioritizing crony businesses, leading to economic issues like a weakening manufacturing sector, rising trade deficits, high inflation, and slowing GDP growth. He stated that only a few billionaires benefit while farmers, workers, and the middle class face hardships.
articles.title: Rahul Gandhi slams govt for trade deficit and economic woes
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli penned a note on X for Ravichandran Ashwin, who retired from international cricket on Wednesday. He wrote, "I've played with you for 14 years and when you told me today you’re retiring...it made me a bit emotional." He added, "I’ve enjoyed every bit of the journey with you...Your skill and match winning contributions...are second to none."
articles.title: When you told me today that you are retiring, it made me a bit emotional: Kohli to Ashwin
articles.subtitle: 'Thanks for everything buddy'

articles.content: X (formerly Twitter) owner Elon Musk has urged the platform's users to stop using hashtags. "Please stop using hashtags. The system doesn't need them anymore and they look ugly," Musk posted on X. Musk was responding to xAI's chatbot Grok, which said, "If you want to watch your engagement plummet like a stone into the abyss...fill your posts with hashtags."
articles.title: Stop using hashtags on X: Elon Musk
articles.subtitle: 'Hashtags are your ticket to nowhere'

articles.content: All-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin retired from international cricket on Wednesday. Ashwin is the second Indian after Anil Kumble to have taken 500-plus Test wickets. He retired after drawn third Test of Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2024-25 with his final wicket being a Mitchell (Marsh). Notably, Kumble also retired after drawn third Test of BGT 2008 with his final wicket being a Mitchell (Johnson).
articles.title: What are the coincidences between Ashwin and Kumble's international retirements?
articles.subtitle: Ashwin took 537 wickets in Test cricket

articles.content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced in Parliament that the BJP is determined to implement the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) across all states. He said, "It will be examined legally and there will be discussions…suggestions will be accepted. After that, the government will bring a common civil code in all states."
articles.title: BJP will implement Uniform Civil Code in all states: Amit Shah
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A man has been arrested from Noida for threatening to kill Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, police said on Tuesday. A pistol, a knife and some objectionable pictures were also recovered from the accused. The man is said to be a resident of West Bengal's Malda. His family reportedly came to India from Bangladesh many years ago.
articles.title: Man arrested from Noida for threatening to kill UP CM Yogi
articles.subtitle: A Mumbai woman also threatened to kill UP CM

articles.content: Solar solutions provider Solarium Green Energy has received approval from the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) for its DRHP. The company filed the papers for IPO in September and intends to issue 55 lakh equity shares, each with a face value of ₹10. Founded in 2018 by Ankit Garg, Solarium is bootstrapped and hasn't raised any equity funding till now.
articles.title: Solarium Green Energy's DRHP for IPO approved by BSE
articles.subtitle: Solarium reported PAT of ₹15.59 crore in FY24

articles.content: Team India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has ended his career as the seventh-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket. Ashwin took 537 wickets in 106 Test matches. Overall in international cricket, Ashwin took 765 wickets and finished as the 11th highest wicket-taker. Ashwin made his Test debut in 2011.
articles.title: Ashwin ends career as 7th highest wicket-taker in Test cricket
articles.subtitle: He took 37 five-wicket hauls in int'l cricket

articles.content: The Tumakuru Town Police have arrested a 30-year-old realtor, Maruthi Hanumantharayappa, for forging the letterhead of Karnataka’s Home Minister, G Parameshwara, to secure and sell VIP Tirumala Darshan passes. The accused, a resident of Yelahanka New Town, allegedly sold these forged passes for amounts ranging from ₹6,000 to ₹10,000 each.
articles.title: Realtor arrested in Tumakuru for selling fake VIP Tirumala passes
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Union Minister Dr Jitendra Singh has launched Kisan Kavach, India's first anti-pesticide bodysuit, designed to protect farmers from harmful pesticide exposure. This launch represents a significant step towards ensuring the safety of farmers and aligns with government's vision of using science and technology to empower agriculture.
articles.title: Govt launches India's first anti-pesticide bodysuit 'Kisan Kavach'
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Mohammed Siraj dismissed Travis Head on Day 5 of the 3rd BGT 2024-25 Test at The Gabba. A young fan celebrated joyfully by mimicking Siraj's iconic 'go back' gesture. Siraj had previously used the celebration in the Adelaide Test. The video of the fan’s imitation went viral, adding to the excitement of India’s performance.
articles.title: Young fan mimics Siraj’s iconic celebration after Travis’ wicket
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The Russian Health Ministry said it has developed a new cancer vaccine, which is set to be launched in 2025 and which will be distributed for free, state-owned TASS news agency reported. The mRNA vaccine suppressed tumour development and potential metastases during pre-clinical trials, said head of a state-owned research centre. It is unclear which cancers the vaccine treats.
articles.title: Russia claims to develop its own 'cancer vaccine', will distribute it for free
articles.subtitle: Cancer cases reportedly rising in Russia

articles.content: In a tragic incident on Monday night, three individuals lost their lives in Sindhanur town, Raichur, Karnataka, after a speeding lorry overturned, spilling bags of paddy husks onto them. The accident occurred near Dollars Colony Cross, close to the PWD camp, police reported. The deceased were identified as Shivaraj Rampur (28) and Mallikarjun Sarjapur (29).
articles.title: Three killed in Sindhanur as overturned lorry traps bystanders
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Sri Vaikundam Station Master A Jawber Ali has been selected for the Athi Vishisht Rail Seva Puraskar for managing the Senthur Express rescue during the December 2023 floods. He led efforts to save 500 stranded passengers. The award will be presented at the 69th Railway Week in New Delhi on December 21.
articles.title: Sri Vaikundam station master wins Athi Vishisht Rail Seva Puraskar
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A man's X post asking, "How is Zomato allowed to sell ₹10 water bottles for ₹100 at concert venues where no one's allowed to bring their own bottles," has gone viral on social media. "Outright theft," an X user said, while another said, "Sue them." Zomato apologised and responded, "We weren't event organisers but the ticketing partner...we've noted your feedback."
articles.title: 'How is Zomato allowed to sell ₹10 water bottle for ₹100,' asks man in viral post
articles.subtitle: 'Thank you for talking this loud'

articles.content: Lara Trump said that God had a hand in her father-in-law Donald Trump winning 2024 presidential elections. "You have to believe that God has him here for a purpose and that God's going to continue to look out for him," she stated. Trump defeated Kamala Harris in the elections by winning 312 seats.
articles.title: God had a hand in this: Lara Trump on Donald Trump's win in polls
articles.subtitle: Trump will become President for 2nd time

articles.content: High net worth individuals currently hold 48% of global wealth, projected to reach 55% soon, says a report by Avendus. Asia and the Middle East lead growth, surpassing North America and Europe. The shift toward professional wealth management and alternative investments is reshaping global financial dynamics.
articles.title: HNWIs hold 48% of wealth, projected to reach 55% globally
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Purple United Sales shares made a strong debut on NSE SME on Wednesday at a premium of 58% over the IPO price. The shares were listed at ₹199, higher than the issue price of ₹126. The IPO consists of fresh issue of 26,04,000 equity shares aggregating to ₹32.81 crore. The shares are currently trading at ₹209.
articles.title: Purple United Sales shares list at 58% premium over IPO price
articles.subtitle: The IPO had opened on Dec 11

articles.content: A complaint of medical negligence has been filed against a doctor at the Mother and Child Department of the Kalaburagi district hospital following the death of a 23-year-old new mother, Bhagyashri Shivaji. According to her husband, Shivaji, Bhagyashri delivered a baby boy at the Afzalpur government hospital on Tuesday.
articles.title: Complaint filed against doctor in Kalaburagi after woman's death
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Team India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin and former India captain Virat Kohli were seen hugging each other after a long conversation in Team India's dressing room at the Gabba in Brisbane. Ashwin later announced his retirement from international cricket. The India-Australia Gabba Test ended in a draw.
articles.title: Ravichandran Ashwin, Virat Kohli hug each other in dressing room
articles.subtitle: Ashwin wasn't in India playing XI in Gabba Test

articles.content: In a significant move to counter Naxal influence, the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) has established a security camp in Gundam village, Chhattisgarh, once a Naxal bastion. Beyond security, the camp includes a free medical facility that has become a lifeline for villagers who previously struggled to access healthcare.
articles.title: CRPF sets up security camp with medical facility in Gundam
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A Class 10 student in Telangana was left paralysed in her right leg and hand after reportedly being bitten by rats multiple times over the course of eight months. She was reportedly bitten 15 times by rats and was administered anti-rabies vaccine each time she was bitten between March-November. Her family alleged the repeated rat bites led to her paralysis.
articles.title: Girl paralysed after rats bite her 15 times in 8 months in T'gana
articles.subtitle: The student is currently receiving treatment

articles.content: After Sonakshi Sinha called his remarks on her upbringing "distasteful", 'Shaktimaan' actor Mukesh Khanna said, "I had no...intention to malign her or her father (Shatrughan Sinha), who's my senior." He added, "My intention was to react to today's generation...called Gen Z by elders, which has become slaves to Google...and mobile phones. Their knowledge is limited to Wikipedia."
articles.title: Used her example to highlight Gen Z's limited knowledge: Mukesh as Sonakshi slams remarks
articles.subtitle: Sonakshi failed to answer question on Ramayana

articles.content: A Chinese delegation, led by Shanghai’s Vice Mayor Hua Yuan, arrived in Taiwan's Taipei city for the Taipei-Shanghai City Forum. This marks a rare instance of official cross-strait engagement amidst tense Taiwan-China relations. The forum, established in 2010, serves as a platform for fostering municipal cooperation and dialogue.
articles.title: Chinese officials arrive in Taipei for Taipei-Shanghai City Forum
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more
