articles.content: Vishal Mega Mart shares debuted on the NSE on Wednesday at ₹104 per share, a premium of 33.33% over the IPO allotment price of ₹78. Later, it extended gains to ₹111.19 per share on the NSE, rising 42.55%. The company's ₹8,000-crore IPO received a bumper response, with the public issue subscribed over 27 times during the three-day bidding last week.
articles.title: Vishal Mega Mart shares list at 33% premium after ₹8,000-crore IPO
articles.subtitle: IPO was priced in the range of ₹74-78 per share

articles.content: India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has announced his retirement from international cricket. Ashwin's announcement comes after India's Gabba Test against Australia. The 38-year-old wasn't a part of India's playing XI in the Test. He was also not included in the Perth Test. Ashwin took 765 wickets in 287 international matches for India. He scored 4,394 international runs, including six Test tons.
articles.title: Ravichandran Ashwin retires from international cricket
articles.subtitle: Ashwin made his India debut in 2010

articles.content: The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting (MIB) has issued a stern advisory to Over-the-Top (OTT) platforms, cautioning them against airing content that promotes or glorifies the use of narcotic drugs and psychotropic substances. The advisory urges OTT platforms to be 'mindful of their social responsibility'.
articles.title: MIB issues advisory to OTT platforms on depictions of drug use
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: An Instagram post claims mix of soda, coffee, Colgate, tomato juice, and lemon juice cleans underarms in 5 minutes and prevents hair growth. The Medical Dialogues Fact Check Team found this claim to be False. Experts warn these ingredients may cause adverse skin reactions, and hair growth prevention requires proven methods like waxing or laser. Hence, the claim is false.
articles.title: Can soda, coffee, Colgate, tomato, lemon juice remove hair?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: AAP MP Sanjay Singh criticized Union Home Minister Amit Shah over his remarks on BR Ambedkar, accusing BJP of disrespecting Ambedkar's legacy. Congress leaders joined the backlash, calling Shah's comments an insult. The row has intensified debates on Ambedkar's role and political narratives.
articles.title: Sanjay Singh slams Amit Shah over remarks on Ambedkar
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Prominent Congress figures, including Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi, and members of the Congress Working Committee (CWC), will convene in Belagavi on December 26. Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar announced that this meeting aligns with the Gandhi Bharat programme, commemorating the centenary of the 1924 Congress session held in Belagavi.
articles.title: Congress leaders to assemble in Belagavi for historic CWC meet
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: US authorities on Tuesday charged Luigi Mangione, suspected of killing UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in New York on December 4, with murder, including a charge of second-degree murder "as an act of terrorism". Mangione faces a total of 11 charges, including three counts of murder along with other weapon and forgery charges, as per court documents.
articles.title: Mangione charged with murder in UnitedHealthcare CEO's killing
articles.subtitle: Mangione is held on gun charges in Pennsylvania

articles.content: Bengaluru’s historic Queen Victoria statue at Queen’s Circle has been damaged, with its crown dislodged under unclear circumstances. The statue, unveiled by George Frederick Ernest Albert on February 5, 1906, is a prominent heritage landmark. Heritage Beku, a conservation group, raised concerns, suggesting the crown may have been deliberately removed.
articles.title: Queen Victoria statue at Bengaluru’s Queen's Circle suffers damage
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The India-Australia Gabba Test ended in a draw after rain forced early Stumps on the final day. The five-match series is tied at 1-1 with two Tests to go. Earier on Day 5, India were bowled out for 260 in their first innings after which Australia declared their second innings at 89/7. India were 8/0 before the play was abandoned.
articles.title: India-Australia Gabba Test ends in a draw, series tied at 1-1 with 2 Tests to go
articles.subtitle: To view the match scorecard

articles.content: MobiKwik shares were listed on the NSE with a premium of nearly 60% on Wednesday after the company's ₹572-crore IPO was subscribed 119 times. MobiKwik stock listed at ₹440 per share on the NSE, at a premium of 57.71% against the issue price of ₹279. On the BSE, the shares listed at ₹442.25 per share, a premium of 58.51%.
articles.title: MobiKwik makes bumper debut, shares list at nearly 60% premium over IPO price
articles.subtitle: MobiKwik IPO was fully subscribed in first hour

articles.content: The venue for Punjabi singer AP Dhillon's show on December 21 has been shifted from Sector 34 to Sector 25 in Chandigarh, following concerns over traffic, crowd management, and public safety. Authorities aim to improve arrangements, ensure smooth traffic flow, and minimize inconvenience to residents during the event.
articles.title: AP Dhillon's Chandigarh show venue shifted to Sector 25
articles.subtitle: Concert moved to Sector 25 amid traffic concerns

articles.content: IMD Bhubaneswar forecasts light to moderate rainfall in Odisha. Isolated rains are likely in Ganjam, Gajapati, and nearby areas. Temperatures are expected to rise by 3-5 degree C. As per the IMD, light to moderate rainfall at isolated places accompanied with isolated thunderstorms and lightning are likely to occur in Odisha on December 19 and 20.
articles.title: IMD predicts rainfall and rising temperatures in Odisha
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Zomato is expected to witness inflows of about $513 million next week after the food delivery giant enters BSE Sensex's 30-share frontline index on December 23, brokerage firm Nuvama said. The inclusion would make Zomato the first new-age tech stock to enter the 30-share frontline index. It will replace JSW Steel, whose exclusion will lead to $252-million outflows, Nuvama added.
articles.title: Zomato to see $513 mn inflow after Sensex entry next week: Nuvama
articles.subtitle: Zomato stock surged over 135% in the year so far

articles.content: Raj Shamani asked MrBeast about how much he spends in a year and the latter said that his YouTube channel and Beast Games spending together was around $200 million this year. MrBeast further said that he spends $3 million on average for videos on his main YouTube channel. He added that he spends a lot on thumbnail designers and video production.
articles.title: Have spent around $200 million this year: MrBeast
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Congress' Priyanka Gandhi reacted after UP CM Yogi Adityanath criticised her for carrying bag with 'Palestine' written over it. "Congress leader was spotted with Palestine bag...while we're sending youths of UP to Israel for jobs," Adityanath said. Priyanka said, "Throwing our youth into war zones for employment isn't something to pat on the back for, but a matter of shame."
articles.title: Throwing youths to war zone is a shame: Priyanka on Yogi's remark
articles.subtitle: She also carried bag with B'desh written on it

articles.content: Reacting to India's celebrations in the dressing room after avoiding follow-on in Gabba Test, Australia off-spinner Nathan Lyon said, "It looked like their top order didn't want to bat if we enforced follow-on." "Pushing to enforce...follow-on was pretty challenging with Josh Hazlewood out. Mitchell Starc and Pat Cummins, they’ve been brilliant for Australia for a number of years," he added.
articles.title: Seemed India's top order didn't want to bat: Lyon on celebrations after avoiding follow-on
articles.subtitle: 'Privileged to be part of this bowling attack'

articles.content: 'Flying naked' is the latest cost-saving hack among travellers where they board flights without any carry-on or check-in baggage, but with just the clothes they are wearing at the time and some essentials in their pockets. Travellers say this results in no baggage fees and speedy, more convenient boarding. Travellers then either buy or rent essentials from their destination.
articles.title: What is 'flying naked', latest travel trend?
articles.subtitle: Critics argue trend impractical for longer trips

articles.content: Evidence of mass graves emerged in Syria after fall of dictatorship of Bashar al-Assad, an international war crimes prosecutor said. "We're talking about a system of state terror, which became a machinery of death," said former US war crimes ambassador-at-large Stephen Rapp. Over 1 lakh people are estimated to have been tortured and killed in Syria since 2013.
articles.title: Mass graves found in Syria after fall of dictator Assad, visuals surface
articles.subtitle: Not seen anything like this since Nazis: Rapp

articles.content: India batter Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said it is unfair to say that Kohli is out of form on the basis of two innings. "He has already scored a hundred in...series [against Australia]. How many players have got...hundred in the series?" Rajkumar stated. Kohli has registered scores of 5, 100*, 7, 11, 3 in the series so far.
articles.title: How many batters scored ton in series?: Kohli's coach on form
articles.subtitle: 'Kohli has been performing well since 2008'

articles.content: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta questioned the film selection of Film Federation of India (FFI) after Kiran Rao directorial 'Laapataa Ladies' failed to make it to the Oscars 2025 shortlist. "FFI does it again! Their strike rate and selection of films year after year is impeccable," Hansal wrote. "We shouldn't expect anything from the senile idiots at FFI," an X user wrote.
articles.title: FFI strike rate & selection impeccable: Hansal as 'Laapataa…' exits Oscars race
articles.subtitle: ''Laapataa…' wrong choice to represent India'

articles.content: A layer of fog covered parts of Delhi on Wednesday morning as the minimum temperature fell to 5°C, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD). Meanwhile, the air quality in the national capital remained in the "severe" category, with the overall AQI recorded at 442 at 8 am. Notably, GRAP-IV anti-pollution measures have also been reimposed in the Delhi-NCR region.
articles.title: Fog covers Delhi as temperature drops to 5°C, air quality 'severe'
articles.subtitle: Some areas reported visibility issues amid fog

articles.content: Actress Shahana Goswami shared a post after her film 'Santosh', a Hindi-language UK co-production set in India, got shortlisted in Best International Feature Film category for Oscars 2025. "So happy for the team especially our writer-director Sandhya Suri for this little glory of recognition…How incredible to be shortlisted from amongst 85 films," wrote Shahana. Several actors congratulated her.
articles.title: Little glory of recognition: Shahana as 'Santosh' gets shortlisted for Oscars
articles.subtitle: India's entry Laapataa Ladies out of Oscars race

articles.content: The Gauhati High Court has banned buffalo and bulbul fights after a petition by PETA India. The court ruled these fights violated animal cruelty laws, including the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act and the Wildlife Protection Act. This decision aims to prevent abuse and uphold animal welfare standards in Assam.
articles.title: Assam High Court bans buffalo, bulbul fights after PETA plea
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: NASA has again delayed the return of astronauts Sunita Williams and Barry Butch Wilmore, stranded for months on the International Space Station (ISS). NASA's SpaceX Crew-10, which would relieve Williams and Wilmore, is now targeting no earlier than late March 2025 for launch. "It gives NASA and SpaceX teams time to complete processing on a new Dragon spacecraft," NASA said.
articles.title: NASA again delays Sunita Williams' return from space
articles.subtitle: Both crews to be on board for a handover period

articles.content: Mitchell Santner has been appointed New Zealand's new white-ball captain, officially taking over the role from Kane Williamson, who stepped down after the ICC T20 World Cup in June. He'll start his captaincy tenure in the upcoming T20I and ODI series against Sri Lanka in late December and early January. Santner has picked 108 wickets in 107 ODIs so far.
articles.title: Mitchell Santner appointed New Zealand's white-ball captain
articles.subtitle: Santner has played 106 T20Is so far

articles.content: Kanika Tekriwal, founder of JetSetGo, revealed that India is building infrastructure for flying taxis with prices similar to Uber rides. eVTOL technology aims to cut 45-minute drives to 5-minute flights. She predicts personal air mobility will soon become affordable, transforming commuting. Success will depend on scalability and market size.
articles.title: Flying taxis fare in India will be same like Uber rides
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The Pentagon has ruled out security threats from recent drone sightings in New Jersey, stating they are likely commercial or recreational. Pentagon spokesperson Pat Ryder clarified that these drones pose no risk to national security or public safety unless they enter restricted airspace.
articles.title: Pentagon rules out threats from New Jersey drone sightings
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Gold prices edged higher on Wednesday as attention turned to the Federal Reserve's upcoming monetary policy decision, with the US central bank anticipated to implement a third rate cut this year and provide insights into its plans for 2025. Spot gold nudged 0.1% higher to $2,648.43 per ounce by 02:37 GMT. US gold futures were flat at $2,663.20.
articles.title: Gold prices edge higher with focus on Fed's policy decision
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The stage is set for the Vijay Hazare Trophy 2024, and Uttar Pradesh will be led by the dynamic Rinku Singh. Fresh off a solid performance in SMAT, Uttar Pradesh enters the tournament with renewed confidence. This leadership opportunity is a golden chance for Rinku to cement his credentials not just as a player but as a captain as well.
articles.title: Rinku Singh to lead Uttar Pradesh in Vijay Hazare Trophy 2024
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Army and Assam Rifles reportedly seized a Starlink satellite dish and an antenna, along with weapons including sniper rifles, pistols, grenades, etc from an insurgent group in Manipur. Starlink, owned by billionaire Elon Musk, is not available in India as it's not licensed to operate here. Musk called the news "false", saying, "Starlink satellite beams are turned off over India."
articles.title: Elon Musk's Starlink devices seized from insurgents in Manipur, he reacts
articles.subtitle: Agencies have launched probe into the recovery

articles.content: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said Israel will be eliminated and Hezbollah cannot be defeated. Khamenei stated that Israel's efforts to surround Hezbollah through Syria will not succeed. He added that Hezbollah remains a powerful force in the region and US, Israel, and their allies are wrong to think that regional resistance is weak.
articles.title: Israel will be eliminated, Hezbollah can't be defeated: Khamenei
articles.subtitle: 'Israel will suffer for its actions'

articles.content: Protesting farmers led by Jagjit Singh Dallewal rejected the Supreme Court-formed committee, citing insensitivity and unmet demands. Dallewal, on a hunger strike for 22 days at the Khanauri border, highlighted police brutality at Shambhu. Farmers demand direct talks with the government and legal MSP guarantees.
articles.title: Farmers reject SC panel, demand talks with government
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The US dollar held steady against the yen and other major rivals on Wednesday as investors waited to see whether the Federal Reserve will deliver a hawkish cut before the Bank of Japan and other central banks meet this week. Fed likely to cut rates by 25bps, 97% probability. Focus on Fed's 2025 rate cut projections with decision.
articles.title: Dollar steady against peers as Fed rate cut looms
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: UP Congress Chief Ajay Rai criticized the government for using barricades near the Vidhan Sabha, comparing them to those at the Ghazipur border. Congress workers plan to gherao the Vidhan Sabha, demanding accountability. Rai assured a peaceful protest despite alleged harassment and vehicle seizures by authorities.
articles.title: Congress workers to gherao Vidhan Sabha, Ajay Rai leads protest
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Oil prices traded in a narrow range early on Wednesday as investors remained cautious ahead of an expected interest rate cut by the US Federal Reserve. Brent futures inched up 12 cents, or 0.16%, to $73.31 a barrel by 01:34 GMT, while US West Texas Intermediate crude rose 11 cents, or 0.16%, to $70.19 a barrel.
articles.title: Oil prices little changed ahead of Fed rate decision
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: DMRC announced that the Metro services between Jahangirpuri and Samaypur Badli stations will remain affected for over ten days starting Wednesday. Metro services between Jahangirpuri and Samaypur Badli will be unavailable after 10.45 pm till the end of revenue service. It further said that Samaypur Badli, Rohini Sector-18, 19 and Haiderpur Badli Mor stations will remain closed during this period.
articles.title: Jahangirpuri-Samaypur Badli Metro service to see 10-day disruption
articles.subtitle: DMRC did not state the reason for the disruption

articles.content: Rival automobile companies Honda and Nissan are exploring a potential merger that would create a singular rival to Toyota in Japan, Bloomberg reported. Honda is considering several options including a merger, capital tie-up or the establishment of a holding company, Honda's Executive Vice President Shinji Aoyama said. Nissan shares rose 24% following the reports, while Honda stock fell 3.4%.
articles.title: Rivals Nissan, Honda considering merger: Report
articles.subtitle: 'Nissan has just 12-14 months to survive'

articles.content: US President-elect Donald Trump accused India and Brazil of imposing high tariffs on certain US products and warned of reciprocal taxation. "If they tax us, we tax them the same amount...And they tax us. Almost in all cases, they're taxing us...we haven't been taxing them," said Trump. "If India charges us 100%, do we charge them nothing?" he added.
articles.title: If India taxes us, we tax them the same amount: Donald Trump
articles.subtitle: 'Reciprocity major focus of new administration'

articles.content: During a rain break on the fifth day of the Gabba Test match, Nathan Lyon expressed his surprise at the Indian camp's elation to the team avoiding the follow-on, saying, "Surprised about their reaction. We have played well and driven the game to where we are. Frustrating but we are still sitting in the changing room 185 in front."
articles.title: Surprised by their reaction to avoiding follow-on: Nathan Lyon
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Chinese Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Lin Jian said the country is ready to work with India to bring bilateral ties back on track "as soon as possible". "China is ready to work with India to...respect each other's core interests and...properly settle differences," Lin said. This comes ahead of the key talks between NSA Ajit Doval and Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi.
articles.title: Ready to work with India: China ahead of Doval-Wang Yi meet today
articles.subtitle: Meeting between both leaders to be held today

articles.content: Pakistani actress Mahira Khan revealed that she auditioned for Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Heeramandi' 15 years back. Recalling their meeting, Mahira said, "Bhansali said, 'Can you wipe your lipstick off?' I said, 'I'm not wearing any lipstick'." "He was very excited that I could be a part of it but it didn't work out," she told BBC Asian Network.
articles.title: Auditioned for 'Heeramandi' 15 yrs ago, it didn't work out: Mahira
articles.subtitle: 'I called to tell I'm married as I couldn't lie'

articles.content: Talking about batter KL Rahul, ex-India cricketer Harbhajan Singh said Rahul is a "proper batter", has "excellent" technique and should have Test average of 50-55. "He has had an up-and-down career. He has been in and out of...team and couldn't play cricket for a long time due to injury," Harbhajan stated. Rahul currently has an average of 34.54 in Tests.
articles.title: Rahul's average should be 55, has had up-down career: Harbhajan
articles.subtitle: Rahul has smashed 8 Test tons so far

articles.content: The eight-year-old boy who was injured in a stampede at Hyderabad's Sandhya Theatre ahead of 'Pushpa 2' screening is brain dead, City Police Commissioner CV Anand said. The damage occurred due to "lack of oxygen supply during the stampede", he added. The stampede took place on December 4 as large crowds gathered at the theatre ahead of Allu Arjun's visit.
articles.title: 8-year-old boy injured during 'Pushpa 2' screening declared brain dead
articles.subtitle: Boy's mother died during the stampede

articles.content: Indian music composer and Grammy Award winner Ricky Kej said 'Laapataa Ladies' was "absolutely the wrong choice to represent India" after the film lost the Oscars 2025 race. "When are we going to realize....we're choosing the wrong films," Kej posted on X. "Unfortunately we live in a "Mainstream Bollywood" bubble...we cannot look beyond films...that we ourselves find entertaining," he added.
articles.title: Wrong film to represent India: Ricky Kej as 'Laapataa Ladies' loses Oscars race
articles.subtitle: 'We should be winning every year'

articles.content: Former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar, in a podcast, said that he wants to be richer than Pakistan. "I will become Pakistan's first billionaire (in terms of US dollars)," he added. "I am not kidding about it. I am serious," the 49-year-old further said. Akhtar had retired from international cricket after the ODI World Cup 2011.
articles.title: I want to be richer than Pakistan: Shoaib Akhtar
articles.subtitle: He played 224 international matches

articles.content: 'Laapataa Ladies', India's official entry for Oscars 2025 in the Best International Feature Film category, is out of the Oscars race. The Hindi film, directed by Kiran Rao, is not part of the shortlist of 15 feature films released by The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences on December 17. UK's Hindi-language film "Santosh" is among the films shortlisted.
articles.title: India's official entry 'Laapataa Ladies' out of Oscars 2025 race
articles.subtitle: France's "Emilia Pérez" among shortlisted films

articles.content: A naked man entered ladies' compartment of CSMT-Kalyan fast AC local train on Monday. A video of the incident showed female passengers panicking on seeing the man, following which a ticket checker came to the compartment and deboarded the man at the next station. "Deploying RPF constables in women's coaches is the need of the hour," a commuter said.
articles.title: Naked man enters ladies' compartment in Mumbai local train; women seen panicking
articles.subtitle: The ticket collector pushed the man out

articles.content: Sanju Samson has been left out of the side's squad for the Vijay Hazare Trophy after failing to attend a pre-tournament training camp. KCA secretary Vinod S Kumar stated, "Sanju had sent an email stating that he would not be available for the camp. Naturally, we only considered those who were part of the sessions for selection."
articles.title: Sanju Samson left out of Vijay Hazare Trophy squad
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai reacted to a video that showed Jasprit Bumrah asking a reporter to use Google to learn about his records. "I did Google it:) anyone who can hook Cummins for a six knows how to bat! Well done [Bumrah] saving the follow on with Deep," Pichai wrote. Elon Musk replied to Pichai, saying, "Nice."
articles.title: Elon Musk, Sundar Pichai react to Bumrah's 'Google my records' remark
articles.subtitle: To watch the video of Bumrah's interaction

articles.content: A video has surfaced on social media showing two young tourists fighting with locals in Nainital after being asked not to throw garbage on road. When locals confronted the tourists for throwing a cake box and a packet on roadside, they said there's no dustbin and later said, "Mind your own business." Several people criticised the tourists on social media.
articles.title: Tourists seen fighting with Nainital locals on being asked not to throw garbage on road
articles.subtitle: 'Worst part is they call themselves educated'

articles.content: A 53-year-old woman from Alabama with kidney failure who waited eight years for an organ transplant has received a kidney harvested from a genetically modified pig. Towana Looney is the third human across the world to get a gene-edited pig kidney, and she is the only person currently living with any type of pig organ.
articles.title: US woman suffering from kidney failure gets kidney from pig
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh criticised BJP saying that the leaders are giving "same speech" in Parliament. "In Lok Sabha 'One Nation One Election' has been introduced and in Rajya Sabha it was 'one speech, many speakers'," Jairam added. The Congress leader said this after Union Home Minister Amit Shah gave a 90-minute speech in Rajya Sabha during the Constitution debate.
articles.title: One speech, many speakers: Jairam after Shah's Rajya Sabha speech
articles.subtitle: This was just an attack on Congress: Jairam

articles.content: A court in Goa issued notice to AAP MP Sanjay Singh on a defamation suit filed by CM Pramod Sawant's wife Sulakshana Sawant, who sought ₹100 crore in damages from Singh for allegedly naming her in cash-for-jobs scam. Singh had allegedly made allegations against Sulakshana during a recent press conference. Court has sought Singh's reply by January 10, 2025.
articles.title: Goa CM's wife files ₹100-cr defamation case against Sanjay Singh
articles.subtitle: 'Direct Singh to publish an apology'

articles.content: China is constructing what will be the world's largest artificial-island airport, SCMP reported. The Dalian Jinzhouwan International Airport, currently under construction, will cover 20 square kilometres, as per Liaoning provincial government's official website. The terminal will initially handle 43 million passengers annually and will expand to accommodate up to 80 million passengers per year.
articles.title: China to build world's largest artificial-island airport
articles.subtitle: It is slated for completion by 2035

articles.content: A software engineer died of a heart attack while playing cricket in Mumbai's Azad Maidan last week on Sunday. Thirty-one-year-old Vikram Ashok Deshmukh was an engineer by profession. In the 10th over, he complained of chest pain but continued to play for the next six overs. In the 17th over, he took a run and fell on the ground.
articles.title: 31-year-old techie dies of heart attack while playing cricket in Mumbai
articles.subtitle: He's survived by his wife, parents, 1-yr-old son

articles.content: Karnataka HC on Monday stayed proceedings in a rape case against a Bengaluru resident who was booked on a complaint lodged by a woman he met through Bumble. The court said the 22-year-old was "caught in a web of crime" for the "mistake" of having registered himself on a dating app. "This case projects...classic...instance of...dangers of dating apps," it added.
articles.title: Youth granted relief after his date accuses him of rape, HC flags 'dangers of dating apps'
articles.subtitle: Accused's counsel said it was consensual sex

articles.content: SEBI on Tuesday notified about a new asset class 'Specialized Investment Fund' (SIF), which falls between portfolio management services (PMS) and mutual funds. The minimum investment for SIFs is ₹10 lakh but accredited investors are exempt from the requirement. The new asset class will be allowed to follow open-ended, close-ended or interval investment strategies.
articles.title: What is Specialized Investment Fund?
articles.subtitle: SEBI also imposed certain restrictions for SIFs

articles.content: MobiKwik's unlisted shares were trading at ₹444 apiece on Tuesday, indicating a grey market premium (GMP) of ₹165 or around 60% over the upper end of its IPO price band. Meanwhile, shares of Vishal Mega Mart were trading at a grey market premium of roughly 24%. Both companies will make their debut on stock market exchanges tomorrow (December 18).
articles.title: MobiKwik's GMP at 60%, Vishal Mega Mart's at 24% ahead of listing
articles.subtitle: MobiKwik's IPO was worth ₹572 crore

articles.content: If India-Australia Gabba Test ends in draw, India would need to win Melbourne and Sydney Tests to directly qualify for WTC final. If India win series 2-1, they'd need Sri Lanka to avoid whitewash against Australia. If it ends in 2-2 draw, India would need SL to win series against Australia. If India-Australia draw 1-1, Sri Lanka must draw/beat Australia.
articles.title: How can India qualify for WTC final if Gabba Test ends in a draw?
articles.subtitle: To view the WTC table

articles.content: A 66-year-old man was allowed to take admission at Gujarat University’s DT Law College for the LLB course after a 24-year legal battle. The institute had denied admission citing a 15-year educational qualification requirement, that is 12 years of school and 3 years of graduation. However, the man had completed his education in Kolkata in the 1970s in 14 years.
articles.title: 66-year-old man wins legal battle to study law in Gujarat after 24 years
articles.subtitle: 'Duration irrelevant as long as degree is valid'

articles.content: Ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said he doesn't think Australia will quickly set a target for India and try to bowl them out on the fifth day of the third Test. "Do their fast bowlers still have...strength left in their legs?" he said. "I don't think Australia have scope of adding 100-150 runs and making India play two sessions," Harbhajan said.
articles.title: Do Australia pacers still have strength left in legs: Harbhajan
articles.subtitle: Josh Hazlewood has been ruled out of 3rd Test

articles.content: Uttar Pradesh Police arrested a Bangladeshi national from Delhi's Shaheen Bagh on Tuesday for issuing death threats to CM Yogi Adityanath on social media. The accused reportedly made derogatory statements and communal remarks in the video. The 40-year-old Sheikh Ataul was found with a pistol, cartridges, objectionable documents, and a mobile phone, which was used to issue threats.
articles.title: Bangladeshi man held in Delhi for threatening to kill UP CM
articles.subtitle: 'Accused tried to spread communal unrest'

articles.content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, while speaking in Rajya Sabha, said he used to listen to Binaca Geetmala but it suddenly stopped during Emergency. "My neighbour informed me that Kishore Kumar had fallout with Indira Gandhi, leading her to prohibit his songs from being broadcast," he added. Binaca Geetmala was radio countdown show that aired weekly from 1952 to 1994.
articles.title: Binaca Geetmala was halted over Kishore-Indira fallout: Amit Shah
articles.subtitle: Shah said this while criticising Indira Gandhi

articles.content: Customs officials at Chennai International Airport foiled a smuggling bid and seized 1,424 grams of cocaine worth ₹14.2 crore. A Kenyan woman, who arrived from Addis Ababa, was arrested and remanded to judicial custody. Officials intercepted the passenger based on suspicion and discovered she ingested 90 cylindrical hyperdense objects. Further examination confirmed the objects contained cocaine.
articles.title: Woman from Kenya ingests cocaine capsules worth ₹14 crore, arrested at Chennai airport
articles.subtitle: An investigation is ongoing

articles.content: US-based AI startup Databricks has raised $10 billion in one of the largest venture capital funding rounds in history. The round, which saw participation from Thrive Capital, Andreessen Horowitz and DST Global, values the startup at $62 billion. GIC, Insight Partners, MGX and WCM Investment Management also participated in the funding round.
articles.title: AI startup Databricks raises $10 billion at $62 billion valuation
articles.subtitle: 'These are still the early days of AI'

articles.content: The Ministry of Civil Aviation has amended the Aircraft (Security) Rules, 2023 such that hoax threat calls to flights may now face a penalty of up to ₹1 crore, depending on the culprit. As per the Gazette Notification, two rules have been added which include reserving the right of admission in aircraft and the prohibition to communicate false information.
articles.title: Hoax threat calls to flights may now face fine of up to ₹1 crore
articles.subtitle: 'An individual may face fine of ₹1 lakh'

articles.content: RBI has lifted supervisory restrictions imposed on two Edelweiss Group companies in May over multiple violations including those related to the evergreening of stressed loans. ECL Finance was barred by RBI from undertaking any structured transactions in respect of its wholesale exposures. Edelweiss Asset Reconstruction Company was ordered to stop acquiring financial assets.
articles.title: RBI lifts restrictions on two Edelweiss Group companies
articles.subtitle: 'Satisfied from remedial measures put in place'

articles.content: Syria's new transitional government said there is no place for Russian presence in Syria, adding that it should reconsider its troops in the country. The comments came a week after the country's long-time President Bashar al-Assad was overthrown. Russia operates two military bases in Syria, namely the Khmeimim air base near Latakia and Tartus naval base on the Mediterranean coast.
articles.title: Russia should reconsider their troops here, says new Syrian govt
articles.subtitle: 'Russia's interests were linked to Assad's'

articles.content: Pacers Jasprit Bumrah and Akash Deep, on Tuesday, became the first Indian number 10 and 11 batters to hit sixes against Australia in a Test match. The duo smashed the sixes off Pat Cummins' deliveries. Akash scored 27* runs off 31 deliveries on Day 4 of the third Test, while Bumrah made 10* runs off 27 deliveries.
articles.title: Bumrah, Akash 1st India no. 10-11 pair to hit sixes in a Test against Australia
articles.subtitle: India ended Day 4 with scoreline of 252/9

articles.content: The X account of Google India reacted to a post captioned, "Name a better comeback than 'Google it’" by a user who shared video of Jasprit Bumrah asking a reporter to Google his batting record. "I only believe in Jassi Bhai," Google India wrote. Notably, Siraj had said "I only believe in Jassi bhai" after India's T20 World Cup win.
articles.title: I only believe in Jassi Bhai: Google India as Bumrah asks reporter to Google his record
articles.subtitle: To watch video of Bumrah's answer to reporter

articles.content: France raised its national flag on Tuesday over its embassy in Damascus, Syria, after it had been closed for 12 years during Syrian civil war, the foreign ministry said. France, which cut ties with ousted ex-Syrian President Bashar al-Assad in 2012, said a political transition in Syria must be credible, inclusive and in line with a framework issued by UN.
articles.title: France raises its flag at embassy in Syria after 12-year closure
articles.subtitle: Qatar to reopen its embassy in Syria

articles.content: Independent MP Pappu Yadav on Tuesday said that 'One Nation, One Election' bill will harm the parties of BJP allies Eknath Shinde, Nitish Kumar and Chandrababu Naidu the most. "You take up any issue, you will understand that in any situation they (NDA government) have only two issues. First, divide and rule...Second, ignore all important issues," Yadav added.
articles.title: ONOE bill will harm parties of Shinde, Nitish, Naidu: Pappu Yadav
articles.subtitle: ONOE bill was introduced in LS today

articles.content: A CCTV footage, widely shared online, shows a speeding vehicle travelling in the wrong direction on a highway in Kanpur, hitting a young boy who was crossing the road. A group of friends who witnessed the incident immediately rushed the injured boy to the hospital. Some social media users alleged the vehicle involved in the hit-and-run was a police jeep.
articles.title: Jeep speeding in wrong direction hits boy crossing road in UP, caught on CCTV
articles.subtitle: Kanpur Police issued a statement

articles.content: The Indian Embassy in Georgia is reportedly working to repatriate the mortal remains of the 11 Indians killed inside a restaurant in Gudauri. Most of the victims reportedly hailed from Punjab, reports claimed. All the victims died due to carbon monoxide poisoning and Georgia's internal affairs ministry said that the initial inspection found no signs of injury or violence.
articles.title: Govt working to repatriate 11 killed in Georgia restaurant: Report
articles.subtitle: 'The victims were employees at the restaurant'

articles.content: A video showing 10-year-old self-styled spiritual guru Abhinav Arora getting hit by a bull is going viral with the claim that it is a real incident. However, it is digitally altered and the original video, posted on November 8, does not show any bull attacking him. Abhinav had also shared the video on his Instagram handle.
articles.title: Fact check: Clip of Abhinav Arora getting hit by a bull is altered
articles.subtitle: To know more

articles.content: A Delhi restaurant printed tribute on bills for Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash, who died by suicide after accusing his wife Nikita Singhania and her family of harassment. "We deeply mourn the suicide of techie Atul Subhash. His life was just as important as everyone else's. RIP brother. We hope you finally found peace on the other side," the message read.
articles.title: Delhi restaurant prints tribute for Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash on bill
articles.subtitle: Atul said wife filed fake cases to extort money

articles.content: A woman from US who purchased a property in Italy's Sambuca di Sicilia, auctioned for $1 in 2019, has spent approximately ₹4 crore ($446,000) crore to renovate it. While the house was being auctioned for $1, the woman, Meredith Tabbone, ended up purchasing it for $6,200. Tabbone's grandparents hailed from the region before emigrating to US in 1902.
articles.title: US woman buys '$1' home in Italy, spends ₹4 crore to renovate it
articles.subtitle: The house dates back to the 17th century: Report

articles.content: From Kriti Sanon's bold role in Do Patti to Varun Dhawan's action-packed Citadel, 2024 saw Bollywood stars shine in OTT debuts. Sidharth Malhotra made his digital debut with Indian Police Force (IPS), directed by Rohit Shetty. Ananya Panday captivated audiences in Call Me Bae, where her transformation from a South Delhi socialite to an ambitious Mumbai-based journalist charmed fans.
articles.title: Kriti Sanon to Varun Dhawan: Bollywood stars shine in OTT debuts
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Paparazzo Varinder Chawla said Diljit Dosanjh was enjoying paparazzi culture a few years ago but the "times have changed now" as he has become an "international celebrity". "He has hired...international bouncers who shine...lights on...paparazzi so they can't get photos," he said. "On one hand, [he walks] with folded hands...those paparazzi are doing their job...you aren't allowing them," he said.
articles.title: Diljit walks with folded hands, doesn't let us click him: Varinder
articles.subtitle: 'He is not letting paparazzi take pictures'

articles.content: Hyderabad police has issued a show cause notice to Sandhya Theatre asking why the Cinematograph License in Form-B granted should not be cancelled for all the lapses which led to the death of a woman during a stampede on December 4. Police found that the theatre's management had not made any additional provisions regarding security to manage the crowd.
articles.title: Hyderabad police issues notice to theatre over Pushpa 2 stampede
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The Infrastructure Development Department has entrusted IDECK with the task of conducting a study and submitting a report on the proposal to establish a second international airport for Bengaluru, said Karnataka Minister MB Patil. Patil added that a detailed study is underway to identify potential sites that meet criterias.
articles.title: Study for Bengaluru’s second airport underway
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The government plans to impose up to 25% "safeguard duty" or a temporary tax on steel imports to curb cheap Chinese imports, Reuters reported. Small industries reportedly agreed to the proposal after receiving assurances that they would not be affected by higher steel prices. The duty will be imposed after an investigation, an industry official said.
articles.title: Govt plans up to 25% temporary tax on steel imports: Report
articles.subtitle: 'Probe likely to be completed in a month'

articles.content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's elections were declared null and void by Allahabad High Court, so she prohibited judicial inquiry of a Prime Minister through amendment. "I want to ask my Communist brothers to introspect with whom they are sitting," he further stated. Shah said this while criticising Opposition during debate on the Constitution.
articles.title: Indira Gandhi amended Constitution after HC set aside her election: Amit Shah
articles.subtitle: 'Today, they lose and blame the EVM'

articles.content: Pakistan has placed around 4,300 beggars on the Exit Control List to prevent them from flying out of the country. This comes after Middle Eastern countries threatened Pakistan with strict action if they didn't stop "exporting" beggars. In September, Saudi Arabia had told Pakistan to stop its nationals from misusing Umrah and Hajj visas to reach Saudi and beg.
articles.title: Why has Pakistan put 4,300 beggars on no-fly list?
articles.subtitle: '90% of beggars arrested abroad are from Pak'

articles.content: Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's ongoing corruption case trial hearing was delayed on Tuesday owing to "special circumstances". Netanyahu and his defence attorney Amit Hadad said they could only divulge behind closed doors as to why the hearing had to be postponed. Notably, Netanyahu's plea had come hours after an Iranian minister issued an open call for Netanyahu's death.
articles.title: Netanyahu's trial hearing delayed due to 'special circumstances'
articles.subtitle: Netanyahu facing charges in 3 cases

articles.content: Trauma bonding occurs when an abuser creates cycle of manipulation by alternating between abusive behaviour and affectionate gestures, said relationship counsellor Ruchi Ruuh. This makes victim emotionally dependent, confusing love with control and harm. Relationship expert Shahzeen Shivdasani said trauma bonding is staying in relationship where emotional abuse is followed by periods of kindness.
articles.title: What is trauma bonding?
articles.subtitle: It can lead to anxiety, depression: Ruuh

articles.content: In an apparent reference to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that a "54-year-old leader who calls himself 'yuva' is roaming around claiming we would change the Constitution", however, the provision for amendments is within it. He also alleged that Congress distributed "blank" Constitutions in Maharashtra, terming it as the "biggest fraud" he's ever seen.
articles.title: 54-yr-old leader calls himself 'yuva', claims we'll change Constitution: Amit Shah on Rahul
articles.subtitle: 'Constitution never considered immutable'

articles.content: A ball bowled by MP Tigers spinner Pawan Negi dismantled a stump after UP Brij Stars' Chirag Gandhi edged it, however, Chirag survived as the bail remained intact in their Big Cricket League match. Chirag was batting on 98*(52) when the incident happened. He went on to score an unbeaten 101 off 58 balls in the match.
articles.title: Ball dismantles stump, bail doesn't fall as batter survives in Big Cricket League match
articles.subtitle: To watch the video of the incident

articles.content: On the Figuring Out podcast, MrBeast stated that the first episode of Beast Games had 1,100 cameras and an investment of around $15 million. MrBeast added, "That first episode had more cameras recording than any production in the history of anything." "No production has ever used 1,100 cameras recording at the same time," he further said.
articles.title: Used 1,100 cameras for first episode of Beast Games: MrBeast
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Smriti Mandhana was the highest scorer as India ended up with 159/9 in the first innings, scoring 62 off 41 deliveries in the second T20I against West Indies. It was her 29th fifty in T20Is, the most for any batter in the format. However, she lived a charmed life at the crease and was dropped thrice in the field by the Windies.
articles.title: Smriti Mandhana hits 29th T20I fifty in India's 159/9 vs WI
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: India are trailing Australia by 193 runs in their first innings after Day 4 of the Gabba Test. Scattered thunderstorms are expected in the morning with temperature ranging from 83°F to 85°F (28.3°C to 29.4°C) between 9 am and 11 am (local time). Thunderstorms are expected throughout the day, while the forecast of rain is at 5 pm (local time).
articles.title: What is the hour-wise weather forecast for last day of India-Australia Gabba Test?
articles.subtitle: To view the match scorecard

articles.content: Adani Group-owned Ambuja Cement on Tuesday approved the merger of its subsidiaries Sanghi Industries (SIL) and Penna Cement Industries (PCIL) with itself. Ambuja will issue 12 equity shares of ₹2 face value each for every 100 shares of SIL of ₹10 face value held by its shareholders. Ambuja bought SIL and PCIL for ₹5,185 crore and ₹10,422 crore, respectively.
articles.title: Ambuja Cement to merge Sanghi Industries, Penna Cement with self
articles.subtitle: Merger expected to be completed in 9-12 months

articles.content: Mukesh Khanna reacted to Sonakshi Sinha's note criticising him for questioning her upbringing. The actor said, "I'm surprised she took so much time to react. I knew I was antagonising her...But I'd no malicious intention to malign her." Mukesh had said it was her father Shatrughan Sinha's fault that she couldn't answer a KBC question on Ramayana in 2019.
articles.title: I knew I was antagonising Sonakshi: Mukesh on Ramayana remark
articles.subtitle: Sonakshi asked Mukesh to stop talking about it

articles.content: The father and stepmother of a 10-year-old girl whose body was discovered on her bed in UK's Surrey, after the family had fled to Pakistan have been sentenced to life imprisonment. The victim's uncle was also found guilty of causing or allowing the girl, Sara Sharif, to be beaten to death. He was sentenced to 16 years in prison.
articles.title: Dad, step-mom get life term for killing 10-yr-old British-Pak girl
articles.subtitle: To know more

articles.content: Akasa Air has received a show-cause notice from civil aviation regulator DGCA for violating norms related to its operations manual, as per reports. The airline reportedly exceeded the six-month timeline for the manual revision cycle. Earlier this month, DGCA sent another notice to an Akasa engineer over poor maintenance standards and certification.
articles.title: Akasa Air gets DGCA notice for operation manual violation: Report
articles.subtitle: DGCA has given Akasa Air 15 days to respond

articles.content: Roorkee Police have filed an FIR after three men and two women were seen performing obscene dance and doing stunts on bridge over Ganga River. Police reportedly said that the accused have amassed 5.28 lakh followers through their obscene content. The video also showed one of them jumping into the river.
articles.title: Men, women seen doing obscene dance for Reel on bridge over Ganga River; FIR filed
articles.subtitle: The video surfaced on December 16

articles.content: Spiritual leader Sri Sri Ravishankar backed 'One Nation One Election' bill, saying that it can pave road for a more prosperous India. "Repeated polls force candidates to continuously make...impractical promises, offer freebies," he said, adding such a process damages public faith in politicians. "With single, synchronised election, leaders will have ample time to focus on development," he said.
articles.title: ONOE paves way for prosperous India: Sri Sri Ravishankar
articles.subtitle: The bill was introduced in Lok Sabha today

articles.content: While speaking on the Constitution in Rajya Sabha, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said Congress increased the tenures of Lok Sabha and assemblies through 42nd Constitutional Amendment out of fear of losing polls. He further said Congress ruled for 55 years and made 77 changes to the Constitution while BJP brought 22 amendments in 16 years.
articles.title: Congress increased tenures of Lok Sabha, assemblies as it feared losing polls: Amit Shah
articles.subtitle: 'Some are calling themselves 'Yuva neta' at 54'

articles.content: Simran Shaikh, who became the most expensive buy of WPL 2025 auction after being bought by GG for ₹1.9 crore, has said that her dream is to meet Virat Kohli once. The 22-year-old also thanked her family and GG for their support. "After getting such a huge amount, it's now my responsibility to perform for GG," Shaikh further said.
articles.title: My dream is to meet Virat Kohli once: WPL 2025 auction's costliest buy Simran Shaikh
articles.subtitle: She plays domestic cricket for Mumbai

articles.content: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief of Uttar Pradesh, Shyam Lal Pal on Tuesday said that no temple was found in the state's Sambhal district. He said, "No temple has been found anywhere... go and look in the excavations. No temple has been found...except for the Ayodhya case, all religious places are as they were."
articles.title: No temple found in Sambhal: SP UP chief Shyam Lal Pal
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Subash Chand, a 70-year-old farmer from Haryana's Karnal district, ended his 44-year-old marriage with his estranged wife, Santosh Kumari, 73, after an 18-year legal battle. According to a report, the husband agreed to part ways in exchange for a settlement of ₹3.07 crore in permanent alimony, selling his prime agricultural land to fulfil the agreement.
articles.title: 70-year-old Haryana farmer ends 44-year marriage, sells land to pay ₹3.07 crore alimony
articles.subtitle: They started living separately from May 8, 2006

articles.content: The UK government has approved Bharti Global's acquisition of a 24.5% stake in Britain's largest broadband firm BT Group for £3.2 billion (around ₹34,500 crore). Bharti Global, the investment arm of India's Bharti Enterprises, announced in August that it would buy the stake from BT's former top investor Patrick Drahi's Altice. The approval was given following a national security assessment.
articles.title: Bharti's acquisition of ₹34,500 crore stake in BT approved by UK
articles.subtitle: 'Have no intention of buying all of BT'

articles.content: European Union's (EU) privacy regulator has issued a fine of €251 million (over ₹2,200 crore) on Meta for a data breach that took place in 2018. The breach had affected nearly 29 million Facebook accounts, of which around 3 million were in EU. Ireland's Data Protection Commission, which issued the penalty, stated that Meta had notified it about the breach.
articles.title: EU regulator fines Meta over ₹2,200 cr for 2018 data breach that affected lakhs
articles.subtitle: Meta had fixed breach shortly after discovery

articles.content: Addressing the Rajya Sabha, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said Congress amended the Constitution 77 times in its 55 years of rule. Shah criticised Rahul Gandhi over their remarks that BJP will change Constitution, saying Rahul spreads fear among the citizens of the country over Samvidhan Amendments. This debate on Constitution shows how much progress India has made, Shah added.
articles.title: Congress amended Constitution 77 times in its 55-yr rule: Shah
articles.subtitle: 'Congress is doing vote bank politics'

articles.content: Akshay Kumar shared a video on Instagram revealing that his initiative has fed over 1,250 monkeys in Ayodhya. The actor launched the initiative with the Anjaneya Sewa Trust. Akshay called it a 'chhoti si koshish (a small effort)' while sharing the video. He had donated ₹1 crore to ensure the daily feeding of monkeys in Ayodhya.
articles.title: Akshay Kumar funded initiative feeds over 1250 monkeys in Ayodhya
articles.subtitle: Many followers lauded Akshay's efforts

articles.content: The EU said it will establish contacts with Syria's Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS) group and reopen its delegation in the country. "The risk of a Daesh (Islamic State) resurgence, particularly in eastern Syria, is real. We cannot let this happen," EU Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said. HTS seized control of Damascus, which led to ex-President Bashar al-Assad's ouster.
articles.title: Can't allow IS to resurface: EU on engaging with Syria's HTS group
articles.subtitle: 'Turkey's security concerns must be addressed'

articles.content: Non-banking financial company Aye Finance has filed draft papers with SEBI to raise ₹1,450 crore through an initial public offering. The IPO consists of a fresh issue of shares worth up to ₹885 crore and an offer for sale portion worth ₹565 crore. Alpha Wave India and an Alphabet fund are among those selling shares in the IPO.
articles.title: Alphabet-backed Aye Finance files papers for ₹1,450 crore IPO
articles.subtitle: Elevation Capital V is Aye's largest shareholder

articles.content: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz on Tuesday said the Israeli army will keep security control over the Gaza Strip after "defeating" Hamas in the territory. "Israel does not want military control or civilian governance over the residents. There are no decisions regarding settlement in Gaza," Katz also said. Over 45,000 people have died in Gaza since war broke out.
articles.title: Will keep security control in Gaza after defeating Hamas: Israel
articles.subtitle: 'Won't allow a return to the pre-Oct 7 reality'

articles.content: Former NCB officer Sameer Wankhede, speaking on 'The Gaurav Thakur Show', was asked about the arrest of Aryan Khan, the son of Shah Rukh Khan. "I don't want to take names and make anyone famous," he said. "Whatever the chat leaks happened, the case is with the High Court, so I cannot comment on that," Wankhede further said.
articles.title: Won't take names & make anyone famous: Wankhede on question on SRK
articles.subtitle: Wankhede was part of team which arrested Aryan

articles.content: Chelsea's Mykhailo Mudryk has been provisionally suspended from football after testing positive to a doping test. The footballer released a statement which said, "This has come as a complete shock as I have never knowingly used any banned substances or broken any rules, and am working closely with my team to investigate how this could have happened."
articles.title: Mudryk reacts to getting suspended after failed doping test
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Mumbai Police have arrested a 32-year-old woman and eight others for allegedly selling her baby girl after her mother-in-law filed a complaint. The woman, who received around ₹1 lakh from the infant's sale, apparently wanted to raise money to secure bail for her jailed husband. "The infant has been rescued and is now in our custody," a police officer said.
articles.title: Woman sells her baby girl for ₹1 lakh to secure bail for jailed husband in Mumbai
articles.subtitle: The baby was rescued from Karnataka

articles.content: Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Uddhav Thackeray met Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis in Nagpur on Tuesday. Uddhav was accompanied by other leaders, including his son and Worli MLA, Aaditya Thackeray, Anil Parab, Varun Sardesai and Sachin Ahir. "There are multiple issues, political differences and ideological clashes, but that does not mean we are enemies," Aaditya Thackeray said after the meeting.
articles.title: Uddhav meets Maha CM Fadnavis, Aaditya says 'we aren't enemies'
articles.subtitle: 'I expect normal politics in Maharashtra'

articles.content: The owners of a house in UP's Sambhal located near Shiv-Hanuman Temple, which was recently discovered during an anti-encroachment drive, removed an illegal part of their house. They also covered the section being demolished to avoid debris falling into the temple and nearby buildings. Meanwhile, the local administration continued the anti-encroachment drive in Sambhal.
articles.title: Owners themselves remove illegal part of house near temple found in Sambhal
articles.subtitle: The temple was reopened after 46 years

articles.content: American vlogger Drew Binsky has shared a video to show his "worst business class experience" on Air India flight from London to Amritsar. "I had to eat on a hair-infested pillow!!! Can you believe I paid $750 to upgrade...I'll never be flying Air India again," he wrote. He complained of broken, non-reclining seat, broken table and dirt and filth.
articles.title: US influencer Binsky shared video of his 'worst business class experience on Air India'
articles.subtitle: To watch the video he shared

articles.content: Ex-NCB officer Sameer Wankhede, who was part of the team which arrested Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan in a drugs case in 2021, reacted to SRK's 'Jawan' dialogue, 'Before touching my son, talk to the father'. Speaking on The Gaurav Thakur Show, he called it "very cheap" and "third-rate". "In Indian culture, we don't use these words," he said.
articles.title: Third-rate: Ex-NCB officer Sameer on SRK's Jawan's 'baap' dialogue
articles.subtitle: 'Won't go down to that level & respond'

articles.content: Russia's State Duma, the lower house of the country's parliament, has approved a bill that could remove Taliban from country's terror list. The bill will now be sent to the upper-house, Federation Council, and then to President Vladimir Putin to be signed into law. Notably, no country currently recognises the Taliban government in Afghanistan, which seized power in August 2021.
articles.title: Russian State Duma clears bill that may end Taliban's 'terror' tag
articles.subtitle: Taliban put on Russia's terror list in 2003

articles.content: LG Energy Solution and India's JSW Energy are in talks for a $1.5 billion joint venture for EV batteries and renewable energy storage, Reuters reported. The proposed venture will reportedly set up a plant in India with a total capacity of 10 gigawatt hours. Under the initial agreement, LG will contribute the technology and JSW will invest the money.
articles.title: LG Energy, India's JSW plan $1.5 billion battery venture: Report
articles.subtitle: 'Firms want plant to start before 2026 end'

articles.content: A purported video claiming to show a 'human corpse' being burnt is being shared online with claims that it depicts recent atrocities against Hindus in Bangladesh. The claim is false and the video actually originated from a theme park in China. The 'corpse' isn't a real human body but a dummy installed at the park in 2018, a fact-check found.
articles.title: China park clip shared as footage of anti-Hindu attacks in B'desh
articles.subtitle: To know more

articles.content: As many as 32 political parties are supporting the 'One Nation, One Election' Bill citing benefits like resource optimisation, while 15 parties have opposed it, citing concerns about potential anti-democratic effects. As per News18, BJP, BJD and SAD are among the parties who are backing the bill, while Congress, Samajwadi Party and AAP are among those opposing it.
articles.title: Which political parties are supporting or opposing the 'One Nation, One Election' Bill?
articles.subtitle: The Bill was introduced in Lok Sabha on Tuesday

articles.content: BJP will be sending notices to the MPs who remained absent during the introduction of the 'One Nation, One Election' Bills in the Lok Sabha on Tuesday, according to reports. The party will reportedly seek an explanation from over 20 leaders regarding their absence since they did not attend the session despite the party's whip.
articles.title: BJP to send notices to 20 MPs absent during 'One Nation, One Election' Bills introduction: Report
articles.subtitle: The Bills were referred to JPC

articles.content: Actress Radhika Apte showcased her baby bump in a photo shoot for Vogue magazine a week before delivery.  Talking about the shoot, Radhika said, "I had never seen myself put on so much weight...My body was swollen, I had shooting pains in my pelvis." She added now she's adapting to the new "challenges and new discoveries" as a new mother.
articles.title: Radhika Apte poses for Vogue a week before delivery, says she struggled with weight gain
articles.subtitle: 'Struggled to embrace how I looked at the time'

articles.content: New electricity meter was installed at the residence of Samajwadi Party MP from Sambhal Zia Ur Rehman on Tuesday amid heavy security, officials said. The earlier meter is being replaced with a smart meter, Sambhal's SDO said. On Monday, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said that "mini-power stations" are being operated from religious places in Sambhal.
articles.title: Electricity meter installed at SP MP's home amid heavy security in Sambhal
articles.subtitle: 'This is loot of the country's resources'

articles.content: After 'One Nation, One Election' bill was introduced in Lok Sabha, BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad called it a "historic day". "I am proud of my Prime Minister...It's a welcome step and this will bring more stability to the country," he added. Meanwhile, 269 MPs voted in favour of the bill, 198 members voted against it in Lok Sabha.
articles.title: Historic day, proud of PM: BJP MP as ONOE bill introduced
articles.subtitle: 'The entire bill does not make any sense'

articles.content: SEBI has proposed launching a new platform to help investors trace inactive and unclaimed mutual fund folios. The platform, named MITRA (Mutual Fund Investment Tracing and Retrieval Assistant), will provide investors with a searchable database of inactive folios. Investors can use MITRA to trace their overlooked investments or those made by others for which they might be rightful claimants.
articles.title: SEBI proposes new platform to trace inactive mutual fund folios
articles.subtitle: SEBI has asked for comments on the proposal

articles.content: India opener KL Rahul opened up about rain disrupting the third Test between India and Australia multiple times in Brisbane. Terming the breaks "very frustrating" for both teams, he said, "I think I got more tired running up and down the stairs than being in the middle." The game saw nine rain breaks on the third and fourth days.
articles.title: Got more tired running up & down than being in middle: Rahul on rain breaks
articles.subtitle: Rahul scored 84 runs off 139 deliveries

articles.content: A man freed by CNN reporter Clarissa Ward after being found in ousted Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's windowless jail is a former intelligence officer, reports said. Fact-checker Verify-Sy claimed the prisoner, Salama Mohammad Salama, was jailed less than a month ago due to dispute over extorted funds' profit-sharing. Reports said Salama used to torture and kill civilians who refused bribes.
articles.title: Man freed from Assad's windowless jail by CNN reporter tortured, killed innocents: Report
articles.subtitle: Salama gave wrong identity of himself to Ward

articles.content: Lt. General Igor Kirillov, chief of Russia's Nuclear, Biological, and Chemical Defence Forces, was assassinated in a scooter blast in Moscow, for which Ukraine claimed responsibility. Kirillov was tasked oversee troops responding to nuclear, chemical, and biological threats while protecting Russian ground forces. Kirillov's troops have been accused of using "barbaric chemical weapons in Ukraine".
articles.title: Who was Igor Kirillov, top Russian general who was assassinated?
articles.subtitle: Ukraine to get imminent revenge: Ex-Russia Prez

articles.content: Singer Diljit Dosanjh recently said that he will not perform in India until proper concert infrastructure is available. On Tuesday, Diljit posted a note on social media sharing that his statement was misinterpreted, only to delete it in a few minutes. "I said the problem was with the venue in Chandigarh," he wrote on X, but deleted the post.
articles.title: Diljit backtracks on 'not performing in India without infrastructure' remark; deletes post
articles.subtitle: Diljit said this during his Chandigarh concert

articles.content: A 21-year-old man was beaten to death after he was caught with the wife of another person at a house in Delhi's Shastri Park area, police said. He was beaten up badly by more than one person, a neighbour said. "They...tore out Ritik's nails and tortured him badly...He had injuries on every part of his body," the victim's uncle stated.
articles.title: Man finds wife, lover at home; tears out his nails and kills him in Delhi
articles.subtitle: The victim used to drive a tempo

articles.content: Former Russian President Dmitry Medvedev reacted to the killing of top Russian general Igor Kirillov, who was chief of Russia's Nuclear, Biological and Chemical Protection Troops and said Ukraine will receive "imminent revenge". "Realising the inevitability of its military defeat, [Ukraine launched] cowardly and despicable strikes," Medvedev said. Kirillov was killed outside a building in Moscow.
articles.title: Ukraine to get imminent revenge: Ex-Russia Prez on general's death
articles.subtitle: His assistant was also killed

articles.content: A temple, allegedly locked for 70 years, has been discovered in Varanasi's Madanpura, with Sanatan Raksha Dal demanding its re-opening. The temple was found after its picture surfaced on social media, prompting the group to visit the site. Mohammad Shahabuddin, the owner of the place where the temple is located, said, "Anyone can come and worship here peacefully."
articles.title: Temple locked for 70 years found in Varanasi
articles.subtitle: 'Many Hindus live here, they never raised issue'

articles.content: Diane Delano, best known for her role in Northern Exposure, passed away at 67 in Los Angeles after a brief illness. Her agent confirmed her death on December 13. Delano was celebrated for roles in Popular, The Wicker Man, and voice acting in Teen Titans. Her legacy spans film, TV, and stage performances.
articles.title: Northern Exposure star Diane Delano dies at 67
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Batter Prithvi Shaw took to Instagram Stories to share his one-day cricket statistics after he was dropped from Mumbai's Vijay Hazare Trophy squad. "Tell me God...what more do I have to see...if 65 innings, 3399 runs at an average of 55.7 with a strike rate of 126 [aren't good enough]," he wrote. "I will come back for sure," he added.
articles.title: Tell me God, what more do I have to see? Prithvi Shaw after being dropped by Mumbai
articles.subtitle: Shaw had gone unsold in IPL mega auction

articles.content: A DTC bus collided with an auto in Delhi's Azadpur Mandi causing minor injuries to a few people. People blocked the road and pelted stones at the bus following the incident. A video surfaced online showing the vandalised bus and the damaged auto lying on the road. Later, the police cleared the crowd and resumed the traffic on the road.
articles.title: Stones pelted at DTC bus after collision with an auto in Delhi
articles.subtitle: Video showed bus' cracked windscreen

articles.content: Former Pakistan cricketer Aamer Sohail praised T10 cricket for its fast-paced nature and role in promoting emerging talent. He believes the format helps connect non-cricket-playing nations to the sport. The Lanka T10 Super League in Sri Lanka has drawn strong fan interest with its entertaining matches.
articles.title: Aamer Sohail praises T10 cricket for promoting new talent
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A video of two men assaulting a woman in broad daylight on Kanpur street has surfaced online. The video showed people watching as the men beat her, pulled her hair and tried to drag her to a house. Police reacted to the video and said, "Local police station has taken the accused into custody and further action is being taken."
articles.title: 2 men beat, pull hair of woman on Kanpur street; people watch as they forcefully take her
articles.subtitle: A woman tried to stop them

articles.content: Satish Sharma, Sports Minister of Jammu and Kashmir, supported the One Nation One Election bill. "First I will take the opinion of my CM. Apart from being the minister, I believe nothing is wrong. If the country's money gets saved, our tax money gets saved, then I feel it is fine." Satish Sharma said.
articles.title: J&K minister supports One Nation One Election bill
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: UFC fighter Conor McGregor on Tuesday said that he has agreed to a preliminary deal with the Ambani family to face YouTuber-wrestler Logan Paul in a boxing exhibition in India. This will be McGregor's first fight since he broke his leg in a UFC match in 2021. He added that he'll return to UFC Octagon after the match with Paul.
articles.title: Conor McGregor to face Logan Paul in boxing match in India backed by Ambanis
articles.subtitle: Earlier, Jake Paul proposed MMA fight with Conor

articles.content: Breast cancer is the most common cancer in women in India, making up 28% of all female cancers. However, nearly 75% of palpable breast lesions are benign. While benign lesions are non-cancerous, they increase breast cancer risk. Medical Oncologist Dr Chetana Bakshi emphasizes the importance of regular checks and mammograms for early detection and management.
articles.title: Are benign breast lesions a hidden cancer risk?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Mukesh Khanna, in an interview with Siddharth Kannan, shared that Ranveer Singh told him that he was duped into doing the nude photoshoot. "I felt sympathy for him, but...later, he went and told...press that he wasn't ashamed of the shoot," he added. Mukesh also questioned why the actor did not take legal action if he was duped into it.
articles.title: Ranveer told me he was duped into doing nude photoshoot: Mukesh
articles.subtitle: 'He might be comfortable, but we aren’t'

articles.content: Filmmaker Pankaj Parashar said late actor Vinod Khanna hired him as the director for his son Akshaye Khanna's debut film, adding, that he put certain conditions. "He said...this will be a love story...Composer Anu Malik will give the music and screenwriter Honey Irani will write. I said fantastic," he recalled. Akshaye made his debut with the 1997 film 'Himalay Putra'.
articles.title: Vinod Khanna hired me for son Akshaye's 1st film, put conditions: Pankaj Parashar
articles.subtitle: 'Akshaye's problem was Hindi'

articles.content: Australian players made significant gains in the latest ICC Women's Player Rankings. Annabel Sutherland rose to 29th among ODI batters, while Ash Gardner climbed to third among bowlers. India's Smriti Mandhana moved to second among ODI batters after her ninth century, closing in on the top spot.
articles.title: Australia shine in ICC rankings; Mandhana nears top spot
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Disability isn't a limitation but a challenge to society's perception, says Paediatrician Dr Himani Narula. Myths often overshadow the strengths of disabled children. Focusing on abilities, inclusive education, and access to technology can unlock their true potential. Empowering children with support and understanding fosters confidence, breaking barriers and creating a more inclusive world.
articles.title: Disability is a challenge, not a limitation: Dr Himani
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The Parliamentary Standing Committee presented its report on Demands for Grants 2024-25 to the Lok Sabha. Key recommendations include increasing the agriculture budget, making MSP a legal guarantee, doubling PM-KISAN support, implementing crop insurance, and waiving farmer debts to improve welfare.
articles.title: Panel seeks higher farm budget, legal MSP, and debt waiver
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Mumbai announced its squad for first three matches of the Vijay Hazare Trophy 2024-25. The side will be led by Shreyas Iyer, who recently led Mumbai to Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2024 title victory. While the team had many talented players, notable names including Prithvi Shaw were dropped. The squad also has India's T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav and Shivam Dube.
articles.title: Shreyas Iyer to lead Mumbai in Vijay Hazare Trophy; Shaw dropped
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Another abandoned temple has been found in UP's Sambhal. After police opened the ancient temple, known as the Radha-Krishna Temple, cleaning process was carried out there. This comes days after an ancient Lord Shiva and Lord Hanuman temple, which was found during anti-encroachment drive in Sambhal, was reopened after 46 years.
articles.title: Another abandoned temple found in Sambhal
articles.subtitle: To watch the visuals of the temple

articles.content: Actor Arjun Kapoor, during a conversation with Mashable India, said he was a "very good" student until his parents Boney Kapoor and Mona Shourie's separation. "Then, obviously, psychologically...it affected me," he added. Arjun said he took a year's break after joining college to assist on 'Kal Ho Naa Ho', adding, "But my mother didn't appreciate that I started working."
articles.title: I was very good student until my parents' separation: Arjun Kapoor
articles.subtitle: 'I was the most overweight I'd been in college'

articles.content: A Deloitte report reveals 92 percent of Indian executives view security vulnerabilities as the main barrier to AI adoption. Privacy risks and regulatory challenges were cited by 91 and 89 percent respectively. The report highlights the need for strong governance frameworks to build trust in AI.
articles.title: 92% of Indian executives see security as AI adoption barrier
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A video showing the moment a 7.3-magnitude earthquake hit Vanuatu has surfaced online. The clip showed a garage shaking during the earthquake. The earthquake, which occurred 30 km west of the capital Port Vila, reportedly caused widespread destruction in the city. Several videos of the damage caused by the earthquake also surfaced on social media.
articles.title: Video shows the moment 7.3-magnitude earthquake hit Vanuatu
articles.subtitle: The earthquake occurred at a depth of 43 km

articles.content: A spherical egg has been sold at a charity auction for £200 (over ₹21,500) in the UK. The Iuventas Foundation said that it initially thought that the egg, donated to them by Ed Pownell, was a "joke". Auction house Thomson Roddick Callan, which had previously sold the egg, stated that round eggs are thought to be "one in a billion".
articles.title: 'One in a billion' spherical egg sold for over ₹21,500 in UK
articles.subtitle: Pownell had bought the egg for £150

articles.content: US President-elect Donald Trump on Monday threatened to reverse President Joe Biden's decision to allow Ukraine to use American long-range weapons against Russia. Calling the move "stupid", he said, "I don't think that should have been allowed...certainly not just weeks before I take over." "Why would they do that without asking me what I thought?" Trump further asked.
articles.title: Trump threatens to disallow US long-range weapons' use by Ukraine
articles.subtitle: 'I think it was a big mistake'

articles.content: North Korean soldiers who have been deployed to Russia's Kursk region are "legitimate targets" for the Ukrainian military, US State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller said. "If the North Korean troops were to cross the border into Ukraine...that would be yet another escalation by Russia," he added. This comes after Ukraine said Russia is using North Korean troops in "significant numbers".
articles.title: N Korean troops in Kursk legitimate targets for Ukraine forces: US
articles.subtitle: 'The use of North Korean troops could extend'

articles.content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the GDP growth slowdown in Q2 FY25 was a "temporary blip" and "the economy will see healthy growth in the next quarters". The GDP growth slowed to 5.4% in the July-September quarter, the lowest in nearly two years. "In the last three years, India's GDP growth rate has averaged 8.3%. This is outstanding," she added.
articles.title: Q2 GDP slowdown was temporary blip, more growth coming: Sitharaman
articles.subtitle: 'Q2 was challenging for most economies'

articles.content: Union minister Nitin Gadkari said that food delivery economy is very important for job creation in India. Gadkari noted that India currently has 77 lakh delivery workers and it's expected to rise to 2.5 crore by 2030. He further expressed concerns over road safety issues faced by delivery workers due to the urgency of time-bound deliveries.
articles.title: Food delivery economy crucial for job creation in India: Gadkari
articles.subtitle: '55,000 deaths caused by non-usage of helmets'

articles.content: Italian tennis player Fabio Fognini said he is fan of Roger Federer and watching his matches was a "pleasure". He stated Novak Djokovic "wastes your time and doesn't let you play". Fognini further said that Rafael Nadal "destroys you physically and psychologically". Federer, Nadal won 20 and 22 singles Grand Slam titles while Djokovic has won 24 Slams so far.
articles.title: I'm a Federer fan, Djokovic wastes your time: Fabio Fognini
articles.subtitle: Federer retired in 2022

articles.content: President Droupadi Murmu, during her five-day visit to Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, graced the first convocation of AIIMS Mangalagiri. She emphasized the national goal of inclusive healthcare and the vital role young doctors play in achieving this vision. Her address urged graduates to dedicate their skills to improving healthcare access, especially in underserved regions.
articles.title: President inspires young doctors at AIIMS Mangalagiri convocation
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A Chinese businessman linked to UK's Prince Andrew has denied allegations by authorities, claiming that he is a spy. The businessman, Yang Tengbo, waived his right to anonymity to respond to the accusations and appealed against a decision to revoke his permission to stay in UK. Tengbo allegedly gained access to the Buckingham Palace through Prince Andrew.
articles.title: 'I'm not a spy', says Chinese businessman linked to Prince Andrew
