articles.subtitle: I'm independent, self-made entrepreneur: Tengbo

articles.content: Himachal Pradesh CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu facilitated the adoption of a child at Shishu Grih Shimla, urging society to adopt children from orphanages. He highlighted schemes like Mukhya Mantri Sukh-Aashray Yojana and Sukh-Aashray Kosh, supporting education and welfare of over 4,000 vulnerable children in the state.
articles.title: Himachal CM Sukhu promotes adoption, child welfare schemes
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: PM Narendra Modi alleged that Congress promoted river disputes between states. "Congress never wants to reduce water problems...The water of our rivers used to flow across...borders, but our farmers didn't get its benefits," PM Modi said at an event in Rajasthan. "They talk...of farmers but they don't do anything for them, nor do they let others do it," he added.
articles.title: Congress promoted river disputes between states: PM Modi in Raj
articles.subtitle: 'We believe in cooperation, not opposition'

articles.content: Talking about Steve Smith's one-handed diving catch to dismiss India batter KL Rahul on Day 4 of the ongoing third Test, ex-India cricketer Ravi Shastri said, "Just pure reflex." "It's an absolute ripper. This was flying across to his right there," he stated. Rahul was dismissed after playing a knock of 84(139) in India's first innings.
articles.title: Ball was flying, pure reflex: Shastri on Smith's one-handed catch
articles.subtitle: India are 252/9 at Day 4 Stumps

articles.content: Potato and other winter vegetables are more expensive than before, a Moneycontrol analysis found. Potato prices have seen nearly four-year-high inflation, with people paying 67% more for potatoes in November 2024 than they did a year ago. Similarly, people are paying 85% more for garlic, 48% more for cauliflower, 44% more for cabbage and 33% more for carrots this winter.
articles.title: Potato prices at 4-year high, winter vegetables more expensive than before
articles.subtitle: Cauliflower inflation at 33-month high

articles.content: Shares of Paytm parent One97 Communications hit a fresh 52-week high of ₹1,063 on BSE on Tuesday before paring some gains and ending at ₹1,014.75. Shares crossed the ₹1,000 mark on Monday after nearly three years. The rally comes after Paytm sold a 5.4% stake in Japan's PayPay for ₹2,364 crore, boosting its cash reserves.
articles.title: Paytm shares hit fresh 52-week high, remain above ₹1,000 mark
articles.subtitle: Shares hit a 52-week low of ₹310 in May

articles.content: Actor Arjun Kapoor said he was the "most overweight" he had ever been during his college days. Recalling his first day in college, the 39-year-old said, "I came to college in shorts, and I realised I was a misfit there...I dressed in my oversized clothes and carried a school bag." He further revealed he used to bunk college "a lot".
articles.title: Was the most overweight I had ever been during college days: Arjun
articles.subtitle: 'I failed in accounting'

articles.content: The Education and Health Ministries are discussing whether to conduct the NEET-UG medical entrance exam in pen-and-paper or online mode, with a decision expected soon, according to Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan. The Education Ministry has held two rounds of talks with the Health Ministry, led by Union Minister JP Nadda.
articles.title: Education, Health Ministries discuss NEET-UG exam mode options
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Actor Mukesh Khanna blamed Akshay Kumar for the box office failure of 'Samrat Prithviraj', in which the actor portrayed Rajput ruler Prithviraj Chauhan. "It was his fault as...actor that he couldn't do justice to the film. Even the director (Chandra Prakash Dwivedi) admitted in an interview with me that they cut corners," he said in a chat with Siddharth Kannan.
articles.title: Akshay couldn't do justice to Prithviraj, was his fault: Mukesh
articles.subtitle: The movie was released in 2022

articles.content: China is constructing the world's largest artificial island airport, the Dalian Jinzhouwan International Airport, to boost regional trade and connectivity. Spanning 20 square kilometres, it will feature four runways and a 900,000-square-metre terminal. Set for completion by 2035 at a cost of $4.3 billion, the airport will eventually handle up to 80 million passengers annually.
articles.title: China building world’s largest artificial-island airport in Dalian
articles.subtitle: It is 1st Chinese airport on artificial island

articles.content: Asian Energy Solutions Limited, engaged in the business of providing a wide range of services to the energy and minerals sector, jumped up to 5% in the day’s trade upon receiving a new work order worth ₹200 crore for supplying Compressor Station on a Build, Own, Operate, and Transfer (BOOT) basis for 3 years.
articles.title: Asian Energy Solutions secures ₹200 cr compressor station order
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: ITC fixed January 1, 2025, as the effective date for demerger of its hotel business after receiving an approval order from National Company Law Tribunal. The demerger was approved by shareholders in June. Following the demerger, ITC will retain 40% stake in ITC Hotels, with ITC shareholders acquiring the remaining 60% in proportion to their stake in the parent entity.
articles.title: ITC hotel business demerger to be effective from Jan 1, 2025
articles.subtitle: ITC hotel division's revenue rose 12% YoY in Q2

articles.content: The Noida authority's CEO made the staff of the residential plot department work for 20 minutes without sitting on their chairs as punishment for not duly attending to visitors. The visuals of this were caught on camera. "I noticed through CCTV...that...one...of our staff members was sitting idle...I saw a senior citizen standing for over an hour," CEO Lokesh M said.
articles.title: Noida authority CEO makes staff stand for 20 minutes after elderly man made to wait
articles.subtitle: Social media users have praised the CEO's move

articles.content: Union Minister JP Nadda on Tuesday criticised the Congress party, calling the Emergency an "evil attempt to strangle democracy". Talking about the Emergency days, Nadda said that he was an Intermediate student in Patna and was arrested twice from the class. "We had gone to study, we were arrested from the class. We have seen those days too," he said.
articles.title: Was arrested from class, we've seen those days: Nadda on Emergency
articles.subtitle: 'Emergency was imposed as chair was in danger'

articles.content: The Football Association handed a provisional suspension to Chelsea winger Mykhailo Mudryk after he was tested positive in a doping test. Mudryk has been out of the club’s last five matches and has not featured since the Europa Conference League match on November 28. The Blues manager Enzo Maresca suggested illness was the reason behind the footballer’s absence.
articles.title: Mykhailo Mudryk provisionally suspended for positive doping test
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Visuals of long queues for baldness cure in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut have surfaced on social media. Police intervened after several people gathered causing traffic jam after seeing a newspaper ad by men named Anees Mandola and Salman, who were offering baldness cure oil massage for ₹20 and the oil's bottle for ₹300. They reportedly had no permit for the gathering.
articles.title: Men selling baldness cure for ₹20 cause traffic jam in UP; pics show long queue
articles.subtitle: The men came from Delhi

articles.content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said in the Lok Sabha that unemployment rate in the country has come down to 3.2% from 6% in 2017-18. "Inflation is better controlled in NDA regime. Under UPA, it touched double digits," Sitharaman added and said that there is no generalised slowdown in manufacturing.
articles.title: Unemployment rate down from 6% in 2017-18 to 3.2% now: Nirmala Sitharaman
articles.subtitle: 'Half the manufacturing sectors showing growth'

articles.content: Congress MP Manickam Tagore claimed that 'One Nation, One Election' proposal failed to gain two-thirds support in Lok Sabha. Sharing a screenshot of e-voting system, Tagore said, "Two-thirds majority (307) was needed out of total 461 votes...but government secured only (269), while the opposition got 198." "It's obvious that they should not persist too long with this," Shashi Tharoor said.
articles.title: ONOE proposal failed to gain 2/3rd support: Congress MP
articles.subtitle: 'They very clearly don't have 2/3rd majority'

articles.content: Ukraine's SBU intelligence service planted a bomb in an electric scooter that killed Russian general Igor Kirillov, who Ukraine accused of being responsible for use of chemical weapons against its troops, Reuters reported. The 54-year-old is the most senior Russian military officer to have been assassinated inside Russia by Ukraine. Russia may rush to find way to avenge Kirillov's murder.
articles.title: Ukraine planted bomb that killed Russian general accused of chemical weapon crimes: Report
articles.subtitle: 'Ukraine leadership now faces imminent revenge'

articles.content: The workers of WB Montreal are reportedly set to lay off 99 quality assurance team members. According to sources, the announcement was made during a recent internal staff meeting. The team was targeted due to the relatively poor reception of Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League. WB Games Montreal has yet to confirm the news.
articles.title: WB Games Montreal to lay-off 99 team members
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The Special Representative (SR) Dialogue is a mechanism established in 2003 to find a political solution to the India-China boundary issue. Suspended since 2019 due to the eastern Ladakh border row, the 23rd round will be held in Beijing on December 18. National Security Advisor Ajit Doval will lead discussions, marking a step towards improved bilateral ties.
articles.title: What's Special Representative Dialogue for which Doval is visiting China?
articles.subtitle: Decision to revive the dialogue was taken in Oct

articles.content: Actor Rahul Vohra recalled filming 'Swades' at the NASA Headquarters, and shared that he and Shah Rukh Khan went to the launch pad where not even the NASA director was allowed. "We had clearances from...White House, CIA Headquarters at Langley Virginia, US military and FBI," he added. Vohra also shared that he and SRK were gifted a rare astronaut's hat.
articles.title: Went to NASA launch pad, got clearance from CIA: Vohra on Swades
articles.subtitle: 'Were allowed to shoot from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm'

articles.content: The gold jewellery industry is projected to grow 14-18 percent in FY2025, driven by rising prices, festive demand, and store expansions, says ICRA. Despite a temporary margin dip from the customs duty cut, organised players are expected to expand networks, especially in Tier II and Tier III cities.
articles.title: Gold jewellery industry to grow 14-18% in FY2025: ICRA
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: KL Rahul has been India’s best batter in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy. He has faced the most deliveries in the series and has made Australian bowlers work hard for his wicket. "You have to soak in the pressure and wait for your time to score runs. You have to earn the right to score runs in overseas conditions," said Rahul.
articles.title: You have to earn the right to score runs in overseas: KL Rahul
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Team India head coach Gautam Gambhir jumped out of his chair and high-fived Virat Kohli as Akash Deep and Jasprit Bumrah helped India avoid follow-on in the Gabba Test. Akash and Bumrah stitched an unbeaten partnership for 10th wicket of 39 runs on Day 4. India trail Australia by 193 runs.
articles.title: Gambhir jumps out of his chair, high-fives Kohli as Akash, Bumrah help India avoid follow-on
articles.subtitle: Akash is batting on 27*(31)

articles.content: Mounee Consulting Services posted a job opening for a Data Analyst in Noida with a note saying, "South Indian candidates are not eligible for this position." The post sparked a controversy among social media users, with one X user saying, "What part of being a data analyst involves having to know Hindi?" The job advertisement required fluency in Hindi.
articles.title: Job ad says 'South Indian candidates not eligible' for position in Noida, sparks row
articles.subtitle: 'Why are so called language activists silent?'

articles.content: China on Tuesday executed ex-official Li Jianping, who was convicted in the largest-ever corruption case in the country. The 64-year-old was found guilty of embezzling three billion yuan (around $412 million) in illegal gains. Li's death sentence was initially issued in September 2022 and upheld on appeal in August 2024. The execution followed the approval of the Supreme People's Court.
articles.title: China executes ex-official involved in its largest corruption case
articles.subtitle: The execution took place in Inner Mongolia

articles.content: India captain Rohit Sharma left his gloves in front of dugout after getting out in India's first innings in the Gabba Test, sparking retirement rumours. Rohit got out for 10 runs off 27 deliveries. Reacting to Rohit's gesture, a fan commented, "He is about to announce his retirement, I guess." Another wrote, "Does it mean he's going home?"
articles.title: Rohit Sharma leaves gloves in front of dugout, sparks retirement rumours
articles.subtitle: India trail Australia by 193 runs after Day 4

articles.content: Pakistan Defence Minister Khawaja Asif stated that negotiations with PTI cannot begin until a clear message is received from its founder Imran Khan. He called PTI leadership powerless and highlighted internal disputes. Asif also emphasized Pakistan's concern over Afghan soil being used by the banned TTP for cross-border attacks.
articles.title: Pakistan Defence Minister says PTI talks can't start without Imran
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Union Minister JP Nadda criticised Congress over Emergency and amendment to the Constitution's Preamble and said, "The bad lot has interfered with Constitution many times." Nadda also criticised ex-PM Jawaharlal Nehru for bringing Article 370, which gave special status to J&K. "After the bad lot, we got the good lot. On August 5, 2019, we abrogated Article 370," he added.
articles.title: Bad lot interfered with Constitution many times: Nadda on Congress
articles.subtitle: Preamble was amended in 1976

articles.content: Zomato's Global Head of Finance and Hyperpure unit's CFO Hemal Jain has resigned after six years at the food delivery company. In a letter, Jain said, "After much reflection, I have taken this tough decision to move on and explore a different path." This is the second top-level departure from the company after its Co-founder Akriti Chopra resigned in September.
articles.title: Zomato's Global Finance Head Hemal Jain resigns
articles.subtitle: Jain's last working day will be Jan 31, 2025

articles.content: Klarna stopped hiring humans last year, CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski told Bloomberg, adding that "AI can already do all the jobs that we as humans do". He added that the Swedish fintech will work to translate profits brought by AI's efficiency into more frequent pay raises for employees. On Klarna's website still advertising open positions, it said it's backfilling "essential roles".
articles.title: Klarna stops hiring humans as 'AI can do all work', to use resulting profits for pay hikes
articles.subtitle: 'By not hiring, we're simply shrinking'

articles.content: Black Myth: Wukong gamers were seen review bombing Baldur's Gate 3. The reason behind this backlash was the remarks made by Baldur's Gate creator Swen Vincke while delivering the Game of the Year award. Vincke said the winner 'didn't have to meet any arbitrary sales target' and 'didn't treat their developers like numbers on a spreadsheet.'
articles.title: Black Myth: Wukong gamers review bomb Baldur Gate's 3
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Madhya Pradesh CM Mohan Yadav thanked PM Narendra Modi for the MoU on the Parvati-Kalisindh-Chambal river linking project signed between Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh. The project will benefit several districts by providing drinking water and industrial supply. PM Modi urged other states to collaborate for public welfare.
articles.title: MP, Rajasthan sign MoU for PKC river project
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Gautam Buddha Nagar administration has asked all schools in Noida and Greater Noida to start classes from 9 am amid cold weather conditions, according to an official order. It has also ordered schools to switch to hybrid mode of teaching for students up to Class 5 due to pollution. Government departments have been asked to enforce staggered work timings.
articles.title: Noida & Gr Noida schools to start classes from 9 am amid winters
articles.subtitle: GRAP-4 anti-pollution curbs reimposed in NCR

articles.content: DMK leader Kanimozhi opposed the One Nation One Election bill, calling it unconstitutional and against federal rights. She stated it undermines the federal structure and the will of the people. The bill, introduced in Lok Sabha, was sent to a Joint Parliamentary Committee for detailed discussions.
articles.title: Kanimozhi opposes One Nation One Election bill
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A thin layer of frost formed on leaves in some parts of Odisha recently as the temperature dropped to as low as 3°C in some areas of the Mayurbhanj district, ANI reported. According to Forest Department, temperatures plummeted to as low as 10°C in Ramatirtha, while areas like Barehipani, Chahala and Nawana recorded temperatures of 6°C, 4°C and 5°C, respectively.
articles.title: Odisha sees rare frost as temperature dips to 3°C
articles.subtitle: 'Possibility of increase in temp by Dec 16-17'

articles.content: A set of four unrelated photos of Hindu idols and objects is viral on social media falsely claiming that they were discovered during the recent survey of the Shahi Jama Masjid in Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh. BOOM found that the set of four photos are unrelated and were not captured after the survey at Shahi Jama Masjid in Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh.
articles.title: Unrelated Hindu idols pics falsely linked to Sambhal mosque survey
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Talking about batter Ravindra Jadeja who scored 77(123) in India's first innings in third Test against Australia, ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said India can think of dropping a batter but not Jadeja. "Unlike top order, he didn't play and miss. He looked the most comfortable Indian batter," Kaif stated. Jadeja was not part of the team in first two Tests.
articles.title: India can think of dropping a batter but not Jadeja: Kaif on 77
articles.subtitle: Jadeja smashed 7 fours in his knock

articles.content: Shiv Sena Leader Uday Samant extended his support to the One Nation One Election bill tabled in Lok Sabha on Tuesday. "It'll be good for the country. It was PM Modi's commitment to implement it. We are with him," he said. The bill that proposes simultaneous elections for the Lok Sabha and state assemblies has faced criticism from the Opposition.
articles.title: It'll be good for the country: Shiv Sena's Samant on ONOE bill
articles.subtitle: Opposition said the bill is attack on democracy

articles.content: Andhra Pradesh government approved the solar deal, for which Adani Group executives allegedly paid bribes totalling $228 million, against officials' advice, Reuters reported. Few officials publicly said the deal would strain government coffers and procure electricity that the state doesn't need. Experts added the 57 days Andhra Pradesh energy regulator took for deal's approval was unusually fast.
articles.title: Adani deal involving bribe passed against officials' advice: Report
articles.subtitle: Andhra govt approved deal 1 day after SECI's bid

articles.content: NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal took a veiled dig at party chief Ajit Pawar after he was denied a ministerial berth in CM Devendra Fadnavis' cabinet in Maharashtra. "I am not a toy in your hands who will follow blindly everything....CM wanted me in his cabinet. But I was dropped," said Bhujbal. "In every party, the chief decides this," he added.
articles.title: I am not a toy in anyone’s hand: Bhujbal on Maha cabinet exclusion
articles.subtitle: 'I'll find out who rejected my name'

articles.content: An Indian woman who was living in Pakistan for the last 22 years returned to her homeland on Monday, an official said. The woman, originally from Mumbai, was fraudulently brought to Pakistan by a travel agent. According to her, the agent deceived her with the promise of a job in Dubai but instead brought her to Pakistan's Hyderabad in 2002.
articles.title: Indian woman deceived by travel agent returns from Pak after 22yrs
articles.subtitle: She got married in Pakistan

articles.content: UP CM Yogi Adityanath criticised Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi for carrying bag with 'Palestine' written over it. "Congress leader was spotted with Palestine bag...while we are sending youths of UP to Israel for Jobs," Adityanath said. "The Congress leadership remains disconnected from national priorities," Adityanath added. Meanwhile, Priyanka carried a bag with Bangladesh written on it today.
articles.title: UP youths being sent to Israel for job: UP CM on Priyanka's bag
articles.subtitle: 'Who's going to decide what clothes I wear now?'

articles.content: Australia pacer Josh Hazlewood has been ruled out of ongoing Gabba Test after sustaining a right-sided calf strain during warm-ups on the fourth day. He walked off the field after bowling just one over. Hazlewood is likely to miss the remainder of the Border-Gavaskar series, with Scott Boland returning to the side for the Boxing Day Test at the MCG.
articles.title: Hazlewood ruled out of Gabba Test, likely to miss rest of series
articles.subtitle: Hazlewood took 1 wicket in The Gabba Test

articles.content: Instagram has launched a new feature allowing users to schedule direct messages up to 29 days in advance. Users can long-press the send button in a chat to set a date and time for text-based messages. Currently, photos, videos, and GIFs cannot be scheduled. This update enhances messaging flexibility.
articles.title: Instagram now lets users schedule DMs for later delivery
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee criticised the BJP over the 'One Nation, One Election' bill, calling it an "unashamed" attack on democracy. The bill proposes simultaneous elections for the Lok Sabha and state assemblies across India. "The One Nation One Election bill seeks to rob the people of their fundamental right to vote regularly," Banerjee wrote on X.
articles.title: Unashamed attack on democracy: TMC's Banerjee on ONOE bill
articles.subtitle: 'It's direct assault on foundation of democracy'

articles.content: The mother of Nirbhaya, who was gang-raped in a moving bus in Delhi in December 2012, said that the daughters are still not safe in the country. "It is with great pain that I want to say that even after 12 years the circumstances have not changed...The daughters of the country are not safe," Nirbhaya's mother Asha Devi said.
articles.title: Even after 12 years, the daughters are not safe: Nirbhaya's mother
articles.subtitle: To know what else she said

articles.content: Former Google executive and author Jenny Wood has shared three red flags to avoid while making a resume. She advised people not to go over five bullet points for any role, not to overdo it with links and to try not to "cram in" too much. She stated that one-line bullet points make people look like an "absolute superstar."
articles.title: What are the red flags to avoid in resumes?
articles.subtitle: Wood is Google's Own Your Career Program Founder

articles.content: Kannada superstar Darshan's partner and actress Pavithra Gowda walked out of a Bengaluru jail on Tuesday, after being granted bail in the sensational Renukaswamy murder case. She was spotted visiting the Vajra Muneshwara temple in Talaghattapura to perform a special puja for Darshan. She even got emotional while offering her prayers to the deity for Darshan.
articles.title: Pavithra performs puja for Darshan after bail in Renukaswamy case
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Pat Cummins became the captain with the third-highest Test wickets, surpassing Garfield Sobers and Daniel Vettori during the Brisbane Test against India. Cummins now has 119 wickets as captain. Above him are Richie Benaud with 138 and Imran Khan with 187. The series is tied at 1-1.
articles.title: Pat Cummins claims third-highest Test wickets as captain
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Pakistani actress Mahira Khan said she thought her career was over after pictures of her smoking with Bollywood actor Ranbir Kapoor came out. "That time was very tough. I wouldn't get out of bed, I was crying daily and it affected my professional and personal life. Lots happened on my personal side," the 39-year-old added. The pictures surfaced in 2017.
articles.title: Felt my career was over after pics of me smoking with Ranbir came out: Mahira
articles.subtitle: Mahira featured in the 2017 film 'Raees'

articles.content: Reacting to Akash Deep and Jasprit Bumrah putting up 39*-run partnership in India's first innings against Australia, Wasim Jaffer said Akash and Bumrah ensured KL Rahul and Ravindra Jadeja's knocks didn't go in vain. India avoided the follow-on with the help of the partnership in the third Test. Rahul and Jadeja scored 84(139) and 77(123) respectively.
articles.title: Akash & Bumrah ensured Rahul's knock didn't go in vain: Jaffer
articles.subtitle: India were 252/9 at Day 4 Stumps

articles.content: The US military on Tuesday said it bombed a Houthi command and control facility in Yemen's Sanaa. The strike targeted the facility that was a hub for coordinating attacks on US Navy and merchant vessels in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden. Houthis have targeted dozens of merchant vessels with missiles and drones since Israel-Hamas war broke out.
articles.title: US military bombs Houthi command & control facility in Yemen
articles.subtitle: Israel-Hamas war broke out in October 2023

articles.content: Businessmen Raj Kundra, while referring to the porn racket case, said his wife Shilpa Shetty is being used as a clickbait. Criticising the media, the 49-year-old stated, "It's so unfair that the controversy is mine, and you are involving Shilpa's name...You are spoiling her reputation for views," he added. Kundra was arrested in the case by Mumbai Police in 2021.
articles.title: Controversy is mine, unfair that Shilpa is being involved: Raj Kundra on porn racket case
articles.subtitle: 'Shilpa has nothing to do with this'

articles.content: After five accused were arrested for allegedly kidnapping actor-comedian Sunil Pal, he said that he prays Yogi Adityanath remains the CM of the state. "Criminals are facing the harshest possible punishment...Yogi government is handling such situations," he said. Sunil further urged Adityanath to continue to guide the police. Notably, one of the accused was shot in the leg by police.
articles.title: I pray Yogi Adityanath remains UP CM: Sunil on kidnappers' arrest
articles.subtitle: 'The truth will come out soon'

articles.content: Addressing the UP Assembly, CM Yogi Adityanath said that Lucknow's Shia-Sunni dispute came to an end under BJP's rule. "That's why we said, Hum na batenge, na katenge (We'll not get divided)," he said. He further said the slogan of 'Jai Shri Ram' is not provocative, adding, "I can spend my whole life with the salutations of 'Jai Shri Ram'."
articles.title: 'Hum na batenge, na katenge,' says CM Yogi in UP Assembly
articles.subtitle: 'We do not need any other salutation'

articles.content: Addressing his first press conference after being elected US President, Donald Trump claimed that everyone was "fighting" him during his first term but now wants to become his friend. "I don't know, [I feel like] my personality changed or something," he further said. Trump, who will take oath on January 20, had previously served as President from 2017-2021.
articles.title: Everyone fought me in 1st term, now they want to be friends: Trump
articles.subtitle: He addressed many issues, including Ukraine war

articles.content: Comedian Kapil Sharma, who was criticised over his comment on filmmaker Atlee, has reacted to the controversy. An X user shared a video of Kapil and Atlee's interaction on the show, along with the caption, "Kapil Sharma subtly insults Atlee's looks?" "Can you [please] explain...where and when I talked about looks in this video? [Please] don't...spread...hate on...social media," Kapil responded.
articles.title: Don't spread hate: Kapil Sharma to X user who claimed he insulted Atlee for his looks
articles.subtitle: 'Guys watch and decide by yourself'

articles.content: Virat Kohli's average in Tests stands at 47.49, third lowest among players who've scored 9,000 runs in red-ball cricket. He's also the only batter in 'fab four', a group consisting of Kohli, Steven Smith, Kane Williamson and Joe Root, to have Test average below 50. While Smith's Test average is 56.35, Williamson and Root's averages stand at 54.88 and 50.87.
articles.title: Kohli's average in Test 3rd lowest among players with 9,000 runs
articles.subtitle: Kohli scored 3 runs in Gabba Test's 1st innings

articles.content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday inaugurated 24 projects worth over ₹46,000 crore in Rajasthan's Jaipur. The projects are related to Railways, energy, road and water sectors, and include Navnera Barrage and Smart Electricity Transmission Network. He also laid the foundation stone for the construction work of Ramgarh Barrage and Mahalpur Barrage. He was accompanied by CM Bhajan Lal Sharma.
articles.title: PM launches, lays foundation stone of ₹46,000-cr projects in Raj
articles.subtitle: 'When Raj develops, India will also develop'

articles.content: Hearing the Competition Commission of India's plea to transfer all cases filed by Amazon and Flipkart sellers against it to a single court, the Supreme Court on December 16 observed that prima facie, all cases should be handled by the Karnataka High Court. Justices AS Oka and Manmohan were hearing the competition watchdog's plea to transfer 24 writ petitions to the High Court.
articles.title: Supreme Court says Karnataka HC should handle Amazon-Flipkart case
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Gaming major Nazara Technologies has announced the acquisition of 1,000 equity shares of Nextwave Multimedia, the developers of the mobile cricket game franchise World Cricket Championship, for ₹2.3 crore. This increases the gaming major's total holding in Nextwave Multimedia to 74.88%, up from 71.88%.
articles.title: Nazara Technologies acquires 1,000 shares in Nextwave Multimedia
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Rapper-singer Badshah was fined ₹15,500 for wrong-side driving of the road after attending Punjabi singer Karan Aujla's concert in Gurugram. While the car was not registered in the rapper's name, he was reportedly present in it. The traffic police have also taken possession of CCTV footage to identify other vehicles that were part of Badshah's convoy.
articles.title: Badshah fined ₹15,500 for wrong-side driving in Gurugram
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Shares of DroneAcharya Aerial Innovations rallied as much as 12.88% to touch an intraday high of ₹131.00 on the BSE on December 16 after the company announced its strategic expansion into the Middle East through a new subsidiary in Abu Dhabi. The expansion comes as DroneAcharya reported H1FY25 PAT of ₹1.50 crore, down 62.1% YoY, despite revenue growing 28.8% to ₹26.90 crore.
articles.title: DroneAcharya shares climb to 12.88% amid expansion plans
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Zomato-backed fitness startup Curefit consolidated net loss for the financial year ending March 2024 widened 42% to ₹888.5 crore from ₹625.5 crore in the previous fiscal year due to an increase in cash burn. The rise in loss came despite the startup operating revenue growing 33.6% to ₹926.6 crore in FY24 from ₹693.7 crore in FY23.
articles.title: Zomato-backed startup Curefit faces loss 42% to ₹889 cr
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Scientists have uncovered evidence of cannibalism in a 4,000-year-old massacre in Somerset where 37 people were killed. Analysis of 3,000 bone fragments revealed cut marks indicating the victims were dismembered with stone tools and consumed. Researchers suggest the act was ritualistic, aimed at "dehumanising" the victims and sending a message by "insulting the remains".
articles.title: Somerset massacre victims were cannibalised in Bronze Age: Study
articles.subtitle: It is Bronze Age's largest incidence of violence

articles.content: Dominique Pelicot, a French man accused of organising the rape of his sedated ex-wife by dozens of strangers, sought forgiveness during his trial. "I would like to start by hailing the courage of my ex-wife," he said. "I regret what I did, making (my family) suffer...Accept my apologies," he added. Pelicot, 72, admitted drugging Gisele Pelicot for nearly a decade.
articles.title: Accept my apologies: Pelicot's ex-husband in mass rape trial
articles.subtitle: 'I ask my family for forgiveness'

articles.content: The 'One Nation, One Election' Bills have been introduced in Lok Sabha after division voting. As many as 269 MPs voted in favour and 198 against the motion of introducing the Bills in the house. The Bills have been referred to Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC), which Home Minister Amit Shah said PM Narendra Modi wanted.
articles.title: 'One Nation, One Election' Bills introduced in Parliament after division voting
articles.subtitle: Voting held through electronic system

articles.content: Two passengers who arrived from Saudi Arabia's Riyadh were arrested at Delhi airport after they were caught wearing underwear weighing about one kilogram each. Secret pockets were discovered in the underwear containing 931.57 grams of 24K gold worth ₹68.93 lakh, Delhi customs said in a post on X. The passengers aged 41 and 36 are from UP, the customs added.
articles.title: Men wearing 1kg underwear held at Delhi airport, 930gm gold seized
articles.subtitle: The seizure took place on December 15

articles.content: An Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT) bench has ruled that profits from cryptocurrency sales before April 1, 2022, will be treated as capital gains. Taxpayers can benefit from tax deductions on such gains under the Income Tax Act, ITAT said. The government introduced regulations for virtual digital assets in 2022 which ruled out tax exemptions for them.
articles.title: Crypto gains before FY23 eligible for tax exemptions: ITAT
articles.subtitle: 'The regulations are prospective in nature'

articles.content: When asked about the potential ban on TikTok, US President-elect Donald Trump said, "I've a warm spot in my heart for TikTok." "I won youth by 34 points...[People] say that TikTok has something to do with that," he added. TikTok CEO Shou Chew reportedly met Trump at Mar-a-Lago on Monday. TikTok told to divest its Chinese ownership interest by January.
articles.title: I've warm spot in my heart for TikTok: Trump ahead of potential ban
articles.subtitle: Trump unsuccessfully tried to ban TikTok in 2020

articles.content: The Delhi High Court has referred a trademark dispute filed by Medecins Sans Frontieres (MSF), also known as Doctors Without Borders, against Dharma Productions to mediation. The suit challenges the unauthorized use of MSF’s trademark in a scene from the Alia Bhatt-starrer film Jigra.
articles.title: Delhi HC refers MSF trademark dispute with Dharma to mediation
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Indian Union Muslim League MP ET Muhammed Basheer opposed the One Nation One Election bill, calling it an attack on democracy and federalism. The Constitution Amendment Bill 2024 was introduced in Lok Sabha, with 269 members in favor and 196 against. The bill will be sent to a Joint Parliamentary Committee for discussions.
articles.title: IUML MP calls One Nation One Election an attack on democracy
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole on Tuesday said he has expressed his willingness to resign from the post and now it's up to the party high command to decide. However, Patole clarified that last week he had not tendered his resignation and rumours were being spread. Congress won 16 seats out of the 288 seats in the Maharashtra Assembly polls.
articles.title: Maha Congress chief Patole offers to resign after poll defeat
articles.subtitle: Opposition MVA won 46 seats in the Assembly poll

articles.content: Former President Ram Nath Kovind said the 'One Nation One Election' model is competent for the all-round development of the Indian population. "In other aspects also, adopting this model will help the nation," he stated. Notably, 'One Nation One Election' Bills were tabled in Parliament today. Congress has opposed the Bills in the Parliament.
articles.title: 'ONOE' model competent for all-round development of India: Kovind
articles.subtitle: 'The Bills are unconstitutional'

articles.content: Coromandel International Limited partnered with Mahindra's Farm Equipment Sector to expand drone spraying services across seven Indian states. The collaboration leverages Mahindra's 'Krish-e Kheti Ke Liye App' to provide farmers with advanced agricultural technology. The company's subsidiary, Dhaksha Unmanned Systems, supports the initiative by providing drones and trained pilots.
articles.title: Coromandel & Mahindra team up for drone spraying services in India
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A 19-year-old man working at a roadside stall in Mumbai died after getting pulled into a grinder while he was preparing Chinese bhel, reports said. The incident involving the deceased, identified as Suraj Narayan Yadav, was also captured on CCTV camera. Police have registered a case against the food stall's owner Sachin Kothekar.
articles.title: Man crushed to death by grinder while making Chinese bhel, incident caught on camera
articles.subtitle: Kothekar booked for negligence over the death

articles.content: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami distributed appointment letters to 45 candidates in Dehradun, including 11 lab assistants in the Home Department and 34 youth welfare officers. CM Dhami emphasized the importance of transparency in recruitment and urged the new recruits to contribute to the state's development.
articles.title: CM Dhami distributes 45 appointment letters in Dehradun
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Sangani Hospitals' stock rose 2.74% to ₹77 after signing a 10-year Memorandum of Understanding with Dr Bhanuben Nanavati Hospital, Chorvad. The agreement, effective December 16, 2024, involves managing and operating the hospital without share transfers or changes in management control.
articles.title: Sangani Hospitals stock rises 2.74% on MoU with Nanavati hospital
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Islamabad District and Sessions Court extended the interim bail of PTI founder Imran Khan and his wife Bushra Bibi in the Toshakhana case until January 7. The case involves allegations of illegally obtaining a Bulgari jewelry set during a visit to Saudi Arabia, causing a loss to the national treasury.
articles.title: Imran Khan, Bushra Bibi's bail extended till January 7
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Shares of Genesys International Corporation Ltd surged by 8% after securing a ₹56 crore project from DLRS in West Bengal to modernize land records using advanced geospatial technology. The project involves precision mapping, georeferencing, and creating 3D terrain models and cadastral maps to improve land administration accuracy and efficiency.
articles.title: Genesys International shares soar 8% after securing ₹56 cr project
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: 28-year-old Akash Deep set a unique batting record after his unbeaten 27 became the second-highest score for an Indian No.11 against Australia during the third Test in Brisbane. Shivlal Yadav still holds the highest score for an Indian No.11, with 41 in Adelaide, all the way back in 1985.
articles.title: Akash Deep sets unique batting record at the Gabba
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Ravindra Jadeja's brilliant fifty kept India's hopes alive in the Brisbane Test against Australia. Following his knock, he celebrated with his signature sword dance, a gesture beloved by cricket fans worldwide. This iconic celebration reflected his fighting spirit, embodying the determination that has become a trademark of Jadeja's playing style.
articles.title: Ravindra Jadeja does iconic sword celebration after reaching a 50
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Actress Sharmila Tagore called Shatrughan Sinha "notorious" for his habit of being late, adding his car would enter 'Dostana' sets when Amitabh Bachchan's car would leave. "You can imagine director Raj Khosla lost all his hair during the making of the film...You won't find all three—Amitabh, Shatrughan, and Zeenat Aman—in one frame," she said. The film released in 1980.
articles.title: Big B would leave & Shatrughan Sinha would enter: Sharmila Tagore on 'Dostana' shoot
articles.subtitle: 'Shatrughan was late to his own wedding'

articles.content: The Government e-Marketplace (GeM) hosted Seller Samvad 2024 in Dehradun, Uttarakhand, to empower local entrepreneurs, MSEs, and women-led businesses. Over 60 sellers attended training sessions on the GeM platform. Uttarakhand has 20,000 sellers on GeM, contributing significantly to digital procurement and economic growth.
articles.title: GeM hosts 'Seller Samvad 2024' to empower Uttarakhand sellers
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Nikita Singhania, the estranged wife of Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash, who died by suicide following alleged harassment by Nikita and her family, said, "If I harassed Atul for money, why would I stay away from him?" Following her arrest, Nikita claimed it was Atul who subjected her to harassment. She said she'd been living separately from Atul for three years.
articles.title: If I harassed Atul for money, why would I stay away from him?: Wife Nikita
articles.subtitle: Nikita, her mother, Nikita's brother arrested

articles.content: A YouTube video thumbnail claiming the Central Government will waive electricity bills for everyone under an "Electricity Bill Waiver Scheme" is fake. The Press Information Bureau's Factcheck Unit confirmed there is no such scheme. "Be cautious. Don't fall prey to such tempting claims," PIB Factcheck warned in its advisory.
articles.title: YouTube thumbnail saying electricity bill to be waived off is fake
articles.subtitle: The fake details were attributed to APD Academy

articles.content: Rohit Sharma was dismissed for 10 runs by Pat Cummins early on in the third Border-Gavaskar Test at The Gabba. Cummins, who dismissed him for the second straight time in the series, celebrated with a short dance. Cummins, energized after claiming the first wicket of the day, celebrated with a short-step jog, mimicking Mitchell Marsh's signature celebration.
articles.title: Pat Cummins dances after dismissing Rohit Sharma in BGT 3rd Test
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: When asked about being criticised for calling Union Home Minister Amit Shah the "Lord Hanuman of India", actor Varun Dhawan said, "Let the critics speak. I'm not a political man." "I called him Lord Hanuman because he consistently places India and Prime Minister Narendra Modi ji above all else," said Varun. This selflessness reminded me of Lord Hanuman, he added.
articles.title: I'm not a political man: Varun on calling Amit Shah 'India's Lord Hanuman'
articles.subtitle: Varun will next be seen in 'Baby John'

articles.content: Sensex fell over 1,000 points intraday on Tuesday while Nifty dipped 330 points. One of the key reasons for this was US Fed's upcoming interest rate decision, which investors are watching closely. Indian rupee also hit a record low of 84.92 against US dollar while FIIs went on a selling spree on Monday. Additionally, heavyweight stocks also dragged Sensex lower.
articles.title: Why did Sensex fall over 1,000 points intraday today?
articles.subtitle: Bharti Airtel, IndusInd Bank were top losers

articles.content: The Central Government has sanctioned ₹777.61 crore to widen and upgrade the Shangshak-Tengnoupal Road in Manipur under the 2024-25 Annual Plan. The 48-km stretch on NH-102A will be expanded to two lanes, boosting connectivity, reducing vehicle costs, and promoting tourism and economic growth in the region.
articles.title: Govt approves ₹777.61 cr for Shangshak-Tengnoupal road in Manipur
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A video has surfaced on social media showing Team India's head coach, Gautam Gambhir, performing shadow practice in the dressing room amid the team's batting struggles in the 3rd Test of ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy. The team's continued batting failures have led to growing scrutiny of the head coach and his support staff.
articles.title: Gambhir does shadow practice as India batters struggle in 3rd Test
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: An audio clip claiming to feature Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar's speech from the Second Round Table Conference in London from 1931 has gone viral online. However, The Quint has revealed the clip is fake, with the voice actually belonging to Malayalam actor Mammootty. Mammootty portrayed the role of the leader in the 2000 biopic titled Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar.
articles.title: Audio clip claiming to feature Dr Ambedkar’s voice is from movie
articles.subtitle: The speech can also be found in official records

articles.content: England Test skipper Ben Stokes expressed delight with the series win over New Zealand but was disappointed with the heavy defeat in the final Test. England won the first two matches but fell to a 423-run loss in the third. Stokes praised the team effort despite the setback, securing their first series win in New Zealand since 2008.
articles.title: Stokes proud of series win, disappointed with 3rd Test loss
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The Karnataka legislature's winter session in Belagavi made history on Monday by conducting a 15-hour-long session. Starting at 10 am, the proceedings continued uninterrupted, with only a lunch break and minor disruptions, until 12:55 am. The session broke a decade-old record set between 2009 and 2013 under Speaker KG Bopaiah, which ended at 1:45 am.
articles.title: Karnataka Assembly sets record with 15-hour non-stop session
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Opposing 'One Nation One Election' Bills which were tabled in Parliament today, AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi said the bills are "draconian" and "unconstitutional". He stated the bills introduce "presidential style of democracy" and will "finish off regional parties". "These bills are only brought in to massage the ego of the supreme leader," he further said.
articles.title: Draconian, they'll finish regional parties: Owaisi on 'ONOE' Bills
articles.subtitle: 'Bills are based on maximising political gain'

articles.content: Singer Chinmayi Sripaada criticised Kapil Sharma for his remark on 'Jawan' director Atlee's appearance. "Will they never stop these crass and racist jibes...in name of 'comedy'? Someone with the amount of influence and clout like Kapil Sharma saying something like this is disappointing...[but] not surprising," she said. "When you meet a star, do they say, 'Where's Atlee?'" Kapil had joked.
articles.title: Will racist jibes never stop?: Chinmayi as she criticises Kapil's joke on Atlee
articles.subtitle: 'They'd have choreographed it'

articles.content: Talking about 'One Nation One Election' Bills, Home Minister Amit Shah said when the Bills came up in Cabinet, PM Narendra Modi said they should be sent to Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC). "He wanted detailed discussion on all topics of the Bills," Shah stated. Notably, 'One Nation One Election' Bills have been tabled in the Parliament today.
articles.title: When ONOE Bills came in cabinet, PM said they must go to JPC: Shah
articles.subtitle: 'This Bill could pave way for dictatorship'

articles.content: Following criticism of the two Bills on 'One Nation One Election' by Opposition, Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal said, "Objections to these Bills are political in nature." He said, "The Bills are in line with Constitution, do not assault basic structure doctrine." "There'll be no damage to the Constitution...We are not tampering with the powers of the states," he added.
articles.title: There will be no damage to Constitution with 'ONOE' Bills: Meghwal
articles.subtitle: Opposition sought the Bills' withdrawal

articles.content: In response to Australia's 445, India finished Day 4 at 252/9 in their first innings in the Gabba Test in Brisbane. India avoided the follow-on with Jasprit Bumrah and Akash Deep stitching an unbeaten 39-run partnership. Earlier in the day, KL Rahul and Ravindra Jadeja scored 84 and 77, respectively. Australia captain Pat Cummins has taken four wickets.
articles.title: India avoid follow-on as Bumrah-Akash stich 39*-run partnership, end Day 4 at 252/9
articles.subtitle: To view the match scorecard

articles.content: Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra criticized the central government's relocation of the iconic 1971 Dhaka surrender photograph from the Army Chief's office in South Block to the Manekshaw Centre in Delhi Cantonment. She accused the government of disrespecting war heroes like Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw and Lt Gen JS Aurora. The replaced image now features tanks and religious symbols.
articles.title: Congress slams central govt over relocating Dhaka surrender pic
articles.subtitle: Dhaka Surrender Photo Shift Sparks Controversy

articles.content: Multiple US firms bribed Indian entities like Railways to get contracts and were later fined over 300% of the bribe amount by US, The Pioneer reported. Moog was fined $1.7 million over $500,000 bribes to HAL and Railways while Oracle was fined $23 million for $6.8-million bribes to Railways. Albemarle was fined over $197 million for $63.5-million bribes to IOCL.
articles.title: US firms bribe Indian Railways, HAL for contracts; fined 300% of bribes by US: Report
articles.subtitle: US accused Adani of paying bribes for contracts

articles.content: The global oil market is expected to see a surplus in 2025 despite OPEC+ extending supply cuts to stabilize prices. Brent crude is forecasted to average $71 per barrel. Non-OPEC supply growth of 1.4 million barrels per day will outpace demand growth under 1 million barrels per day, keeping the market under pressure. Geopolitical risks remain a concern.
articles.title: Global oil market to see surplus in 2025 despite OPEC+ cuts
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: After a reporter asked Jasprit Bumrah to assess India's batting in Gabba Test and added he might not be the best person to answer, the pacer jokingly said, "You're questioning my batting ability." Bumrah added, "You should use Google and see who has got...most...runs in an over." Bumrah scored 29 runs in 35-run over bowled by Stuart Broad in 2022.
articles.title: Google and see who has got most runs in a Test over, Bumrah jokingly tells reporter
articles.subtitle: To watch Bumrah's interaction with the reporter

articles.content: Businessman Raj Kundra has opened up about the porn racket case in which he was jailed last year. "Till date, I have not been a part of any pornography, any production...I have nothing to do with porn at all." He added, "Let a girl come forward who says she has met me or worked in any of my movies."
articles.title: Has any girl said that she has worked in any of my movies?: Raj Kundra on porn racket case
articles.subtitle: 'The allegations were very hurtful'

articles.content: GST Council may lower tax on food delivery charges by e-commerce players such as Zomato and Swiggy to 5% from 18%, CNBC-TV18 reported. The tax cut, which may take effect retrospectively from January 1, 2022, would disallow delivery platforms from claiming input tax credits, the report added. Recently, Maharashtra's GST department imposed a tax demand of ₹803.4 crore on Zomato.
articles.title: GST council may cut tax on online food delivery fees to 5%: Report
articles.subtitle: GST Council to meet on December 21

articles.content: Addressing a press conference, Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said, "By academic 2023-24 we have more schools than we had in 2013-14. Earlier, 53% of the schools had electricity, but now 91.8% of schools have electricity." Pradhan further said that NCERT is planning to publish 15 crore quality and affordable books to meet the demands of students.
articles.title: 91.8% of Indian schools now have electricity: Pradhan
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: YouTube now allows creators to control third-party AI training on their videos through a new YouTube Studio setting. Creators can approve specific companies, including Adobe, Apple, and OpenAI, or allow all third parties. Google, however, will continue training its own AI models under existing agreements. Settings are adjustable anytime via YouTube Studio Content Manager.
articles.title: YouTube empowers creators to control AI training access
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) is likely to get a new president in February 2025 who will replace incumbent JP Nadda, PTI reported quoting a senior party functionary. The ongoing organisational election is on track to conclude the polling process in over half of its state units by mid-January. The exercise will unveil the process of electing the new national president.
articles.title: BJP to replace Nadda as party president in February 2025: Reports
articles.subtitle: Nadda took over role from Amit Shah in Jan 2020

articles.content: Chennai-based marketing consulting company Toss The Coin's shares made a bumper market debut on Tuesday, listing at ₹345.8 per share on BSE SME, a premium of 90% over the issue price of ₹182. The company's ₹9.17-crore IPO of an entirely fresh issue of shares priced at ₹172-182 was fully subscribed within a few hours of opening on December 10.
articles.title: Toss The Coin's bumper market debut, shares list at 90% premium on IPO price
articles.subtitle: Its IPO was subscribed 952.56 times on final day

articles.content: Congress MP Manish Tewari opposed the two Bills on 'One nation one election' that were passed by Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal in the Lok Sabha, saying the Bills must be "withdrawn immediately". He said, "The Bills...absolutely assault...basic structure of Constitution and are beyond the legislative competence of this House." He said, "Introduction of these Bills have to be stopped."
articles.title: 'One nation one election' Bills have to be stopped: Congress
articles.subtitle: 'The Bills need to be opposed'

articles.content: The United States has advised its citizens to leave Syria following the collapse of the Assad regime, citing growing violence and instability. Americans unable to depart were urged to "shelter in place" and prepare for extended periods of confinement. The US also directed citizens to contact embassies in countries they plan to enter, as consular services in Syria remain suspended.
articles.title: US urges citizens to leave 'volatile' Syria amid violence
articles.subtitle: US embassy in Syria suspended operations in 2012

articles.content: Talking about batter Shubman Gill's form outside Asia, cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra said Gill has been dismissed for single digits or early double digits many times. "If your scores are like this and you bat at number three in Tests, it's a problem," he stated. Gill has scored 179 runs in his last 10 Test innings outside Asia.
articles.title: If your scores are like this at 3, it's a problem: Chopra on Gill
articles.subtitle: Gill made 1(3) in 1st innings in 3rd Test

articles.content: Actress and BJP MP Kangana Ranaut, during Agenda Aaj Tak, was asked about PM Narendra Modi meeting the Kapoor family while she herself has been waiting for an audience with him. "Yes, I've requested for an audience with PM Modi ji. I hope I get it soon." Calling the industry "orphaned", Kangana said it needed PM Modi's guidance.
articles.title: I've requested for audience with PM, hope I get it soon: Kangana
articles.subtitle: 'Actors are very vulnerable'

articles.content: Uncapped batter Simran Shaikh aims to meet Virat Kohli after Gujarat Giants bought her for ₹1.9 crore in the WPL 2025 auction. Simran, the most expensive player of the 2025 WPL mini auction, expressed her dream to play for India. She thanked her family and pledged to perform well for the franchise in the upcoming season.
articles.title: Simran Shaikh eyes Virat Kohli meet after ₹1.9 cr WPL bid
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Opposing 'One Nation One Election' Bill, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav said the feeling of 'one' "has no place for others" and it "violates social tolerance". "Democracy favours plurality. The decision of 'one country-one election' will prove fatal for true democracy," he stated. "This will eliminate importance of regional issues," he further said. The Bill has been tabled in Parliament today.
articles.title: Democracy favours plurality: Akhilesh on 'One Nation One Election'
articles.subtitle: 'The word 'one' itself is undemocratic'

articles.content: On being asked about BJP's protest against her over a bag with "Palestine" written on it which she carried to Parliament, Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi said, "Who's going to decide what clothes I wear now?" "That's typical patriarchy that you decide what women wear also," she stated. BJP IT Cell head Amit Malviya had called Congress "the New Muslim League".
articles.title: Who will decide what I wear?: Priyanka on 'Palestine' bag row
articles.subtitle: 'Priyanka is bigger disaster than Rahul Gandhi'

articles.content: Khan Sir, a popular Patna tutor and YouTuber, clarified he has no intention of entering politics, despite repeated questions. He also responded to allegations of police misconduct during BPSC protests, stating he was not mistreated and was unwell during the protests. Khan Sir acknowledged that the protest was a necessary step to bring the issue to the Commission's attention.
articles.title: Patna’s Khan Sir breaks silence on contesting elections
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Hockey India announced free tickets for all matches of the Hockey India League 2024-25 in Ranchi and Rourkela. This initiative aims to boost fan engagement and promote live hockey. The men's league starts on December 28 in Rourkela, while the women's league begins on January 12 in Ranchi.
articles.title: Hockey India League offers free tickets in Ranchi, Rourkela
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Speaking in the Rajya Sabha on Monday, Union Minister JP Nadda criticised the Congress party over the 'Emergency' and said, "BJP invites you to mark 50 years of emergency." Further, addressing Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge, Nadda said, "You gave us the first gift (Emergency) within the first 25 years of Independence. Why should we not talk about it?"
articles.title: You gave us Emergency, why can't we talk about it: Nadda to Kharge
articles.subtitle: 'Emergency was imposed as chair was in danger'

articles.content: Communications Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said auctioning satellite spectrum is technically unfeasible. Satellite spectrum operates at higher altitudes & frequencies, making it shareable by nature. "This spectrum cannot be assigned to a single person or entity. It is shared by its very nature," said Scindia. Earlier, Mukesh Ambani and Sunil Bharti Mittal lobbied for satellite spectrum auction.
articles.title: Why can't India auction satellite spectrum, which Ambani is demanding?
articles.subtitle: No auction by India a win for Musk's Starlink

articles.content: upGrad Co-founder Ronnie Screwvala said CEOs have fear of missing out (FOMO) and feel they need "top-up course" in AI. "People are looking for hacks. That's not going to cut it in AI...Lot of CEOs want to do a short course...that doesn't mean much," he said, adding he wouldn't want to be earliest investor as he doesn't suffer from FOMO.
articles.title: A lot of CEOs want to do short course on AI out of FOMO: Ronnie
articles.subtitle: 'I’ll be careful in investing in AI companies'

articles.content: After a 7.3-magnitude earthquake struck the coast of Vanuatu, witnesses claimed they saw "bodies" lying on the streets. The ground floor of a building housing the US and French embassies had been crushed under higher floors, resident Michael Thompson told AFP. A landslide on one road had covered a bus, Thompson stated, adding that there are "obviously some deaths there".
articles.title: Bodies lying on streets: Witnesses after earthquake hits Vanuatu
articles.subtitle: Tsunami warning was issued after the earthquake

articles.content: Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal on Tuesday tabled two Bills on 'One nation one election' in the Lok Sabha. If passed by both Houses of Parliament, the Constitution (One Hundred and Twenty-Ninth Amendment) Bill, 2024, and the Union Territories Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2024, will enable simultaneous elections for Lok Sabha and state and UT Assemblies. Opposition sought the Bills' withdrawal.
articles.title: 'One nation one election' Bills tabled by Law Minister Meghwal in Lok Sabha
articles.subtitle: 'Assault on basic structure of Constitution'

articles.content: Former Mumbai first-class cricketer Vilas Godbole, in an interview with mid-day, revealed tabla maestro Zakir Hussain was passionate about cricket and used to play as a wicketkeeper. "He was keen to take up cricket seriously, but his...father Alla Rakha dissuaded him from doing so as he feared Zakir would injure his hands," the 82-year-old added. Hussain passed away aged 73.
articles.title: Zakir Hussain was passionate about cricket, he was a wicketkeeper: Godbole
articles.subtitle: 'Hussain lived in Mahim then'

articles.content: Madras High Court's Madurai Bench directed the Tamil Nadu government and TNPCB to file a report on Vaigai River pollution causes and propose an action plan. The court acted suo motu after reports revealed severe contamination, with sewage mixing in the river. The action plan is due by January 20, 2025.
articles.title: Madras HC directs TN govt to act on Vaigai River pollution
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A massive earthquake measuring 7.3 on Richter scale hit the Pacific island of Vanuatu, reportedly causing several landslides and damaging buildings housing the US, UK and French embassies. Reports claimed that some buildings also collapsed while people were inside. "Some casualties and damage are possible...Estimated economic losses are 1-10% of Vanuatu's GDP," the US Geological Survey said.
articles.title: 7.3-magnitude earthquake hits Vanuatu; causes landslides, damages US Embassy
articles.subtitle: Tsunami warning issued after the earthquake

articles.content: The Finance Ministry highlighted steps to boost trade, including the new SAARC Currency Swap Framework 2024-27. It introduces an INR Swap Window worth ₹25,000 crore alongside the USD/Euro Swap Window of $2 billion. The move aims to enhance trade ties, promote the Indian Rupee, and support SAARC nations' foreign exchange needs.
articles.title: Finance Ministry unveils new SAARC currency swap framework
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A 35-year-old man, Manaru Akali, lost his life in an IED blast in the forested region near Koshalnar in Barsoor mandal, Bijapur district. According to police reports, Manaru had ventured into the hills to collect bamboo when an improvised explosive device (IED), allegedly planted by Naxalites, detonated. The explosion killed him instantly.
articles.title: Man killed in suspected Naxalite IED blast in Bijapur
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Several schools in Delhi received bomb threats on Tuesday morning. Among the schools to have received the threats were Indian Public School in South Delhi and a school in Saraswati Vihar in North West Delhi. School premises have been evacuated and an investigation has been launched, said Delhi Police. This is said to be the fifth such incident this month.
articles.title: Several Delhi schools receive bomb threat, 5th incident this month
articles.subtitle: Bomb squad teams were sent to the schools

articles.content: Veteran actress Sharmila Tagore said she was recently told that actors nowadays are having competition over the size of their vanity vans. "I'm concerned about how actors are not just charging huge amounts, but many even travel with cooks, masseuse and an entire entourage," she said. "All of this is pushing actors away from what actually matters...the acting," added Sharmila.
articles.title: Actors today compete over size of their vanity vans: Sharmila
articles.subtitle: 'Vanity vans were all about privacy & comfort'

articles.content: Members of the Karnataka State Farmers Association and Hasiru Sene staged a protest on Monday in front of DCC Bank in Bidar city, opposing the auction of Bidar Sahakara Sakkare Karkhane (BSSK). The sugar factory, which shut down due to mounting debts, is undergoing an auction process to recover its ₹235 crore loan from DCC Bank.
articles.title: Farmers protest against auction of Bidar sugar factory
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra brought bag featuring peace sign and text showing solidarity with Bangladeshi minorities, to Parliament, a day after her 'Palestine' bag triggered controversy. "Stand with Bangladeshi Hindus and Christians," read the text on her bag that was also carried by several other Opposition MPs. BJP criticised Priyanka over 'Palestine' bag, accusing her of "appeasement".
articles.title: After criticism of her 'Palestine' bag, Priyanka brings 'B'desh' bag to Parliament
articles.subtitle: 'They've never carried patriotism bag'

articles.content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju said that India had One Nation One Election for almost two decades after independence. Talking about Congress' opposition to 'One Nation One Election' Bill, he asked does Congress mean that Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru's government for so long was "illegal". The Bill is likely to be tabled in Parliament today.
articles.title: Nehru's govt was on One Nation One Election: Kiren Rijiju
articles.subtitle: 'One Nation, One Election important for nation'

articles.content: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge demanded PM Narendra Modi’s apology for "twisting facts" about former PM Jawaharlal Nehru. Kharge said PM Modi alleged that the Congress had "illegally amended the Constitution", adding, "The PM forgot that the first amendment was made by the Provisional Parliament, and its members were members of the Constituent Assembly, [including Syama Prasad Mookerjee]."
articles.title: PM Modi twisted facts to defame Nehru, he should apologise: Kharge
articles.subtitle: To know what else he said

articles.content: US President-elect Donald Trump called the removal of Syria's Bashar al-Assad an "unfriendly and very smart takeover" orchestrated by Turkey. "Turkey did an unfriendly takeover, without a lot of lives being lost...Assad was a butcher, especially with what he did to children," Trump stated. Turkey has been a key supporter of opposition groups trying to overthrow Assad.
articles.title: Unfriendly, smart takeover by Turkey: Trump on Syrian regime fall
articles.subtitle: It now controls large areas in North Syria

articles.content: Indian Embassy in Tbilisi clarified that 11 of 12 people found dead in bedrooms belonging to an Indian restaurant in Georgia were Indian nationals. According to reports, they suffered carbon monoxide poisoning from a generator placed near their bedrooms, which was switched on following a power cut. Congress MP Gurjeet Singh Aujla, however, claimed all 12 deceased were from Punjab.
articles.title: 11 of 12 people who died at Indian eatery in Georgia were Indians, likely suffered poisoning
articles.subtitle: Embassy had earlier claimed 12 Indians had died

articles.content: Actor Naga Chaitanya, who was born in Hyderabad but grew up in Chennai, said he keeps telling his wife Sobhita Dhulipala to talk to him in Telugu so he can improve. "Just hearing that same texture (Telugu) and having that same warmth when you speak to someone...it just drew me closer...faster," he added. The couple got married on December 4.
articles.title: I tell Sobhita to talk to me in Telugu so I can improve: Chaitanya
articles.subtitle: The wedding took place in Hyderabad

articles.content: Padma Shri awardee Tulsi Gowda, known as 'Vruksha Maate' (Mother of Trees), passed away aged 86 at her residence in Karnataka's Karwar district on Monday. She was renowned for planting and nurturing lakhs of trees in her vicinity. Condoling her demise, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "She will always remain a guiding light for environmental protection."
articles.title: Padma Shri awardee Tulsi Gowda, fondly called Mother of Trees, passes away at 86
articles.subtitle: She was conferred with Padma Shri award in 2021

articles.content: A bomb hidden in an electric scooter killed Russian Lieutenant General Igor Kirillov, the chief of Russia's Nuclear, Biological and Chemical Protection Troops. His assistant was also killed in the blast. Photographs posted on Russian Telegram channels showed a shattered entrance to a building littered with rubble and two bodies lying in the blood-stained snow.
articles.title: Bomb kills chief of Russian nuclear protection forces
articles.subtitle: A criminal case has been opened

articles.content: Sensex crashed over 800 points on Tuesday and was trading at 80,915.83 while Nifty was down nearly 250 points, trading at 24,424.65. The indices were weighed down by financials and oil & gas stocks, as investors remained cautious ahead of the US Federal Reserve's crucial December 17-18 meeting. Bharti Airtel, TCS, Power Grid Corp, Larsen, Reliance were top Sensex losers.
articles.title: Sensex crashes over 800 points
articles.subtitle: Adani Ports, Tata Motors among Sensex gainers

articles.content: Iran's National Security Council has halted enforcement of controversial "hijab and chastity law" following domestic and international backlash. President Masoud Pezeshkian called the legislation "ambiguous and in need of reform", suggesting it'll be revisited. The law, which included harsh penalties for dress code violations, faced condemnation from human rights groups like Amnesty International.
articles.title: Iran pauses crackdown on 'hijab and chastity law' amid protests
articles.subtitle: A singer was held for performing without hijab

articles.content: A candidate reportedly got 101.66 marks out of the total 100 due to the adoption of "normalisation" process in a Madhya Pradesh government recruitment examination. Job aspirants have staged a protest over the same in Indore, alleging fraud in the recruitment examination and demanding a fair inquiry. The examination was conducted by the Bhopal-headquartered Madhya Pradesh Employees Selection Board.
articles.title: Candidate gets 101.66 marks out of 100 in MP exam, protest erupts
articles.subtitle: The result was declared on December 13

articles.content: Prabhas recently sprained his ankle during the shoot of Hanu Raghavapudi's film. He also apologised to his fans in Japan as he missed the promotions of Kalki 2898 AD there. The dystopian sci-fi action film will release in Japan on January 3. Prabhas sprained his ankle during the shoot, however, the cause of his injury is not known yet.
articles.title: Prabhas suffers ankle injury, apologises for skipping Japan event
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A 23-year-old man, Adarsh, from Ainali Kurubarahatti, Chitradurga, Karnataka, collapsed and died while dancing to DJ music at a wedding. Despite being rushed to a nearby hospital, he was declared dead on arrival. The cause of death is yet to be determined, with investigations ongoing.
articles.title: Man dies while dancing at wedding in Chitradurga
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Rahul Gandhi paid his last respects to PP Madhavan, longtime aide to Sonia Gandhi, in Thrissur, Kerala. Madhavan, 73, passed away due to cardiac arrest. KC Venugopal and Shashi Tharoor expressed condolences, highlighting his decades of dedication to the Congress party and the Gandhi family.
articles.title: Rahul Gandhi pays tribute to Sonia Gandhi's aide PP Madhavan
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: New Zealand rose to fourth place on the WTC points table after their 423-run win against England at the Seddon Park, Hamilton. Their points percentage (PCT) increased to 48.21, while England dropped to sixth place, with a PCT of 43.21. Notably, both teams are out of the race for a final berth.
articles.title: Updated WTC standings after New Zealand's record win in Hamilton
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: New Zealand's Tim Southee played his last Test against England in Hamilton. He finished with 391 wickets in the format, the second-highest number of wickets taken by a New Zealand player in Tests. In his first statement after the Test, Southee said, "Look forward to watching on as a fan. All the best, boys."
articles.title: Tim Southee makes first statement after Test retirement
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Actress Sobhita Dhulipala, who recently married actor Naga Chaitanya, wore a handcrafted bagru multi-panel 'chotu lehenga' inspired from the archives of Sabyasachi for her wedding celebration, the designer said. Her skirt was adorned with antiqued zardozi and hand-painted mirror borders, paired with a hand-woven cotton dupatta and "Kanthi" blouse. The ensemble was accentuated with a parandi.
articles.title: Sobhita wears bagru multi-panel 'chotu lehenga' for her wedding celebration
articles.subtitle: Sobhita, Naga Chaitanya got married in Hyderabad

articles.content: The removal of an iconic picture depicting Pakistan Army's surrender following the Bangladesh war, which was placed next to Indian Army chief's office in Rashtrapati Bhawan's South Block, has triggered a row. Congress MP Manickam Tagore called the move "troubling" and a "direct affront to historical memory". Indian Army called the picture's placement at Manekshaw Centre "its most befitting place".
articles.title: 1971 war 'surrender' pic's removal from South Block triggers row, Army clarifies
articles.subtitle: 'New placement will benefit large audience'

articles.content: Speaking about pornography case in which he was arrested in July 2021 and then granted bail in September that year, businessman Raj Kundra said he has nothing to do with porn. He stated one makes enemies when the person does business in India. Kundra stated a business rival was responsible for his arrest in the case.
articles.title: You make enemies when you do business: Kundra on porn case
articles.subtitle: 'A known enemy tried to make this whole game'

articles.content: Artefact Projects secured a ₹2.53 crore project from the National Highways Authority of India. The contract involves consultancy services for upgrading four lanes of the Talaja-Mahua-Kagvadar section of NH-8E in Gujarat, as per the company's business filing.
articles.title: Artefact Projects secures NHAI project worth ₹2.53 crore
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: OpenAI Co-founder Sam Altman didn't take any equity when it launched in 2015 and draws just $76,000/year (₹65 lakh) salary. He recently said, "This is my childhood dream job...Getting to work on AI...with the smartest researchers...is what I always wanted." Earlier, Altman said he rejected an equity stake because OpenAI needed a majority disinterested board to qualify for nonprofit status.
articles.title: Why does Co-founder Sam Altman have zero OpenAI equity?
articles.subtitle: OpenAI was most recently valued at $157 billion

articles.content: Actress Madhuri Dixit has rented out her office space in Mumbai for ₹3 lakh per month, as per a report. The office space is located in Andheri West area and has been leased to a private company. the report added. The space of the office reportedly spans an area of 1,594.24 square feet.
articles.title: Madhuri Dixit rents out her Mumbai office space for ₹3 lakh/month: Report
articles.subtitle: Madhuri bought a flat worth ₹48 crore in October

articles.content: Pharmaceutical company Mankind Pharma has launched Qualified Institutional Placement (QIP) to raise funds up to ₹3,000 crore. The funds will be to partly finance its ₹13,630-crore acquisition of Bharat Serums and Vaccines (BSV), announced in July. The company said it has set the floor price at ₹2,616.55 per share as per SEBI's pricing formula.
articles.title: Mankind Pharma launches ₹3,000 cr QIP for Bharat Serums takeover
articles.subtitle: Mankind Pharma aims to become debt-free in 3 yrs

articles.content: Ousted President Bashar al-Assad escaped Syria after a rebel uprising with Russia's help in an unplanned operation, he has clarified. "My departure from Syria...didn't occur during final hours of battles," Assad said. As terrorist forces infiltrated Damascus, he said he moved to Russian naval base in Latakia, following which Russia requested his "immediate evacuation" a day after Damascus fell.
articles.title: How did Assad escape Syria in unplanned operation with Russia's help?
articles.subtitle: Assad called Syria's new leaders 'terrorists'

articles.content: Kannada actor Darshan Thoogudeepa has been discharged from the hospital after being granted interim bail on medical grounds. Reports indicate that Darshan left the hospital without undergoing the planned surgery for his back injury, which had initially been scheduled. He reportedly skipped the surgery due to high blood pressure.
articles.title: Darshan discharged from hospital after being granted interim bail
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Colder temperatures bring an increase in the risk of developing kidney stones, clusters of crystals that form from minerals and other substances in your urinary tract. Extremely painful and discomforting, these are mostly formed in winter due to high consumption of oxalates, less hydration, and more calcium in your urine.
articles.title: Why do cases of kidney stones spike in winter?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Indian Railways will eliminate 21 level-crossing gates in Prayagraj ahead of Maha Kumbh 2025 to ease traffic congestion. Fifteen gates are ready and the rest will be completed soon.
