This project, costing ₹450 crore, aims to ensure smooth road and train movement during the massive gathering.
articles.title: Railways to remove 21 level crossings for Maha Kumbh 2025
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: STAR Health's 'Super Star' plan introduces the 'Future Shield' add-on, designed for newly married couples. It allows spouses to continue waiting periods served by the insured, ensuring seamless coverage continuity. Future Shield simplifies health insurance for newlyweds, providing financial security and uninterrupted protection for families, STAR Health said.
articles.title: STAR Health Insurance unveils Future Shield add-on with Super Star plan
articles.subtitle: Adapt to life's changes with 'Super Star'

articles.content: Delhi's air quality worsened to 'severe' category on Tuesday, with overall AQI of 421 at 8 am. Meanwhile, the government has reimposed GRAP-IV anti-pollution restrictions in Delhi-NCR region. Under GRAP-IV, there'll be restrictions on construction and demolition activities, entry of trucks, BS-IV and medium and heavy goods vehicles. Schools will shift to online classes except for Classes 10, 12.
articles.title: Delhi records AQI of 421 as GRAP IV curbs return
articles.subtitle: Noida's air quality in 'very poor' category

articles.content: NDP leader Jagmeet Singh has called for PM Justin Trudeau's resignation, accusing him of neglecting Canadians' struggles. "He has to go," Singh said, adding, "People cannot find a home...they can't buy their groceries and on top of that, we have Trump threatening tariffs...which puts...thousands of Canadian jobs at risk." He criticised Trudeau and the Liberals for fighting themselves.
articles.title: NDP's Jagmeet Singh asks Trudeau to resign amid political crisis
articles.subtitle: 'Trudeau is not fighting for the people'

articles.content: HTS leader Abu Mohammed al-Jolani stated rebel factions in Syria would "be disbanded and the fighters trained to join the ranks of the defence ministry". He urged sanctions be lifted to enable refugees to return, adding, "All will be subject to the law." The group, which spearheaded an 11-day offensive, toppled President Bashar al-Assad on December 8, entering Damascus.
articles.title: Will disband rebel factions, put fighters in defence ministry: al-Jolani
articles.subtitle: Jolani, now uses his real name, Ahmed al-Sharaa

articles.content: Security forces in Jammu and Kashmir intercepted a major drug smuggling attempt, recovering 5.3 kg of heroin from a village near the Line of Control. Two suspects were arrested during the operation. They have been identified as Sajan Kumar and Subash Chander, both residents of Nowshera.
articles.title: Jammu & Kashmir Police seize 5.3 kg heroin near LoC, two arrested
articles.subtitle: 5.3 kg heroin near LoC seized

articles.content: Talking about batter Virat Kohli's dismissal in India's first innings in the third Test against Australia, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said Kohli could've left the ball [outside off stump] well alone. "Even earlier, there was a delivery of Mitchell Starc which was angled across, and he reached for it, so, that is worrying," he stated.
articles.title: Kohli reaching out for ball outside off is worrying: Gavaskar
articles.subtitle: Kohli scored 3(16) in India's 1st innings

articles.content: The total number of companies registered during current fiscal (FY25) stands at 1,12,962 (till November 30), the government informed on Monday. The Minister of State in the Ministry of Corporate Affairs, Harsh Malhotra, said in a written reply in Lok Sabha that multiple initiatives have been taken by the government to promote the registration of companies.
articles.title: Nearly 1.13 lakh companies registered in FY25 to date: Centre
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: New Zealand ended their World Test Championship cycle with a huge win against England on Tuesday. Tim Southee ended his Test career with 391 wickets after picking 2 wickets as the home team won the third and final game in Hamilton by 423 runs. With this win, the series ended with a 2-1 score, preventing England a series whitewash.
articles.title: New Zealand beat England as Tim Southee retires from Tests
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Grandmaster Gukesh D received prize money of around ₹11.45 crore for winning World Chess Championship 2024 in Singapore. He's likely to pay around 39%-42% of prize money as tax as per Section 194B, Rule 26 of Income Tax Act. The provision mandates deduction of tax at source on winnings from games. Gukesh would've to pay around ₹4.67 crore in tax.
articles.title: How much tax will Gukesh D have to pay on his World Chess Championship prize money?
articles.subtitle: Gukesh is the youngest world chess champion

articles.content: The RBI Deputy Governor Michael Debabrata Patra stated that BNPL schemes and credit card spending reduce youth savings and pose challenges for monetary policy. He highlighted risks like rising household debt, financial stress, and mismanagement due to low financial literacy amid rapid digital financial adoption.
articles.title: BNPL schemes, credit card spending reduce youth savings: RBI
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Music composer AR Rahman, while condoling tabla maestro Zakir Hussain's demise, revealed the duo had planned to do an album together. "I regret not being able to collaborate with him as much as we did decades ago," he added. Calling Hussain an "inspiration", the 57-year-old said, "You shall be truly missed." Hussain passed away aged 73 in San Francisco.
articles.title: We had planned an album together: Rahman on Zakir Hussain's demise
articles.subtitle: Rahman shared pictures with Hussain on Instagram

articles.content: A Gurugram man claimed an Uber driver, who was few seconds away from him, texted, "I want to go to kidnap you happily." He said the driver immediately cancelled the ride while he himself "ran back into the house with [his] luggage". "'Drop' would've got autocorrect to 'kidnap'," a Reddit user said. "That's not how autocorrect works," said another.
articles.title: Man says Uber driver texted him 'I want to kidnap you happily' in Gurugram, sparks debate
articles.subtitle: 'I checked around 8+ native language queries'

articles.content: Actor and BJP MP Kangana Ranaut, when asked about the Kapoor family and other actors meeting PM Narendra Modi, said the Bollywood industry is "completely orphaned" and needs guidance. "Whether it is Jihadi agenda or Palestinian agenda, anyone can capture them...They don't know where to go," she added. Kangana stated people in Bollywood often become targets of hawala and drugs.
articles.title: B'wood industry is orphaned: Kangana on Kapoor family meeting PM
articles.subtitle: 'Dawood takes B'wood people to his parties'

articles.content: Music composer Ilaiyaraaja has reacted to the controversy after he was asked to step out of the sacred chamber of Srivilliputhur Andal Temple in Tamil Nadu. The Rajya Sabha MP wrote, "Some people are spreading false rumours...I'm not one to compromise my self-respect at any time or place." Several people alleged that he was denied entry due to his caste.
articles.title: People spreading false rumours: Ilaiyaraaja on temple controversy
articles.subtitle: 'People spreading news that did not happen'

articles.content: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said that "Jai Shree Ram" was never a communal slogan. He said, "People in West UP greet each other with 'Ram Ram'. When we wake up, we say 'Hey Ram'. We wish 'Ram Ram' when we meet someone. Even during the last journey, we chant 'Ram Naam Satya Hai'." "Without Ram, we've no existence," he added.
articles.title: Jai Shree Ram not communal, we've no existence without Ram: Yogi
articles.subtitle: UP CM said this while addressing state Assembly

articles.content: Techie Atul Subhash's wife Nikita Singhania's uncle Sushil Singhania was granted pre-arrest bail by Allahabad High Court on Monday. Sushil's bail plea said he's a 69-year-old elderly person with a chronic medical condition, 'incapable' of abetting Atul's suicide. Nikita, her mother Nisha and brother Anurag were arrested last week and remain in judicial custody.
articles.title: Atul Subhash's wife Nikita's uncle gets pre-arrest bail in his suicide case
articles.subtitle: 'Allegations of harassment, not abetment apply'

articles.content: An IIT graduate is being criticised on social media for putting a sticker on their car, saying, "You are chasing an IITian but that is ok. We are used to it." Several social media users called the sticker "Super Cringe", while one said, "Going to an IIT is bro's entire personality...imagine that!" A person also commented, "This is embarrassing."
articles.title: IIT graduate puts 'you're chasing an IITian' sticker on car; criticised
articles.subtitle: 'I've stopped telling people where I study'

articles.content: Seven tourists, including four Australians, were hospitalised after a suspected case of alcohol poisoning at Fiji's Warwick resort. Fiji's government stated the guests fell ill after consuming a cocktail at a specific bar within the resort. Resort management denied altering drink quality, with the government calling it an "extremely isolated incident" affecting only the seven guests.
articles.title: 7 tourists hospitalised due to alcohol poisoning at Fiji resort
articles.subtitle: The resort management is investigating the case

articles.content: DU law students protested outside the Law Faculty demanding a 10-day exam extension, citing incomplete syllabus due to fewer classes. Students blocked exits, forcing police to escort the dean and staff. Authorities announced that exams set for December 26 are on hold, with new dates pending.
articles.title: DU law students protest, demand 10-day exam extension
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said mosques in Sambhal are operating illegal power stations and have distributed connections for free. "This is a loot of the country's resources. If administration catches the theft, it will be said that it is an atrocity," CM Adityanath said. Notably, electricity theft worth ₹1.3 crore by four mosques, one madrasa was recently reported in Sambhal.
articles.title: Sambhal mosques are operating illegal power stations: CM Yogi
articles.subtitle: CM Yogi said this in Assembly post Question Hour

articles.content: A man has claimed that an airport taxi driver in Bengaluru inflated the ride fare by ₹1,000 using an "exact replica of Uber app". "[The driver] started and ended the trip with ₹1,000 extra [and] said the extra is because of GST," the man said. "When I asked for the bill, he said I'll get it next month," he added.
articles.title: Man says driver inflated bill by ₹1,000 for 'extra GST' using Uber app replica in B'luru
articles.subtitle: 'They use an Android app called Blumeter'

articles.content: Filmmaker Sanjay Gupta recalled visiting Amitabh Bachchan's residence Jalsa for the narration of 2002 film 'Kaante'. "I saw his black and white pictures from his films, shoots...So by the time you reach the second floor, you seem very little," said Gupta. He added Bachchan's office had speakers worth ₹50-60 lakh and 25-30 pens, which were Montblanc's designer editions.
articles.title: Big B's office had speakers worth ₹60 lakh, 30 designer pens: Gupta
articles.subtitle: 'He gave no reaction, my heart was beating fast'

articles.content: Police in Chhattisgarh have arrested a Nigerian national, identified as Johnson, in connection with a marriage scam. The 40-year-old suspect is accused of defrauding a woman of ₹15.72 lakh after promising to marry her According to the police, Johnson created a fake profile on a matrimonial website.
articles.title: Nigerian national arrested in Chhattisgarh marriage scam
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Vladimir Putin-led Russia has unveiled 'Kalinka', a new system to counter Elon Musk-led SpaceX's Starlink signals. The system, being called 'Starlink killer', is designed to locate and track Starlink signals, which Ukraine relies on for drone communication & real-time military coordination. Kalinka can detect unmanned aerial and maritime drones connected to Starlink from up to 15 kilometres away.
articles.title: Russia unveils 'Starlink killer' Kalinka in fresh trouble for Musk, Ukraine
articles.subtitle: Small-scale production of Kalinka is underway

articles.content: A 15-year-old girl opened fire in a school in US' Wisconsin, killing a fellow student and a teacher and injuring six others, police said. The girl, identified as Natalie Rupnow, shot herself dead with the same handgun, they added. The incident took place at Abundant Life Christian School and two of the injured students sustained life-threatening injuries, police said.
articles.title: 15-year-old girl shoots student & teacher dead in US school, kills herself
articles.subtitle: School shootings by girls are rare, say studies

articles.content: Sonakshi Sinha reacted to Mukesh Khanna saying it's her father Shatrughan Sinha's fault that she couldn't answer a 2019 KBC question regarding 'Sanjeevani booti'. "There were two women...You chose to keep taking my name...for obvious reasons," Sonakshi said, adding, "I definitely need you to...stop bringing up same incident...to be back in news at me and my family's expense," she added.
articles.title: Stop bringing incident up to be back in news: Sonakshi to Mukesh on 'Ramayana' remark
articles.subtitle: 'I may have blanked out that day'

articles.content: Dominic LeBlanc has been sworn in as Canada's new Finance Minister following Chrystia Freeland's sudden resignation. A close ally of Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, LeBlanc, 57, previously served as Public Safety Minister. His appointment comes as Canada faces a Can$62 billion deficit due to "unexpected expenses" and ongoing economic challenges, including the looming threat of US tariffs.
articles.title: Dominic LeBlanc named as Canada's new Finance Minister
articles.subtitle: Freeland accused Trudeau of 'political gimmicks'

articles.content: BJP IT cell head Amit Malviya called the Congress "the New Muslim League" after party MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra was seen carrying a handbag with "Palestine" written on it in the Parliament on Monday. He said, "Observe a two-minute silence for everyone in Congress, who believed Priyanka was the long-awaited solution." "She's a bigger disaster than Rahul Gandhi," he added.
articles.title: Bigger disaster than Rahul: BJP on Priyanka carrying Palestine bag
articles.subtitle: 'She didn't speak word on atrocities on Hindus'

articles.content: Aamir Khan, who was the producer of 'Laapataa Ladies', said the country would go "ballistic" if the film wins an Oscar. "We've been dying to win an Academy Award for an Indian film which hasn't happened till now...They'll just go mad if we win. So just for the people of India, I'd be very happy if we win," he added.
articles.title: If 'Laapataa Ladies' wins Oscar, country would go ballistic: Aamir
articles.subtitle: Oscars 2025 shortlist to be announced on Dec 17

articles.content: The late tabla maestro Zakir Hussain was voted "sexiest man" by readers of the Indian magazine Gentleman in 1994. Hussain, who passed away aged 73 this week, had beaten actor Amitabh Bachchan in the race for the title. He had revealed the magazine was "equally shocked and surprised" with his win as they had assumed Big B would win.
articles.title: Zakir Hussain once beat Amitabh Bachchan to win ‘sexiest man’ title
articles.subtitle: Hussain died of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

articles.content: Gold price on Tuesday stood at ₹77,170 per 10 grams as of 6:50 am, according to the India Bullion Association. The price was marginally higher than the current rate on Monday after it fell from ₹79,100 on Friday. Gold price had hit the highest levels in the month so far on December 11. Gold reached up to ₹81,500 in October.
articles.title: Gold falls to ₹77,170 per 10 grams
articles.subtitle: Gold futures for Feb 5, 2025 stood at ₹77,045

articles.content: Usha (72), an elderly woman from Mangaluru, drowned at Someshwar beach while participating in the Pinda Pradhan ritual for her deceased brother-in-law. The ritual was performed on Monday, and Usha, wife of the late Jagadish Bhandari, was swept away by the sea while taking a dip in the water, in the presence of her relatives.
articles.title: Elderly woman tragically drowns at Someshwar beach during ritual
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: US President-elect Donald Trump does not have Presidential immunity to have his conviction for covering up hush money payments to a porn star thrown out, New York judge Juan Merchan has ruled. Supreme Court had ruled that Trump should receive immunity for official acts during his Presidential term. Merchan said evidence against Trump related "entirely to unofficial conduct".
articles.title: Trump does not have Presidential immunity from conviction in hush money case: US court
articles.subtitle: Trump paid Stormy Daniels to keep affair secret

articles.content: New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) has announced the installation of mist sprayers on electric poles to combat rising air pollution. In the first phase, 15 mist sprayers will be installed on electric poles along a 500-metre stretch of Lodhi Road. Each pole will feature five nozzles, with each nozzle having six spray holes. Delhi's AQI today is in 'severe' category.
articles.title: NDMC to install mist sprayers on electric poles to curb pollution
articles.subtitle: 'Project expected to be implemented next year'

articles.content: The Constitution (One Hundred and Twenty-Ninth Amendment) Bill, 2024, commonly known as the 'One nation one election' Bill, will be introduced in the Lok Sabha today (Tuesday, December 17). The Bill will likely be sent to a joint parliamentary committee of the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha, PTI reported. The Bill proposes simultaneous elections for Lok Sabha and state Assemblies.
articles.title: 'One nation one election' Bill to be introduced in Lok Sabha today
articles.subtitle: UT Laws (Amendment) Bill will also be tabled

articles.content: US President-elect Donald Trump with SoftBank Group CEO Masayoshi Son by his side announced the Japanese conglomerate would invest $100 billion in the US over the next 4 years. The two said the investment would create 100,000 jobs focused on artificial intelligence and related infrastructure. Son made a similar announcement with then-President-elect Trump in December 2016 and pledged $50 billion.
articles.title: Trump, SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son announce $100 billion US investment
articles.subtitle: Trump playfully encouraged Son to invest $200 bn

articles.content: YouTuber and former Bigg Boss Kannada contestant NM Prathap, also known as Drone Prathap, has been arrested after he posted a video that showed him causing an explosion using sodium in an agricultural pond in Karnataka's Tumakuru. Police said Prathap claimed that it was a science experiment performed as part of a promotional video for his YouTube channel.
articles.title: YouTuber 'Drone Prathap' arrested after exploding sodium bomb in pond
articles.subtitle: Court has sent him to 14-day judicial custody

articles.content: The 20-20-20 formula for SIP investments in mutual funds involves starting as low as ₹20 per day. According to William O’Neil India CEO Anupam Singhi, this per-day investment in an equity mutual fund can grow to ₹34 lakh in 20 years with a 20% annual step up and an assumed annualised return of 14%.
articles.title: What is the 20-20-20 Mutual Fund SIP formula?
articles.subtitle: The total investment in 1st year would be ₹7,300

articles.content: The AQI in Delhi-NCR breached the 400 mark (severe+) on Monday, forcing the Commission for Air Quality Management, the anti-pollution panel, to impose GRAP-IV restrictions in the region. Under GRAP-IV, there will be restrictions on construction and demolition activities, entry of trucks, BS-IV and Medium Goods Vehicle (MGV) and Heavy Goods Vehicle (HGV) and physical school mode.
articles.title: GRAP-IV restrictions reimposed in Delhi-NCR as air quality dips to 'severe+'
articles.subtitle: Earlier, CAQM re-imposed GRAP-III

articles.content: NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal expressed his displeasure on being excluded from the expanded ministerial cabinet in Maharashtra. "Yes, I'm upset. You should ask those who sidelined me about the reasons," Bhujbal said. BJP-supported independent MLA Ravi Rana and RPI(A) chief and central minister Ramdas Athawale were also reportedly upset over being excluded from the cabinet.
articles.title: I'm upset: Chhagan Bhujbal on being excluded from Maha cabinet
articles.subtitle: 39 legislators took oath on Sunday

articles.content: A 16-year-old boy has been charged with the murder of four members of his family in US' New Mexico. According to the police, the teenager called 911 and told the dispatcher that he had killed his family. "When deputies arrived, [he] walked out of the residence with his hands in the air and was extremely intoxicated," police said.
articles.title: 16-year-old boy kills entire family of 4, then 'drunk' calls police to confess in US
articles.subtitle: Boy's siblings were aged 16 and 14

articles.content: New India Assurance settled the highest number of health insurance claims it received (95%) in FY23, according to the Insurance Brokers Association of India's data. It was followed by Aditya Birla Health Insurance, which settled over 94.5% of the claims received. IFFCO-Tokio, Bajaj Allianz and SBI were also among the top 10 players in terms of health claims paid.
articles.title: Which firms settled the most health insurance claims in FY23?
articles.subtitle: To know top standalone health insurers

articles.content: Youngest world chess champion Gukesh D did bungee jumping in Singapore after his championship win against Ding Liren. A video of the same has gone viral on social media. "I am the world champion," Gukesh was heard shouting while bungee jumping. Gukesh and his second Grzegorz Gajewski had promised each other that they'd bungee jump if Gukesh becomes world champion.
articles.title: Gukesh D shouts 'I am the world champion' while bungee jumping in Singapore
articles.subtitle: To watch the viral video

articles.content: Bharat Rashtra Samithi working president KT Rama Rao is facing a corruption case over alleged irregularities in payments made to a company during Formula-E race held in Hyderabad last year. Telangana government alleged that ₹55 crore was transferred to a company during the Formula-E race by flouting the necessary procedures. KTR was the MA&UD minister when the race was held.
articles.title: KTR faces corruption case over irregularities in Formula-E race
articles.subtitle: To read more

articles.content: Mukesh Khanna commented on a 2019 incident when Sonakshi Sinha couldn't answer a KBC question related to 'Sanjeevani booti' in Ramayana. "People were angry that Sonakshi didn't know this, but I would say it's not her fault, it's her father's (Shatrughan Sinha) fault," Khanna said. "Why didn’t they teach their children this? Why did they become so modern?" he asked.
articles.title: Her dad's fault: Mukesh on Sonakshi lacking Ramayana knowledge
articles.subtitle: 'Her brothers names are Luv and Kush'

articles.content: Former Pakistan Minister Fawad Chaudhry shared picture of Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra carrying 'Palestine' bag in the Parliament and praised the leader. Thanking Priyanka, Fawad wrote, "What else could we expect from a granddaughter of a towering freedom fighter like Jawaharlal Nehru?" BJP criticised Priyanka's move, saying, "Gandhi family has always been carrying the bag of appeasement."
articles.title: Ex-Pak minister Fawad shares pic of Priyanka Gandhi carrying Palestine bag in parliament
articles.subtitle: BJP's Patra shared collage of PM Modi & Priyanka

articles.content: Actress Katrina Kaif on Monday visited and sought blessings at Shirdi Sai Baba Temple in Maharashtra with her mother-in-law Veena Kaushal. Visuals of her visit have surfaced on social media. Recently, Katrina and Vicky Kaushal celebrated their third wedding anniversary in Rajasthan's Jodhpur.
articles.title: Katrina Kaif visits Shirdi Sai Baba Temple with mother-in-law Veena Kaushal
articles.subtitle: To see all the pictures

articles.content: A town in the US witnessed brown-coloured snowfall, following which the local officials warned people to "avoid ingesting or direct skin contact" with it. Rumford authorities said the precipitation of brown snow occurred due to a malfunction at a mill which released spent black liquor into the air. While non-toxic, the brown snow was a skin irritant, it added.
articles.title: Brown snow falls over US town, authorities tell people 'avoid eating or touching it'
articles.subtitle: Visuals of the brown snow have surfaced online

articles.content: The Supreme Court on Monday indicated that it could move all petitions against a CCI probe into Amazon and Flipkart to the Karnataka High Court. It also stayed the proceedings going on in the 12 cases in the Karnataka High Court. Amazon and Flipkart sellers have filed over 20 cases across various High Courts to stop the antitrust probe.
articles.title: SC backs moving pleas against Amazon, Flipkart probe to K'taka HC
articles.subtitle: SC will next hear the case on January 6

articles.content: Visuals showing fans punching and fighting with each other and throwing cans during Punjabi singer Karan Aujla's concert in Gurugram have surfaced online. One of the incidents reportedly took place in the VIP areas of the 'Tauba Tauba' singer's concert and security guards also tried to intervene to stop the fight. Rapper Badshah, actor Varun Dhawan also attended the event.
articles.title: Fans seen punching each other, throwing cans at Karan Aujla's concert in Gurugram
articles.subtitle: The concert took place on December 15

articles.content: GST Council could hike GST on old and used electrical vehicles (EVs) and smaller petrol and diesel vehicles from 12% to 18%, CNBC-TV18 reported. The proposal could be discussed at the GST Council's meeting this week in Jaisalmer. Currently, old and used larger vehicles and SUVs are already taxed at 18%.
articles.title: GST Council may raise tax on old, used EVs to 18%: Report
articles.subtitle: GST on old vehicles levied on supplier's margin

articles.content: An alleged Chinese spy, who was banned from the UK on national security grounds, is believed to have used Prince Andrew to gain access to Buckingham Palace and other royal residences. Notably, an adviser to Andrew had also authorised the alleged spy, who has been named as businessman Yang Tengbo, to act on his behalf with potential Chinese investors.
articles.title: Prince Andrew gave alleged Chinese spy access to Buckingham Palace
articles.subtitle: Andrew stated he's stopped all contact with Yang

articles.content: A tribal man was dragged along the road for nearly half a kilometre on a car's bonnet by tourists in Kerala's Wayanad on Sunday after he reportedly intervened in quarrel between two tourist groups. The man sustained injuries to his arms and legs and is undergoing treatment at hospital. Wayanad MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra sought stringent action against the accused.
articles.title: Tribal man dragged 500m on car's bonnet by tourists in Kerala
articles.subtitle: A case of attempted murder has been registered

articles.content: On the Figuring Out podcast, clinical psychologist Havovi stated that there are some common ways to spot a narcissistic boss. She said that narcissistic bosses are known for being very hard on their employees. She added that such bosses always dehumanise their employees and sometimes even throw things at them.
articles.title: Clinical psychologist reveals common habits of narcissistic bosses
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz's coalition government has lost a confidence vote in the country's parliament, paving the way for snap elections in February. As many as 394 lawmakers cast their votes against the government, with 207 voting in favour. The confidence vote came after the Free Democrats (FDP) left the coalition government with Scholz following disputes over the budget.
articles.title: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz loses confidence vote in parliament
articles.subtitle: 116 lawmakers abstained from voting

articles.content: Canada's Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland, who also served as the Deputy PM, has resigned after citing policy clash with PM Justin Trudeau. Citing threat of new tariffs on Canada by Donald Trump, Freeland said, "That means keeping [Canada's] fiscal powder dry today, so we have the reserves we may need for a tariff war. That means eschewing costly political gimmicks."
articles.title: Canada's Deputy PM Chrystia resigns, calls out Trudeau's 'political gimmicks'
articles.subtitle: Gimmicks make Canadians doubt us: Freeland

articles.content: During a session in UP Assembly, CM Yogi Adityanath said communal riots had been an issue in Sambhal since 1947. He claimed that 184 Hindus were burnt in 1978 and 209 Hindus have been killed there since 1947. His remarks came in wake of communal clashes in Sambhal, over a court-monitored survey of mosque, that killed at least five people.
articles.title: 184 Hindus burnt in Sambhal in 1978: UP CM Yogi on communal riots
articles.subtitle: No communal riots in UP since 2017: CM Yogi

articles.content: Senior Maharashtra BJP leader Sudhir Mungantiwar claimed his name had figured in list of ministers who took oath a day before but it was removed later, adding that he doesn't know the reason. "I'll...[keep working] for...my constituency," he said. Thirty-nine legislators of Mahayuti allies took oath as ministers on Sunday as part of first expansion of CM Devendra Fadnavis-led cabinet.
articles.title: Don't know why I was removed from Maha minister list: Mungantiwar
articles.subtitle: 'We might give him other responsibility'

articles.content: Supreme Court issued a notice to the Centre and States over a petition seeking pan-India measures to tackle crimes against women. The petition sought multiple directions including chemical castration for sexual offenders upon arrest and a complete ban on unrestricted free online adult content. The apex court said that some of the proposals were "barbaric" and wouldn't be indulged.
articles.title: Plea seeking chemical castration, complete ban on adult content filed in Supreme Court
articles.subtitle: 'Some issues are innovative & will be examined'

articles.content: Supreme Court has quashed criminal proceedings under Section 498A of the IPC against a woman who was alleged to be in a relationship with the husband of an aggrieved woman. The court said husband's girlfriend or even a woman with whom he has had romantic or sexual relationship cannot be construed to be a relative for prosecution under Section 498A.
articles.title: Husband's girlfriend can't be interpreted as relative to be tried under Section 498A: SC
articles.subtitle: This is nothing but abuse of law: SC

articles.content: A Blackstone-led consortium has emerged as the top bidder for a 20% stake in the snacks business of Haldiram's, Bloomberg reported. It could reportedly pay around $1.6 billion for the minority stake, valuing the business at about $8 billion. Blackstone is looking to partner with Singapore state investor GIC Pte and Abu Dhabi Investment Authority for the deal.
articles.title: Blackstone top bidder for $1.6-billion stake in Haldiram's: Report
articles.subtitle: 'Temasek also interested in minority stake'

articles.content: The Delhi High Court has summoned the CEO and COO of SpiceJet over non-payment of dues to its engine lessors Team France and Sunbird France. The lessors filed a case after SpiceJet failed to comply with an earlier court order directing it to pay $603,871. Both positions of CEO and COO are currently lying vacant at SpiceJet, CNBC-TV18 reported.
articles.title: SpiceJet CEO, COO summoned by Delhi HC over dues to lessors
articles.subtitle: CEO, COO summoned on January 16

articles.content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla told the House's Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi not to use his phone during PM Narendra Modi's speech on the 75th anniversary of the adoption of India's Constitution, according to reports. The Congress MP reportedly kept checking his phone during PM Modi's address, which was around 1 hour and 50 minutes long.
articles.title: Lok Sabha Speaker tells Rahul Gandhi not to use phone during PM Modi's speech
articles.subtitle: PM Modi bored us: Priyanka Gandhi on his speech

articles.content: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee reacted to Congress' claim on EVM tampering and said it should show proof to Election Commission to support its claim. "If someone works well during EVM randomisation and...booth workers check EVMs during mock polls...I don't think there's anything substantial in these allegations," he said. Earlier, J&K CM Omar Abdullah had also criticised Congress for its allegations.
articles.title: Show proof to EC: TMC's Abhishek on Congress' EVM tampering claim
articles.subtitle: 'Can't criticise when results don't go your way'

articles.content: Anil Kumble has dismissed false quotes attributed to him being spread on social media questioning Virat Kohli's current form. Kumble in his post wrote, "It has come to my attention that some social media accounts are using my image and attributing fabricated quotes to me. I want to categorically deny any association with these accounts and their content."
articles.title: Anil Kumble dismisses fake quotes on Virat Kohli going viral
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The Supreme Court raised concerns over consumption of drugs among India’s youth and stated that it has regrettably become a "cool" symbol. The observation came when a bench of justices, BV Nagarathna and N Kotiswar Singh, were hearing a case registered by NIA against a man accused of smuggling heroin from Pakistan to India. The court upheld NIA's investigation.
articles.title: Consumption of drugs has become 'cool' among India's youth: SC
articles.subtitle: The heroin was smuggled via sea

articles.content: A military tank used by former Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's forces has been turned into a vegetable stand by a vendor. A photo which surfaced online showed the T-55 Soviet era tank at a market stall in Damascus, with various vegetables kept on it. Assad fled the country and sought refuge in Russia after rebels seized control in Damascus.
articles.title: Tank used by Assad regime turned into vegetable stand in Syria
articles.subtitle: Assad's family also granted asylum in Russia

articles.content: A controversy has erupted after "jungli murga" (grey junglefowl), which is an endangered species, was served at dinner that Himachal Pradesh CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu had with locals in Tikkar. "Hunting and eating this species is illegal," BJP said. Meanwhile, Sukhu said that villagers had cooked "desi murga", which he offered to others as he doesn't eat it.
articles.title: Row erupts over 'jungli murga' served at Himachal CM's dinner
articles.subtitle: 'Is this what you call a system change?'

articles.content: Meghalaya police informed Border Security Force (BSF) about sightings of Bayraktar TB2 unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) close to India-Bangladesh border, sparking concerns over national security. Notably, Bangladesh acquired the drones earlier this year as part of its military modernisation efforts. India and Bangladesh's relations became strained following ouster of Bangladesh ex-PM Sheikh Hasina.
articles.title: UAVs sighted along India-B'desh border: Meghalaya police to BSF
articles.subtitle: 'Such actions serve to rally internal support'

articles.content: Bombay High Court has rejected a plea filed against a contract awarded to Adani Group by the Maharashtra government for supplying 6,600 MW of renewable and thermal power and fined the petitioner ₹50,000. The petitioner had claimed that the contract was a "scam". "Filing...such petitions containing unsubstantiated and reckless averments...sometimes [risk] even good causes being lost," court said.
articles.title: Reckless: HC as it rejects plea on Adani's power contract in Maha & fines petitioner ₹50,000
articles.subtitle: HC noted plea lacked evidence to back claims

articles.content: Aamir Khan said making a film on Mahabharata is his "dream project" but he is "scared of getting it wrong". "It's a huge responsibility because as Indians, it's something so close to us, it's in our blood," he stated. "I want to make every Indian proud. I also want to show the world what India has," he added.
articles.title: I'm scared of getting it wrong: Aamir on 'Mahabharata' project
articles.subtitle: 'I don't know if it will happen'

articles.content: After Virat Kohli edged a delivery to Australia wicketkeeper Alex Carey and got out in India's first innings at Gabba, Sunil Gavaskar said he needs to exercise restraint when it comes to playing cover drives. "He just needs to look at his hero Sachin Tendulkar's 241-run knock in 2004 in Sydney...wherein Sachin didn't play any shot in covers," he added.
articles.title: Virat Kohli just needs to look at his hero Sachin's 241-run knock in Sydney: Gavaskar
articles.subtitle: Kohli got out for 3 runs off 16 balls

articles.content: Pakistan's central bank slashed its key policy rate by 2% to 13% on Monday amid easing inflation. The fifth straight rate cut since June brought down the rate to its lowest level in more than two years. "[The] approach of measured policy rate cuts is keeping inflationary and external account pressures in check," the bank's monetary policy committee said.
articles.title: Pakistan's central bank cuts key policy rate by 2% to 13%
articles.subtitle: Inflation eased to 4.9% in November

articles.content: Bashar al-Assad has released first statement after rebel groups led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS) under Abu Mohammed al-Julani's leadership overthrew his government in Syria. Denying planned departure from Syria, Assad said he wanted to continue fighting but was evacuated by Russian forces from the Khmeimim base on the evening of December 8 as it came under drone attacks.
articles.title: Bashar al-Assad releases 1st statement after rebels overthrow him in Syria
articles.subtitle: Bashar al-Assad came to power in 2000

articles.content: Supreme Court on Monday questioned how raising slogan 'Jai Shri Ram' could be considered an offence. Justices Pankaj Mithal and Sandeep Mehta raised the point while reviewing an appeal against Karnataka HC's decision to dismiss proceedings against two individuals accused of shouting the slogan inside a mosque. The alleged incident occurred in September 2023 at a mosque in Uttara Kannada.
articles.title: How's that an offence: SC on 'Jai Shri Ram' slogan inside mosque
articles.subtitle: To know more

articles.content: The Supreme Court has ordered an interim stay on Carnatic singer TM Krishna being recognised as the recipient of the 'Sangita Kalanidhi MS Subbulakshmi Award' and also restrained him from projecting himself as its recipient. The Bharat Ratna awardee's grandson had claimed that the award is against Subbulakshmi's Will and that Krishna maligned her reputation.
articles.title: Carnatic singer TM Krishna shouldn't be recognised as MS Subbulakshmi awardee: SC
articles.subtitle: 'It's not remark on Krishna's singing abilities'

articles.content: Bangladesh interim leader Muhammad Yunus commemorated Vijay Diwas and said celebrations this year were extra significant after ouster of ex-PM Sheikh Hasina's regime, which he termed "world’s worst autocratic government". Yunus didn't mention country's founding leader Sheikh Mujibur Rahman in his speech. Vijay Diwas marks Pakistan army's surrender to India, which led to Bangladesh's liberation.
articles.title: Vijay Diwas more significant as worst autocratic govt fell: Yunus
articles.subtitle: Yunus also paid tribute to the martyrs

articles.content: Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who met PM Narendra Modi on Monday, in a joint press statement said, "I've assured the PM that we'll not allow our land to be used in any manner detrimental to India's interests." He stated that cooperation with India will continue to flourish, adding, "I reaffirm our unwavering support for India."
articles.title: Won't allow our land to be used against India: Sri Lanka President Dissanayake
articles.subtitle: Dissanayake arrived in India on Sunday

articles.content: Singer Guru Randhawa has requested the government to talk with protesting farmers, saying, "Farmers provide food to every household in our country. Their voices need to be heard." After an X user asked the artist whether he got money or a threat, he said, "I am from a farmer family myself. Dono mein se kuch nhi mila (I got neither)."
articles.title: Their voices need to be heard: Guru Randhawa on farmers' protest
articles.subtitle: 'I am only requesting as an Indian'

articles.content: On Vijay Diwas, the Indian Air Force shared pictures showing India's victory over Pakistan in 1971 war. "The Indo-Pak War of 1971 concluded on 16 December 1971 with the unconditional surrender by Lt Gen AAK Niazi, marking the birth of independent Bangladesh. This historic moment was achieved through coordinated military effort, wherein the IAF played a pivotal role," IAF said.
articles.title: IAF shares pics of India's victory over Pakistan in 1971 war on Vijay Diwas
articles.subtitle: '1971 War a landmark in Indian military history'

articles.content: Bombay Shaving Company CEO Shantanu Deshpande raised concerns over 10-minute food delivery, saying, "We are suffering from the biggest epidemic of poor nutrition and unhealthy processed and ultra processed food which is high on palm oil and sugar." Claiming that frozen purees are being garnished to look fresh, he added, "Please cook. It's an adult skill...You are what you eat."
articles.title: Frozen purees garnished to look fresh: Shantanu Deshpande on 10-min food delivery
articles.subtitle: 'Junk food addiction taking us down US path'

articles.content: Amid strain in India-Bangladesh ties, a Bangladeshi delegation, comprising military veterans and serving army officers, visited Kolkata to mark 'Vijay Diwas' and said that ties between nations are "everlasting". "We'll always appreciate India's contribution," Bangladeshi Brigadier General Mohammed Aminur Rahman said. Indian Army defeated Pakistan army and liberated Bangladesh on December 16, 1971.
articles.title: Ties with India everlasting: B'desh army officers on Vijay Diwas
articles.subtitle: An Indian delegation has also gone to Dhaka

articles.content: Indore is taking steps to make the city beggar-free, with District Collector Asheesh Singh urging people "not to become partners in the sin by giving alms". "Our awareness campaign against begging will continue till the end of this month. If any person is found giving alms from January 1, an FIR will also be registered against him/her," Singh said.
articles.title: Case to be filed against people giving money to beggars in Indore
articles.subtitle: Indore has India's cleanest city tag

articles.content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella condoled the demise of tabla maestro Zakir Hussain and called him a "true legend". "[He] brought immense joy through his rhythmic brilliance," Nadella wrote on X.  "Your music transcends boundaries and will live on forever," he added. Hussain passed away at the age of 73 following complications from idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.
articles.title: Zakir Hussain brought joy via his rhythmic brilliance: Nadella
articles.subtitle: He died in San Francisco

articles.content: India's merchandise trade deficit rose to an all-time high of $37.8 billion in November, driven by a rise in gold imports. Merchandise exports declined by 4.9% YoY to $32.11 billion, while imports jumped by 27% YoY to $69.95 billion. Gold imports climbed 331% YoY to record $14.8 billion in November fueled by festive demand and asset diversification amid geopolitical tensions.
articles.title: India's trade deficit rises to record high of $37.8 billion in Nov
articles.subtitle: Trade deficit in October was $27.14 billion

articles.content: Pro batter Karun Nair has been named as the leader of Vidarbha for the Vijay Hazare Trophy 2024-25, as the team named their squad for the upcoming 50-over domestic competition. A 17-man squad revealed by the senior selection committee misses 'Vidarbha Express' Umesh Yadav, who also happens to be the most experienced campaigner, hasn't found a place in the team.
articles.title: Karun Nair named Vidarbha VHT captain, no place for Umesh Yadav
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Devdanya Farmers Producer Company Ltd, an FPO (Farmers’ Producer Organisation) based in Hubballi, Karnataka, has achieved a commendable annual turnover of ₹58 lakh, with a net profit of ₹1.4 lakh after expenses and taxes. The company, which serves over 500 small farmers from Kundagol and Shiggaon taluks, primarily focuses on selling millets and grains at affordable prices.
articles.title: Devdanya FPO records profit, focuses on sustainable farming
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Unemployed youth in Shimla protested against the Himachal Pradesh government, demanding permanent jobs and reforms in recruitment policies. They criticized outsourcing and temporary solutions, warning of intensified protests, including a gherao of the Assembly on December 19 during the Winter Session in Dharamshala.
articles.title: Youth protest in Shimla demanding permanent jobs and reforms
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Addressing the Uttar Pradesh state Assembly, CM Yogi Adityanath cited NCRB's data and said that no incident of communal riots had taken place since 2017. "Between 2012 and 2017, 815 communal riots took place and 192 people were killed," he further said. His remarks came days after violence broke out in Sambhal during a court-monitored survey of a mosque.
articles.title: No communal riot has taken place in UP since 2017: CM Yogi
articles.subtitle: '616 communal incidents took place from 2007-11'

articles.content: Tata Starbucks "will calibrate" its plans to open more Starbucks stores in India in the near term, Tata Consumer Products CEO Sunil D'Souza said, at a time when customer footfall is falling. "In near term, there'll be pressure," he said, adding the company is still focussed on operating 1,000 stores by 2028. Tata Starbucks currently operates 457 outlets in India.
articles.title: Will calibrate to open more Starbucks stores: Tata Consumer CEO
articles.subtitle: Tata Starbucks is JV of Starbucks, Tata Consumer

articles.content: Interventional Cardiologist Dr PRLN Prasad highlights how chronic stress impacts cardiovascular health. Prolonged stress keeps the body in a 'fight or flight' state, causing hypertension, arrhythmias, and inflammation. Managing stress through exercise, relaxation techniques, and lifestyle changes is vital to safeguard heart health and prevent complications like heart attacks and cardiomyopathy.
articles.title: How chronic stress affects the heart?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Haryana Steelers excel in the Pro Kabaddi League with 15 wins in 20 games, securing a playoff spot. Coach Manpreet Singh praised JSW Sports for their support. Key players like Vinay, Shivam Patare, Jaideep, and Shadloui have showcased exceptional performance, making the team strong contenders for the title.
articles.title: Haryana Steelers shine as coach praises management support
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A video from actors Naga Chaitanya and Sobhita Dhulipala's wedding, which showed her touching his feet, has sparked a debate on social media with some people praising the gesture while some criticising it. "He's not even stopping her, instead he thinks he is some God," a social media user reacted. "Nice to see traditions were followed," said another
articles.title: Sobhita touches Naga Chaitanya's feet at wedding; sparks debate
articles.subtitle: The couple got married on December 4

articles.content: Cody Rhodes retained his WWE title in a thrilling match against Kevin Owens following which he was attacked. WWE released a statement which said, "Cody Rhodes suffered cervical swelling and was kept overnight at a local hospital for observation. While X-Rays were negative for a fracture, Rhodes has been officially diagnosed with axial compression of the cervical spine with spasm.
articles.title: Cody Rhodes retains WWE title, diagnosed with spinal injury
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake on Monday thanked India for the $5-billion economic support it rendered during the island nation's "unprecedented" financial crisis and said it supported the country immensely. "We have cooperation in all 25 districts of Sri Lanka," PM Narendra Modi said. Notably, Dissanayake is on his first bilateral visit to Delhi after assuming power in Colombo.
articles.title: Supported us immensely: Sri Lanka Prez on India's $5-bn support
articles.subtitle: India, Sri Lanka have signed several MoUs

articles.content: AAP Sarpanch Sukhjit Singh was attacked by an armed mob in Punjab on Sunday, reports said. Sukhjit, the sarpanch of Chhanna Gulab Singh village, reportedly sustained serious injuries and died on the way to hospital. The incident reportedly occurred after an altercation erupted between the deceased and the other party. Sukhjit was actively fighting drug menace in the region.
articles.title: AAP Sarpanch Sukhjit killed after attack by mob in Punjab: Reports
articles.subtitle: Sukhjit's father also sustained injuries

articles.content: Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra was seen carrying a handbag with "Palestine" written on it in the Parliament on Monday. The bag displayed emblems showing solidarity with the Palestinian cause, including a watermelon. BJP has criticised the leader, calling the move an attempt at "appeasement". Notably, Palestinian envoy Abed Elrazeg Abu Jazer called on Priyanka Vadra last week.
articles.title: Priyanka Vadra seen carrying bag with 'Palestine' written on it in Parliament
articles.subtitle: 'Act on atrocities against Bangladeshi Hindus'

articles.content: Actress Jacqueliene Fernandez revealed that her father was a part-time DJ, adding that her home would be filled with records. "That exposure to diverse musical genres laid the foundation for my love of music," she further stated. Notably, the 39-year-old made her singing debut with the song 'Stormrider' in September. "The response to 'Stormrider' has been so encouraging," Jacqueliene said.
articles.title: Dad was a part-time DJ, home would be filled with CDs: Jacqueliene
articles.subtitle: 'I'm currently exploring solo music'

articles.content: North Korea's state media KCNA on Monday reported on President Yoon Suk Yeol's impeachment, two days after South Korea's National Assembly voted to impeach Yoon over his attempt to impose martial law. "The impeachment motion against the puppet Yoon was approved in the puppet ROK on Saturday," KCNA said. "The puppet Constitutional Court will finally decide the impeachment," it added.
articles.title: N Korea reports Yoon's impeachment 2 days after parliamentary vote
articles.subtitle: Yoon was impeached in a second vote

articles.content: A video of tabla maestro Zakir Hussain playing the instrument in his last film appearance 'Monkey Man' has gone viral after his demise. The clip shows actor-director Dev Patel's character practising boxing on a punching bag as Hussain creates a rhythm with tabla, matching the punches. "Only Ustad Zakir Hussain could've turned an action movie scene into...concert," a user wrote.
articles.title: Video shows Zakir Hussain playing tabla in his last film 'Monkey…'
articles.subtitle: Zakir Hussain passed away aged 73 in US

articles.content: The Indian rupee recorded an all-time closing low of 84.8625 against the US dollar on Monday. This comes amid a rise in US bond yields, weakness in the Chinese yuan and a widening of India's merchandise trade deficit in November. The deficit widened to a record high of $37.8 billion last month, driven by a jump in gold imports.
articles.title: Rupee hits record closing low of 84.86 against US dollar
articles.subtitle: Offshore Chinese yuan fell 0.2% to 7.29/dollar

articles.content: An Al Jazeera photojournalist was killed in an airstrike by the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) in Gaza on Sunday, the news channel said. The cameraman, identified as 39-year-old Ahmad Al-Louh, was among the five people killed in the strike. The IDF, however, has claimed that Ahmad was a "terrorist" who was earlier a part of the Islamic Jihad.
articles.title: Israeli strike kills journalist in Gaza, IDF says he was 'terrorist'
articles.subtitle: Al Jazeera has condemned the attack

articles.content: India vice-captain Jasprit Bumrah said the team is going through a transition and it's his job to help other bowlers. The 31-year-old fast bowler further stated that new players are coming to Australia, adding, "It isn't the easiest place to play cricket." Harshit Rana and Nitish Kumar Reddy made their Test debuts in the first Test against Australia in Perth.
articles.title: Team India is in transition, it’s my job to help others: Bumrah
articles.subtitle: Bumrah took 6 wickets in 1st innings in Brisbane

articles.content: World chess champion Gukesh D's father Dr Rajinikanth revealed he and Gukesh's mother "didn't even plan on having him play chess". "We were just trying to enrol him in extracurricular activities such as physical sports during the summers in Velammal," he added. Rajinikanth stated they chose chess because it was "easy" for them to manage their time and job schedules.
articles.title: Did not even plan on having him play chess: Gukesh's father
articles.subtitle: Both of Gukesh's parents are doctors

articles.content: Bengaluru FC goalkeeper Gurpreet Singh Sandhu responded to a Zomato customer's complaint on X about paying ₹12 extra for packaging on a shawarma order in Bengaluru. The customer complained that the shawarma was packed in a Bengaluru FC box and questioned why he was paying for the team's ad. Sandhu humorously asked for his GPay number to refund the ₹12.
articles.title: Will return ₹12: Sandhu to Zomato customer over Bengaluru FC ad
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Mumbai captain Shreyas Iyer has said that opener Prithvi Shaw, who went unsold in the IPL 2025 mega auction, needs to improve his work ethics. He added, "We can't babysit anyone, right? Every professional who is playing at this level, they need to know what they should be doing." Shaw scored 197 runs in nine SMAT 2024 matches for Mumbai.
articles.title: We can't babysit anyone, he needs to improve his work ethics: Shreyas Iyer on Prithvi Shaw
articles.subtitle: Mumbai won SMAT 2024 by beating MP in final

articles.content: While responding to BJP MP Sambit Patra seeking the return of late PM Jawaharlal Nehru's personal letters that were taken by Sonia Gandhi in 2008, Union Culture Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said he's noted the suggestion and action can be taken. Patra had also appealed for an investigation. The letters include those between Nehru and Edwina Mountbatten, Albert Einstein, etc.
articles.title: Action can be taken: Shekhawat on demand for late PM Nehru's letters taken by Sonia
articles.subtitle: Patra called the letters 'historical heritage'

articles.content: The NCERT announced a 20 percent reduction in textbook prices for classes 9 to 12, starting next academic year. Speaking at an event, NCERT Director Dinesh Prasad Saklani said this is the first time that the price of textbooks has been significantly reduced. NCERT has also partnered with Flipkart and Amazon to enhance access to textbooks nationwide, ensuring broader reach and availability.
articles.title: NCERT cuts textbook prices by 20% for classes 9-12
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Ukraine's military intelligence reported that at least 30 North Korean soldiers deployed by Russia in the Kursk region were either killed or wounded in recent clashes. Ukrainian officials found multiple bodies near Plekhovo, Vorozhba, and Martynovka on December 14 and 15. These troops were part of Russia's effort to reclaim territory lost to Ukraine during a surprise attack in summer.
articles.title: 30 North Korean troops either killed or wounded in Kursk: Ukraine
articles.subtitle: 10,000 N Korean forces are deployed in Russia

articles.content: In a charity cricket match between Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha members on the cricket ground at Delhi's Major Dhyan Chand Stadium to promote the goal of a TB-free India by 2025, Union Minister Anurag Thakur hit a massive six off Raghav Chadha to complete his century. The high-profile game showcased the sporting spirit of politicians, drawing widespread attention on social media.
articles.title: Anurag Thakur smashes Raghav Chadha for six in charity match
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Alex Bruesewitz, US President-elect Donald Trump's campaign advisor, collapsed while delivering a speech at the New York Young Republican Club gala event. He was heard speaking incoherently before leaning on the mic and falling off stage face-first along with the podium. The gala's emcee Raheem Kassam said, after regaining consciousness, Bruesewitz asked if he looked "cool" while collapsing.
articles.title: Video shows Trump advisor Bruesewitz collapsing on stage while giving speech in US
articles.subtitle: Trump also called Bruesewitz later

articles.content: Union ministry of ports, shipping and waterways has unveiled a cargo promotion policy 'Jalvahak' that incentivises movement of long-haul cargo through national waterways. Jalvahak scheme is a joint effort by the Inland Waterways Authority of India and Inland & Coastal Shipping. The scheme, which is initially valid for 3 years, is aimed at reducing logistics cost.
articles.title: Govt launches ‘Jalvahak’ scheme set to reduce logistics cost
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The gaming and esports sector in India is growing rapidly, and Tata is taking notice. According to Amur Lakshminarayanan, Managing Director and CEO of Tata Communications, the company is increasingly investing in the sector. Tata plans to support its growth with modern technologies and address the expanding e-gaming and esports markets.
articles.title: Tata Communications to also focus on e-gaming and esports
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The fast-fashion industry is driving a global environmental crisis, with textiles contributing significantly to greenhouse gas emissions, water and chemical use and waste generation. A new working paper by the OECD has advocated for the adoption of Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR) policies to embed circular economy principles in the garments sector.
articles.title: OECD paper governments to adopt EPR to tackle textile waste
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: While addressing the state Assembly, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said, "The tenth incarnation of Lord Vishnu will take place in Sambhal only." His remarks came days after violence broke out in Sambhal over the court-ordered survey of a mosque. Recently, a 400 to 500-year-old temple was also discovered in Sambhal during anti-encroachment drive there.
articles.title: 10th incarnation of Lord Vishnu will take place in Sambhal: Yogi
articles.subtitle: Temple was reopened after 46 years of closure

articles.content: A video circulating online showing Elon Musk promoting a $20 million crypto giveaway is a deepfake. It showed Musk saying, "Here's a surprise for everyone. I'll be doing a $20 million crypto giveaway at Elon4u.com for one week starting December 13." "It's just a few quick steps that shouldn't take longer than three minutes," Musk said in the fake video.
articles.title: Video of Elon Musk promoting $20 million crypto giveaway is fake
articles.subtitle: 'Don't fall for scams!'

articles.content: Swiggy share price hit a fresh record high on Monday after domestic brokerage Axis Capital initiated coverage on the stock with a 'Buy' rating and a 20% upside with a target price of ₹640. Swiggy stock touched an intraday high of ₹612.40 per share. Swiggy shares debuted at ₹420/share on NSE over the IPO price of ₹390 on November 13.
articles.title: Swiggy shares hit record high as Axis Capital estimates 20% upside
articles.subtitle: 4.81 crore Swiggy shares changed hands today

articles.content: A diabetes patient with continence issues soiled his pants due to a lack of toilets at Bryan Adams' Mumbai concert. "You should be ashamed for providing ~3 loos/1000 people," the concertgoer said in an open letter criticising Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal and the head of EVA Global Events. "This is NOT a rant...It's a CRY for help," his post read.
articles.title: Man soils pants at concert over lack of loos, writes open letter to Zomato CEO
articles.subtitle: 'Couldn't get into loo meant for other category'

articles.content: India and Sri Lanka signed several Memorandums of Understanding (MoUs) in the presence of PM Narendra Modi and Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake in Delhi on Monday. India has vowed to train 1,500 civil servants of Sri Lanka and cooperate in areas of housing, renewable energy and infrastructure. India-Sri Lanka connectivity will also be increased via more ferry services.
articles.title: India & Sri Lanka sign key MoUs to strengthen bilateral ties
articles.subtitle: This is Dissanayake's 1st visit to India as Prez

articles.content: Google has appointed Preeti Lobana as the new Country Manager and Vice President for India. Lobana, who has worked with Google for around nine years, previously served as VP of Google's publisher, partner, ads content teams, and gTech. She succeeded Sanjay Gupta, who was promoted earlier this year to Google's President for the Asia Pacific region.
articles.title: Google appoints Preeti Lobana as Country Manager, VP for India
articles.subtitle: Lobana is IIM Ahmedabad alumna

articles.content: Nagasri Vandana Parimala, a 26-year-old woman from Tenali, Andhra Pradesh, died in a car crash in Memphis, Tennessee, on Friday. She was driving when her vehicle collided with a truck, leading to her death. Two of her friends were seriously injured in the crash. Her body will be returned to Tenali for her final rites.
articles.title: 26-yr-old Indian-origin woman from Andhra dies in car crash in US
articles.subtitle: She was pursuing master's degree in data science

articles.content: The world's richest man and X (formerly Twitter) owner Elon Musk has hinted at launching an e-mail service to rival Google's Gmail. "X Mail would be cool. username@X.com," a post read on X, to which Musk responded, "Yeah. On the list of things to do." In another post, Musk said, "We need to rethink how messaging, including e-mail, works overall."
articles.title: Musk hints at launching Gmail rival
articles.subtitle: 'DMs turned into e-mail would be incredible'

articles.content: Bashar al-Assad, who fled to Russia after being ousted as Syria's President following a rebel uprising, airlifted $250 million (over ₹2,122 crore) in cash to Moscow, FT reported. Over 2018 and 2019, Assad dispatched 21 planes carrying nearly two tonnes of $100 and €500 currency notes. In the same time period, Assad's relatives were secretly buying luxury properties in Russia.
articles.title: Ousted Syrian President Assad airlifted ₹2,122-cr cash before fleeing to Russia: Report
articles.subtitle: Money kept in banks which were sanctioned by US

articles.content: Nikita Singhania, who has been accused of abetting Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash's suicide, reportedly changed her location everyday and made calls only on WhatsApp to avoid arrest. Police reportedly traced her location to Gurugram after she mistakenly made a normal call to her relative. Police then traced her family's location to Prayagraj after detaining Nikita and making her call them.
articles.title: How did Bengaluru Police catch Atul Subhash's wife Nikita Singhania & family?
articles.subtitle: They were taken to B'luru on late-night flight

articles.content: A man sued organisers after he paid 20,000 yuan (₹2.3 lakh), while being unemployed and in debt, to register for a self-discipline challenge and failed thrice. The challenge required participants to stay in camera-surveilled rooms for 26 days under strict rules, offering a 860,000-yuan (₹1 crore) prize. He was disqualified twice for covering his face for over three seconds.
articles.title: Man fails thrice after spending ₹2.3 lakh on 'isolation' challenge with ₹1-cr prize in China
articles.subtitle: He was disqualified once for covering beer can

articles.content: Actor Manoj Bajpayee said that people have stopped inviting him to Bollywood parties because he never attends them. "They've realised why to be offended and humiliated by me not attending, which I'm very happy with," he added. "Please don't call me because I like to sleep by 10-10:30 pm and I'm always looking forward to my early mornings," said Manoj.
articles.title: People stopped inviting me to avoid humiliation of me not attending: Manoj
articles.subtitle: 'People think I'm very arrogant as I'm reserved'

articles.content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said socialism and license raj under Congress' 50-year rule "ruined" India's economy. "Though the country...changed course in 1991, by then it had lost four precious decades," Sitharaman said, adding, "History built over these decades continued to haunt development efforts even after change of course." Congress "baggaged" India in 50 years, she further said.
articles.title: Socialism, license raj in Congress' 50-year rule ruined India: FM
articles.subtitle: 'Much-promised 'garibi hatao' wasn't delivered'

articles.content: Addressing the state Assembly on Monday, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath spoke on the Sambhal violence. He said, "Not a single arrest has been made without evidence, and I would like to remind that none of those who indulged in stone pelting will be spared." Notably, the violence erupted in Sambhal in November over court-ordered survey of a mosque.
articles.title: Not a single stone pelter will be spared: Yogi on Sambhal violence
articles.subtitle: 5 people lost their lives in the incident

articles.content: Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Monday raised the issue of the removal of the photo showing the Pakistani Army surrendering in front of the Indian Army during the 1971 war. She demanded its restoration in Lok Sabha on Vijay Diwas. "I want to salute the brave soldiers who fought for us in the war of 1971," she said.
articles.title: Priyanka demands restoration of 1971 war pic in LS on Vijay Diwas
articles.subtitle: She lauded Indira Gandhi's leadership during war

articles.content: 'Seat squatters' is a travel trend used to describe people who occupy seats on flights that have been assigned to another person. "[Flyers] may not be able to get what they want from...airline when reserving seats, or the airline may want a fee for the seats...so they'll try their luck on board," a travel industry expert told Fox News Digital.
articles.title: What is the 'seat squatters' travel trend?
articles.subtitle: 'I would be so ashamed to be caught'

articles.content: Madhya Pradesh's famous Baiga tribal artist Jodhaiya Bai, a Padma Shri recipient, died in Umaria after prolonged illness. The 86-year-old painter, who was instrumental in getting international recognition to Baiga tribal art, passed away at her native Lodha village, PTI reported. Madhya Pradesh ex-CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan condoled her demise and said she was a strong voice of tribal community.
articles.title: Padma Shri awardee Baiga tribal artist Jodhaiya Bai dies at 86
articles.subtitle: 'Big loss in the field of art & culture'

articles.content: The Centre's Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) has reimposed GRAP-3 anti-pollution restrictions in the national capital, following "highly unfavourable meteorological conditions". Under GRAP-3, all schools in the Delhi-NCR region must switch to a hybrid class mode for students till Class V. Furthermore, there will be restrictions on the entry of diesel-powered commercial vehicles.
articles.title: GRAP-3 anti-pollution measures reimposed in Delhi-NCR
articles.subtitle: Delhi reported 'Very Poor' air quality on Mon

articles.content: The Ursid meteor shower, the year's final celestial display, will peak overnight from December 21 to December 22, with up to 10 meteors per hour. Best viewed before dawn, the meteors will appear to originate from the Ursa Minor constellation, also known as the Little Dipper. The shower will remain active from December 17 to 26 in the Northern Hemisphere.
articles.title: Ursid meteor shower to peak overnight from Dec 21-22
articles.subtitle: Ursids produce fewer meteors than the Geminids

articles.content: Diljit Dosanjh has reacted after controversy over him writing Punjab as 'Panjab' in his post and not inserting National Flag emoji with the state's name. "If in some tweet I forget to mention the flag emoji, then it's considered conspiracy...I forgot in Bengaluru concert tweet also," he wrote. He also shared picture of 'Panjab University' over the spelling controversy.
articles.title: Diljit reacts to controversy over writing Punjab as 'Panjab', not using Tricolour emoji
articles.subtitle: 'Creating row over spelling given by Britishers'

articles.content: Actor Vikrant Massey revealed he wrote the post on Instagram about his acting break at midnight as he was unable to sleep. Initially mistaken for a retirement announcement, the 37-year-old later clarified that he is not going on a permanent break. "So coming 2025, we would meet each other for one last time. Until time deems right," Massey had written.
articles.title: Wrote acting break post at midnight as I could not sleep: Massey
articles.subtitle: 'I got much more than what I asked for'

articles.content: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar criticised batter Shubman Gill after he was dismissed playing a drive on his third delivery in India's first innings in the Gabba Test against Australia. "Leave your image in dressing room...Keep all those shots in your back pocket. Take them out when you are 30-40-50 not out," he said. Gill scored one run in the innings.
articles.title: Leave your image in the dressing room: Gavaskar on Shubman Gill's 1(3)
articles.subtitle: India ended Day 3 at 51-4 in 17 overs

articles.content: During his visit to Chhattisgarh, Union Home Minister Amit Shah promised 15,000 houses and livelihood support to the surrendered Maoists in Bastar. He assured them, "Prime Minister Modi's government will do everything possible to rehabilitate you." Shah also pledged a cow or buffalo for each family and assistance to build dairy cooperatives, ensuring a minimum income of ₹15,000.
articles.title: Amit Shah promises 15,000 houses to surrendered Maoists in Bastar
articles.subtitle: 'Killing is not the way forward'

articles.content: Pandit Sanjay Ram Marathe, a renowned classical singer and harmonium maestro, passed away at the age of 68. The artist had suffered a severe heart attack and was admitted to a private hospital in Thane where he died on Sunday night, his family said. He was the eldest son of Sangeet Bhushan Pandit Ram Marathe.
articles.title: Harmonium maestro Pandit Sanjay Ram Marathe passes away at 68
articles.subtitle: He is survived by his wife, son & granddaughter

articles.content: Filmmaker Imtiaz Ali took to Instagram Stories to react to a video showing a fan climbing a tree to watch Punjabi singer Diljit Dosanjh's concert in Chandigarh, saying, "Recreating Chamkila." "Diljit Dosanjh effect," he further wrote. Imtiaz was referring to a scene from Diljit and Parineeti Chopra-starrer 'Amar Singh Chamkila', wherein Chamkila's fans climbed trees to see him.
articles.title: Recreating Chamkila: Imtiaz as fan climbs tree to watch Diljit's concert
articles.subtitle: Diljit's Chandigarh concert took place on Dec 14

articles.content: Premchand Godha, who once worked as Amitabh Bachchan's CA managing the actor's finances, has become one of India's richest people with a net worth of $1.7 billion, ET reported. In 1975, he and the Bachchan family invested in the loss-making pharma company Ipca Laboratories. Over the years, Godha made the company profitable and now serves as its Executive Chairman.
articles.title: Premchand Godha, who worked as Bachchan's CA, now among India's richest
articles.subtitle: In 1999, Bachchan family sold their Ipca stake

articles.content: A mistress filed a petition in a court seeking a refund after her lover's wife accepted 1.2 million yuan (approximately ₹1.39 crore) as "divorce fee" but refused to leave him in China, South China Morning Post reported. The court, however, has rejected the woman's petition. The man reportedly has two daughters with his wife and a son with the mistress.
articles.title: Wife refuses to divorce husband despite taking ₹1.39 cr from mistress in China; she sues wife
articles.subtitle: Wife had reportedly refused to return the money

articles.content: Businessman Gautam Adani condoled the demise of tabla maestro Ustad Zakir Hussain and said, "His legacy is an eternal taal, resonating through generations to come." "The world has lost a rhythm it can never replace...Our maestro whose tabla beats will forever echo in the soul of India, leaves behind his inimitable form of timeless art," he added.
articles.title: His legacy is an eternal taal: Adani on Zakir Hussain's demise
articles.subtitle: Hussain passed away aged 73 in US

articles.content: Team India captain Rohit Sharma scolded fast bowler Akash Deep after he bowled a stray delivery during Day 3 of the Gabba Test against Australia. "'Abbe sar mai kuch hai?' (Is there anything in your brain?)" Rohit was heard saying on stump mic while shouting at Akash, who took one wicket in Australia's first innings.
articles.title: Rohit Sharma scolds Akash Deep, yells 'Abbe sar mai kuch hai?'
articles.subtitle: To watch the video of Rohit scolding Akash

articles.content: Punjabi singer Diljit Dosanjh, during his Chandigarh concert, said India doesn't have the infrastructure for live shows and concerts, adding they're a big source of revenue. "Many people get work and are able to work here," he added. Diljit further stated, "I'll try next time that the stage is at the centre...Till this happens, I won't do shows in India."
articles.title: We don't have infra for concerts, it's big revenue source: Diljit
articles.subtitle: The concert was held on December 14

articles.content: Rabindra Ghosh, a Bangladeshi lawyer who has been defending jailed Hindu monk Chinmoy Krishna Das, is in West Bengal's Barrackpore for treatment, his son said. "I've requested my father not to return to Bangladesh and to stay here...for a while," the son said, expressing concerns for Ghosh's safety. Earlier, Bangladeshi lawyers threatened to thrash anyone who represented Chinmoy.
articles.title: Jailed Hindu monk Chinmoy Das' lawyer in India for treatment
articles.subtitle: Das' bail hearing scheduled for January 2

articles.content: India's wholesale inflation eased to a three-month low of 1.89% in November as prices of food articles, especially vegetables, fell. The wholesale inflation stood at 2.36% in October and 0.39% in November last year. Food prices dropped to 8.63% in November from 13.54% in October. Vegetable prices fell to 28.57% from 63.04% during the same period.
articles.title: India's wholesale inflation eases to 3-month low of 1.89% in Nov
articles.subtitle: Price of mineral oils increased

articles.content: LG Electronics is considering increasing its Indian unit's valuation to as much as $15 billion (over ₹1.27 lakh crore) in a planned listing in Mumbai next year, reported Bloomberg. The company is planning to start a formal roadshow within the next two months, report added. Earlier this month, LG filed for an IPO to raise around $1.5 billion (₹15,237 crore).
articles.title: LG Electronics eyes ₹1.27 lakh cr valuation in India IPO: Report
articles.subtitle: LG targeting a listing in first half of 2025

articles.content: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Monday said he would oppose the "anti-federal and impractical 'one nation one election' bill" as it'd push the country into the "perils of a unitary form of governance". "State elections would lose their political significance and regional sentiments and diversity would be destroyed, Stalin said, stating that all democratic forces must oppose the move.
articles.title: Anti-federal, impractical: Stalin on One Nation One Election Bill
articles.subtitle: Union cabinet has approved the bill

articles.content: Israel's bombing of Syria has caused massive explosions that were registered as a 3.0 magnitude earthquake on Richter scale, reports said. The 'earthquake' bomb strikes are part of Israel's 'most intense' offence on Syria's coastal Tartus region since 2012, a Syrian war monitor said. Visuals of a 'mushroom cloud' forming after the explosions have surfaced online.
articles.title: Israel launches heaviest bomb strikes in decades on Syria, visuals surface
articles.subtitle: Syria's Tartus has a Russian military base

articles.content: One of the five men arrested over kidnapping of comedian Sunil Pal and actor Mushtaq Khan was shot in leg by police in Meerut. Police said he tried to escape from the police jeep while being taken to the hospital for medical check up on Sunday morning. He also reportedly snatched a sub-inspector's gun and fired at the police team.
articles.title: Man involved in kidnapping Sunil Pal shot by police
articles.subtitle: A pic showed him in hospital

articles.content: Criticising the Congress, Union Minister Nirmala Sitharaman referred to the arrests of poet and lyricist Majrooh Sultanpuri and actor Balraj Sahni for their “anti-Nehru" stance in 1949. Speaking in Rajya Sabha, she said, "Sultanpuri recited a poem that was written against Jawaharlal Nehru and, therefore, he had to go to jail." She added Sahni was jailed for his revolutionary thinking.
articles.title: Balraj Sahni was jailed in 1949 for anti-Nehru stance: Sitharaman
articles.subtitle: She said this during debate over Constitution

articles.content: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has called a confidence vote in parliament, expected to lead to fresh elections in February 2025. Scholz's coalition collapsed last month, leaving his position in jeopardy. The political turmoil comes as Germany faces economic challenges, including high energy prices and fierce competition from China in its export-driven industrial sector.
articles.title: Germany's Scholz calls confidence vote as coalition falls apart
articles.subtitle: He is expected to lose as per opinion polls

articles.content: India ended Day 3 of the Gabba Test at 51/4 in their first innings, trailing Australia by 394 runs. Earlier in the day, Australia were bowled out by India for 445 runs. Jasprit Bumrah took six wickets in the innings, while Mohammed Siraj took two wickets. Australia wicketkeeper Alex Carey scored 70 runs off 88 balls.
articles.title: India trail Australia by 394 runs after rain-curtailed Day 3 of Gabba Test
articles.subtitle: KL Rahul is unbeaten on 33
