articles.content: RBI's newly-appointed Governor Sanjay Malhotra in his first address to employees asked them to "make perfection a habit", NDTV Profit reported. He said he expects everyone to bring in "100% commitment to the workplace". He told members of the RBI staff that all departments, starting from housekeeping to those involved in policy-making, must focus on doing their jobs perfectly well.
articles.title: Bring 100% commitment to work: New RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra to staff
articles.subtitle: 'Take decisions quickly'

articles.content: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge took a dig at Union Minister Nirmala Sitharaman over her attack on ex-PM Jawaharlal Nehru during a debate on the Constitution in Rajya Sabha. Kharge said, "I've studied at municipality school. She (Sitharaman) studied at Jawaharlal Nehru University." He added, "It's certain that her English will be good, Hindi will be good, but...her deeds aren't good."
articles.title: Sitharaman studied in JNU, her English good but not deeds: Kharge
articles.subtitle: To know what else he said

articles.content: Priyanka Gandhi raised concerns over the growing man-animal conflict in Wayanad during Parliament session. She highlighted 90 cases of conflict in a year and called for increased compensation. Protesting with MPs, she demanded a relief package for Wayanad and criticized the central government for alleged discrimination in disaster aid.
articles.title: Priyanka Gandhi raises man-animal conflict in Parliament
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A scripted video showing women being rescued from a cupboard is being shared with a false communal claim that Hindu women are being kidnapped so that they can be killed and their body parts can be sold. BOOM found that the video was scripted and created by YouTuber Naveen Jangra, with a disclaimer stating it was made for entertainment purposes.
articles.title: Scripted video of women being kidnapped viral with false claim
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: India, China, Japan, Korea, and Malaysia have qualified for the FIH Hockey Women's Junior World Cup 2025 in Chile by finishing in the top 5 of the Asia Junior Cup 2024. India won the Junior Asian Cup by defeating China in a thrilling final. The 2025 edition marks the first time the event features 24 teams.
articles.title: India, China, Japan, Korea, Malaysia qualify for Women's Junior WC
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A manipulated video of 10-year-old religious influencer Abhinav Arora is viral, showing him getting attacked by bull while he is giving sermon. BOOM accessed the original video where Arora can be seen giving the entire sermon without being attacked. Furthermore, we ran viral clip through deepfake detection tool TrueMedia, which indicated 90% chance of it being manipulated using AI tools.
articles.title: Influencer Abhinav Arora getting hit by bull video is manipulated
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: According to a report by the Observer Research Foundation (ORF), India's online gaming sector is driving the $1 trillion digital economy goal by 2025, boosting FDI, tax revenues, fintech growth, and innovation. With 700 million internet users, gaming fuels fintech adoption, AR, VR, and Web 3.0 development, creating a ripple effect across sectors like healthcare, media, and manufacturing.
articles.title: Online gaming boosts India's $1 trillion digital economy goal
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Three broken idols were found near the ancient Sambhal temple that was recently reopened after 46 years. The idols, two of which appear to be Lord Ganesh and Lord Kartikeya, were found during digging works in the well near the temple. The area around the temple has been secured so that excavation works can be done, said an official.
articles.title: Broken idols found in well near Sambhal temple as it's reopened after 46 yrs
articles.subtitle: Temple was reopened on December 13

articles.content: The net worth of tabla maestro Ustad Zakir Hussain was approximately $1 million (about ₹8.5 crore) at the time of his demise, as per multiple reports. Ustad Hussain charged between ₹5 lakh and ₹10 lakh for each performance, with concerts, collaborations, recordings and workshops accounting for most of his wealth. For his first performance, he reportedly earned only ₹5.
articles.title: What was Ustad Zakir Hussain's net worth?
articles.subtitle: Hussain passed away aged 73

articles.content: Premier Roadlines Limited's stock jumped 12% after winning orders worth ₹30 crore, including a ₹10 crore contract for transporting over-dimensional cranes. The logistics company secured contracts from equipment rental, solar power, and infrastructure sectors. Founded in 2008, PRL is an IBA-approved logistics provider with 28 branch offices, serving clients like Tata and L&T.
articles.title: Premier Roadlines' stock surges 12% with new ₹30 crore contract
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Opposition leader Rahul Gandhi paid tribute to the soldiers of the 1971 war on Vijay Diwas. "Today...we honour the courage and sacrifices of the brave soldiers who contributed to India's historic victory in 1971," PM Modi said. Rahul Gandhi in an X post wrote, "I salute the valour, dedication and resolve of our armed forces."
articles.title: PM Modi, Rahul Gandhi pay homage to soldiers on Vijay Diwas
articles.subtitle: Other leaders also paid tribute to the soldiers

articles.content: During the Constitution Debate in Rajya Sabha, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said, "Accusing me of lying is clearly in blood of Congress." She said, "When I was the Defence Minister, not only did they call PM Narendra Modi a thief, they also kept on accusing me of lying." She also criticised Congress for making various amendments to the Constitution.
articles.title: Accusing me of lying is clearly in blood of Congress: Sitharaman
articles.subtitle: 'Indian Constitution has stood the test of time'

articles.content: Barbie's sequel is reportedly in early development as Greta Gerwig and Noah Baumbach work on new story ideas. The 2023 blockbuster earned $1.4 billion globally and became a cultural phenomenon. Margot Robbie, the lead and producer, is expected to return, with Warner Bros discussing the project's next steps.
articles.title: Barbie sequel in early development with Gerwig, Baumbach
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Former Australia opener Matthew Hayden criticised Australia for not declaring in their first innings against India in the rain-curtailed Gabba Test. "I sense that playing with the weather is like playing with fire. You have just got to focus on winning the Test," he said. The 53-year-old further termed Pat Cummins' captaincy as "conservative", adding that he is "not surprised".
articles.title: It’s like playing with fire: Hayden on Aus not declaring vs India
articles.subtitle: Australia were bowled out for 445 in the innings

articles.content: Actor Mukesh Khanna said he sees obscenity in comedian Kapil Sharma's show, adding that it has "double-meaning dialogues" and "below-the-belt jokes". "Though people laugh, I don't see any decency in it," the 66-year-old stated. Khanna, who hasn't appeared on Kapil's show yet, further said he would have declined any invitation, despite never being contacted by the producers.
articles.title: Kapil Sharma's show is obscene, has double-meaning dialogues: Mukesh Khanna
articles.subtitle: 'He never contacted me'

articles.content: Congress Chief Mallikarjun Kharge criticized RSS and BJP in Rajya Sabha for disrespecting the Constitution. He highlighted their opposition to the tricolor and democratic values, stressing the need to protect constitutional principles. Kharge praised Indira Gandhi's 1971 war leadership and urged action for minorities in Bangladesh.
articles.title: Kharge criticizes RSS, BJP over alleged Constitution disrespect
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: UIDAI offers a limited-time opportunity for Aadhaar holders to update their details online for free, encouraging accurate authentication and seamless service delivery. Originally set to end on December 14, 2024, the deadline has now been extended to June 14, 2025, giving millions of Aadhaar holders the chance to ensure their information is accurate.
articles.title: UIDAI extends free Aadhaar update deadline to June 14, 2025
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Former Australia fast bowler Jason Gillespie, who recently resigned as Pakistan Test head coach, said that "I was completely and utterly blindsided by a decision to not have a high-performance coach." "[Pakistan assistant head coach] Tim Nielsen was told his services were no longer required, and I had absolutely zero communication from anyone about that," he added.
articles.title: I was blindsided by PCB's decision to fire Nielsen: Gillespie on quitting as Pak head coach
articles.subtitle: 'Players were getting a lot out of Tim'

articles.content: Third umpire KN Ananthapadmanabhan changed the on-field umpire's decision of wide to legal ball after Mumbai challenged decision on last ball of MP's innings in SMAT final. MP captain Rajat Patidar questioned decision and pointed out where ball pitched. Third umpire reviewed the footage again and declared it wide. "Extremely sorry...I didn't see it pitched outside popping crease," he said.
articles.title: 3rd umpire reverses, then re-reverses decision after protest during SMAT final, apologises
articles.subtitle: Mumbai beat MP in the final

articles.content: On Monday, Australia added 40 more runs to their overnight score to put 445 runs. However, India did not had a great start with their top order registering a collapse with Jaiswal, Gill and Kohli departing cheaply. However, the day saw several breaks marred due to rain, on-field umpires called for early stumps, with India trailing by 394 runs.
articles.title: Umpires call for early stumps on Day 3 as India trail by 394 runs
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Veteran music director and Rajya Sabha MP Ilaiyaraaja was asked to step out of the sacred chamber of the Srivilliputhur Andal Temple in Tamil Nadu. The temple authorities reportedly asked Ilaiyaraaja to step out because he entered space that wasn't allowed to the public. A video of the incident has gone viral online with some users alleging a caste-based discrimination.
articles.title: Ilaiyaraaja asked to step out of Tamil Nadu temple's sacred chamber
articles.subtitle: Ilaiyaraaja completed the darshan of diety

articles.content: President Droupadi Murmu honoured soldiers for their "indomitable courage" during the 1971 war on Vijay Diwas.  "I pay homage to our valiant soldiers... securing victory for India," read a post from her office. She added, "A grateful nation remembers the ultimate sacrifice of our bravehearts whose stories inspire every Indian and shall remain a source of national pride."
articles.title: President Murmu pays homage to soldiers on Vijay Diwas
articles.subtitle: She attended 'At-Home' reception at Army House

articles.content: The Delhi High Court has recused from hearing AAP MP Raghav Chadha's plea challenging the cancellation of his bungalow by the Rajya Sabha House Committee. Justice Rekha Palli directed the matter to another bench. A trial court earlier ruled no malafide intent in the cancellation, citing no legal grounds for Chadha's claim.
articles.title: Delhi HC judge recuses from Raghav Chadha bungalow plea
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Character.AI has rolled out teen-focused safety features, including a stricter AI model with content limits. Sensitive prompts like self-harm now trigger referrals to support services, and minors can't edit bot responses to prevent bypassing. These updates follow lawsuits claiming the platform contributed to self-harm and suicide, with efforts to address addiction and confusion.
articles.title: Character.AI introduces teen safety features after lawsuits
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The National Lok Adalat, held on Saturday, reunited six estranged couples in Udupi and Dakshina Kannada districts, resolving their long-standing disputes. A particularly emotional reunion took place at the Family Court in Udupi, where a couple, separated for six years, exchanged garlands and shared sweets.
articles.title: Six couples reunite at National Lok Adalat in Udupi & DK
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: With rain marring Day 3 of the third Test, weather forecast for Day 4 also does not look pleasing. According to Accuweather.com, probability of precipitation remains 100% with probability of thunderstorm reduced to 29%. Moreover, with considerable humidity, cloud cover is expected to be around 96% with precipitation of two and a half hours.
articles.title: AUS vs IND 3rd BGT Test: What is the weather forecast of Day 4?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Paragon restaurant in Kerala's Kozhikode has ranked fifth on Taste Atlas' list of world's 100 most legendary restaurants while Kolkata's Peter Cat has ranked seventh. Amrik Sukhdev in Haryana's Murthal, Karim's in Delhi and Central Tiffin Room in Bengaluru have been ranked 13th, 59th and 69th respectively. Delhi's Gulati restaurant ranked 77th while Mumbai's Ram Ashraya ranked 78th.
articles.title: 7 Indian restaurants on Taste Atlas' list of world's 100 most legendary restaurants
articles.subtitle: Figlmüller topped the list by Taste Atlas

articles.content: BJP MP and party spokesperson Sambit Patra questioned Gandhi family's intentions over Sonia Gandhi taking custody of first Indian PM Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru's personal letters in 2008. "People want to know what Nehru ji [wrote] to Edwina Mountbatten (wife of India's last Viceroy Lord Mountbatten)...What was in these letters that Gandhi family didn't want nation to know?" he said.
articles.title: People want to know what Nehru ji wrote to Mountbatten's wife: BJP on letters
articles.subtitle: Centre has sought a return of the letters

articles.content: AAP leader Manish Sisodia criticized the BJP for failing to manage Delhi's law and order, highlighting deteriorating conditions under Union Home Minister Amit Shah. He praised CM Arvind Kejriwal for improvements in schools, electricity, and hospitals. Sisodia also questioned BJP's stance on Rohingya rehabilitation in Delhi.
articles.title: Manish Sisodia slams BJP over Delhi's law and order failures
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Singer Diljit Dosanjh stirred a controversy after writing Punjab as 'Panjab' in one of his posts, and netizens slammed him for using the Pakistani spelling of the region. Amid the row, singer Guru Randhawa penned a cryptic note on X, without any explanation. "Punjab," he wrote, with a tricolour emoticon, and netizens felt it was a dig at Diljit.
articles.title: Guru Randhawa pens cryptic note amid Diljit's 'Panjab' controversy
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: India requires ₹16,000 crore capex by 2030 to meet public EV charging demand, says FICCI. The report highlights scaling charging stations in top 40 cities and favorable policies as key enablers. Government schemes like PM E-DRIVE and GST cuts aim to drive EV adoption toward India's 30% electrification goal.
articles.title: India needs ₹16,000 crore for EV charging by 2030: FICCI
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: On Bangladesh Victory Day, former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina criticised interim leader Muhammad Yunus, calling him a "fascist". She alleged his regime sought to suppress the Liberation War's spirit. "This undemocratic group led by the fascist Yunus has no responsibility towards the people," she said, adding, "They are taking power and obstructing all public welfare work."
articles.title: Yunus is a fascist, led undemocratic group in B'desh: Ex-PM Hasina
articles.subtitle: 'Yunus secretly backs extremist-communal forces'

articles.content: A 20-foot-wide crater emerged on a road that caved-in in Lucknow's Vikas Nagar on Monday. Videos of the massive sinkhole went viral online. According to reports, road repair work in the area had been ongoing for several months and the incident occurred near a powerhouse. No one suffered injuries even as the police have closed the road by installing barricades.
articles.title: Video: Road cave-in forms 20-ft crater in Lucknow's Vikas Nagar
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: World chess champion Gukesh D returned to India on Monday and was accorded a grand welcome at the Chennai airport. Scores of fans welcome Gukesh D at the Chennai airport and chanted 'Gukesh, Gukesh'. Gukesh became the youngest world chess champion at the age of 18 after defeating Ding Liren of China in World Chess Championship 2024 in Singapore.
articles.title: World chess champion Gukesh D returns home, gets grand welcome at Chennai airport
articles.subtitle: Gukesh won the 14-game c'ship 7.5-6.5

articles.content: PM Narendra Modi condoled the demise of tabla maestro Zakir Hussain. Taking to X, he said, "Zakir Hussain will be remembered as a true genius who revolutionised the world of Indian classical music." PM Modi added, "He also brought the tabla to...global stage, captivating millions with his unparalleled rhythm. Through this, he seamlessly blended Indian classical traditions with global music."
articles.title: PM Modi condoles demise of Zakir Hussain, calls him 'True genius'
articles.subtitle: Zakir Hussain passed away in San Francisco

articles.content: Switzerland cited a 2023 Supreme Court order while revoking India's 'most favoured nation (MFN)' status. Delhi HC ruled in 2021 that Nestlé was eligible for tax refund on dividends it paid to foreigners in reciprocity for Switzerland extending MFN status' benefits to Indian entities. SC said the benefits cannot automatically apply to Swiss entities in India without a government notification.
articles.title: What is the Nestlé case Switzerland cited while revoking India's most favoured nation tag?
articles.subtitle: SC cited rules under Income Tax Act's Section 90

articles.content: Vijay Diwas (December 16) marks India's victory over Pakistan in the 1971 war leading to segregation of East Pakistan (now Bangladesh) & West Pakistan (now Pakistan). The war began on December 3, following humanitarian crisis in East Pakistan, where Pakistani military tortured civilians. India supported liberation movement, which lasted 13 days & ended with 93,000 Pakistani soldiers surrendering.
articles.title: What is Vijay Diwas, celebrated on December 16?
articles.subtitle: 'Testament to India's commitment to its friends'

articles.content: Moldova Deputy PM Mihail Popsoi visited India from December 15 to 16, strengthening bilateral ties. Key highlights included the inauguration of Moldova's Embassy in New Delhi, signing agreements on migration, mobility, and solar alliance, and fostering trade, cultural, and diplomatic cooperation.
articles.title: Moldova Deputy PM visits India to boost bilateral relations
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A man was caught raping a stray dog in Karnataka’s Ramanagara district on Saturday. The public witnessed the act on Sathanur road near Channapatna town, immediately intervening by beating the man before handing him over to the police. The accused is identified as a native of Hosapete in Ballari and resident of Channapatna. A case has been registered under multiple sections of BNS.
articles.title: Man arrested for raping stray dog in Karnataka's Ramanagara
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Eight Indian military veterans of Bangladesh's 1971 Liberation War reached Dhaka while eight Bangladesh Army war veterans arrived in Kolkata to mark Vijay Diwas, amid tensions in India-Bangladesh ties. Vijay Diwas commemorates Pakistan military's surrender to Indian forces and the liberation of Bangladesh. India has raised concerns over attacks on Hindus under Muhammad Yunus in Bangladesh.
articles.title: Amid India-B'desh tensions, 1971 war veterans' exchange visit to mark Vijay Diwas
articles.subtitle: Mukti Jodha fighters part of B'desh delegation

articles.content: Leader of Opposition (LOP) Rahul Gandhi has urged External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar to address the arrest of Indian fishermen during Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake's India visit. He highlighted the fisherfolk's plight, loss of livelihood, and requested the release of impounded vessels and regular bilateral talks to resolve issues.
articles.title: Rahul Gandhi urges EAM to action on Indian fishermen's arrest
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The Shiv Sena faction led by Deputy CM Eknath Shinde is considering having its newly sworn-in ministers sign an affidavit agreeing to vacate their positions after two and a half years to make room for other contenders. The Shinde faction received 11 ministries in the new government led by Devendra Fadnavis.
articles.title: Shiv Sena seeks affidavits from ministers for 2.5-year term
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Congress' Manipur MP Alfred Kanngam Arthur questioned government's handling of the situation in the state and PM Narendra Modi for not visiting Manipur. "Is my nation so weak that you cannot protect lives and properties of Manipur people?" he asked. "Why is it that till date PM isn't answerable to Manipur people? Is it too much to ask?" he asked.
articles.title: Why PM not answerable to Manipur people, is it too much to ask: MP
articles.subtitle: 'Are we not part of this nation?'

articles.content: The Mumbai-bound section of the Thane Creek Bridge (popularly known as the Vashi Bridge) is nearing completion and is expected to open by the end of February, as per reports. This comes just two months after the Navi Mumbai-bound section of the project was opened to motorists on October 13. The bridge will open after some final touches get done.
articles.title: New Vashi bridge's Mumbai-bound arm to open by Feb 2025
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The UP Assembly winter session began in Lucknow with Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya assuring the opposition that all their questions would be answered. Despite SP protests over issues like communal tensions and anti-encroachment drives, Maurya emphasized smooth proceedings. Tight security arrangements are in place.
articles.title: Maurya assures opposition answers as UP Assembly session begins
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: K Leelavathi Baipadithaya, the first woman to perform as a Yakshagana ‘Bhagavatha’ (singer), passed away on Saturday, December 14, at the age of 77. A trailblazer in coastal Karnataka’s traditional theatre, Leelavathi broke gender barriers with her remarkable 40-year career, touring with professional Yakshagana troupes and performing all-night shows.
articles.title: Pioneering Yakshagana singer Leelavathi Baipadithaya passes at 77
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: WPI inflation in India eased to 1.89% in November 2024, down from 2.36% in October. The decline was driven by lower food and crude oil prices. Food inflation dropped to 8.92%, while the Fuel and Power index rose slightly by 0.41%. Manufactured products saw a steady increase of 0.35%.
articles.title: WPI inflation eases to 1.89% in November 2024
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Narendra Bhondekar, an MLA from Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena, resigned from the party post shortly after being denied a cabinet berth in Mahayuti government. "I joined Shiv Sena on...condition that I'd be given a cabinet berth. Shinde had even promised me the same," he said. "I no longer have the mindset to hold...official position. I've submitted my resignation," he added.
articles.title: No longer have mindset to hold any position: Sena MLA on resigning
articles.subtitle: Narendra represents Bhandara constituency

articles.content: The Uttar Pradesh Assembly winter session began with CM Yogi Adityanath urging members to engage in constructive discussions. He emphasized the state's role in India's development, highlighting key issues like the Maha Kumbh Mela 2025 and the trillion-dollar economy goal. A supplementary budget will be presented on December 17.
articles.title: UP Assembly winter session begins, CM Yogi calls for smooth talks
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Actor Sanjay Dutt at a Bar Council event urged citizens to understand the law, advocating for legal education from school. Convicted for possessing weapons linked to 1993 Mumbai blasts, he said, "It's important to know the law, so we don't end up breaking it." Dutt added, "As far as I remember, I was neither told about my rights nor...the charges."
articles.title: Was neither aware of my rights nor charges: Dutt on 1993 arms case
articles.subtitle: Dutt completed his prison sentence in 2016

articles.content: Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake arrived in India on Sunday for his first overseas visit and will meet PM Modi in New Delhi to hold talks to bolster relations between the two nations. Sharing that he had held discussions on economic cooperation, security, tourism, and energy with Indian ministers, Dissanayake added, "These engagements reaffirm commitment to deepening partnership."
articles.title: SL President visits India on first overseas trip, to meet PM Modi
articles.subtitle: He is also expected to visit China in early 2025

articles.content: Trisha is set to make a grand return to the screen with South superstar Suriya in their upcoming movie, tentatively titled Suriya 45. This marks their first collaboration in 20 years, since their last film together, Aaru. Directed by RJ Balaji, the film is being produced by Dream Warrior Pictures.
articles.title: Trisha reunites with Suriya after 20 years for 'Suriya 45'
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Rashid Khan has been picked for Afghanistan's Test side for the Zimbabwe series, nearly four years after he last played a game in the format. Rashid has played five Tests in his career, picking up 34 wickets at an average of 22.35. Afghanistan have picked seven uncapped players, including Azmatullah Omarzai, Fareed Ahmad, Riaz Hassan and Sediqullah Atal.
articles.title: Rashid Khan returns to Afghanistan's Test side for Zimbabwe series
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A Pinterest post claims that drinking lemon ginger tea fights indigestion. Upon being fact-checked, it is found that this claim is half-true. While lemon and ginger have properties that can potentially alleviate mild digestive symptoms like bloating and sluggish motility, their efficacy is limited to mild, non-serious cases of indigestion.
articles.title: Can drinking lemon-ginger tea fight indigestion?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: US indictment against Gautam Adani, backed by documents including alleged "bribe notes", makes a strong case, legal experts said. However, he's unlikely to be extradited for trial anytime soon, they added. Adani could argue he wasn't personally involved in crafting company's anti-bribery practices claim made to investors. Prosecutors may also struggle to secure testimony from witnesses in India.
articles.title: What are legal experts saying about US fraud case against Adani?
articles.subtitle: 'Not received any request on the case from US'

articles.content: On Sunday, December 15, an accident occurred on the Dharmasthala–Subrahmanya Road near Kokkada, Karnataka, when a private bus from Andhra Pradesh, carrying Ayyappa devotees, rammed into a motorcycle. The impact resulted in the death of the rider, identified as 46-year-old Madhava Acharya from Moodabailu.
articles.title: Bus hits motorcycle, kills rider in Karnataka crash
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF), which resulted in tabla maestro Zakir Hussain's death, is a chronic disease that causes lungs to become scarred. It's thought to be caused by cycle of lung damage and healing that goes wrong, with people in 60s and 70s usually suffering from it. Some symptoms include shortness of breath, weight loss, swollen fingertips, dry cough, etc.
articles.title: What is idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, the cause of Zakir Hussain's death?
articles.subtitle: Smokers more at risk of developing IPF

articles.content: Getalong Enterprise Ltd announced a 1:10 stock split, effective January 2, 2025. Each equity share with a face value of ₹10 will be split into 10 equity shares with a face value of ₹1 each, aiming to enhance liquidity and investor accessibility. The decision was approved in an Extraordinary General Meeting on December 13, 2024.
articles.title: Getalong Enterprise announces 1:10 stock split effective Jan 2025

articles.content: India's economy saw robust growth in December 2024 as the Composite PMI rose to 60.7 from 58.6 in November, according to HSBC data compiled by S&P Global. Manufacturing and services sectors drove the momentum with new orders and job creation. Export growth hit a five-month high, and business optimism surged, signaling strong economic resilience and recovery.
articles.title: India's economy ends 2024 strong with PMI at 60.7 in December

articles.content: Urban Enviro Waste Management Limited hit a 5% upper circuit in the day’s trade after receiving a new work order from Saoner Municipal Council in Nagpur District, Maharashtra. articles.content: Shares of Original Equipment Manufacturer Comrade Appliances Ltd surged up to 10% after securing a prestigious work order worth ₹5.26 crore from Livpure Private Limited. The order involves supplying air coolers, boosting investor confidence, and driving positive momentum in the company's stock performance.

articles.content: CPSEs have outperformed benchmark indices over the past three years, with a market cap rising 3.61 times from ₹12.10 lakh crore in 2021 to ₹43.65 lakh crore in 2024. The BSE CPSE Index grew by 157.22%, and NSE CPSE Index surged 185.79%, reflecting strong CAPEX and value creation strategies.

articles.content: Preetham Shetty, 26-year-old national-level Kabaddi player from Mutlupady Nadumane near Ajekaru, passed away on December 13 due to cardiac arrest while playing in a tournament in Mandya, Karnataka. Preetham experienced chest pain mid-game and was immediately rushed to the hospital, but doctors declared him dead on arrival.

articles.content: Congress MP Manickam Tagore hit back at J&K CM Omar Abdullah for criticising the party over expressing doubts about EVMs. "It's...Samajwadi Party, NCP, and Shiv Sena UBT that have spoken against EVMs. Please check your facts," Tagore said. articles.content: At least 12 people, including 11 foreigners and a local, have been found dead inside bedrooms belonging to an Indian restaurant in the Middle Eastern country of Georgia. "At first glance", there were "no signs of violence" on the bodies, the Georgian Internal Ministry said. A generator placed near the bedrooms was switched on due to power cut, it added.

articles.content: PPAP Automotive's stock surged 19% after winning orders worth ₹118 crore, including ₹50 crore in EV components. The company expanded its partnership with KIA, showcasing its growing presence in India's automotive sector. CEO Abhishek Jain highlighted the company's commitment to excellence and innovation.

He succumbed to his injuries while being transported to the hospital. Singh was actively fighting the drug menace in the region, sparking a deadly rivalry.

articles.content: BJP Karnataka President BY Vijayendra Yediyurappa will address ₹150 crore bribery allegations in the Karnataka Assembly during the upcoming legislative session. CM Siddaramaiah claimed Vijayendra tried to bribe Anwar Manippady to suppress Waqf property encroachment investigations. Siddaramaiah demands a CBI inquiry into the matter.
