articles.content: An Instagram post claims honey and onion boost immunity by 200%. The Medical Dialogues Fact Check Team found this claim false. While honey and onion have health benefits, such as antioxidants, no scientific evidence supports immunity enhancement by 200%. Immunity cannot be quantified or boosted by specific percentages through diet alone.
articles.title: Can honey and onion boost immunity by up to 200%?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: A tourist bus carrying 55 passengers from Mangaluru to Jog Falls overturned on a sharp bend near Kargal along Aralagodu Road in Sagar Taluk, Shivamogga district, Karnataka. The accident, which took place on Saturday, left more than 15 people injured, causing widespread panic. The bus lost control while navigating a steep curve and dramatically overturned.
articles.title: Tourist bus accident in Karnataka leaves 15 injured
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Cricketer-turned-commentator Isa Guha apologised on live TV for her "most valuable primate" remark for Jasprit Bumrah while commentating in Gabba Test. "I was trying to frame...enormity of his achievements and I chose...wrong word...And for that, I'm deeply sorry," she said. Isa added, "As someone who's also of South Asian heritage...I hope people would recognise there was no other intention."
articles.title: Isa Guha apologises on live TV for using 'primate' word for Bumrah
articles.subtitle: 'People are entitled to make mistakes'

articles.content: Punjab police caught eight people, including two helpers at the Attari Integrated Check Post. They were moving drugs and weapons across the border. The team tracked down the group trying to sneak illegal items into the country. Police seized weapons and drugs, stopping a dangerous criminal plan.
articles.title: Punjab police busts drug and weapon smuggling network
articles.subtitle: Smugglers Caught: Punjab's Crackdown on Crime

articles.content: Over 8,000 residents of Chandigarh have fallen prey to cyber fraud this year, losing a staggering ₹70 crore. Authorities are warning citizens to stay vigilant and report suspicious activities as cybercrime rates continue to rise. One of the latest tricks employed by scamsters is 'digital arrest'. Police advise people to immediately report such crimes at helpline 1930.
articles.title: Over 8,000 Chandigarh residents lose ₹70 crore to cyber fraud
articles.subtitle: Over ₹70 crore lost to cyber scams in 2024.

articles.content: Indian equities continued to be the top-performing asset class of 2024 for the second consecutive year, Moneycontrol reported. One lakh rupees invested in the broad-based Nifty 500 Index at the start of 2024 would've grown into ₹1,21,300 by December 13. Gold would've turned ₹1 lakh investment into ₹1,20,700 by December 13. Real estate would've turned ₹1 lakh investment into ₹1,02,700.
articles.title: How much is ₹1 lakh invested in stocks, gold, property in Jan 2024 worth now?
articles.subtitle: Nifty 500 Total Return Index referred for equity

articles.content: Australia batter Travis Head opened up about his 152(160) in the first innings in the Gabba Test against India, saying he had a "blueprint" as he has "played enough" against India. "They moved through some really good plans, I felt under pressure most of the time," he added. Head had a partnership of 241 with former Australia captain Steve Smith.
articles.title: I have played enough against India, had a blueprint: Head on 152
articles.subtitle: Head hit 18 fours in the innings

articles.content: Director Madhur Bhandarkar revealed that people told him that his 2001 film 'Chandni Bar' had a good subject but asked him to put six item songs in it. "I was reluctant to do that. Very few producers want to back women-centric cinema," he said. The filmmaker stated that 'Chandni Bar' was "trashed" by critics, adding that they called it "depressing".
articles.title: Was asked to put 6 item songs in 'Chandni...', felt reluctant: Bhandarkar
articles.subtitle: 'Chandni Bar' starred Tabu, Atul Kulkarni

articles.content: Mukesh Ambani and Gautam Adani, India's richest and the second-richest persons, respectively, have exited Bloomberg's $100 billion net worth club due to business setbacks. While Reliance Industries Chairman Ambani's net worth is $96.7 billion, Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani's net worth has slipped to $82.1 billion. Elon Musk remains the world's richest person with a $455-billion net worth.
articles.title: Ambani, Adani out of $100 billion net worth club
articles.subtitle: Jeff Bezos' $246 bn wealth almost half of Musk's

articles.content: UP CM Yogi Adityanath raised concerns about the 46-year closure of a temple in Sambhal and asked, "Was this not a matter of faith?" He said, "This temple didn't appear overnight. It represents our enduring heritage and...truth of our history." Notably, the temple, said to be around 400-500 years old, was found by Sambhal district officials during an anti-encroachment drive.
articles.title: Was this not a matter of faith?: Yogi on closure of Sambhal temple
articles.subtitle: Lord Hanuman statue was discovered at the temple

articles.content: A member of the Prime Ministers' Museum & Library has written to Rahul Gandhi seeking his help in return of Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru's personal letters that were taken by Sonia Gandhi in 2008. Around 51 cartons of the papers were sent to Sonia, the-then UPA Chairperson. The letters include Pandit Nehru's correspondence with Albert Einstein, Edwina Mountbatten, among others.
articles.title: Return Pt Nehru’s letters that were taken by Sonia in 2008: PMs' Museum to Rahul
articles.subtitle: Similar request was made to Sonia in September

articles.content: At 24, Kainaz Messman met with a serious accident that gave her a back injury and shattered her dream of becoming a pastry chef. She did not lose hope and started her own baking outlet - Theobroma, at Colaba in Mumbai. Today, Theobroma has 225 stores in 30 cities. It is valued at ₹3500 crore.
articles.title: Met with an accident at 24 and built a ₹3500 cr business
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Bangladesh interim government's chief advisor Muhammad Yunus announced the country will hold fresh general elections to elect the government in late 2025 or early 2026. Yunus had been appointed the chief advisor after a student-led uprising ousted former PM Sheikh Hasina in August. He clarified that the polls were delayed due to major reforms currently being undertaken across the country.
articles.title: Bangladesh to hold general elections in late 2025 or early 2026: Yunus
articles.subtitle: 'Poll dates depend on what parties agree to'

articles.content: On Sunday, December 15, Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan was suspended from bowling across all top-level cricketing tournaments. As per the assessment conducted at Loughborough University, it was found that Shakib's "elbow extension in his bowling action exceeded the 15 degree threshold as defined in the Regulations", leading to his suspension followed by ECB's decision.
articles.title: Why Shakib Al Hasan has been banned from bowling in int'l cricket?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: UltraTech Cement has transported a large consignment of mineral gypsum through National Waterway 1 in a pilot project with an aim to reduce logistics cost. UltraTech Cement is the first cement company in India to leverage the Ganga-Bhagirathi-Hooghly river system for gypsum transport at scale. In April 2023, UltraTech transported 57,000 metric tonne of phosphogypsum from Paradeep port to Gujarat.
articles.title: UltraTech leverages inland waterways to reduce logistics cost
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: India were handed an early jolt in their first innings with the top order departing cheaply. Amid them was Shubman Gill, who got an edge with Mitchell Marsh completing a flying catch. The moment came in the third over when Marsh leaped to his left at gully to complete a clean catch with both hands to dismiss Gill.
articles.title: Mitchell Marsh takes sharp catch to dismiss Gill in third BGT Test
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Israel plans to double its presence in the Golan Heights, a strategically important region it captured from Syria during the 1967 Six-Day War and annexed in 1981. The area, spanning 1,200 square kilometres, offers high elevation, crucial for monitoring enemy movements. Although Israel's annexation is not internationally recognised, US officially backed Israeli sovereignty over the region in 2019.
articles.title: What is history of Golan Heights where Israel plans to double its presence?
articles.subtitle: Golan Heights is Syria’s highest peak

articles.content: After Virat Kohli got out caught behind in India's first innings in the Gabba Test, cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar tweeted, "I guess the time has come to scrutinise the role of a batting coach in the Indian team." "Why major technical issues have remained unresolved for so long with certain Indian batters," he wrote. Kohli got out for 3(16).
articles.title: Why have major issues remained unsolved for so long with certain batters?: Manjrekar
articles.subtitle: He got out in similar way in previous Test too

articles.content: A popular method of applying ghee on your nostrils, believed to reduce allergy symptoms, can cause dangerous ailments like lipoid pneumonia, according to experts. Lipoid pneumonia is a rare condition that occurs when fat particles enter the lungs and cause inflammation. It can cause deadly symptoms like chest pain, chronic cough, breathlessness, high fever and coughing up blood.
articles.title: Does applying ghee to nose reduce allergies? Expert says no
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) has received a letter from UP's Sambhal district administration to conduct carbon dating of the Bhasma Shankar temple that was recently discovered during an anti-encroachment drive there. A well has also been found inside the temple, Sambhal District Magistrate Rajender Pensiya said. The temple was reopened recently after 46 years of closure.
articles.title: ASI asked to conduct carbon dating of ancient temple found in Sambhal
articles.subtitle: 'Temple is being guarded round the clock'

articles.content: Ustad Zakir Hussain's mother Bavi Begum had changed the tabla maestro's surname few days after his birth based on a saint's advice, he'd revealed in 2018. "When I was born, my father's...health deteriorated...A saint...told [my mother] to call me 'Zakir Hussain'...instead of giving the family name 'Qureshi'," Hussain had said, adding that the saint said the name would bring luck.
articles.title: Zakir Hussain's mother had changed his surname on saint's advice after his father fell ill
articles.subtitle: 'My mother wondered if I was bringing bad luck'

articles.content: A helpline at Mumbai International Airport received two back-to-back calls from a woman urging the cancellation of a Mumbai-Delhi flight in the early hours of Sunday, December 15, citing an unspecified 'major problem.' The Sahar Police later registered an FIR and launched an investigation, suspecting the calls to be a hoax.
articles.title: Woman makes 2 hoax calls to Mumbai International Airport; probe on
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Efforts to clear two decades of accumulated waste at the Sewage Farm in Vidyaranyapuram, Mysuru, are progressing rapidly. The Mysuru City Corporation (MCC) has entrusted the task to a Surat-based company under a ₹75 crore project, approved by the state government last year. The clean-up operation, which began in March, has already removed 1.5 lakh tonnes of waste.
articles.title: Mysuru steps up to clear two decades of legacy waste
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Surat Police seized fake currency worth ₹1.06 lakh during a routine vehicle check and arrested three individuals. The accused targeted crowded markets in Surat using counterfeit notes mixed with genuine ones. The suspects brought the fake currency from Mumbai. Further investigation is underway.
articles.title: Surat Police seize fake currency worth ₹1.06 lakh, arrest three
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: When Raj Shamani asked clinical psychologist Havovi Hyderabadwalla her thoughts on the Animal movie, she said that the father in the movie had a narcissistic personality and Ranbir was the victim. He further crosses different limits to please his father. She shared many examples of narcissistic partners and bosses on the podcast.
articles.title: 'Animal' had a perfect example of a narcissistic person: Havovi
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Miss Netherlands beauty pageant has been scrapped after running for over three decades. "Miss Netherlands is saying goodbye to the title...But it's not the end; it's a new beginning...The world is changing, and we are changing with it," its organisers said. A new platform 'No Longer of this Time' has been announced, which revolves around mental health, diversity and self-expression.
articles.title: Why has Miss Netherlands beauty pageant been scrapped?
articles.subtitle: The pageant created history in 2023

articles.content: World's second richest person Jeff Bezos, currently worth $246 billion, was paid an annual salary of $80,000 (about ₹68 lakh) by his company Amazon but reportedly earned $8 million (about ₹68 crore) per hour between 2023 and 2024. A majority of Bezos' earnings came from his stake in Amazon. His wealth has increased by nearly $150 billion since early 2023.
articles.title: Bezos got ₹68 lakh annual pay from Amazon in 2023-2024, still earned ₹68 crore/hour
articles.subtitle: 'I felt how could I need more incentive?'

articles.content: Several hundred people and possibly even thousands may have been killed as Cyclone Chido hit the French Indian Ocean archipelago of Mayotte, Reuters reported citing a senior local official. "I think there will certainly be several hundreds, maybe we'll reach a thousand (deaths), even several thousands," prefect Francois-Xavier Bieuville said. Cyclone Chido hit Mayotte with winds of over 200 kmph.
articles.title: Thousands feared dead as cyclone Chido hits France's Mayotte
articles.subtitle: 'Strongest storm in over 90 yrs to hit islands'

articles.content: The newly-inducted ministers in CM Devendra Fadnavis-led Maharashtra government will undergo a "performance audit". Deputy CM Eknath Shinde said a review of the ministers' performance will be done after 2.5 years, and those who perform will progress. Deputy CM Ajit Pawar added that "non-performers" can be replaced in 2.5 months. Notably, 39 legislators from Mahayuti allies took oath on Sunday.
articles.title: Maha ministers to undergo review, non-performers can be replaced
articles.subtitle: BJP secured 19 ministerial berths in Maha govt

articles.content: Tabla maestro Zakir Hussain, in an old interview, said he went to the US because he wanted to wear jeans and be a rock and roll star. "I wanted to make a million dollars yesterday...Everybody was into it. I thought that was the way to go and make...lot of money," he added. Hussain passed away aged 73 in San Francisco.
articles.title: I wanted to be a rock & roll star: Zakir Hussain in old interview
articles.subtitle: Hussain's career spanned six decades

articles.content: Israel has announced plans to close its embassy in Ireland after Dublin supported an ICJ petition accusing PM Netanyahu of genocide. Israeli Foreign Minister Gideon Sa'ar said the move reflects Ireland's "extreme anti-Israeli policies". Meanwhile, Irish PM Simon Harris called Israel's decision "deeply regrettable", stating Ireland is "pro-peace, pro-human rights, and supports a 2-state solution".
articles.title: Israel to shut Ireland embassy over its extreme anti-Israel policy
articles.subtitle: Ireland has been a critic of Israel's Gaza war

articles.content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor clarified on an old tweet wherein he called billionaire George Soros an "old friend" and "concerned world citizen". Tharoor said he "knew Soros well" when he worked at UN, adding, "I've never received or solicited a penny from him or any of his foundations." BJP has accused Congress of conspiring with Soros to 'destabilise' Indian government.
articles.title: I knew him well, never received money from him: Tharoor as old tweet on Soros resurfaces
articles.subtitle: 'Met Soros at HS Puri's home when he was envoy'

articles.content: Indian tourists may soon enjoy visa-free travel to Russia, potentially starting by spring 2025. The plan follows successful visa-free programs with China and Iran. Currently, Indian travellers can apply for a Unified E-Visa (UEV), enabling easier access to Russia. This development reflects their commitment to strengthening its tourism ties with India, a key market.
articles.title: Indian tourists can now visit Russia without any visa
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: "Joining Scaler was a turning point in my career. The rigorous training and mentorship I received from Scaler was the core reason for me landing a job at BookMyShow," says Scaler learner Prateek Agrawal from Bhopal. He received a 250% hike despite severe academic woes and speech impediments, reveals Scaler. Prateek later joined Deloitte as a Senior Software Engineer.
articles.title: Software Engineer gets a 250% hike at Product-Based Company: Scaler
articles.subtitle: Learn Software Development and Data Science

articles.content: SpiceJet Chairman and Managing Director Ajay Singh said the capital infusion of ₹3,000 crore in September has helped the airline resolve 70% of claims with lessors and vendors. "We hope to have 70 aircrafts by the end of FY26 and 100 by the end of FY27," he added. Singh said the airline's turnaround plan is making "steady progress".
articles.title: SpiceJet has resolved 70% of claims with lessors & vendors: MD
articles.subtitle: 'In 10 yrs, India will have 1,400-1,500 planes'

articles.content: The fiscal deficit of the central government is projected to be 4.8 per cent of GDP for FY25, slightly below the budgeted estimate of 4.9 per cent, according to a report by CareEdge Ratings. The marginal improvement is attributed to healthy tax collections, despite certain shortfalls. GDP growth is expected at 6.5 percent, with manageable inflation and a CAD of 0.9 percent.
articles.title: India's fiscal deficit projected at 4.8% for FY25: Report
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: An open-label clinical study proved Bontress Pro+ Scalp Serum's efficacy in 100% of its volunteers, Bontress revealed. It added that the study reported 68% reduced hair fall and 12000+ new hair growth after 84 days of consistent use. Results were visible from Day 28 of usage and no side effects were reported in this Ethical Committee-approved clinical study, Bontress added.
articles.title: 12000+ new hair strands in 84 days: Bontress Pro+ from Glenmark
articles.subtitle: To know more about Bontress Pro+ Scalp Serum

articles.content: India's primary market is set to generate ₹2,251 crore this week through six IPOs launching between December 16 and December 20, including three mainboard and three SME IPOs. Additionally, 12 new stocks will debut on exchanges. The momentum from last week's IPO activity continues, offering investors diverse opportunities and high market anticipation.
articles.title: 6 IPOs, 12 listings launching this week in stock market
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Farmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher has urged people of Punjab to join the Rail Roko protest on December 18. The agitation will be held from 12 to 3 PM, with farmers going to block railway crossings. This follows a tractor march and clashes at the Shambhu border, where 17 farmers were reportedly injured during police action.
articles.title: Sarwan Pandher urges Punjab to join 'Rail Roko' protest on Dec 18
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Gold prices inched higher on Monday as investors anticipated a potential interest rate cut by the Federal Reserve this week, with focus on the central bank's language on rate cuts for next year. Spot gold was up 0.1% to $2,650.86 per ounce as of 0532 GMT. Meanwhile, US gold futures slipped 0.2% to $2,669.00.
articles.title: Gold edges higher with spotlight on Fed meeting
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Two teenage migrant workers were shot dead in the Kakching district of Manipur on Saturday evening. According to police, the two men were from Bihar and have been identified as Sunalal Kumar (18) and Dasharat Kumar (17). They were construction workers and were living in rented accommodation in Kakching. Those behind the incident are yet to be identified, police said.
articles.title: 2 teenage labourers from Bihar shot dead in Manipur
articles.subtitle: To know more

articles.content: After 22-year-old Mumbai batter Simran Shaikh became the costliest expensive player in WPL 2025 auction, her father Jahid Ali said, "Eleven people in our family live in two rooms. We'll now buy a good house." "Thank god...I didn’t listen to friends who told me to dissuade Simran from playing cricket," he added. Simran was bought by GG for ₹1.9 crore.
articles.title: We 11 people live in 2 rooms, we'll buy good house: Simran's father after ₹1.9-cr WPL deal
articles.subtitle: Simran's father is a wireman

articles.content: Former India batter and coach Sanjay Bangar wasn't happy with Rohit Sharma's captaincy on day 3 of the Gabba Test after he removed Jasprit Bumrah from the attack just an over after he had dismissed Mitchell Starc. "You generally give another over to a bowler who has taken a wicket in his previous over," he said while speaking on air.
articles.title: Sanjay Bangar questions Rohit Sharma’s captaincy during Gabba Test
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The Indian rupee, having witnessed slight relief late last week, is likely to come under renewed strain on Monday on the back of a further rise in US Treasury yields. The 1-month non-deliverable forward indicate that the rupee will open at 84.82-84.83 to the U.S. dollar compared with its previous close of 84.7875.
articles.title: Indian rupee to face renewed pressure as US yields climb
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Asian stock markets were in a wary mood on Monday as surging bond yields challenged equity valuations, particularly for the richly priced tech sector, in a week packed with central bank meetings and major economic data. Figures from China out on Monday showed retail sales rose just 3% in November, compared to a year earlier, well below market forecasts of 4.6%.
articles.title: Asian markets wary of Fed rate future, China data disappoints
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: At least 14 people were killed as cyclone Chido struck Mayotte, a French group of islands in the Indian Ocean. The storm, with winds of 226 kmph, destroyed shantytowns, uprooted trees, and toppled power poles. "The hospital is hit, the schools are hit. Houses are totally devastated," said Mayor Ambdilwahedou Soumaila, adding that at least 246 people were seriously injured.
articles.title: Cyclone Chido hits France's Mayotte group of islands, 14 killed
articles.subtitle: The death toll is expected to rise

articles.content: An old video has resurfaced showing Ustad Zakir Hussain talking about the first time his father held him. For a tradition where the father recites prayers in the baby's ear, Hussain's father Ustad Alla Rakha recited "tabla rhythms", Hussain recalled, adding, "My mother was livid...He said, 'This is how I pray.'...And he said, 'I'm Goddess Saraswati and Lord Ganesh's worshipper.'"
articles.title: Father recited tabla rhythms, not prayers when he held me for 1st time: Hussain in old video
articles.subtitle: 'This was a devout Muslim talking'

articles.content: Infosys Founder Narayana Murthy defended his calls for 70-hour work week, saying that "young people must work hard towards making India number one". Murthy said, "We've to set our aspirations high because 800 million Indians get free ration...That means 800 million Indians are in poverty." He added, "If we're not in a position to work hard, then who'll work hard?"
articles.title: Narayana Murthy explains why he wants 70-hour workweek
articles.subtitle: 'Must ensure rest of the world respects India'

articles.content: The gang that kidnapped actor Mushtaq Mohammad Khan was planning to abduct Shakti Kapoor as well, police said. The deal, however, fell through due to a high advance request, NDTV reported citing police investigation. Kapoor was offered ₹5 lakh in a similar abduction plot as Khan's who was invited to an event in Meerut and kidnapped enroute.
articles.title: Kidnappers didn't go after Shakti Kapoor due to high advance fee request: Police
articles.subtitle: Kidnappers withdrew ₹2.2 lakh from Khan's bank

articles.content: Actor Amitabh Bachchan condoled tabla maestro Zakir Hussain's demise on X and wrote, "A very sad day." Kareena Kapoor took to her Instagram to share a picture of herself with Hussain, writing, "Maestro Forever." "The man who never missed a beat had to relinquish the beat of his heart," Jaaved Jaaferi said. "[Hussain's] music was a gift," Riteish Deshmukh stated.
articles.title: Amitabh, Kareena & other actors condole Zakir Hussain's demise
articles.subtitle: Hussain passed away aged 73 in San Francisco

articles.content: During the third Test against England, Kane Williamson hit his seventh Test hundred at Seddon Park in Hamilton. Williamson is now joint-fifth on the list of batters with the most hundreds at a venue. He became the first New Zealand batter to hit seven Test hundreds at a single venue, surpassing Ross Taylor, who has six tons in Hamilton too.
articles.title: Kane Williamson edges up star-studded list with Hamilton hundred
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Former Maoists told Home Minister Amit Shah that Maoist cadres who wish to get married are forced to undergo "nasbandi' (vasectomy) by their leaders. The perception among members of the proscribed outfit is that childcare will prove a distraction and their movement suffer, they said. "Leaders don't want any member being involved emotionally with his offspring," a surrendered Maoist said.
articles.title: Leaders force nasbandi if cadres want to marry: Ex-Naxals to Shah
articles.subtitle: 'I appeal to Maoists, please surrender'

articles.content: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva was discharged from a Sao Paulo hospital on Sunday after emergency surgery for an intracranial haemorrhage. "I'm here in one piece...returning home," the 79-year-old said at a surprise press conference with his medical team. A head injury caused the bleeding in his brain after he fell in his bathroom in October.
articles.title: Brazilian Prez Lula discharged from hospital after brain surgery
articles.subtitle: I confess I was scared by fluid growth in head'

articles.content: Actress Archana Puran Singh made her vlogging debut after launching her YouTube channel on Saturday. However, the channel got hacked within 24 hours of its launch. Sharing a video, Archana wrote, "My YouTube channel went viral in just a few hours...The channel should be back in a day or two. Fingers crossed."
articles.title: Archana Puran Singh's YouTube channel hacked in 24 hrs of launch
articles.subtitle: She is currently seen on 'The Great Indian..'

articles.content: West Indies took on Bangladesh in the first of three T20I matches. The biggest moment of the game was when Rovman Powell completed a terrific catch that reminded fans of Surya Kumar Yadav's effort in the T20 WC finals. Powell threw the ball in the air after losing balance and came back in to complete the catch.
articles.title: Rovman Powell recreates Surya Kumar Yadav's WC final catch
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Anand Mahindra mistakenly shared Pakistani musician Ustad Abdul Sattar's (Tari Khan) video while paying tribute to Indian tabla maestro Ustad Zakir Hussain, who passed away aged 73. "The rhythm of India paused today," Mahindra wrote with the video. "Don't hurt our emotions and be irresponsible!" an X user said. "Fire your media team or double, triple check yourself," said another.
articles.title: Mahindra mistakenly shares Pakistani musician's video in tribute to Ustad Zakir Hussain
articles.subtitle: Ustad Hussain died after prolonged illness

articles.content: Indian shares are likely to open little changed on Monday, in line with Asian peers, starting the week with a focus on the US Federal Reserve's policy meeting later this week and the imminent 25-basis-points interest rate cut. Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,776 (8:10 a.m. IST) signal a flat Nifty 50 opening near Friday's close of 24,768.3.
articles.title: Indian shares set to open Fed-focussed week flat
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Ben Stokes walked off with an injury midway through an over while bowling on day three of the Hamilton Test between England and New Zealand. Stokes, bowling his 13th over of the innings clutched his left hamstring immediately after being hit for a four off the second ball. Jacob Bethell was asked to finish the rest of the over.
articles.title: Stokes limps off injured mid-over on day three of Hamilton Test
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Tabla maestro Zakir Hussain, who passed away in the US aged 73 following complications from idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, shared a video of trees swaying in the wind in his last Instagram post. "Trees changing colours...to fall colours...gently swaying in the wind, so beautiful to watch...The movement is so graceful, so unbelievable," he said in the video dated October 29, 2024.
articles.title: Trees changing colours: Zakir Hussain in his last Instagram post
articles.subtitle: 'I want to walk out here in Champaign, Illinois'

articles.content: Kolkata Municipal Corporation (KMC) announced temporary water supply disruption in the city on Monday and Tuesday. The filtered water supply will remain suspended in Borough-I to Borough-VII and part of Borough VIII, including Kasba. The disruption will begin at 9 am today and will continue till 6 am tomorrow, with the civic body appealing to people to use less water.
articles.title: Kolkata to face water supply disruption today & tomorrow
articles.subtitle: KMC apologised for the inconvenience caused

articles.content: Former Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan has been banned from bowling in international cricket.  This comes after he was banned from bowling in all England and Wales Cricket Board-run competitions after he failed an independent assessment of his bowling action at Loughborough University during his county stint. He'll need to pass independent reassessment of action to overturn suspension.
articles.title: Shakib Al Hasan banned from bowling in international cricket
articles.subtitle: His action was called out by umpires in Sept

articles.content: Bitcoin surged to a record high above $106,000 in early Asian trade on Monday. Its price was boosted by comments from US President-elect Donald Trump suggesting he plans to create a US Bitcoin strategic reserve similar to its strategic oil reserve."The next figure the market will be looking for is $110,000," said Tony Sycamore, an analyst at IG.
articles.title: Bitcoin soars above $106,000
articles.subtitle: 'A pullback many were waiting for didn't happen'

articles.content: Tabla maestro Zakir Hussain has passed away aged 73 in San Francisco, his family said on Monday. Hussain died due to complications arising out of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. He had been hospitalised for last two weeks and was later taken to ICU. On Sunday, reports of his death emerged, but his family denied the rumours, saying he was "very critical".
articles.title: Zakir Hussain passes away aged 73, confirms family
articles.subtitle: His career spanned six decades

articles.content: G Kamalini went for INR 1.6 crore at the WPL 2025 auction, making her one of the highest-paid cricketers of her age. She bats left-handed, bowls leg-breaks, and keeps wicket for Tamil Nadu. Originally an aspiring skater, Kamalini took to cricket during the lockdown of 2020. She is currently representing India in the U19 Asia Cup in Malaysia.
articles.title: Who is G Kamalini, one of the best-paid 16-year-olds in cricket?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Cheteshwar Pujara questioned India's decision to play Ravindra Jadeja in the 3rd Test match. He said, "In Australian conditions, when you know that the strong opposition batters are left-handers. So, you want your off-spinner to be there." "Even if you look at the rough, it's mainly for the right-handers, so off-spinners will come into play eventually, even in the second innings," he added.
articles.title: Pujara questions change in India's playing XI for 3rd BGT Test
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Fortunes shifted dramatically for Manchester United during their Premier League clash against Manchester City. In the 90th minute, Martinez sent a precise long ball down the middle to Amad Diallo. He controlled the ball and deftly navigated around the keeper. He then confidently tapped the ball into the net from a tight angle and helped United beat City 2-1.
articles.title: Diallo scores in 90th minute as Manchester United beat City 2-1
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) affects 10 to 15 % of the global population, with symptoms like pain, bloating, and altered bowel habits. Gastroenterologist Dr Bhuvan Shetty emphasises that IBS is often linked to mental health conditions like anxiety and depression. Addressing the gut-brain axis through holistic care including diet, therapy, and stress management can improve quality of life.
articles.title: Is there a hidden link between IBS and mental health?
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Captagon, an amphetamine-type drug, illicitly manufactured in Syria and Lebanon, helped keep ousted ex-President Bashar Al-Assad's regime afloat throughout years of civil war due to the revenue generated by its sale. Captagon generated more than $7.3 billion in Syria and Lebanon between 2020 and 2022, reports claimed. Large quantities of the drug were seized by rebels at Syrian military bases.
articles.title: How is Captagon drug linked to Bashar Al-Assad's regime in Syria?
articles.subtitle: To read more

articles.content: England batter Nat Sciver-Brunt on Sunday created history by smashing the fastest hundred in the history of women's Test cricket. The 32-year-old reached the three-figure mark off 96 deliveries against South Africa on Day 1 of their one-off Test to set the record. Nat scored 128 runs off 145 deliveries as England declared their first innings at  395/9.
articles.title: Nat Sciver-Brunt smashes fastest hundred in women's Test cricket history
articles.subtitle: It is her 2nd hundred in Test cricket

articles.content: Actor Allu Arjun shared why he hasn't visited the second victim of the stampede, an eight-year-old boy who was admitted to hospital in a critical condition. He said he's "deeply concerned" about him, adding he was advised not to visit him due to the ongoing legal proceedings. "I remain committed to taking responsibility for addressing...medical and family needs," he said.
articles.title: Was told not to visit: Allu Arjun on not meeting stampede victim
articles.subtitle: The boy lost his mother in stampede

articles.content: At least nine students were admitted to hospital after they became ill due to suspected gas leak from air conditioning system on the premises of a private coaching institute in Jaipur on Sunday. The incident occurred at around 6.45 pm when an unusual odour began emanating in the classroom during an ongoing session.
articles.title: 9 students hospitalised after suspected gas leak from AC in coaching centre in Jaipur
articles.subtitle: Two students are in ICU

articles.content: Tripura CM Manik Saha said several projects connecting Tripura with Bangladesh have been delayed owing to the unrest in the neighbouring country. Saha stated that the Maitri Setu built over the Feni River linking both countries could not be utilised despite being ready. PM Narendra Modi and ex-Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina had virtually inaugurated the setu in 2021.
articles.title: Several India-B'desh projects delayed due to unrest: Tripura CM
articles.subtitle: Agartala-Akhaura Railway project also unfinished

articles.content: Vivo India and Dixon Technologies have signed a binding term sheet for a proposed joint venture in India to manufacture electronic devices including smartphones. Dixon will hold a majority 51% stake in the venture, while Vivo will hold the remaining 49%. Oppo is also in talks with various Indian companies in the handset sector, Moneycontrol reported.
articles.title: Vivo, Dixon to form JV in India to manufacture smartphones
articles.subtitle: 'Dixon, Vivo will not hold stakes in each other'

articles.content: Punjabi singer Ranjit Bawa's show was cancelled in Himachal Pradesh following protests by Bajrang Dal and Vishva Hindu Parishad members. He was accused of hurting sentiment of Hindus with his song 'Mera Ki Kasoor'. He expressed frustration via Instagram and urged CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu to intervene, highlighting this was the third time his show was cancelled in the state.
articles.title: Ranjit Bawa's show cancelled in Himachal after protests by VHP
articles.subtitle: 'People are turning this into Hindu-Sikh issue'

articles.content: A Russian oil tanker carrying thousands of tonnes of oil products in Kerch Strait split into two during a heavy storm on Sunday, Russian officials said. The Kerch Strait is a key route for exports of Russian grain and is also used for exports of crude oil, fuel oil and liquefied natural gas.
articles.title: Russian oil tanker splits into two amid heavy storm in Kerch Strait
articles.subtitle: The oil tanker was built in 1969

articles.content: Indian companies raised ₹1.21 lakh crore through qualified institutional placements (QIPs) till November 2024, according to data from Prime Database. This is the first time that fundraising through QIPs crossed the ₹1 lakh crore mark in a calendar year. This shows a more than two-fold increase compared to the ₹52,350 crore raised in the previous calendar year.
articles.title: India Inc raises record ₹1.21 lakh cr via QIPs till Nov: Report
articles.subtitle: Vedanta, Zomato among firms that raised funds

articles.content: India bowling coach Morne Morkel admitted that the bowlers need to get better with old ball between overs 50-80. "I think for us with...ball, if you look at it from overs 50-80, even in last game, is where we fall short, leaking a little bit," he said. Australia ended Day 2 of the third Test with a scoreline of 405/7.
articles.title: India need to get better with old ball between overs 50-80: Morkel
articles.subtitle: 'It's definitely an area we need to focus on'

articles.content: World's second-richest person Jeff Bezos said he fixed his salary at Amazon at $80,000 (about ₹67 lakh) per year as he "didn't feel good about taking more. "I owned over 10% of the company. I just felt, how could I possibly need more incentive?" said Bezos. The billionaire reportedly made around $8 million per hour last year through his stake.
articles.title: Didn't feel good about taking more: Bezos on earning $80,000 pay
articles.subtitle: 'Bezos is currently worth $246 billion'

articles.content: India defeated China 3-2 in shootout in the final of Women's Hockey Junior Asia Cup 2024 in Oman's Muscat on Sunday to win the tournament for the second time in a row. The match was tied at 1-1 after the 60-minute regulation time. Earlier this month, India also won the Men's Hockey Junior Asia Cup.
articles.title: India beat China in shootout, win Women's Junior Asia Cup for 2nd time in a row
articles.subtitle: Indian goalie Nidhi saved 3 goals in shootout

articles.content: Senior Congress leader Mani Shankar Aiyar claimed that had ex-President Pranab Mukherjee been the country's PM in place of Dr Manmohan Singh, Congress' defeat in the 2014 polls wouldn't have been so "humiliating". "A party that had been at 414 in December 1984 [fell to] 44 seats in 2014. That is because there was no governance in 2013," he said.
articles.title: If Pranab Mukherjee was PM, our 2014 loss wouldn't be so humiliating: Aiyar
articles.subtitle: 'Dr Manmohan Singh should've been President'

articles.content: Zomato is the top 1-year gainer on the Nifty Next 50 index with its shares seeing over 146% returns as of December 11. It is followed by Vedanta, Siemens, IRFC, Info Edge, Motherson Sumi, Hindustan Aeronautics Limited, Bosch, Torrent Pharma and Divis Labs. The index has given over 30% returns so far this year, compared to Nifty 50's 13% returns.
articles.title: Which are the top 1-year gainers on Nifty Next 50 index?
articles.subtitle: Vedanta's 1-year returns at 110%

articles.content: Sambhal's Superintendent of Police (SP) Krishan Kumar and District Magistrate (DM) Rajender Pensiya offered prayers at the Shiv-Hanuman Temple in the district on Sunday, which was reopened after authorities stumbled on it during an anti-encroachment drive. An 'aarti' was also performed at the temple that had remained closed since 1978 following communal riots in the town.
articles.title: Sambhal SP, DM offer prayers at temple as it reopens after 46 yrs
articles.subtitle: Police have been deployed outside temple

articles.content: Mumbai's Simran Shaikh was the costliest buy in WPL 2025 auction, being bought by GG for ₹1.9 crore. West Indies all-rounder Deandra Dottin was the second-most expensive buy, being sold to GG for ₹1.7 crore. G Kamalini, a 16-year-old wicketkeeper from TN, was the third-most expensive buy (₹1.6 crore, MI). Uttarakhand leg-spinner Prema Rawat went to RCB for ₹1.2 crore.
articles.title: Who were the most expensive buys in WPL 2025 auction?
articles.subtitle: To view the full list of sold players

articles.content: Brazilian President Lula da Silva on Friday posted an Instagram video where he was seen walking for the first time since being rushed to a hospital earlier this week. The 79-year-old underwent two operations in Sao Paulo's Sirio-Libanes Hospital to relieve and prevent bleeding in his skull. Lula is now in his third non-consecutive term as president.
articles.title: Brazil's President Lula seen walking for first time since surgeries
articles.subtitle: Lula appeared with bandages on his head

articles.content: Finance Ministry said the Centre released ₹71,889 crore in grants to states in FY25 as per the recommendations of the 15th Finance Commission. The grants were released under various heads including the National Disaster Mitigation Fund and post-devolution revenue deficit grant. The Centre released ₹6,845 crore towards Urban Local Bodies Grant and ₹20,847 crore towards Rural Local Bodies Grant.
articles.title: Centre released ₹71,889 crore in grants to states in FY25: Govt
articles.subtitle: ₹2,894 cr released towards Health Sector Grant

articles.content: Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash's wife Nikita Singhania rented a PG in Gurugram a day before he died by suicide, however, she didn't stay there despite paying a month's rent, according to Times Now report. She left her belongings there and did not complete her verification and remained unavailable despite constant calls from the PG owner, the report added.
articles.title: B'luru techie's wife rented Gurugram PG day before his death, paid rent but didn't stay: Report
articles.subtitle: Nikita, her mother & brother have been arrested

articles.content: Mumbai batter Simran Shaikh has become the most expensive player in WPL 2025 auction. The 22-year-old was bought by Gujarat Giants (GG) for ₹1.9 crore. She was bought for her base price of ₹10 lakh by UP Warriorz in the inaugural auction in 2023. She had gone unsold in the WPL 2024 auction. Her father Jahid Ali is a wireman.
articles.title: Simran Shaikh, daughter of a wireman, becomes most expensive player in WPL 2025 auction
articles.subtitle: She scored 29 runs in 9 WPL 2023 matches

articles.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that Russia has begun using North Korean troops in significant numbers for the first time to conduct assaults on Ukrainian forces battling to hold an enclave in Russia's Kursk region. Zelenskyy added that more active use of the troops was a new escalation in the war and called for a global response.
articles.title: Russia has begun using North Korean troops in significant numbers: Ukraine
articles.subtitle: There are 11,000 North Koreans in total: Ukraine

articles.content: Delhi CM Atishi on Sunday wrote to Home Minister Amit Shah and accused Centre of settling "a large number of illegal Rohingyas" in different parts of city. Atishi also claimed that the residents weren't informed about the development. Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri reacted to the claim and said AAP was engaging in "politics of diversion, false narratives and half-truths".
articles.title: Centre settling Rohingyas in different parts of Delhi: CM Atishi
articles.subtitle: 'No Rohingya migrant given govt house in Delhi'

articles.content: Mumbai defeated MP by five wickets in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy (SMAT) 2024 final in Bengaluru on Sunday. MP put up a total of 174/8, with Mumbai chasing down the target in 17.5 overs. Mumbai were led by Shreyas Iyer, who won his second T20 trophy as captain in 2024. Shreyas led KKR to IPL 2024 final win in May.
articles.title: Mumbai defeat MP in SMAT final as Shreyas wins 2nd T20 trophy as captain in 2024
articles.subtitle: Mumbai won SMAT for the 2nd time

articles.content: Cultural enthusiasts and film lovers in Pakistan's Peshawar gathered at Raj Kapoor's ancestral home in the city to mark his 100th birth anniversary on Saturday. The attendees reportedly emphasised Kapoor's connection to Pakistan and praised his enduring influence on cinema. Notably, the Kapoor House is located near ancestral homes of Dilip Kumar and Shah Rukh Khan.
articles.title: Raj Kapoor's 100th birth anniversary celebrated at ancestral Pak home
articles.subtitle: World Bank to fund restoration of Kapoor House

articles.content: Actor Mukesh Khanna clarified that he did not make Ranveer Singh wait for three hours when the actor visited him for the role of 'Shaktimaan'. "It was a misunderstanding...He spoke to me for three hours straight," he added. "I am not as big an actor as he is to make him wait for so long," Mukesh further said.
articles.title: Didn’t make Ranveer wait for 3 hrs, was misunderstanding: Mukesh
articles.subtitle: Wanted Ranveer to play Tamraj Kilvish: Mukesh

articles.content: Michael Saylor's MicroStrategy will join the tech-heavy Nasdaq-100 index, effective December 23. This comes after its shares surged roughly 500% this year driven by a sharp rise in Bitcoin prices, taking the company's market value to around $94 billion. MicroStrategy, which is the largest corporate holder of Bitcoin, has roughly 423,650 Bitcoins worth over $43 billion.
articles.title: MicroStrategy to join Nasdaq-100 as Bitcoin fuels 500% share rally
articles.subtitle: Bitcoin crossed $100,000 earlier this week

articles.content: The 'Ram Temple project' of Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Temple in Ayodhya has been awarded the 'Sword of Honour' by British Safety Council, Chairman Construction Committee Nripendra Misra said in a statement on Sunday. "It's one of the prestigious accolades in safety management. British Safety Council conducts the audit of the process, practices and finally on-site activity assessments," he stated.
articles.title: Ayodhya's Ram Mandir project awarded 'Sword of Honour' by British Safety Council
articles.subtitle: Award only for those with 5-star assessment

articles.content: Hollywood actor Jamie Foxx was injured during his birthday dinner as he was involved in an altercation at a Beverly Hills restaurant, his representative said. Someone at another table "threw a glass that hit him in the mouth", his representative added. The representative further said that the actor "had to get stitches and is recovering".
articles.title: Actor Jamie Foxx gets stitches after person throws glass at him during his birthday
articles.subtitle: 'Matter now in law enforcement's hands'

articles.content: India's 18-year-old Grandmaster Gukesh D, who recently became world chess champion, said he doesn't play chess for money. "It means a lot that we're more comfortable in financial way and my parents don't have to worry about these things...but personally money has never been the reason why I play chess," he added. Gukesh won ₹11.45-crore prize money for championship win.
articles.title: Money is not the reason why I play chess: World champion Gukesh D
articles.subtitle: Gukesh is the youngest world chess champion

articles.content: Grammy-winning singer Billie Eilish was hit by a necklace during her concert in Arizona, a video of which has surfaced online. The singer was singing 'What Was I Made For?' when she was hit. An attendee was heard apologising to her in the video. Billie, however, continued to sing without addressing the incident and later threw the necklace away.
articles.title: Billie Eilish gets hit by necklace during concert in Arizona
articles.subtitle: To watch the video

articles.content: The Biju Janata Dal (BJD) won't support the INDI alliance's no-confidence motion against Rajya Sabha chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar, party MP Niranjan Bishi said. His comment came days after BJD chief and ex-Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik said the party was "examining" the development. The Opposition submitted a notice to move a no-confidence motion after accusing Dhankhar of engaging in "partisan" conduct.
articles.title: BJD not to support no-trust motion against Dhankhar: Party MP
articles.subtitle: BJD has 7 members in Rajya Sabha

articles.content: Grandmaster Gukesh D, who recently became the youngest world chess champion, in an interview with FIDE, said that he hasn't eaten ice-cream in over a year. He added that he would probably treat himself with an ice-cream now. Gukesh also thanked all the chefs who prepared South Indian food for him during the championship in Singapore.
articles.title: I haven't eaten ice-cream in over a year: Youngest world chess champion Gukesh D
articles.subtitle: Gukesh beat China's Ding Liren in the c'ship

articles.content: A video of people dancing in New York has been mislabeled online as people celebrating the death of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. The clip is from November and was recorded after singer Natasha Bedingfield's concert, a fact check has found. Thompson's killing unleashed patient outrage online over reportedly high level of claim denials by insurance companies in US.
articles.title: Clip of people dancing in NY unrelated to UnitedHealth CEO's death
articles.subtitle: Luigi Mangione arrested for the murder

articles.content: Four members of a gang have been arrested for kidnapping actor Mushtaq Khan from the Delhi airport, holding him hostage in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor and demanding ransom, Uttar Pradesh police said. They were also plotting to abduct veteran actor Shakti Kapoor on the pretext of inviting him to an event, police added.
articles.title: Kidnappers of actor Mushtaq Khan planned to abduct Shakti Kapoor: Police
articles.subtitle: Kidnappers asked for Khan's bank account details

articles.content: CCTV footage showed chaos at an exam centre of the Bihar Public Service Commission on Friday after a large group of people looted and tore question papers in the storage area and snatched them from candidates who were taking the test. The exam authorities have filed a police complaint. BPSC earlier dismissed allegations of paper leak.
articles.title: Video shows chaos as candidates loot, tear papers during public service exam in Bihar
articles.subtitle: Candidates were upset over 40-min delay: Reports

articles.content: Amid the Cabinet expansion in Maharashtra, Shiv Sena leader Narendra Bhondekar resigned from the post of deputy leader of the party after being denied a ministerial berth on Sunday. Union Minister Ramdas Athawale also expressed displeasure over the expansion, stating that Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis had promised him a ministerial post, but failed to deliver.
articles.title: Shiv Sena MLA Bhondekar resigns after not getting ministerial post
articles.subtitle: Over 30 MLAs took oath on Sunday

articles.content: Matthew Hayden criticised Marnus Labuschagne for falling victim to Mohammed Siraj's mind game on Day 2 of third Test match. Labuschagne was dismissed shortly after Siraj switched the bails. Hayden said, "If it was me at...crease and a bowler does that, I'm not caring less...I probably would've told him to get out of my space before he even got to...bails."
articles.title: Would've told Siraj to get out of my space: Hayden on bail switching
articles.subtitle: Labuschagne made 12 runs off 55 deliveries

articles.content: Gravita India Limited plans to raise up to ₹1,000 crore through a Qualified Institutional Placement (QIP), priced around ₹2,100 per share with a 7% equity dilution. The company focuses on recycling used batteries, aluminum, and plastic, showing a 14% revenue growth in Q2FY24. It maintains strong financial ratios with an ROE of 28.96%.
articles.title: Gravita India to raise ₹1,000 crore via QIP, shares at ₹2,100
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: NBCC (India) Limited shares rose by 1.68% after the company received a significant order worth ₹9,445 crore from the NCLAT. This contract involves managing 16 projects for Supertech Limited, which will include the construction of 49,748 houses across Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Haryana, and Karnataka.
articles.title: NBCC shares rise 1.68% on ₹9,445 crore Supertech project order
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Shares of Bharat Global Developers Ltd hit a 5% upper circuit at ₹1,127.15 after the board fixed December 26, 2024, as the record date for a stock split in a 1:10 ratio and a bonus issue in an 8:10 ratio, boosting investor's sentiment. Bharat Global Developers Limited is engaged in the business activities of construction and development.
articles.title: Bharat Global Developers hits 5% upper circuit on stock split news
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: National Aluminium Company Limited (NALCO), a leading public sector enterprise in India, is closely tied to fluctuations in alumina prices, a key raw material for aluminium production. The company’s share price has dropped by 8.33% due to a recent decline in alumina prices, caused by reduced demand from Chinese smelters and production disruptions in Mozambique.
articles.title: NALCO shares slide 8.33% on alumina price decline, demand drops
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: Starting on January 21, 2025, Mangaluru will have a direct, nonstop flight to Singapore, marking the first Southeast Asian international route from Mangaluru International Airport. This new service also opens a gateway for travelers from Southeast Asia, Japan, and the Far East to connect to the West Coast of the USA.
articles.title: Direct flight connects Mangaluru with Singapore
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more

articles.content: The Andhra Pradesh Government's Sports Policy 2024-2029 emphasizes world-class infrastructure, identifying and nurturing talent from the grassroots, and increased cash prizes for medal winners. Gold medalists will receive ₹7 crore, silver medalists ₹5 crore, and bronze medalists ₹3 crore at the Olympic and Paralympic Games (Summer and Winter).
articles.title: Andhra Pradesh unveils New Sports Policy 2024-2029
articles.subtitle: Tap to know more
